column3: localised_description

The more Canopic Jars we gather the more my brethren can serve you, your majesty. We should gather as many as we can.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_jars]][[/img]]Canopic Jars [[url:script_link_campaign_canopic_jars]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_canopic_jars}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

It is well, sire. But your resurgence has only just begun. The whole province must be returned to Arkhan the Black.\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Master, the mortal fools, the Knights of the Flame, pose a threat to us. I advise we conquer their stronghold in this region. That will immediately weaken their position.\n\nLearn more about settlements [[url:script_link_campaign_settlements]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_settlements}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The Knights of the Flame are all but destroyed. However, we cannot risk their torch catching again. Better to extinguish the flame utterly. Wipe them out.\n\nLearn more about factions [[url:script_link_campaign_factions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_factions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Now the province is yours, I humbly advise you issue a commandment. All will hear and obey the Liche King!\n\nLearn more about commandments [[url:script_link_campaign_commandments]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_commandments}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Now this Hero is bound to your service, sire, I suggest testing them. Give them an order…\n\nLearn more about heroic actions [[url:script_link_campaign_hero_actions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_hero_actions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Only those who have devoted their eternal souls to Nagash are worthy of serving, sire. I advise you only bind those as dedicated as yourself, Liche King.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Have your Liches delve deep into the lost lore. Seek out the dynasties of old and the champions from such eras, so that they may join your cause.\n\nLearn more about dynasties [[url:script_link_campaign_dynasties]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_dynasties}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The lore we in the Mortuary Cult have discovered over the millennia is ready to be employed in your service, your majesty. Have one of my priestly artisans begin crafting at once.\n\nLearn more about the Mortuary Cult [[url:script_link_campaign_mortuary_cult]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_mortuary_cult}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

I know, my dark king, how you have brokered many allies in your travels across the world. I advise it is time to leverage such relations to aid our resurgence. A non-aggression pact would be of great use.\n\nLearn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_non_aggression_pacts}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

More warriors are needed, sire. For us to enact the greatness we desire it is time to raise a new legion.\n\nLearn more about raising armies [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_forces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_raising_forces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].
{{tr:dlc09_main_tmb_early_game_recruit_capless_units_description}}

There are many legions, warriors and servants still under the sands ready and will to serve. We must find them, sire.\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

A humble suggestion, your eternal majesty, set Liche Priests - other than myself - to uncovering the lost secrets of the dynasties. Such endeavours may grant you even greater power and the discovery of lost legions.\n\nLearn more about dynasties [[url:script_link_campaign_dynasties]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_dynasties}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Sire, in the times since the Great Vitae River changed to the Mortis River bronze is no longer the superior element. We need other resources to compete with these, younger, inferior kingdoms.\n\nLearn more about resources [[url:script_link_campaign_resources]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_resources}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Sire, rogue elements invade your kingdom. I advise no mercy. They will pay the price for challenging the Liche King!\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

My spies inform me that some ruins may hold lost relics of the Arch-Necromancer himself. Sire, I advise we seek out this potential oasis and send minions forth to search it.\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_searching_ruins]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_searching_ruins}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Trade is more a mortal necessity… However, not all resources can be gathered through invasion, sire. The Liches of the merchant classes should be… encouraged.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreements [[url:script_link_campaign_trade]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_trade}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

As your slaves dig deeper, more burial chambers of your willing subjects are discovered and awakened. Put them to good use, sire.\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The more Canopic Jars we gather the more my brethren can serve you, your majesty. We should gather as many as we can.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_jars]][[/img]]Canopic Jars [[url:script_link_campaign_canopic_jars]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_canopic_jars}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The serpent strikes… but this nest remains full of predators, my queen. This territory will need clearing of reptiles before you can focus on your true agenda.\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

My queen, the Lizardmen resent your presence. It is time for them to learn that serpents and reptiles are not the same. Strike at these foes.\n\nLearn more about settlements [[url:script_link_campaign_settlements]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_settlements}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Your forces have all but wiped out the Lizardmen of Xeti. Perhaps this is regrettable, but there is no time for mercy. Destroy them.\n\nLearn more about factions [[url:script_link_campaign_factions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_factions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The province is yours, my queen. It is now time to issue a command that all shall obey.\n\nLearn more about commandments [[url:script_link_campaign_commandments]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_commandments}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Now this Hero is bound to your service, mistress, I suggest testing them. Give them an order…\n\nLearn more about heroic actions [[url:script_link_campaign_hero_actions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_hero_actions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Your renowned patience has paid off, your majesty. Ancient champions of Nehekhara have been resurrected; now we must make them ready to serve.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Have your Liches delve deep into the lost lore, seek out the dynasties of old and the champions from such eras, so that they may join your cause.\n\nLearn more about dynasties [[url:script_link_campaign_dynasties]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_dynasties}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The lore we in the Mortuary Cult have discovered over the millennia is ready to be employed in your service, your majesty. Have one of my priestly artisans begin crafting at once.\n\nLearn more about the Mortuary Cult [[url:script_link_campaign_mortuary_cult]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_mortuary_cult}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Not all solutions can be solved with your gantlet my queen. We must look to Asaph’s wisdom, offer other rivals pacts of non-aggression. We can always strike at them later, if we need to.\n\nLearn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_non_aggression_pacts}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

My mistress, it is time for some of your servants to follow their own path. Awake a new legion to serve you even if they do not march directly in your wake.\n\nLearn more about raising armies [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_forces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_raising_forces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].
{{tr:dlc09_main_tmb_early_game_recruit_capless_units_description}}

There are many legions, warriors and servants still under the sands ready and will to serve. We must find them.\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

A humble suggestion, your eternal majesty, set Liche Priests - other than myself - to uncovering the lost secrets of the dynasties. Such endeavours may grant you even greater power and the discovery of lost legions.\n\nLearn more about dynasties [[url:script_link_campaign_dynasties]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_dynasties}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

My queen, due a lack of sandstone in this region, we require marble if we are to rebuild these cities and monuments to match the greatness of Lybaras.\n\nLearn more about resources [[url:script_link_campaign_resources]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_resources}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

My mistress, rogue elements invade your kingdom. I advise no mercy. They will pay the price for challenging the Beloved of Asaph!\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Mistress, my spies inform me that these jungle ruins could hold relics lost to Nehekhara and even potential leads to end the spawn of Lahmia. Such ruins should be searched, my queen.\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_searching_ruins]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_searching_ruins}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Trade is more a mortal necessity… However, not all resources can be gathered through invasion, mistress. The Liches of the merchant classes should be… encouraged.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreements [[url:script_link_campaign_trade]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_trade}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

As your slaves dig deeper, more burial chambers of your willing subjects are discovered and awakened. Put them to good use, mistress.\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The more Canopic Jars we gather the more my brethren can serve you, Liche Lord. We should gather as many as we can.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_jars]][[/img]]Canopic Jars [[url:script_link_campaign_canopic_jars]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_canopic_jars}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

My lord, the exiles are in control of the foe stronghold, but we must continue this course until the Dark Elves are truly banished.\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Grand Hierophant, the Dark Ones will be a constant nuisance and distraction from our true objective. We must destroy them, start by taking their primary stronghold, my lord.\n\nLearn more about settlements [[url:script_link_campaign_settlements]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_settlements}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The vestiges of a challenge from the Dark Ones are all but over, my lord. They are a flinching corpse… yet as we know too well a cadaver can be returned from the dead. Extinguish their essence and ensure they perish. Finish them.\n\nLearn more about factions [[url:script_link_campaign_factions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_factions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

With your Exiles and by default, the Mortuary Cult, in full control of this realm, it is time for the Voice of the Grand Hierophant to be heard. Enact a ritual, my lord.\n\nLearn more about commandments [[url:script_link_campaign_commandments]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_commandments}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Now this hero is bound to your service, lord, I suggest testing them. Give them an order…\n\nLearn more about heroic actions [[url:script_link_campaign_hero_actions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_hero_actions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Your renowned patience has paid off, your majesty. Ancient champions of Nehekhara have been resurrected; now we must make them ready to serve.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Have your Liches delve deep into the lost lore, seek out the dynasties of old and the champions from such eras, so that they may join your cause.\n\nLearn more about dynasties [[url:script_link_campaign_dynasties]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_dynasties}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The lore we in the Mortuary Cult have discovered over the millennia is ready to be employed, master-of-us-all. Have one of our priestly artisans begin crafting at once.\n\nLearn more about the Mortuary Cult [[url:script_link_campaign_mortuary_cult]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_mortuary_cult}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Master, as you have often propagated, violence, while a useful tool, is just one of many found in a mason’s belt. Another is diplomacy and manipulation. Use such a tool now by offering these Dark Ones a non-aggression pact.\n\nLearn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_non_aggression_pacts}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Grand Hierophant, myself and other brethren in the council of priests believe it is time for the Cult, and therefore the Exiles, to raise another force. We will be mighty again - Settra will demand us return to Khemri when he sees what power we wield!\n\nLearn more about raising armies [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_forces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_raising_forces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].
{{tr:dlc09_main_tmb_early_game_recruit_capless_units_description}}

There are many legions, warriors and servants still under the sands ready and willing to serve. We must find them.\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

A humble suggestion, your eternal majesty, set Liche Priests - other than myself - to uncovering the lost secrets of the dynasties. Such endeavours may grant you even greater power and the discovery of lost legions.\n\nLearn more about dynasties [[url:script_link_campaign_dynasties]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_dynasties}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

With a lack of quality stone in these regions perhaps we should look at more organic materials for various purposes. May I suggest, Grand Hierophant, that trade for the fauna of this realm?\n\nLearn more about resources [[url:script_link_campaign_resources]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_resources}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

My lord, rogue elements invade your kingdom. I advise no mercy. They will pay the price for challenging the Mortuary Cult!\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Lord Khatep, we in the Mortuary Cult have always sought out lost lore. And the ruins in this ice-choked land contain the origins of Dark Magic itself. Seek them out, and send our brethren into investigate.\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_searching_ruins]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_searching_ruins}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Trade is more a mortal necessity… However, not all resources can be gathered through invasion, lord. The Liches of the merchant classes should be… encouraged.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreements [[url:script_link_campaign_trade]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_trade}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

As your slaves dig deeper, more burial chambers of your willing subjects are discovered and awakened. Put them to good use, sire.\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The more Canopic Jars we gather the more my brethren can serve you, your majesty. We should gather as many as we can.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_jars]][[/img]]Canopic Jars [[url:script_link_campaign_canopic_jars]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_canopic_jars}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Sire, your forces dominate, thanks to your greatness! Now is the time to take full control of the province, and see the resurrection of Khemri and all Nehekhara begin in earnest.\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Great King, Nehekhara is yours, as it always has been, but the Orc infestation sullies your clean sands. Sire, if I may advise, raise the legions and purge their nest.\n\nLearn more about settlements [[url:script_link_campaign_settlements]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_settlements}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

As expected, Great King, these living, breathing Greenskins do not pose much of a challenge. Like a scorpion that stings your ankles is not allowed to continue existing, it is time to stamp down hard. Finish them!\n\nLearn more about factions [[url:script_link_campaign_factions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_factions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Now the province is yours I humbly advise you issue a commandment. All will hear and obey the King of Kings!\n\nLearn more about commandments [[url:script_link_campaign_commandments]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_commandments}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Now this Hero is bound to your service, sire, I suggest testing them. Give them an order…\n\nLearn more about heroic actions [[url:script_link_campaign_hero_actions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_hero_actions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Previous champions, those who existed before your reign, may not be as immediately loyal as your other servants, Great King. But as soon as they witness your mighty will and dominance they will bend their knee and be yours forever more.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Majesty, have your Liches delve deep into the lost lore. Seek out the dynasties of old and the champions from such eras, so that they may join your cause.\n\nLearn more about dynasties [[url:script_link_campaign_dynasties]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_dynasties}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The lore we in the Mortuary Cult have discovered over the millennia is ready to be employed in your service, your majesty. Have one of my priestly artisans begin crafting at once.\n\nLearn more about the Mortuary Cult [[url:script_link_campaign_mortuary_cult]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_mortuary_cult}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

At the height of your glory, mighty Settra, you conquered not just through the might of your legions, but with statecraft as well. As your advisor, I suggest a non-aggression pact with Numas, sire.\n\nLearn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_non_aggression_pacts}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Your majesty, the power of Khemri grows under your magnificence. To ensure the campaign continues, I advise we raise another legion to serve.\n\nLearn more about raising armies [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_forces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_raising_forces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].
{{tr:dlc09_main_tmb_early_game_recruit_capless_units_description}}

There are many legions, warriors and servants still under the sands ready and willing to serve. We must find them, sire.\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

A humble suggestion, your eternal majesty, set Liche Priests - other than myself - to uncovering the lost secrets of the dynasties. Such endeavours may grant you even greater power and the discovery of lost legions.\n\nLearn more about dynasties [[url:script_link_campaign_dynasties]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_dynasties}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Sire, in the times since the Great Vitae River changed to the Mortis River, bronze is no longer the superior element. We need other resources to compete with these, younger, inferior kingdoms.\n\nLearn more about resources [[url:script_link_campaign_resources]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_resources}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Sire, rogue elements invade your kingdom. I advise no mercy. Let them feel the wrath of Settra the Imperishable!\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Majesty, my spies have alerted me to ruins that may hold lost relics. In your centuries of sleep, the living dared raid our tombs, and so such treasures have been scattered. Now is the time to seek out and take them back!\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_searching_ruins]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_searching_ruins}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Trade is more a mortal necessity… However, not all resources can be gathered through invasion, sire. The Liches of the merchant classes should be… encouraged.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreements [[url:script_link_campaign_trade]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_trade}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

As your slaves dig deeper, more burial chambers of your willing subjects are discovered and awakened. Put them to good use, sire.\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Beheld by the enraged gaze of Grimnir, the Bloody Spearz have trespassed with impunity all over the sacred mountains. Their forces gather to the east, and must be defeated in battle before their strength is regained.
Our enemies gather to strike against us once more. Attack first, and deny them the opportunity to reach full strength.
We must defeat the Red Fang in battle before they are able to regain their strength. See that it is done.
The Templehof brood must be crushed in battle before they are able to regain their strength. Another victory against Van Kruger's armies will leave his lands ripe for the taking.
Boris Todbringer, the Elector Count of Middenheim, has openly declared against you. Punish him for his mistake. Claim Carroburg as your own.
Your sovereignty over these lands will be secured only by the destruction of Van Kruger and his kin. Castle Templehof is well-defended, but it must fall nonetheless.
Van Kruger has left Eschen wide open to attack. Strike now, and punish his error.
The breakaway city of Grunburg lies relatively undefended. Reclaim it to send a powerful message to all those who doubt your authority.
Gorfang refuses to come out from his keep at Iron Rock. Take the fight to him and drive him from his fortress.

Observed with disdain by Grungni and all his kin, the Bloody Spearz maintain an encampment at the Pillars from which they raid the surrounding valleys. These vermin have long outstayed their welcome in these sacred mountains. March against them, and drive them from these lands that are rightfully Dwarfen.
Your realm abounds with patriotic men of learning. Provide the facilities, and their studies may be turned to matters of war.
Construct a Tinkerer Bench, so that the crafty Goblins that serve your cause may come up with new inventions to aid your war effort.
The finest minds in Altdorf stand ready to improve your methods of war. Task them with a direction of development and reap the benefits of their research.
Your Goblins can be put to work improving your weapons and practises. Set them on a path of development that will advance your methods of war.

Witnessed by a heartbroken Valaya, it seems that some Dawi agitate against the rightful rule of the king, despite his recent victories. Let the great book record that a lasting peace in the mountain must be achieved to ease Valaya's grief.
Your rule in Altdorf is not yet secure despite your successful defence of its walls. Quell the civic unrest, before it devours the city from within.
The inhabitants of Black Crag stir against your rule. They must be pacified if you are to secure the fortress in the long term.
There remain some within Drakenhof that would agitate against your retaking of the citadel. They must be subdued if your conquests are to be unimpeded.

The Black Pyramid stirs, my liege, but to reveal the secrets within, five Books of Nagash must be found. Begin the search at once for other powers also seek domination over the Arch-Necromancer’s shrine.\n\nLearn more about Books of Nagash [[url:script_link_campaign_books_of_nagash]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_books_of_nagash}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Firstborn of King Khetep, Nagash was overlooked for succession and forced to join the Mortuary Cult. He swiftly rose to become a powerful high priest, but envy of his brother, who succeeded their father as king, burned within Nagash like a brazier coal. Seizing his opportunity, he entombed his brother, Thutep, alive and claimed the throne for himself - thus began Nagash's reign of sorcerous terror.

But a throne would not suffice for the insatiable sorcerer. Seeking greater power, he threw himself into the study of Dark Magic, melding it with Necromancy to unlock the very secrets of eternal life. He poured all he had learned into his blasphemous opus, the nine Books of Nagash. The next stage of his plan, if successful, would magnify his powers immeasurably...

Nagash then constructed a vast black pyramid to harness and channel the Winds of Magic. Upon its completion, Nagash felt his powers grow tenfold, though the cost to the Kingdom was ruinous. Even as his might surged, the outraged Nehekharan Priest Kings gathered in secret, devising a way to topple the sorcerous tyrant.

The Priest Kings mustered mighty armies and declared war, but to their horror Nagash raised countless regiments of Skeleton Warriors in reply. Realising flesh alone could not to defeat such horrors, the Priest Kings breathed life into the mightiest statues of Nehekhara. Stone Ushabti, Necrolith Colossi and Khemrian Warsphinxes fought alongside the living, and Nagash's legions were crushed, forcing him to flee. However, is Nehekhara finally rid of his evil?

Order finally returned to Nehekhara, but it was many years until the kingdom prospered again, under the rule of King Alcadizaar. The Mortuary Cult was held under close scrutiny, its researches severely curtailed lest there be a repetition of Nagash's horrors. Many years passed in peace, until Nagash seemed but a dark and distant memory.

All was not seemly well in the Nehekharan city of Lahmia, however. Spellbound by the sorcerer's legacy, Queen Neferata recreated his Elixir of Life, though her method was flawed (she and her court gained eternal life, but were cursed with an insatiable thirst for blood). Their dabblings aroused the fury of King Alcadizaar, and the Lahmians fled in search of refuge.

Little did these first Vampires know, Nagash's dark will had guided their actions all along. They found themselves at his fortress of Nagashizzar, where the perfidious sorcerer welcomed his twisted children with open arms. Together, they launched a fresh offensive against Nehekhara, catching the recovering kingdom unawares.

Nehekhara rallied its forces in defence, and the war ground on for many years, seemingly deadlocked. After a titanic effort, however, Alcadizaar finally smashed the Undead forces. The Vampires fled to new refuges in the Old World, while Nagash retreated once more in abject fury. This time, his wrath was absolute – he cast a foul contagion throughout Nehekhara, scouring it of all life. Only Alcadizaar did he spare to witness the horror.

Incarcerated and fading, King Alcadizaar was visited in his cell one night by a group of cloaked, twitching, rat-like creatures. They whispered to him and freed him, pressing a Warpstone blade into his trembling hands. Ascending to the dark sorcerer's altar, the emaciated king caught Nagash mid-ritual: he bellowed a final war-cry and ran the sorcerer through with the crackling blade. It was over at last, though Nehekhara lay in ruins. But can such reckless hatred ever truly be extinguished?

Even among the Skaven, Warlord Tretch is famed for his guile and instinct for self-preservation. His sixth sense has delivered him from peril on countless occasions, and ensured his promotion over other Skaven whose survival instincts are not so finely honed. This uncanny good fortune drives his peers and superiors to distraction... he seems impossible to kill!\n\nThis doesn’t stop them trying, however, and a sudden directive from the Council of Thirteen to raise a force for an imminent yet unexplained mission has Tretch's whiskers twitching. Another suicide mission? He will bide his time and play along... for now.

Tretch's heightened suspicions keep him in a state of readiness. So when three of Clan Eshin's finest come at him from behind during an inspection of his new troops, he is ready. Clocking their reflections in the eyes of a dim-witted Clanrat, he whirls to slit the first assassin's throat. Its companions, realising the futility of their mission, screech in fear and skitter southwards into the night. Around the corpse's neck is found a curious amulet of Greenskin origin...\n\nThe remaining assassins are last seen going to ground nearby. There will be many hiding places, but their movements will be curtailed. A raid may flush them out.

The interrogation concluded, Tretch releases the assassin - but not before plucking out his eyes and leaving him to wander blind among the still-burning fields. The assassin was generous with his information; it seems the hit was orchestrated by a high-ranking official of a rival clan. Furthermore, the same clan has employed a mercenary army of Greenskins to move in and decimate Clan Rictus upon Tretch's death!\n\nProtocol prevents direct retaliation against the rival Skaven Lord, but Warlord Tretch demands a target for his fury. Before he was blinded, the assassin gave a rough location for where the Greenskins are mustering their forces. An example must be made for those who dare to cross Clan Rictus!

Tretch’s agent in the north has successfully located the burrow in which the Greenskins muster. They await orders from their paymasters, quite unaware that Tretch plans to land the mortal blow first...

Having sent agents far and wide, one has returned to Arkhan with news of his investigations. The Staff of Nagash is found - in the hands of Settra the Imperishable himself, and what’s more, the agent has the location of Settra's forces! Arkhan audibly rattles with outrage at the news of Settra's involvement, and begins his march to the location. As they approach their destination, Arkhan senses something is amiss. His own Black Tower seems to be the destination.\n\nArkhan's concern soon grows to mounting horror as he watches rank after rank of Skaven warriors marching into view. He spies ragged banners proclaiming the armies of three - no, four! Four clans are present - A veritable Vermintide! The foremost warlord holds aloft the Staff of Nagash and laughs at the top of its wet lungs. A subterfuge, then... this is Settra's doing! He has gifted the staff to the faithless ratmen in return for Arkhan's destruction - and on his own turf. Betrayed, Arkhan's horror turns to dark rage and steely determination. This will be a fight to remember... if he can survive the Skaven onslaught!

The Khemrian warrior-king Alcadizaar has dominated Arkhan's thoughts of late. How could he - a mere mortal - resist Nagash's power and slay him? What a resilient soul the man must have had! To bind such a soul into his Tomb Blade, the Liche King reasons, would amplify its power magnificently. But to perform such a rite, Alcadizaar's remains will be required. His tomb lies in a far-distant, cursed city. Arkhan dispatches an agent to scout the area.

As Arkhan and his force approach, his nose wrinkles to a familiar stench... Necromancy! These enterprising reptiles must have uncovered lore pertaining to revivification. Clearly they mean to raise Alcadizaar themselves. But to what purpose? The greater implications are not lost on Arkhan; this band of recalcitrant reptiles must be eradicated, and Alcadizaar's remains recovered. Only then will the Tomb Blade reach its full potential!

The blessing of Asaph, the Asp-Goddess, has waned of late. The divine venom in Khalida’s veins flows sluggishly, and her Venom Staff seems devoid of the goddess' fury. Deeply concerned by this, she summons her priestesses for counsel. After much deliberation, they propose a ritual to invoke the Asp-Goddess and awaken her blessing once more. The incantations cannot be performed without due honours, however. To provide a fitting stage for the ceremony, the Temple of Asaph must be restored to its former glory.

Khalida arranges herself in the restored temple, and the priestesses begin their invocations. As the chant rises, Khalida begins to feel the venom quickening within her. Opening her mind in supplication to the goddess, she hears  Asaph's familiar voice whisper to her "Khalida, my chosen. You feel my blessing once more. But it is weakened, for there is foul work afoot. The cursed Lahmians meddle once more... they sully my sacred ground. Locate my shrine at the Springs of Eternal Life. Purge it of Lahmian filth. With this ritual, you have given me a tribute of magic. Next you must restore beauty...". As the voice of the goddess fades, Khalida sends for her agents. Asaph's shrine must be found.

When Khalida enters Asaph's shrine, a scene of desecration greets her. Thousands of snake-bones litter the cave floor and the springwater is befouled by necromancy. The source of the corruption, a black orb, lies upon the altar of Asaph. Enraged, Khalida bellows in fury and shatters the artefact, then curtly orders her priestesses to prepare a rite of purification. As their intonations fill the caverns, the corrupted waters turn pure again, and serpents emerge from crevices to form a writhing carpet. Khalida hears the voice of Asaph, stronger now "The beauty of my shrines is restored, but vengeance is yet unanswered. You will find our enemies on the river turned to ash. Destroy them in my name!" Emerging from the cavern, Khalida orders her forces to march tirelessly for Ash River. The spawn of Neferata will be undone!

The Rite performed, the Pits of Zardok are indicated as a suitable site for the liturgy. Khatep orders a living human specimen captured and caged, that he might practice the liturgy without risk to mighty Settra. The time has come to test its value!

The golden age is long past but Settra, in his infinite pride, will see it born anew. As a symbol of intent, he demands a statue be raised in his image, one worthy of the greatest ruler that has ever walked the earth. It must be an effigy of pure magnificence. Settra issues his orders. Only the finest materials may be used in its construction - Ka-Sabar marble, Tilean gold, and black opals from the Sylvanias. Anything less will arouse his severest displeasure.

The materials having been secured, a design for the statue is presented. It is a stunning, 200-foot likeness of the king in his youth, raising aloft the Blessed Blade of Ptra. He experiences a rare flash of pleasure, which swiftly turns to rage. His blade! Ensconced still in its reliquary, that none might grasp it while he slept. It must be returned. But first, fresh labourers must be raised for the statue's completion. Settra demands nothing less than a massacre.

The time has come for Settra to retrieve the Blessed Blade of Ptra, and wield his birthright once more in the reformation of Nehekhara. Drawing close to the blade's resting-place in the Charnel Valley, Settra's scouts report activity. A glory-hunting alliance of Dwarfs and men is here in force and approaching the reliquary! The fires of fury are stoked within Settra's withered heart. Larcenous dogs! They dare to defile this place! Settra will send a mighty tribute to the Realm of Souls this day!

Settra surveys the world around him and finds it wanting. All will submit to his rule; all will serve the Imperishable. The time has come for Settra to regain his crown – spirited away by tomb-defiling Northmen as he slept away the ages. The King of Kings will see his birthright returned! \n\nThe lands of the Northmen are far distant though, and a significant journey will be required. But first, wood must be hewn, timbers sealed, and a fleet constructed. Settra must put the Necrotects to work and construct a port capable of rebuilding his royal barge.

Settra's agents bring him word of a place in the north where petty natives have risen above their station, their power bought with ancient treasures of Nehekharan origin. He has witnessed the rise and fall of empires, and senses this is no mere coincidence. A force must be deployed at once to obtain hostages and divine the location of the Crown of Nehekhara. \n\n Raids must be ordered, with a single aim: seize those who know the whereabouts of Nehekharan relics. Slay the rest.

Deep in the Ice Tooth Mountain, a Norscan host lurks in wait. Their leader knows he harbours a relic of great significance, even if he does not glean its origin. In due course, he will know the truth and its terrible price. The king will not be denied a second time. Today, Settra will regain his crown and exact his bloody vengeance!
Grimnir is enraged! These Undead piles of bones come with intent to harm brave Dawi. This will not stand; a grudge is in the Book, see that it is struck out, with haste!
A stinking pile of walking flesh dares attempt to end the life of a courageous Dawi Thane? With Grimnir our witness, we will avenge this outrage - mark this grudge in the Dammaz Kron!

Under the vengeful glare of the Hearth Goddess, Valaya, these sand-dwelling fiends dare to destroy honest, peaceful Dwarfholds! As you might expect, this affront has led to a fresh grudge being recorded in the Great Book. It must be struck out, as swiftly as their soldiers are returned to the dust!

Seen by an outraged Grimnir, those fleshless skulls have scored a lucky victory against our brave Dawi warriors. Naturally, this calls for a new entry in the Dammaz Kron - strike it out, send them back into the sand!

By Valaya's saddened gaze, those fallen, false kings of the desert do raid Dawi lands, leaving destruction and misery in their wake! Justice will be done, mark my words: this grudge shall be answered a thousand times over!

Grungni is disgusted to witness the sacking of our Dwarfhold fortresses by the Undead forces of the sand-dwelling Tomb Kings. Find them and kill them - all of them - strike this heinous grudge from the Dammaz Kron!
By Valaya's sight, the desert-dwelling Undead dare occupy an honest Dawi Hold. A grudge has been entered and must be struck out - these cravens will pay with their very Unlives!
The living send their champion to end us, but we will end this breather.
The Beastmen's gor thinks to frustrate us. End the creature.
The northern Gods task their Champions to come against us.
The Witch King's minions are abroad - one in particular must be silenced.
Dwarfs have a tendency to interfere with our plans whenever we venture beyond the desert realms. One of their bearded-breathers comes. Silence him.
These men of the northern realms are an empire of thieves and pretenders. Their king - a so-called emperor - sends one against us. Ensure they join the Realm of Souls.
The Greenskins are nothing more than noisome beasts, and now one of their number acts against us. Kill it.
The Asur are cowards. They do not send their hosts against us, but merely mouthed agitators instead. Kill their agent.
Accursed reptiles send an agent to interfere with our plans! End this creature's pathetic existence.
Skaven foes try and undermine us, just as they did with King Alcadizaar. Find their verminous agent and slay it.
The civil war for Nehekhara continues - they send an agent against us. Find them and send their spirit back to the Realm of Souls!
The abominations of Neferata try and spread their agents amongst us. Cleanse the world of their filth. Destroy their agent.
The Elves and their tree-creatures interfere in our expansion by sending an agent against us. Find the threat and destroy it.
The invaders and thieves often come from this nation; it is time for them to feel the scorpion's sting. Send the legions against their lands.
The ice dunes of the Dark Elves are a new realm to add to our own. The legacy of Nehekhara will grow beyond the deserts.
The mountain realms of the Dwarfs are valuable to us, for we need stone for the war statuary. Claim it.
The primitives of the north think themselves safe from the dead. Take their land and disabuse them of such a notion.
These filthy creatures defile ancient lands that once belonged to Nehekhara. Purify the region and claim them back.
The High Elves' arrogance will be their undoing; after all, we are truly immortal, not these fleshy things. Take their realm as punishment!
The reptiles view their borders with intransigence. They must make way for a resurgent Nehekhara. Claim this realm for the Undead.
Djaf, the dog-headed God of War and Death, demands that land be conquered from the vermin that infest realms that should belong to Nehekhara.
Our dynasties have ruled here millennia ago, take it back. These are your lands!
More of Neferata's children infest this land, such creatures must be purged and replaced with the true servants of Ptra and their sovereigns.
The woodland realms offer the Tomb Kings unique opportunities. Claim such a realm and our kingdom will benefit.
The rose unfurls to reveal its thorns, does it? We shall show these living fools what a brier patch truly is. Declare war.
These sub-man creatures are no threat to the glory of the Tomb Kings. War on them until their extinction.
Ptra the Creator sends the legions of Nehekhara to war, for the Gods of Chaos stand at the gates to the Realm of Souls and must not be allowed to cross the threshold.
Make war on the Dark Ones in their frozen climes, for that is the only meaningful discourse they understand.
The Dwarfs come to make war and we should not disappoint such stunted foes. Make short work of them!
This king calls himself an 'emperor', but his rule is weak - he is mortal for one thing. Teach this imposter the true meaning of sovereignty - declare war.
The Greenskin menace has festered long enough! Declare war on these primitive tribes and purge them from the world!
The High Elves have become a pain in your regal behind, so it is time to end their place in this world. Call the legions to war!
The Lizardmen threat can no longer be ignored. Declare war on the cold-blooded kind, let them see the power of death.
The ratmen infestation grows. These creatures have ever been a threat, it is time for them to finally perish.
To become the King of Kings, the other sovereigns must be dominated. The legions shall meet in battle.
The Vampires were a threat of our own making and the sins of Lahmia haunt us still. Now is the time extinguish their kind - make war on them.
The tree-Elves need uprooting. Make war on such long-lived creatures, and show them the true path to immortality.
The prey is marked. Ensure their end.
Conquer these lands for they are yours, whether its denizens - living or dead - know it yet.
Bring about the end of this being - we cannot suffer him to exist any longer!
This army is threat to your rule. Seek them out and bring them to battle.
This place contains crypts of a lost dynasty - it must be scoured.
Such a settlement, teeming with beings, must be destroyed. The desert gods demand it!
This one bears the title of king but his existence is merely the span of a slave. His royal blood is as thin as Elven wine, and for such a sin he must perish.
Even back in the old days it was considered a mercy when an animal became rabid to put the beast out of its misery. Hunt Gorthor down and perform this task.
The Chaos Gods send their 'best' against you, and on the field of battle no less. Ptra is not impressed. Hunt down their crowned Champion, show them the power of a real sovereign.
That king - the Dark Elf one. Slay this iron-clad Elf and show the denizens of Naggaroth the power of the true kings, the ones that rule the desert realms!
This stunted king is said to hold grudges. Pathetic! His wrongs are nothing to ours, we awoke without our organs! Seek this ingrate out on the field of battle and end him!
It is time to seek out this 'emperor' we have heard so much about. Find this living king of men and slay him in battle - then the living shall truly fear us!
The Greenskins rally behind the beast known as Grimgor. Seek out this creature in battle and end his lust for our realm.
The Prince of the Asur, the one they hold as a champion and untouchable. Let us prove their claims false - we will hand him nought but death.
The reptiles take orders from the Slann - this Mazdamundi is particularly revered. Destroy it in battle and their reverence will quickly fade.
Seek out this ego-craving ratman and sever its head from its filthy body in battle. Then we shall see how loyal these Skaven truly are.
Their can only be one King of Kings. This one thinks to fight the most ancient of conflicts. It is well. Seek him out in battle.

This Vampire noble claims to a descend from a royal bloodline. His ancestors may have once hailed from Nehekhara but his personal lineage is nothing but mongrels. On the battlefield, hunt him down and destroy him!
This Elven abomination challenges Nehekhara! It likes to hunt, so make it the quarry. Find this 'king' and show him the power of true royalty.
Seek out this serf in battle - this dog - and end his pitiful life. Ptra demands nothing less!
This Beastmen may not be the best specimen of their feeble race but it should still be dealt with.
While the Northmen seem obsessed with skulls, we'll take any bones on offer - especially from the body of this Champion!
In battle, hunt down this Dark Elf pretender and extinguish his soul.
There is a Dwarf that frustrates the will of the Royal Priest Kings of old. Hunt down this nuisance in battle and bring about his death!
The thralls to this child-emperor mock us. We should seek them out in battle and take their flesh-coated skulls.
Find this Orc filth that mocks us. Hunt down in the battle and end it.
Seek out the arrogant breather. Find the High Elf herald and slay it! Our honour demands it.
These reptiles use titles such as 'Oldblood' the arrogance! Ours would be the oldest blood there is, if we still had any. Hunt down this lizard usurper and end it!
Seek out Alcadizaar's bane - the Skaven creature that challenges us. Kill the creature in battle, crush his skull under the wheels of a chariot!
This serf - this slave - dares to defy you. Hunt it down in battle and break its soul!
Hunt down the Vampire-spawn - find the creature that dares call itself Unliving and end its existence quickly.
This Elven creature has been sent to challenge us - seek it out during the battle and kill it. Grind its skull into the ground!
The Errantry War of the breathers from the north blocks our way. Engage them with our legions.
We have let these Beastmen roam sacred lands long enough. Bring the warherd to battle!
Chaos comes. The filth-encrusted gods of the north must be stopped. Send your legions forth!
The Druchii come. Engage their dark host and stop them!
Dwarfs send a throng against us. Djaf demands their destruction - engage them in battle!
The uncivilised breathers from the north send an army. Meet them in battle - raise the legion!
An Orc rabble has invaded. Show these filth who should be invading who!
The High Elves send a host to face us. Do not let this challenge go.
The Bretonnians invade! Repel these living trespassers, make them pay for disturbing the dead!
So the Beastmen invade sovereign Tomb Kings land? Repel these creatures!
A Chaos horde, sent by their vile Gods, invades Tomb King lands. Our own gods demand they should be repelled!
The Witch King's thralls dare to invade our lands - these usurpers must be stopped!
The Dwarfs dare invade sovereign territory of the Priest Kings. Send them back to their mountain burrows!
And so these barbarians from the north dare invade the lands of the desert gods. Slay the slave-warriors make them clamour for their green and unpleasant lands.
The Orcs invade. Stop these green skin breathers!
A High Elf host invades sovereign lands of the ever-living Priest Kings. Repel these trespassers.
The Lizardmen invade! Push these creatures back into their fetid jungles.
Coming from their lairs, the Skaven invade! Send these pests back to their fetid nests!
As in life, war and invasion between the Nehekharan kings is inevitable. Now a rival invades and must be stopped.
Vampires send their wet legions against us, invading the realms of the desert gods. Halt this pathetic invasion.
The Wood Elves dare plant their roots in Nehekharan soil. Stop this Elven invasion!
The Lizardmen hiss that we are not part of their Great Plan, yet we are the only plan! Stop their force as it comes against us.
Find the Skaven army that challenges us. By Ptra, victory is the only option!
Djaf revels for the jackal-headed God of War will witness the Legions of Nehekhara fight once more. Seek out the enemy king's legion and engage.
The half-breed scum of Lahmia sends a force that must be stopped. Engage the fleshy, festering Undead!
A Wood Elf host is close. Intercept and destroy it!
War is not the only answer. An alliance is required so we may continue to exist.
These breathers have raiders our tombs for centuries. It is time to raid their lands and plunder their crypts!
The Dark Elf lands hide much valuable lore and secrets to eternal life. Raid their lands and seek such knowledge!
Crack open the Dwarfen Holds and raid their lands, homes and tombs for anything of value.
This young race of men have stolen secrets that belong to Khemri. We shall go, raid and return what has always been ours.
The Orcs have looted and stolen from us for too long. Now, raid their slum lands!
Enter High Elf lands and take! No longer will these arrogant breathers keep what should be ours!
No longer will the Lizardmen hide their so-called knowledge from our Liche Priests. Seek out their treasures, their plaques of lore. Raid their habitat.
We shall plunder the resources of the ratmen. Raid their warrens, destroy their under-world!
This inferior king hides relics we need. Raid his lands, scatter the sands and his legions. All we survey is ours.
Seek out the lands claimed by the Lahmia's bastard children - raid the lands of their bloodlines. Vengeance will be ours!
Enter the tree-strewn paths of the Wood Elves and take their life-source - claim it for the kings of Nehekhara!
Under the desert sands awaits a long-dead legion, eternally loyal and ready to serve. All it needs are the Liche Priests to utter an incantation of awakening.
Destroy a living city of Bretonnia. Send their presents fleeing into our bony embrace!
Seek out a city of the Dark Elves and raze it to the ground. Every stone must tumble. Ptra demands nothing less.
The Dwarfholds of the stunted are a ripe target for our legions. Make it so.
This new empire's death god inhabits every stone and garden in their vile realm. Topple their city.
The Orcs gather in one of their settlements. Raise the legions and destroy it.
The Gleaming towers of the High Elves rival the height of our pyramids. This cannot be allowed to stand - literally.
The temple-cities of the Lizardmen are a cache of lost lore that could bring about the Day of Awakening, unseal their crypts and burn what is left.
Seek out the Skaven nests and put an end to these vermin once and for all!
The city of a rival Tomb King encroaches on our greatness! Raze it, and execute the Necrotect to ensure our pyramid remains the greatest death shrine.
The only way to halt the Vampire threat is to destroy these night stalkers where they slumber.
The Wood Elves lurk in the deep woods. Send in your skeletal legions and fell any tree that could hold such vermin.
Raise a Tomb Prince and add him to your legions.
A Necrotect is needed to enhance the war statuary in our legions and ensure the greatness of death shrines.
Summon a Liche Priest from the Mortuary Cult to serve.
We require a Screaming Skull Catapult to ensure your reign.
Bring forth the desert knights to serve your majesty.
Summon the bodyguard from the Burial Chamber so they may serve in battle.
The archers of ancient Nehekhara remain the best in the world. Ensure they join your legions.
Awaken the war statuary. Stone must march with sand.
Order the chariots into service at once.
