Deeply concerned by this, she summons her priestesses for counsel. After much deliberation, they propose a ritual to invoke the Asp-Goddess and awaken her blessing once more. The incantations cannot be performed without due honours, however. To provide a fitting stage for the ceremony, the Temple of Asaph must be restored to its former glory.

Khalida arranges herself in the restored temple, and the priestesses begin their invocations. As the chant rises, Khalida begins to feel the venom quickening within her. Opening her mind in supplication to the goddess, she hears  Asaph's familiar voice whisper to her "Khalida, my chosen. You feel my blessing once more. But it is weakened, for there is foul work afoot. The cursed Lahmians meddle once more... they sully my sacred ground. Locate my shrine at the Springs of Eternal Life. Purge it of Lahmian filth. With this ritual, you have given me a tribute of magic. Next you must restore beauty...". As the voice of the goddess fades, Khalida sends for her agents. Asaph's shrine must be found.

When Khalida enters Asaph's shrine, a scene of desecration greets her. Thousands of snake-bones litter the cave floor and the springwater is befouled by necromancy. The source of the corruption, a black orb, lies upon the altar of Asaph. Enraged, Khalida bellows in fury and shatters the artefact, then curtly orders her priestesses to prepare a rite of purification. As their intonations fill the caverns, the corrupted waters turn pure again, and serpents emerge from crevices to form a writhing carpet. Khalida hears the voice of Asaph, stronger now "The beauty of my shrines is restored, but vengeance is yet unanswered. You will find our enemies on the river turned to ash. Destroy them in my name!" Emerging from the cavern, Khalida orders her forces to march tirelessly for Ash River. The spawn of Neferata will be undone!

Though exiled by Settra, Grand Hierophant Khatep remains true to his duty as Liche Lord of Khemri. Since then he has scoured the Land of the Dead, seeking a method to restore Nehekhara to its former glory, and thus return to his rightful place in the City of Kings. Now his tireless quest brings him to the New World. Perhaps some clue may lie sequestered in its ancient ruins…

Deep beneath the ruins, Khatep finds himself in a maze of bone-strewn catacombs. At its focus he stands door bearing a weeping-eye sigil. Behind it lies a hidden library, the final resting place of some Druchii sorceror. To the Hierophant's shock, the shelves around his bones are stacked with Mortuary Cult tomes! Have the Dark Elves truly been dabbling in the arts of resurrection? This demands further enquiry - Khatep must know more. An ancient map on the crumbling desk marks the location of a city - and a sister library...

Khatep enters the great library and scours it for further clues. Among the array of magical texts, bestiaries, and codices, one tome stands out for its more recent binding. Khatep is staggered to find within its pages a new liturgy, capable of binding a soul to a living host. There is some risk to both participants, of course, but could this be the answer? A way to renew Settra - and others besides - to true life? Surely this would restore Khatep's honour and station! Divining an appropriate site for the liturgy will require a powerful expenditure of energy - a Nehekharan Rite should suffice.

Arkhan spies the parched lands in need of taming - he shall bring them into shadow. It is a desert of the dead that should answer not to a Tomb King, but a Liche King… And on the horizon is Khemri itself, where Settra sits smug on the throne. His time will come.

As Arkhan's shadow realm expands, he will inevitably encounter the borders of hostiles. Those Tomb Kings are too blind - their rotting eyes lost - to see what gifts Nagash shall bring unto the world. It is the Liche King's task to prepare the way, to coat the land in shadow for the Arch-Necromancer's resurrection!
column4: Chapter II: The Kingdom of Arkhan

column3: The Liche King's empire will rise from the bones of his enemies. Even mighty Settra shall kneel - if he hasn't done so already - or be destroyed. Continue the conquest - raze what is useless, hunt what is needed, make ready the lands for the Mortarch's call. The kingdom of Arkhan is all.
column4: Chapter III: In Sight of the Black Tower

column3: The living and the dead will suffer at the hands of the Liche King. For countless generations, Arkhan the Black has vented his rage at many foes, but now, on the eve of great change, the Liche King tempers his anger into domination. He prepares the way for the only possible arrival.

Finally, after countless centuries, Arkhan the Black, the Liche King, shall raise and destroy and take what is rightfully his - the world! Bequeathed to him by the Supreme Lord of the Undead himself. All shall bow before the Black King, they will have no choice for their souls shall belong to Arkhan.

There are those who encroach on Lybaras, who mistake that the stillness and calm of High Queen Khalida as inaction or indolence. They will learn, the queen rises from her throne, trespassers, intruders and usurpers shall rue the day they invoked the rage of Khalida!
column4: Chapter I: The Throne of Lybaras

column3: Khalida is beloved by Asaph; the snake shall strike through her champion, seeking out enemies both living or dead. But before the serpent can hunt, it must secure its nest. The queendom of Lybaras is ripe for expansion.
column4: Chapter II: Realm of the Asp Goddess

column3: Before the asp can strike it must coil, tensing its body for the inevitable attack. Khalida should ready her empire in the same way. Her followers must coil, creating a solid foundation for the imminent attack.

With Lybaras thriving, the queen can look to spreading her venom throughout the land. But her ultimate goal is nothing as vacuous as Settra - she cares not for how mighty her empire grows, merely that this will leave her unchallenged to hunt the real foe - the spawn of Lahmia.
column4: Chapter IV: The Realm of Venom

column3: All shall tremble before a queen mighty and merciless. She will purge the lands of Vampire taint. But do not let the living think themselves safe from Khalida, for they are the stock on which the hated night creatures feed. Let the High Queen purge the world no matter if hearts beats within her prey or not.
column4: Chapter V: High Queen of Nehekhara

column3: For centuries Khatep has wandered the world in anguish. His desire is to return to Khemri and be forgiven for the sin of rousing Settra before the Day of Awakening. To make amends, the Liche Lord must gather around him other outcasts of Khemri and forge a powerbase, then answers may be found and, if not outright forgiveness... leniency from the Imperishable.
column4: Chapter I: Anguish of the Liche Lord

column3: Nehekhara beckons. But the time is not right, the return to the Land of the Dead must come with greatness and a vast trove of fresh lore. To that end, Khatep needs to continue his expansion in the chill realms.
column4: Chapter II: Resurgence of the Liche Lord

column3: The claws of the Liche Lord delve deeper into the land. No longer a mere itinerant, the exile and his outcast followers have put down roots and must continue to expand. If they can't go to Nehekhara - yet - then the desert shall come to them!
column4: Chapter III: Bring the Desert to Them

column3: The nascent empire of Undeath, under the stewardship of the Grand Hierophant, thrives. The Mortuary Cult has ever been willing to serve the Tomb Kings, but now their leader wields its power to serve the Cult itself. But such influence is meaningless if their sole, original purpose cannot be fulfilled - to bring about the Day of Awakening.
column4: Chapter IV: Rise of the Liche Lord

column3: Now, at last, is the time for the Liche Lord to exercise the power he has been building. Now is the time to grow the empire he has founded and show those in Khemri and its surrounding kingdoms that the exiles are ready to return.

Oh mighty, Settra... Great King, the Imperishable, Khemrikhara, The Great King of Nehekhara, King of Kings, Opener of the Way, Wielder of the Divine Flame, Punisher of Nomads, The Great Unifier, Commander of the Golden Legion, Sacred of Appearance, Bringer of Light, Father of Hawks, Builder of Cities, Protector of the Two Worlds, Keeper of the Hours, Chosen of Ptra, High Steward of the Horizon, Sailor of the Great Vitae, Sentinel of the Two Realms, The Undisputed, Begetter of the Begat, Scourge of the Faithless, Carrion-feeder, First of the Charnel Valley, Rider of the Sacred Chariot, Vanquisher of Vermin, Champion of the Death Arena, Mighty Lion Of The Infinite Desert, Emperor Of The Shifting Sands, He Who Holds The Sceptre, Great Hawk Of The Heavens, Arch-Sultan of Atalan, Waker of the Hierotitan, Monarch of the Sky, Majestic Emperor of the Shifting Sands, Champion of the Desert Gods, Breaker of the Ogre Clans, Builder of the Great Pyramid, Terror of the Living, Master of the Never-Ending Horizon, Master of the Necropolises, Taker of Souls, Tyrant to the Foolish, Bearer of Ptra's Holy Blade, Scion of Usirian, Scion of Nehek, The Great, Chaser of Nightmares, Keeper of the Royal Herat, Founder of the Mortuary Cult, Banisher of the Grand Hierophant, High Lord Admiral of the Deathfleets, Guardian of the Charnal Pass, Tamer of the Liche King, Unliving Jackal Lord, Dismisser of the Warrior Queen, Charioteer of the Gods, He Who Does Not Serve, Slayer of Redditras, Scarab Purger, Favoured of Usirian, Player of the Great Game, Liberator of Life, Lord Sand, Wrangler of Scorpions, Emperor of the Dunes, Eternal Sovereign of the Khemri's Legions, Seneschal of the Great Sandy Desert, Curserer of the Living, Regent of the Eastern Mountains, Warden of the Eternal Necropolis, Herald of the all Heralds, Caller of the Bitter Wind, God-Tamer, Master of the Mortis River, Guardian of the Dead, Great Keeper of the Obelisks, Deacon of the Ash River, Belated of Wakers, General of the Mighty Frame, Summoner of Sandstorms, Master of all Necrotects, Prince of Dust, Tyrant of Araby, Purger of the Greenskin Breathers, Killer of the False God's Champions, Tyrant of the Gold Dunes, Golden Bone Lord, Avenger of the Dead, Carrion Master, Eternal Warden of Nehek's Lands, Breaker of Djaf's Bonds... and many, many more... begin your conquest!

Khemri has ever-been the greatest city and capital of Nehekhara. To let such status wane would taint not only the city but mighty Settra as well. The city must expand beyond its traditional borders. Any in the path of expansion must submit and give unquestioning allegiance to Khemri and its king, or feel his wrath.
Now is the moment for the King of Kings to expand his domain. The world is a cauldron of war and instability begging for the dominance of Settra to bring order. Make it so.

It is said that every man has a master - be it a parent, a superior, a lord or even a god. But not Settra - he serves none but himself and has done for eternity. For he is the King of Kings and so all other kings must bow to him. Yet there are still those who shun his greatness. Capture such wayward settlements, so their denizens can be corrected!

Even the Gods look upon Settra in deference… or they should. The Great King shall rule all; a vast empire that no living monarch could ever hope to attain. That is not a mere desire that is fate being bent to the will of Settra the Imperishable!
column4: Chapter V: Kingdom of the Gods

column3: Warlord Doomclaw makes many demands of Tretch. The first is to gain a substantial tail-hold in this ice-ravaged land. Gnaw deep into this realm's roots so it may one day rival Crookback Mountain as a lair for Clan Rictus.
column4: Chapter I: From the Deep Warrens

column3: A tail-hold in this region is not enough. No-no. The Clan must spread, must infest the underground and riddle it with our spawn. We shall take this realm's wealth and use it for our ends - that is the Clan Rictus way.

It goes well for Tretch - yet again the Craventail has proven himself resilient and able to almost preternaturally dodge trouble, much to the annoyance of his foes. Yet… the labour is not yet complete. The rise of Clan Rictus must continue.
column4: Chapter III: The Rise of Rictus

column3: Rictus is well established in its new land. Craventail's burgeoning proto-empire continues to grow, gnawing just under the surface. Yet, there are still many nuisances in this world - both vermin and ‘things’ - best to eradicate all so that only Clan Rictus remains. For the Horned Rat! …and his brave, dedicated servant.
column4: Chapter IV: Gnawing at the World

column3: The plan is all but complete; Clan Rictus has grown like a canker, establishing a noisome empire to rival any nest-lair in the Under-Empire, yes-yes! A few more tasks will ensure Tretch can rival the Council - Lord Doomclaw himself will surely be proud-incensed!

Mostly recovered from his ordeal, the Liche Priest employs his new-found knowledge, guiding Arkhan's army with the efficiency of a hunting-dog. As they approach their destination, Arkhan senses something is amiss. His own Black Tower seems to be the destination. \n\n Arkhan's concern grows to mounting horror as he watches rank after rank of Skaven warriors marching into view. He spies ragged banners proclaiming the armies of three - no, four! Four clans are present. A veritable Vermintide! The foremost warlord holds aloft the Staff of Nagash and laughs at the top of its wet lungs. A subterfuge, then... this is Settra's doing! He has gifted the staff to the faithless ratmen in return for Arkhan's destruction - and on his own turf. Betrayed by both a god and a king, Arkhan's horror turns to dark rage and steely determination. This will be a fight to remember... if he can survive the Skaven onslaught.

The books, along with the Necromancer’s staff, have awoken the Black Pyramid. And so the carrion circle. The Tomb Kings have always lusted for power in life and especially in death. Settra comes, leading an undying alliance to wrest the pyramid from its creator’s most loyal servant. The Followers of Nagash raise their warriors even as the Black Pyramid climbs into the sky. The battle for its control is about to begin.

The five books are found. The Liche Priests begin the ultimate incantation, igniting the power within the stirring Black Pyramid. Nagash’s ultimate legacy is ripe for domination. However, the Arch-Necromancer’s greatest lackey, the Liche King, has deployed his legions and lieutenants to defend the master’s shrine. \n\nArkhan himself remains mysteriously absent… for now.

The five books are found. The Liche Priests begin the ultimate incantation, igniting the power within the stirring Black Pyramid. Nagash’s ultimate legacy is ripe for domination. However, the Arch-Necromancer’s greatest lackey, the Liche King, has deployed his legions and lieutenants to defend the master’s shrine. \n\nArkhan himself remains mysteriously absent… for now.

The five books are found. The Liche Priests begin the ultimate incantation, igniting the power within the stirring Black Pyramid. Nagash’s ultimate legacy is ripe for domination. However, the Arch-Necromancer’s greatest lackey, the Liche King, has deployed his legions and lieutenants to defend the master’s shrine. \n\nArkhan himself remains mysteriously absent… for now.

Such excellent progress-growth, Chieftain. But-but I’m afraid Grey Seer Vulscreek asks-demands that you advance faster. Take all of this Elf-thing province.\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The Elf-things hoard precious Warpstone at their own altar. Hersey-blasphemy in the eyes of the Horned Rat. Right this wrong, take it from them!\n\nLearn more about ritual resource sites [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_resource_sites]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_resource_sites}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Come-come Craventail, begin-start, that is orders from Council. Establish a tail-hold in this realm by taking an Elf-thing surface-burrow.\n\nLearn more about settlements [[url:script_link_campaign_settlements]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_settlements}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Excellent-good, now make-refine, bless the Warpstone dedicate it to the Horned Rat, and it will be used for ritual control of the Vortex. Build what we need master-lord.\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Such idle whiskers! Get to work, fool! Secrets to be found, new knowledge, new innovations to be discovered that you must only share with me-me! Build this thing so research can begin!\n\nLearn more about technologies [[url:script_link_campaign_technology]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_technology}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

I need more-more Warpstone. That what I summon demands a high tribute! Now other things see the Vortex is weak and seek to snatch it from us-us. Quickly, fools! Collect more Warpstone.\n\nLearn more about ritual currency [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_currency]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_currency}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

My master-sire, Vulscreek is 'indisposed' but sends a message that he is mildly impressed and expects gratitude for following his advice.\n\nLearn more about factions [[url:script_link_campaign_factions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_factions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

So you are getting a taste for power-control, Craventail, yes-yes? If you know what wielding power feels like, then you’ll know what it is to-to lose it. Never forget that! Issue a commandment.\n\nLearn more about commandments [[url:script_link_campaign_commandments]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_commandments}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

It is time, Grand Chieftain. Enact the Ritual of Dark Scrying, yes-yes!\n\nLearn more about rituals [[url:script_link_campaign_rituals]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rituals}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Your minion is waiting for their first mission, master. Make it a good one!\n\nLearn more about heroic actions [[url:script_link_campaign_hero_actions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_hero_actions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Lord-master, this plan to take the Vortex… there are plenty of opportunities for failure and blame. Build things to lure ‘Heroes’. If they perform well, the glory is yours for-for recruiting them… If they fail, then they take the blame, yes-yes!\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Felicitous news, great one. Facilities are now in place to summon minion-puppets. Begin at once to strengthen your reach across Naggaroth!\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Clan Septik are close. An opportunity? Use them, then dominate them? Make treaty-pact of no-fight.\n\nLearn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_non_aggression_pacts}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Clan Rictus must grow if you are to be of use to Council-plan, yes-yes? Spawn more packs, another army needed.\n\nLearn more about raising armies [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_forces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_raising_forces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Facilities are ready, Lord-master. Your greatest - and most ambitious - minds are poised to begin researching the thousands of ways your enemies will die. It is now for you to select which method they research first!\n\nLearn more about technologies [[url:script_link_campaign_technology]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_technology}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Look-see trespassers come. Ignoring them makes Clan Rictus seem weak-humble. How can I be your advocate-envoy to the council if you appear pathetic? Destroy this threat!\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The answers can be found in the ruins, master-lord. Send minions to hunt through them and precious things can be yours… Unless it’s a rat trap.\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_searching_ruins]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_searching_ruins}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The brood mothers’ bellies are full. New pups are being born and the burrows swell, master. We must make room, before they eat each other. Upgrade the lairs.\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Even among the Skaven, Warlord Tretch is famed for his guile and instinct for self-preservation. His sixth sense has delivered him from peril on countless occasions, and ensured his promotion over other Skaven whose survival instincts are not so finely honed. This uncanny good fortune drives his peers and superiors to distraction... he seems impossible to kill!\n\nThis doesn’t stop them trying, however, and a sudden directive from the Council of Thirteen to raise a force for an imminent yet unexplained mission has Tretch's whiskers twitching. Another suicide mission? He will bide his time and play along... for now.

Tretch's heightened suspicions keep him in a state of readiness. So when three of Clan Eshin's finest come at him from behind during an inspection of his new troops, he is ready. Clocking their reflections in the eyes of a dim-witted Clanrat, he whirls to slit the first assassin's throat. Its companions, realising the futility of their mission, screech in fear and skitter southwards into the night. Around the corpse's neck is found a curious amulet of Greenskin origin...\n\nThe remaining assassins are last seen going to ground nearby. There will be many hiding places, but their movements will be curtailed. A raid may flush them out.

The interrogation concluded, Tretch releases the assassin - but not before plucking out his eyes and leaving him to wander blind among the still-burning fields. The assassin was generous with his information; it seems the hit was orchestrated by a high-ranking official of a rival clan. Furthermore, the same clan has employed a mercenary army of Greenskins to move in and decimate Clan Rictus upon Tretch's death!\n\nProtocol prevents direct retaliation against the rival Skaven Lord, but Warlord Tretch demands a target for his fury. Before he was blinded, the assassin gave a rough location for where the Greenskins are mustering their forces. An example must be made for those who dare to cross Clan Rictus!

Tretch’s agent in the north has successfully located the burrow in which the Greenskins muster. They await orders from their paymasters, quite unaware that Tretch plans to land the mortal blow first...

The Black Pyramid, Nagash's greatest legacy, is a construction of pure, malevolent power. Though eternally loyal to his master, Arkhan would slay a legion to wield even just a little of it. If he can lay his hands on the Staff of Nagash, a fraction will be his to command. No record exists of the staff's whereabouts, but a tool of such arcane eminence does not pass through the world without trace. \n\n Arkhan Summons his agents. He orders them forth to hunt high and low for word of the staff. He bids them be discreet, to cloak their hunt beneath the guise of everyday activity… none must know of Arkhan's the Black's design.

An agent returns to Arkhan with news of his investigations. The Staff of Nagash is found - in the hands of Settra the Imperishable himself! Arkhan audibly rattles with outrage. How to wrest it from the false king's grasp? He must contrive the most subtle and cunning of plans... as his mind embraces the problem, a course of action presents itself. He will need the assistance of those members of the Mortuary Cult who remain loyal to him... and the very gods themselves. \n\n As he enters the small, incense-wreathed temple of his loyal Mortuary Cultists, Arkhan requests that they construct him a powerful artefact. Silently, he knows they hunger for Canopic Jars to fuel their dark studies, and will gladly work to ensure that more flow their way. When the donkey sees the carrot, it will comply...

With his Liche Priests suitably pliant, the second phase of Arkhan's plan may commence. It is somewhat more ambitious: to gain the favour of Tahoth, the ibis-headed God of Knowledge, and plead his assistance with the search. But what manner of feat will turn a god's head? Tapping the Realm of Souls to enliven a great Construct may just do it. Arkhan sets his most capable Liche Priest to a dual task: bring life to stone, while beseeching Tahoth for an audience.

With a subsonic grind of marble on sandstone, the mighty Warsphinx raises its leonine head: the  beast is quickened. The loyal Liche Priest then shudders violently, his eyelids fluttering in deep agitation. As he stills, the eyes snap open to fix Arkhan with an ageless, scholarly gaze, and an ancient voice issues from his lips "I am here. Who entreats Tahoth, Lord of the Wise?"\n\nElated, Arkhan addresses the god. "It is I, Lord, your servant Arkhan! I ask a boon - I must locate the staff of my master." Tahoth tilts the Priest's head with a painful-sounding rasp of sinew. "Its journey is known to us," the god tells Arkhan. "I grant my knowledge to this vessel. Let it act as your guide. May your quarry serve you well." And with that, the audience is over. Tahoth departs, and the Liche Priest collapses.

The Khemrian warrior-king Alcadizaar has dominated Arkhan's thoughts of late. How could he - a mere mortal - resist Nagash's power and slay him? What a resilient soul the man must have had! To bind such a soul into his Tomb Blade, the Liche King reasons, would amplify its power magnificently. But to perform such a rite, Alcadizaar's remains will be required. His tomb lies in a far-distant, cursed city. Arkhan dispatches an agent to scout the area.

As Arkhan and his force approach, his nose wrinkles to a familiar stench... Necromancy! These enterprising reptiles must have uncovered lore pertaining to revivification. Clearly they mean to raise Alcadizaar themselves. But to what purpose? The greater implications are not lost on Arkhan; this band of recalcitrant reptiles must be eradicated, and Alcadizaar's remains recovered. Only then will the Tomb Blade reach its full potential!

The Rite performed, the Pits of Zardok are indicated as a suitable site for the liturgy. Khatep orders a living human specimen captured and caged, that he might practice the liturgy without risk to mighty Settra. The time has come to test its value!

The golden age is long past but Settra, in his infinite pride, will see it born anew. As a symbol of intent, he demands a statue be raised in his image, one worthy of the greatest ruler that has ever walked the earth. It must be an effigy of pure magnificence. Settra issues his orders. Only the finest materials may be used in its construction - Ka-Sabar marble, Tilean gold, and black opals from the Sylvanias. Anything less will arouse his severest displeasure.

The materials having been secured, a design for the statue is presented. It is a stunning, 200-foot likeness of the king in his youth, raising aloft the Blessed Blade of Ptra. He experiences a rare flash of pleasure, which swiftly turns to rage. His blade! Ensconced still in its reliquary, that none might grasp it while he slept. It must be returned. But first, fresh labourers must be raised for the statue's completion. Settra demands nothing less than a massacre.

The time has come for Settra to retrieve the Blessed Blade of Ptra, and wield his birthright once more in the reformation of Nehekhara. Drawing close to the blade's resting-place in the Charnel Valley, Settra's scouts report activity. A glory-hunting alliance of Dwarfs and men is here in force and approaching the reliquary! The fires of fury are stoked within Settra's withered heart. Larcenous dogs! They dare to defile this place! Settra will send a mighty tribute to the Realm of Souls this day!

Settra surveys the world around him and finds it wanting. All will submit to his rule; all will serve the Imperishable. The time has come for Settra to regain his crown – spirited away by tomb-defiling Northmen as he slept away the ages. The King of Kings will see his birthright returned! \n\nThe lands of the Northmen are far distant though, and a significant journey will be required. But first, wood must be hewn, timbers sealed, and a fleet constructed. Settra must put the Necrotects to work and construct a port capable of rebuilding his royal barge.

Settra's agents bring him word of a place in the north where petty natives have risen above their station, their power bought with ancient treasures of Nehekharan origin. He has witnessed the rise and fall of empires, and senses this is no mere coincidence. A force must be deployed at once to obtain hostages and divine the location of the Crown of Nehekhara. \n\nRaids must be ordered, with a single aim: seize those who know the whereabouts of Nehekharan relics. Slay the rest.

Deep in the Ice Tooth Mountain, a Norscan host lurks in wait. Their leader knows he harbours a relic of great significance, even if he does not glean its origin. In due course, he will know the truth and its terrible price. The king will not be denied a second time. Today, Settra will regain his crown and exact his bloody vengeance!

Since the Army of the Seven Kings, you and your followers have despised the Tomb Kings. They are the jealous weaklings who destroyed Nehekhara rather than let our master dominate all. And now one of those spiteful kings thinks to challenge you. Decimate his legions!
Asaph demands, your highness. You must strike at your enemies and those that threaten far Lybaras! Hunt them down.
Sire, it is time to raise the legions. The more books you gather, the more they will require protection. The lore within such tomes is beyond any value.
Your majesty, it is wise to construct certain buildings. Their function will be of use when hunting down your master's remaining books and will ensure success in taking control of the Black Pyramid.
My master, Arkhan, the brethren have need of more Canopic Jars. Such a resource is required if the Mortuary Cult is to be of full use to your plans, Liche King.
My queen, the hunt for the tomes of the Arch-Necromancer must continue. A search of nearby ruins may not produce a book itself, but could put us on the correct path.
Your majesty, curse all your enemies, let the years weigh upon them. But there is one who must be dealt with now - hunt him in battle, King of Liches.
An alliance might be of use, sire. If we cannot make all the world dead, then let use the breathers for our own aims. We can then take their bones at a later time.

There is a need for souls, sire. A tithe needs to be paid to the Mortuary Cult. We ask not to enrich ourselves but for the magics we deal in. It is the fastest route to locating all of Nagash's tomes.

My Lord, let these mortal fools think we are nothing but dust. Let them come, lure them to your legions… then we shall show them that dust, like sand, can combine into a mighty storm! You are that storm, mighty Khatep!

Grand Hierophant, the creatures of the army that comes at us have some interesting organs. Harvest them, Liche Lord, for they will make for exotic Canopic Jars and powerful ingredients in an incantation.
My queen, we must consider reinforcing our stronghold, perhaps with shrines to the desert gods whose voices remain far across the seas. If we call to them, they will send us favour.
The dead do not hunger, yet the Carrion must still be fed. That is the way it has always been. Hunt out these foes, for they are weaklings, the gods and their pets will be sated by their destruction.
Sire, mighty Khemrikhara, I pass a message from your herald that the enemy moves. I humbly advise that we intercept them, let them feel the glare of the Great King and the bite of your sword!
I communed with others in my order, sire. We believe the time will soon be upon us, but that moment might leave us vulnerable. Summon Ushabti, these guardians can stand sentinel while we are exposed.
My king, o great Settra, our stocks of Canopic jars must be refreshed if we are to perform the deeds requested of you, Great King.
All shall bow before the Khemrikhara, but I regret to inform there is one that defies you, Great King. He must be punished!
Your majesty, mighty Settra, it is time to bring about a kingdom to rival one you had when you lived. A new golden age, a kingdom of the dead - all hail, Settra!

Your majesty, even in these far flung lands there are legions… lost sentinels of Nehekhara that rode far and wide at the orders of monarchs from generations past. We have the power to find them, my queen.

Mighty Settra, this creature dares mock you. He thinks to disrespect the Great King. While you could send any servant to vanquish this one, I know you, o king, will take much greater pleasure in destroying him in battle yourself.
As you know, Grand Hierophant, the Canopic Jars are critical to our work within the cult. Our stocks need to be replenished. We must find more, Liche Lord.
The accursed spawn of Neferata are abroad, my queen. They do not deserve a moment to exist. Bring these fell creatures to battle.
The jackal-headed god demands his due. Slay for Djaf; reap the souls, for such a tally will be used to judge your worth when you stand before Usirian.
Nehekhara was your master's possession long after many of these bandaged fools were rotting in their crypts. Conquer it in Nagash's name, prepare the lands for the return of the Necromancer!
They slur us, master. These bloody vessels dare cast aspersions upon the Mortuary Cult. There is only one way to answer such an accusation!
We must spread our web of curiosity far and wide, Liche Lord. Send our brethren into the world to capture such lore.

Sire, the first book is found. Yet, despite it being no business of the local fauna, these living creatures seem alarmed. They will attack - but we should strike first. After all, just like the asp, the best defence is always to attack!

My liege, may I remind you that the construction of a burial chamber is all-consuming if your legacy is to be prepared. Yes, we are dead, but should we perish our remains must be held in state to ensure a bridge to the Realm of Souls. Commission a Necrotect for its construction at your earliest opportunity.
To find more of Nagash's books we should look to the lineage of Thutep, the second brother - the true king of Khemri - the one Nagash murdered to take the throne!

Sire, like hunting jackals with a fresh scent, the other Tomb Kings will surely round on you now a book of Nagash is in your possession. Attack is the best defence! Hunt out the jackals, the weaker kings, for rivals will no longer be rivals if they cease to exist.
Your influence… your dominance… over the region must be absolute, sire. Only then can we search for the books without interference from nagging mortals or our own rivals.

Though exiled by Settra, Grand Hierophant Khatep remains true to his duty as Liche Lord of Khemri. Since then he has scoured the Land of the Dead, seeking a method to restore Nehekhara to its former glory, and thus return to his rightful place in the City of Kings. Now his tireless quest brings him to the New World. Perhaps some clue may lie sequestered in its ancient ruins…

Deep beneath the ruins, Khatep finds himself in a maze of bone-strewn catacombs. At its focus he stands door bearing a weeping-eye sigil. Behind it lies a hidden library, the final resting place of some Druchii sorceror. To the Hierophant's shock, the shelves around his bones are stacked with Mortuary Cult tomes! Have the Dark Elves truly been dabbling in the arts of resurrection? This demands further enquiry - Khatep must know more. An ancient map on the crumbling desk marks the location of a city - and a sister library...

Khatep enters the great library and scours it for further clues. Among the array of magical texts, bestiaries, and codices, one tome stands out for its more recent binding. Khatep is staggered to find within its pages a new liturgy, capable of binding a soul to a living host. There is some risk to both participants, of course, but could this be the answer? A way to renew Settra - and others besides - to true life? Surely this would restore Khatep's honour and station! Divining an appropriate site for the liturgy will require a powerful expenditure of energy - a Nehekharan Rite should suffice.

A great stain is upon the land. Avelorn suffers, and so the light within the Shieldstone of Isha dims. For the first time in the gods' memory, the Druchii – the lost kin – have taken the Phoenix Gate. Finubar and Tyrion are rightly distracted by the momentous events of the Vortex, but Alarielle has never been a queen that merely perches upon a throne. She will act – the Phoenix Gate will return to Asur hands!
The time has come to hush the wailing of the Crone once and for all. Seek out Hellebron and end her!
At last, Malekith is in your sights! Traitor to your race, Sunderer, and slayer of your family. Find him, kill him!
The mother of all our woes - the Hag Sorceress herself - is ripe for slaying. Take her head, and slake our thirst for vengeance!
You have a new target, my king. Scouts report a threat to the Shadowlands - strike now, before they can bring further ruin.
The Shadowlands has a new enemy; the king must act and cull the threat before it festers into war.
The Shadow King will do anything to protect his realm. His warriors have learned of a threat that needs silencing.
A traitor calls for their own death! One of the Witch King's sycophants threatens our realm - take them into shadow!
War or peace - it matters not, a Druchii is always a viable target. The less of their treacherous kind exist, the safer Nagarythe will be.
Loec’s ravens squawk the name of another of Malekith’s minions to slay. Their time can be measured in mere moments from now on.
To go to war with the Shadowlands is to invoke the retribution of Alith Anar, who will seek out this target and usher them to death.
Those who provoke the Shadow King to war surely do not value life, for they will be deprived of it soon enough!
Although a High Elf, Anar does not play by the same rules as his noble kin; war is not just fought on the battlefield.
It is war with the Druchii! This traitor-kin needs their head severed from their neck! Loec has nominated Anar for this honour…
Loec, the God of Deadly Dances, has given Anar a name - a Dark Elf whose own dance should end, war or not.
The only good Druchii is a dead one. To aid the war, Anar must hunt once more; now he knows the identity of his prey.

The Asur Everqueen is the epitome of beauty - the wretched slaves of Ulthuan even call her ‘The Radiant’, the fawning fools! Despoil Alarielle’s capital. This will delight Khaine, and surely he will reward Hellebron with what she desires the most: her lost youth.

At last, a chance to capture the blackest of widows in her own web! Morathi’s lair is vulnerable; surely this is a chance for the Blood Queen to rid herself of the most power of rivals? Take the Hag Sorceress’ capital!

Khaine is pleased by the endless killing orchestrated by the Blood Queen. It is no secret though that the greatest of the Bloody-handed God's gifts has not yet been secured. It is time for Hellebron to gather her most vicious sisters and thralls, and occupy the Shrine of Khaine. Only then will the Amulet of Dark Fire ignite.

Shadowblade – her normally reliable and deadly vassal-assassin – has seemingly gone off with this new player, Felicion, much to Hellebron's chagrin. She puts her wrath on a simmer, and will deal with him when he inevitably returns to her service, for there is no-one else that offers him the challenging targets she does.

In the meantime, Hellebron's concerns lie with her chosen paired weapons – the blades have dulled having separated so many necks. It is Morathi's fault! It always is! The whore of Ghrond has for too long kept the secrets of agelessness – for flesh and metal – from the Blood Queen.

To wrest such lore from Malekith's mother is no easy task. After all, it's one that Hellebron has been trying to steal for thousands of years. A more subtle approach is needed. However, Morathi is unpredictable. Should this scheme come to violence then it would be foolish not to have Khaine's blessing in place. Sacrifices must be made to the Bloody-handed God!

Spies are needed to infiltrate Morathi's Court. Hellebron already had an established espionage network in Ghrond, but with the Hag Sorceress selfishly relocating to Quintex, fresh agents need to be inserted or coerced there.

Perhaps unsurprisingly, Morathi saw through Hellebron's agent. It was a clumsy attempt and no doubt a reprisal from the Hag Sorceress is already being planned or underway. But the Blood Queen is not one to wait for her enemies to act – it is time to take radical steps. Raiding Quintex will create bedlam, sow dissent, and there will be many glorious murders! Capturing Morathi's pleasure-slaves may also enable the Blood Queen to harvest the secrets that Morathi only reveals in the throes of ecstasy!

It is a brave or foolish foe that attacks Morathi so directly… so brazenly! The raiding of Quintex did not bear sufficient fruit, almost as if Morathi was expecting such attack. A pretext created to lure Hellebron into a direct assault, allowing the Hag Sorceress to claim she was provoked and thereby destroy the Blood Queen once and for all, without fear of reprisal from any on the Black Council.\n\nIt is a challenge that Hellebron must answer or look fatally weak. Yet, the Murderess of Khaine will go to battle gladly and use the blood of her entrappers as oil on a cursed whetstone to sharpen the Deathsword and Cursed Blade.

Khaine is pleased by the endless killing orchestrated by the Blood Queen. It is no secret though that the greatest of the Bloody-handed God's gifts has not yet been secured. It is time for Hellebron to gather her most vicious sisters and thralls, and occupy the Shrine of Khaine. Only then will the Amulet of Dark Fire ignite.

She puts her wrath on a simmer, and will deal with him when he inevitably returns to her service, for there is no-one else that offers him the challenging targets she does.

To wrest such lore from Malekith's mother is no easy task. After all, it's one that Hellebron has been trying to steal for thousands of years. A more subtle approach is needed. However, Morathi is unpredictable. Should this scheme come to violence then it would be foolish not to have Khaine's blessing in place. Sacrifices must be made to the Bloody-handed God!

Perhaps unsurprisingly, Morathi saw through Hellebron's agent. It was a clumsy attempt and no doubt a reprisal from the Hag Sorceress is already being planned or underway. But the Blood Queen is not one to wait for her enemies to act – it is time to take radical steps. Raiding Quintex will create bedlam, sow dissent, and there will be many glorious murders! Capturing Morathi's pleasure-slaves may also enable the Blood Queen to harvest the secrets that Morathi only reveals in the throes of ecstasy!

It is a brave or foolish foe that attacks Morathi so directly… so brazenly! The raiding of Quintex did not bear sufficient fruit, almost as if Morathi was expecting such attack. A pretext created to lure Hellebron into a direct assault, allowing the Hag Sorceress to claim she was provoked and thereby destroy the Blood Queen once and for all, without fear of reprisal from any on the Black Council.\n\nIt is a challenge that Hellebron must answer or look fatally weak. Yet, the Murderess of Khaine will go to battle gladly and use the blood of her entrappers as oil on a cursed whetstone to sharpen the Deathsword and Cursed Blade.

Set in the diadem worn upon the Everqueen's brow, the Star of Avelorn is a jewel of immense power. But it has been cursed by Hellebron – the crone has twisted the will of a once-loyal Handmaiden. The breaking of such a trust – a loss keenly felt by Alarielle – has affected the power of the star.\n\nThe Everqueen must replace the traitor, and so fortify herself against further attacks and betrayals.

News of the betrayal against the Everqueen has spread. The Asur are shocked to the core that one so close to Alarielle could turn from her light. Seeds of doubt regarding the Everqueen's purity begin to germinate. The Everqueen must reassure all of Ulthuan she has Isha's unconditional love. She holds the power to purge such taint from the lands and minds of all in her presence.

The cleansing was a success, but if Hellebron or her ruinous allies cannot usurp Ulthuan from within, their rage will come from a more direct route. Norscan puppets attack and raid, desperate to despoil and unmake the peace Alarielle has fostered. These invaders must be shown the wrath of the Radiant!

Hellebron's curse remains upon the Star of Avelorn. The Norse attacks are but a symptom of this malady. A distraction to keep Alarielle occupied rather than trying to repair the damage done by the Handmaiden's treachery. However, the Maiden Guard have found a vile Northman of the Norse raiders, who claims knowledge and the lore needed to break the curse.\n\nHe will sing his sorry tale before the Everqueen as all do, for none can say falsehood in her presence. Yet, her advisors suggest caution. This dark-hearted mortal broke almost too easily... it may well be a trap. The Handmaidens ask they be sent in her stead; when they know it is safe they will summon their mistress.

The Everqueen's scouts report that attempts to lure her to the Norseman with information of the Star's curse is indeed a trap, for the forces of Chaos muster close by. But Alarielle is not like the Everqueens of the past; she has spent as much of her reign on the battlefield as in her silken pavilion. Alarielle will bring her own war host against the Dark Powers, but it will be the heretics forced into a trap, not her.

The Moonbow's quiver is empty. No ordinary arrows can be loosed by such a bow – only those fletched with feathers soaked in Druchii blood warrant the string to be drawn. Collecting such ingredients would be a grisly task for any southern Elf, but it's one the Shadow King will gladly perform.

The Shadow Warriors go about their ruthless duties as expected. The raids are having a devastating impact on the Witch King's minions. However, it won't be long before the Druchii take action to prevent them. King Anar should stay one step ahead and eliminate their patrols in the area.

Like a fine wine that gets better with age, the best Druchii blood for soaking Moonbow feathers is tinged with dread. The Dark Elves fear the Shadow King and the warriors of Nagarythe with good reason, but a reminder is always useful to sustain the legend. It is time to deliver an even heavier blow against the hated foe. Sacking their outposts will cripple them while enriching our own endeavours.

Soon Anar will have gathered all he requires to fill the quiver of the Moonbow once more. And yet, even snivelling cowards such as the Dark Elves can only be pushed so far it seems. They prepare to ensnare the Shadow King into a trap. Surely even these fools know that it is impossible to trap a shadow?

With the Druchii holding most of Nagarythe, including the Shrine of Khaine, the king's campaign of vengeance is at risk. Anar must drive the enemy from his homeland and not let any being close to Widowmaker.

Set in the diadem worn upon the Everqueen's brow, the Star of Avelorn is a jewel of immense power. But it has been cursed by Hellebron – the crone has twisted the will of a once-loyal Handmaiden. The breaking of such a trust – a loss keenly felt by Alarielle – has affected the power of the star.\n\nThe Everqueen must replace the traitor, and so fortify herself against further attacks and betrayals.

It is time to deliver an even heavier blow against the hated foe. Sacking their outposts will cripple them while enriching our own endeavours.

Soon Anar will have gathered all he requires to fill the quiver of the Moonbow once more. And yet, even snivelling cowards such as the Dark Elves can only be pushed so far it seems. They prepare to ensnare the Shadow King into a trap. Surely even these fools know that it is impossible to trap a shadow?

With the Druchii holding most of Nagarythe, including the Shrine of Khaine, the king's campaign of vengeance is at risk. Anar must drive the enemy from his homeland and not let any being close to Widowmaker.
Alarielle, mother and protector of all the Asur, stands guard over Ulthuan. The invading Druchii must be pushed back!
column6: ph the Queen returns to defend Ulthuan. The presence of the queen bolsters your soldiers, no amount of druchii armour could defend against their determinition.

column3: There is a legend known to the sentinels in the watchtowers far to the north of Naggaroth. It tells of a great multi-headed beast: a War Hydra. The creature does not age, but simply gets larger and its scales denser as the years go by. The Beast of Raema is the perfect quarry, so you head toward the Land of Chill, aiming for the watchtowers that guard the Witch King's realm.\n\nAn underling brings you word that, only recently, the watchtower of Dargoth was attacked by a raging beast. The hunt - it seems - is on.
column4: Monster Hunt: The Beast of Raema

column3: The Dark Elves, like all Elves, are cowards; they just hide their craven nature under a veneer of superiority. The tribe shall take from this watchtower whatever riches still remain, then bring violence to the pathetic survivors until one of them tells you what you need to know.
column4: Monster Hunt: The Beast of Raema

column3: The Druchii will not talk. Better to simply deprive the wretches of life then waste any more time. Instead, summon one of your own; the Werekin shall track our quarry - the Beast of Raema will not avoid the Norse hunters for long.
column4: Monster Hunt: The Beast of Raema

column3: You have learned that it was indeed a gigantic War Hydra that attacked the watchtower. This is the monster you hunt! Although there's no doubt, it has also come to light that the creature is not alone. Beastmen accompany the War Hydra, worshipping it as a deity. By all accounts, these Gors are even more rabid than their usual cloven kin. It matters not - if they get between you and your prey then they will become trophies as well!\n\nAs you follow the trail, your scouts report back that the beast has struck again! Even now it attacks another Dark Elf watchtower - now is your chance!
column4: Monster Hunt: The Beast of Raema

column3:
There is a legend known to the sentinels in the watchtowers far to the north of Naggaroth which tells of a great War Hydra known as the Beast of Raema. It is the perfect quarry, never aging but simply getting larger and its scales denser as the years go by. Having received word that the watchtower of Dargoth had recently been attacked by a raging multi-headed beast, you headed toward the Land of Chill to investigate.

You arrived at the watchtower in the aftermath of the attack, the tower itself still aflame, with bodies of the recently-mauled littering the area. Given the scale of the devastation, there could be no doubt that the gigantic War Hydra that you hunt was the creature that attacked it. Furthermore, it also came to light that the creature is not alone. It is accompanied by Beastmen, who are worshipping it as a deity. By all accounts, these Gors are even more rabid than their usual cloven kin. It matters not - if they get between you and your prey then they will become trophies as well!

As you follow the trail, your scouts report back that the beast has struck again! Even now it attacks another Dark Elf watchtower - now is your chance!
column4: Monster Hunt: The Beast of Raema

column3: While dancing in the Warpstone vapours and flames of the camp's fire, your Shaman claims to have been given instructions from the Dark Gods. He has learned that the ratmen of Clan Gritus have commissioned a great beast - a true abomination from the flesh-shapers of Clan Moulder. From his fervour-vision, the Shaman sees thousands upon thousands of screeching rats scratching on bloody walls, desperate to escape their fleshy prison...\n\nClan Gritus were last seen in the cold north - the perfect environment for any Gods-fearing Norseman.
column4: Monster Hunt: The Hellbeast of Seep-Gore

column3: Despite this horde not being Clan Gritus itself, these Skaven are no doubt a vassal-clan or even a decoy. This hunt is going to be a difficult one, for rats are notoriously hard to corner. The trail is at risk of going cold, quite literally. However, it was your Gods that set you on this course, and it is they who can give you the next breadcrumb in the trail. However, you cannot just make demands of the Ruinous Powers - a sacrifice must be made.
column4: Monster Hunt: The Hellbeast of Seep-Gore

column3: The Dark Gods have illuminated the path ahead - they seem as keen as you to grab this prize. It must be worth a great deal, or perhaps slaying such prey will inconvenience the Skaven's own bastard god, the Great Horned Rat? In any case, the way forward is now clear: the hunt is on!\n\nThe trail now goes below ground. This is home territory for the ratmen, but not so much for the Norse, who prefer enough room to swing their axes. Caution is advised.
column4: Monster Hunt: The Hellbeast of Seep-Gore

column3:
While dancing in the Warpstone vapours and flames of the camp's fire, your Shaman claimed to have been given instructions from the Dark Gods. He’d learned that the ratmen of Clan Gritus had commissioned a great beast - a true abomination from the flesh-shapers of Clan Moulder. In his fervour-vision, the Shaman also saw thousands upon thousands of screeching rats scratching on bloody walls, desperate to escape their fleshy prison...

You headed into the cold north where Clan Gritus had last been seen. Rats are notoriously hard to corner, however, and the trail was suddenly at risk of going cold. Razing a few settlements as sacrifices to the Dark Gods, it became evident that they are as keen as you to grab this prize and they illuminated the path ahead, leading you to the vicinity of the Temple of Addidoth. The abomination must be worth a great deal to the Ruinous Powers, or perhaps slaying such prey will inconvenience the Skaven's own bastard god, the Great Horned Rat? In any case, the way forward is now clear: the hunt is on!

The trail now goes below ground. This is home territory for the ratmen, but not so much for the Norse, who prefer enough room to swing their axes. Caution is advised.
column4: Monster Hunt: The Hellbeast of Seep-Gore

column3:
Even by the Norse, it is known that the Annulii Mountains - the unbroken chain that surrounds the Elven home of Ulthuan - are a rich habitat for many wonderous creatures. While the Chaos wastes to the north will always provide the tainted and deranged, the creatures that inhabit the Annulii seem 'purer' and therefore more desirable prey.

Setting foot on Ulthuan is no easy task, the Elf-scum that selfishly live on the island have always gone to great lengths to protect it. But they will not deprive you now, especially when word has reached the tribe that a Phoenix matriarch, one that has not been seen in centuries, will appear on their island once again. To take that from the world would cause great upset to the Elves.

The rumour originates from Dark Elf contacts, a merchant on the black market trying to sell a large pinion of the Flamespyre. Time to give this contact a visit and investigate his wares.
column4: Monster Hunt: Mother of the Flame

column3: The rage in you - channelled by the Dark Gods - begs to punish this pale Elf for daring to make such a demand. Yet, you feel that one punch would break this fragile thing, denying your warband their hunt. You agree to the Druchii's terms and send your underling to find this victim. After all, you can always kill the Elf and his token bodyguards once you have the location of the volcano.
column4: Monster Hunt: Mother of the Flame

column3: Vaul's Anvil lies across the ocean, on the southern edge of Ulthuan. It is a raging volcano and sacred site for the Asur. The Norse gather their longships and set sail. The High Elves will do everything they can to stop the Northmen setting foot of their precious isle, but they shall fail.
column4: Monster Hunt: Mother of the Flame

column3:
Even by the Norse, it is known that the Annulii Mountains - the unbroken chain that surrounds the Elven home of Ulthuan - are a rich habitat for many wonderous creatures. While the Chaos wastes to the north will always provide the tainted and deranged, the creatures that inhabit the Annulii seem 'purer' and therefore are a more desirable prey.

Word had reached you of a rumour amongst the Dark Elves that a Phoenix matriarch, one that has not been seen in centuries, will appear on Ulthuan once again. Legend has it that it is a creature of Hekarti, existing between the mortal plane and the Realm of Chaos. The 'Mother of the Flame' only makes its appearance on the side of the mortal veil rarely, once a century at most, awoken into this world through the heart of a burning volcano. The source of the rumour was a Dark Elf merchant of the black market, who also had knowledge of where the Phoenix is due to appear. He would not give up the information without some petty bargaining, however, which you had little patience for. As you unleashed your Ice Wolves upon him, the wretch told you all you needed to know before one of them bit through his spinal cord with a wet crack.

Vaul’s Anvil, on the southern edge of Ulthuan, is your next destination – a raging volcano and sacred site for the Asur. The Norse gather their longships and set sail. The High Elves will do everything they can to stop the Northmen setting foot on their precious isle, but they shall fail.
column4: Monster Hunt: Mother of the Flame

column3:
The jungles of Lustria are teeming with deadly - and perpetually hungry - predators, but there is one legend that reverberates through the continent; one myth that spooks the Amazons and even has the Pygmies darting back into their warrens...

 Where Gargantulzan stalks nothing lives. The mightiest of feral Carnosaurs has roamed Lustria for centuries but, for once, *it* will become the prey - let the hunt begin!

A guide is needed to take you on the trail into the fetid jungles. Rumours spoken in hushed tones from one oar-slave to the next have reached you that the slave-merchants at the Point may have someone with such knowledge. The slavers will provide such a guide or become enslaved themselves...

At first the Skink claims ignorance of the dark tongue spoken by your tribe. It refuses to even speak in its natural Saurian. But when one of your men starts to cut off its head-crest, it breaks into a broken version of Empire-speak known as Reikspiel. This is a language your folk recognise from various raids across the Sea of Claws - it is the tongue of mewling victims, and fitting for this battered guide.\n\nThe creature babbles non-stop about some 'Great Plan' but after that is beaten from it, the reptile finally mentions a possible lead - an island on which sits a great Crimson Skull, home to the mighty behemoths of Lustria. It is a long journey ahead and so a stop for provisions and a blessing to the Ruinous Powers at the Norse colony of Skeggi would be wise.

After leaving Skeggi, your reptilian guide becomes far less reluctant and seems even helpful in giving directions though the dense jungle. If you didn't know better, you would think the creature was enjoying the misery wrought on your Norsemen - who are people used to cold and ice - now dealing with intense heat and gad-flies constantly feasting on their flesh.\n\nIn the far distance, unmistakable roars are heard of timeless beasts on the hunt. It seems the quarry is getting closer...

The jungles of Lustria are teeming with deadly - and perpetually hungry - predators, but the legend of Gargantulzan reverberates through the continent, spooking the Amazons and sending the Pygmies darting back into their warrens. The mightiest of feral Carnosaurs has roamed Lustria for centuries, but now will become the prey.

In an effort to obtain a guide to take you through the fetid jungles on the beast's trail, you sought out the slave-merchants of the Point. The pathetic slavers initially drew a blank on a willing guide, before one of them dared to make a suggestion, leading you to a cage containing a small reptile – a Skink. He claimed that with the right amount of ‘persuasion’, it would lead you to your quarry. At first the Skink claimed ignorance of the dark tongue spoken by your tribe, but when one of your men started to cut off its head-crest it broke into a broken version of Empire-speak known as Reikspiel, babbling non-stop about some 'Great Plan', before finally mentioning a possible lead.

After a brief stop at the Norse colony of Skeggi for provisions and a blessing to the Ruinous Powers, your reptilian guide leads you deep into the jungle, seemingly far less reluctant in giving directions. If you didn't know better, you would think the creature was enjoying the misery wrought on your Norsemen - who are people used to cold and ice - now dealing with intense heat and gad-flies constantly feasting on their flesh.

In the far distance, unmistakable roars are heard of timeless beasts on the hunt. It seems the quarry is getting closer...

This world was once the dominion of the High Elves; now they are brought to lesser significance in the twilight of their race. Yet their fury and pride have not diminished - from Ulthuan, the High Elves continue to strike out at their enemies, in defence of the world.

After the Sundering, too much was allowed to fall into Druchii hands, and so much else besides slipped into the oceans. What cannot be saved must be destroyed; the enemies of Ulthuan must be hounded to the ends of the world.

There are enemies of the Asur everywhere, and enemies of the Asur are enemies of the world itself. To the west, the Dark Elves plot the destruction of all life, so corrupted have they become. They, and their ilk, cannot be suffered to survive!
If Ulthuan is to be free to know peace, or to regain a semblance of its former glory, all enemies must be expelled from the land, then pursued to their source and destroyed.

At the heart of Ulthuan lies the Vortex, a dimensional rift that, through the actions of the High Elves, holds the world together. If the Vortex falls - as some would see it do - then the world will be ripped apart. All enemies of the Vortex must therefore be vanquished!

This world was once the dominion of the High Elves; now they are brought to lesser significance in the twilight of their race. Yet their fury and pride have not diminished - from Ulthuan, the High Elves continue to strike out at their enemies, in defence of the world.

After the Sundering, too much was allowed to fall into Druchii hands, and so much else besides slipped into the oceans. What cannot be saved must be destroyed; the enemies of Ulthuan must be hounded to the ends of the world.

There are enemies of the Asur everywhere, and enemies of the Asur are enemies of the world itself. To the west, the Dark Elves plot the destruction of all life, so corrupted have they become. They, and their ilk, cannot be suffered to survive!
If Ulthuan is to be free to know peace, or to regain a semblance of its former glory, all enemies must be expelled from the land, then pursued to their source and destroyed.

At the heart of Ulthuan lies the Vortex; a dimensional rift that, through the actions of the High Elves, holds the world together. If the Vortex falls - as some would see it do - then the world will be ripped apart. All enemies of the Vortex must therefore be vanquished!

The frozen lands of Naggaroth are a far cry from the glittering beauty of Ulthuan, but it is the Druchii home now. As such, they will claim as much of it as possible, and forge a new kingdom from the chilled wastes.

It was by the Druchii's hands that the Sundering was brought about. Malekith's forces duelled with the Asur for control of the Great Vortex, and the struggle resulted in a savage cataclysm that rended the world asunder. Malekith would see that again, if he could.

The Dark Elves made their homes in the towering Black Arks that bore them aloft to Naggaroth. Once beached, they became fortresses for the Druchii. From here, they launch expeditions into Naggaroth, to explore and conquer the frozen land.

The Merciless Host marches with a relentless cadence, beating out a drumbeat of destruction. From the rank and file soldiery, to the terrifying and imposing beasts of war, all are aligned with Hellebron's desire for destruction.

The Dark Elves were born to rule over others; strength begets strength, and that strength confers power over the weak; dominion over those unable to stop them. Any Druchii not strong enough to dominate others is fit only for death.
column4: Chapter V: Burn it - Burn it All!

column3: Glorious! The Beast of Raema is just as the legends proclaim - the creature's many heads will make perfect trophies and a worthy sacrifice to the Dark Gods. Its Beastmen acolytes bray with a madness you have not seen in the Cloven Ones before, so be wary when tackling them. But enough posturing - the hunt nears its end and there is a monster to slay!
column4: Monster Hunt: The Beast of Raema

column3: Through the stinking, cramped tunnels you go and then finally you emerge at Seep-Gore, lair of the Hellbeast. The creature lumbers forward, its straining abdomen appearing to pulse as if barely constraining the hordes within its distended belly.\n\nThe monster is truly is an abomination! Its heads will make many trophies and a worthy dedication to the Dark Gods... Kill it!
column4: Monster Hunt: The Hellbeast of Seep-Gore

column3: Despite the Shifting Isles, you arrive in time, as the volcano growls. Assuming the snivelling Druchii told the truth, the Mother of the Flame will rise from Vaul's Anvil at any moment. Then, you see the High Elves deploy their Dragon Princes and Phoenix Guard - warriors sent to guard this mythical creature and a sure sign that this is indeed the right time.\n\nBreak them apart to claim victory. This bird will make a perfect sacrifice!
column4: Monster Hunt: Mother of the Flame

column3:
After endless days trudging through the jungle, your warband arrives at a great temple scattered with the bones of beasts and other prey. It is a feeding ground. You turn to ask the Skink if this is the place to bait a trap, but the reptile has gone! All that remains is a shackle containing a foot gnawed through at the ankle. It seems the trap is not yours to set - for you are the bait!

A great roar rumbles across the clearing, the ground shakes, birds scatter from the lush canopies, and the usually-loud jungle is suddenly silent... until pierced by another roar. Then, from the trees, a chanting is heard "Gargantulzan! Gargantulzan! Gargantulzan!"

The behemoth has arrived, and you must now fight a Carnosaur of legend!

A great stain is upon the land. Avelorn suffers, and so the light within the Shieldstone of Isha dims. For the first time in the gods' memory, the Druchii – the lost kin – have taken the Phoenix Gate. Finubar and Tyrion are rightly distracted by the momentous events of the Vortex, but Alarielle has never been a queen that merely perches upon a throne. She will act – the Phoenix Gate will return to Asur hands!

Mistress, the High Elves are on the back foot - you should press the advantage. Conquer this whole land and create a pirate paradise on Ulthuan.\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Mistress, the Dark Elves' assault across Ulthuan has distracted the Asur - you should strike and take their settlements while the chaos lasts!\n\nLearn more about settlements [[url:script_link_campaign_settlements]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_settlements}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Mistress, these High Elves cannot stand against you - you should finish them off while you still have momentum. If you allow them to rebuild they could cause problems in the future.\n\nLearn more about factions [[url:script_link_campaign_factions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_factions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The entire province has fallen, mistress, and all within are under your control. I advise you enact a new commandment to cement in the people’s minds that you are their ruler now.\n\nLearn more about commandments [[url:script_link_campaign_commandments]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_commandments}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Your minion is completely under your control. Let's send them on a mission. And mistress, I advise you make it a particularly difficult task – only the strong are worthy to serve at your behest.\n\nLearn more about heroic actions [[url:script_link_campaign_hero_actions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_hero_actions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Mistress, there are creatures we can utilise to further our goals. All we need do is build a suitable lair to summon these minions.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Your ingenuity has paid off, mistress, for gifted minions have taken residence in the constructed lair. Now, bend them to your will!\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Mistress, minions who feel appreciated will always perform better than those who feel spurned. Raise a Lord’s loyalty to maximum and witness the benefits of a fulfilled commander.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_loyalty]][[/img]]loyalty [[url:script_link_campaign_vampiric_loyalty]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_vampiric_loyalty}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The dead here worship one above all else; should we agree to not raid their lands we will save ourselves a powerful foe. Sign a non-aggression pact with this king, mistress. \n\nLearn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_non_aggression_pacts}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Mistress, I suggest you establish Pirate Coves at some of your enemies' most profitable settlements. A Pirate Cove can be more profitable in the long run, but you can always take your share of the victor's spoils from battle whilst they are being established. \n\nLearn more about Pirate Coves [[url:script_link_campaign_pirate_coves]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_pirate_coves}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Mistress, you are not fulfilling your potential! There are thousands more corpses ready to be raised for your goals - we need only recruit a capable and loyal leader to direct them.\n\nLearn more about raising armies [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_forces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_raising_forces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Mistress, a band of mortals invades your lands. I advise you show them no mercy and send them to an early grave, and preferably a shallow one, for today's enemies are tomorrow undead fodder.”
