With the sacrificial victims shackled, anointed and otherwise prepared for their ignominious ends, Tehenhauin is ready for yet another great sacrifice to the Sotek the Serpent-God. Though the venerable Slann will never permit filthy Skaven captives to enter their revered temple-cities, the Prophet’s ritual ceremony will nevertheless go ahead as planned: Skaven blood will be spilt this fine day!

With Sotek’s arrival finally at hand, Tehenhauin lays an elaborate trap for the Skaven that he knows still dwell beneath the jungle floors of noble Lustria. If everything goes according to his plan, the remaining Skaven host will be driven back and then herded to Gwakmol Crater, where they would be unable to escape their certain fate. Though the Skaven outnumber the Lizardmen many times over, the Prophet’s ever-growing force is empowered by their leader’s undeniable vigour, and they feel assured of victory despite the seemingly insurmountable odds.

Having felt the power of his Mask of Heavens fading, Tiktaq’to had an inkling that something was amiss. So Hexoatl’s greatest Terradon Rider, the legendary Master of Skies, set out to search for the cause of the disturbance atop his fearsome mount, Zwup. He had first sensed the problem upon his arrival in the Southlands, which led him to conclude that something somewhere on the continent must have been causing it.

Soaring above the vast and immense jungles, Tiktaq’to searched for an explanation through the dense jungle canopy and eventually spotted vermin-like footprints on the ground below. Upon closer inspection, and utilising his highly-developed reptilian senses, he caught the distinct stench of the ratmen’s fear-musk still hanging in the humid air – the Skaven were nearby, and there had to be a link between their presence and the continued weakening of his ancient, revered artefact. After further tracking and skirmishes with small bands of Skavenslaves, Tiktaq’to and his Terradon Riders learnt of an even larger Skaven presence in the jungle. Worse still, they were causing damage to the Geomantic Web through the desecration of the temple ruins in the area, likely whilst searching for the damnable Warpstone deposits.

Only the defiling activities of the despicable Skaven could’ve caused such local disruption to the Web, in turn explaining the weakening of the blessings upon Tiktaq’to’s Mask of Heavens. Now he has acquired this knowledge, there is little else to be done but head to their last known location and slaughter every last one of the blasphemous Skaven-spawn with extreme prejudice!

Although the Mask of Heavens' power is fading, thrice-blessed artefacts such as this are not so easy to destroy – something is amiss. Tiktaq’to, Hexoatl's greatest Terradon Rider – the legendary Master of Skies, no less – must search for the source of this disturbance atop his fearsome mount called Zwup. With the connection to the rest of his Terradon pack weakened, however, he must call in riders from further afield to aid him. Once Tiktaq'to has assembled a complete squadron, he can begin his search for the cause of this blasphemy!

With his squadron finally assembled, Tiktaq’to sets off in search of the disturbance. The weakening of the Mask of Heavens began when the Master of Skies arrived in the Southlands jungles, leading Tiktaq’to to conclude that this continent must be the source of the disturbance. Be that as it may, the Southlands jungles are vast and immense, and searching through the dense jungle canopy is no easy feat, even for the most experienced aerial combatant among the Lizardmen. Pausing for thought, Tiktaq’to realises that the search must begin where he first noticed the power of the Mask of Heavens fade.

Through the cracks in the leafy jungle ceiling, Tiktaq’to spots vermin-like footprints on the ground below. Upon further inspection and utilising his highly-developed reptilian senses, he catches the distinct stench of Skaven fear-musk still hanging in the humid air. Though their thoroughly despicable presence is not unheard of on this continent, the Master of Skies is suspicious that there is a direct link to the continued weakening of his ancient, revered artefact. Whilst there is no proof that these two incidents are related, Tiktaq’to instinctively knows that following the ratmen’s tracks will lead him to the source of the problem.

After tracking down the wretched rat-spawn and immediately before putting an end to their worthless lives, Tiktaq’to and his Terradon Riders learn of an even larger Skaven presence here in the jungle, but their vast underground network of tunnels is masking their whereabouts from any flying above ground. The Master of Skies knows he is close, but now he needs the specialized expertise of another; he needs the aid of a Skink Priest – one able to swiftly use the Winds of Magic to pinpoint the deadly vermin’s filthy, disgusting lair, before he and his noble riders wipe it from the face of Lustria.

The Skink Priest immediately feels a disturbance in the area – he had no need to use the Winds of Magic after all, for he was able to instinctively feel the damage to the Geomantic Web. Whether intentionally or not, the foul rat-spawn must have desecrated the lost temple ruins in this place, probably whilst searching for their damnable Warpstone deposits – only something like that could’ve caused such local disruption to the Web, in turn explaining the weakening of the blessings upon Tiktaq’to’s Mask of Heavens. Now he has acquired this knowledge, there is little else to be done but head to the temple and slaughter every last one of the blasphemous Skaven-spawn with extreme prejudice!

Lord Kroak is one of the First Generation of Slann Mage-Priests, and possibly the eldest, making him one of the most powerful active creatures of any race. He has an added advantage, however, in that he is technically dead; Kroak’s mortal body was killed during the Great Catastrophe but his remains were preserved by loyal Skink attendants, enabling him to re-emerge as the first Relic Priest. Due to his death, Kroak’s meditative cycles are significantly longer than those of younger Slann. An elder Slann must be awakened to reveal his last known location as, simply put, no one else is old enough to remember!

Unfortunately, it appears that the Lord Kroak was roused from his slumber far too early; not enough time had passed since his previous awakening, so he remains in a semi-dream state. This has caused some confusion – both for Kroak and for his attendants – although he is able to give a rough indication as to his whereabouts, pinpointing his exact location will require deeper investigation by his loyal attendants.

After a considerable amount of searching high and low right across Lustria, Lord Kroak’s Skink scouts finally locate the overgrown temple-tomb in which the ancient Relic Priest is meditating, as ever, upon the fine details of the Great Plan. However, in their haste it would appear that the scouts were somewhat careless, as they have been followed to Kroak’s location by a force of those insidious ratmen, the Skaven! They plan to destroy him, once and for all, by incinerating his physical remains that anchor him to the world. This must not come to pass – defend Kroak from harm whilst his priests awaken him!

Ikit Claw understands very well that direct confrontation with the Lizardmen is not viable, but wiping those tiresome toads from the face of the world always remains a priority, as the Lizardmen plot the demise of all Skaven with equal vigour. In an effort to weaken them before facing them in battle, he set into motion a plan to corrupt their ‘blessed’ spawning pools. Bringing his multifarious capabilities to bear, Ikit used a Warpstone Tractor Beam of his own design to blast the Chaos Moon, raining down fragments to corrupt not just the Lizardmen’s spawning pools themselves, but also the entire surrounding area. The outrageous scheme would deliver the added bonus of supplying Ikit with bountiful deposits of Warpstone to fuel further experiments back at his Forbidden Workshop.\n\nNo plan survives contact with an enemy, however, not even one formulated by the great Ikit Claw, and certainly not when faced with such an advanced foe as the perfidious Lizardmen. Irritatingly, the ever-watchful Slann Astromancers had spotted the falling Warpstone as Ikit approached so are fully battle-ready, and a Skaven scouting party reports that additional Lizardmen reinforcements are already on their way. Collecting some of the pure, fallen Warpstone from the field, Ikit repairs his deadly Warp-lightning thrower, Storm Daemon, and steels himself for the fray. There’s nothing else for it – he must hold his ground and make use of the chaos caused by the storm to gain advantage on the battlefield.

Right now, all of Ikit Claw’s not inconsiderable intellect is ranged against the hated Lizardmen, against whom, in a rare moment of solidarity, the various Skaven clans have united. He understands very well that direct confrontation with the Lizardmen is not viable, but wiping those tiresome toads from the face of the world has to remain the priority, as Ikit knows the Lizardmen are plotting the demise of all Skaven with equal vigour. He needs to find a way to weaken them before facing them in battle and fancies there will be no better way than corrupting their ‘blessed’ spawning pools. The location of these are of course unknown, but this doesn’t present much of a problem – the Chief Warlock Engineer isn’t above extracting the information he needs from enemy captives himself, when the need arises…

After hours of brutal torture, involving several different nightmarish devices designed to deliver the truth in between bouts of screaming agony, Ikit is just getting into his stride when a location is finally revealed by the unfortunate captive. Turning to his assistants, he draws his claw across his own throat in silent instruction; immediately, they move in to relieve the dying Lizardman of what little remains of his miserable life. There’s no time to waste – Ikit must send a spy to confirm that the spawning pools are indeed where they are supposed to be.

Having confirmed the spawning pools’ location, Ikit Claw moves in for the kill by bringing his multifarious capabilities to bear. Always looking for new ways to bring about the destruction of his enemies, he plans to use a new device to blast the Chaos Moon so fragments rain down and corrupt not just the spawning pools themselves, but also the entire surrounding area. If successful, this scheme will deliver the added bonus of supplying Ikit with almost endless deposits of Warpstone to fuel further experiments back at his Forbidden Workshop. To better achieve his goal, Ikit now decides to construct a Warpstone beam to blast chunks from the Chaos Moon and guide them directly to their target.

No plan survives contact with an enemy, not even one formulated by the great Ikit Claw, and certainly not when faced with such an advanced foe as the perfidious Lizardmen. Irritatingly, the ever-watchful Slann Astromancers must have spotted the blasted Warpstone closing in, for they are fully battle-ready, and a Skaven scouting party reports that additional reinforcements are already on their way. Collecting some of the pure, fallen Warpstone from the field, Ikit repairs his deadly Warp-lightning thrower, Storm Daemon, and steels himself for the fray. There’s nothing else for it – he must hold his ground and make use of the chaos caused by the storm to gain advantage on the battlefield.

Due to his death, Kroak’s meditative cycles are significantly longer than those of younger Slann. An elder Slann must be awakened to reveal his last known location as, simply put, no one else is old enough to remember!

Unfortunately, it appears that the Lord Kroak was roused from his slumber far too early; not enough time had passed since his previous awakening, so he remains in a semi-dream state. This has caused some confusion – both for Kroak and for his attendants – although he is able to give a rough indication as to his whereabouts, pinpointing his exact location will require deeper investigation by his loyal attendants.

After a considerable amount of searching high and low right across Lustria, Lord Kroak’s Skink scouts finally locate the overgrown temple-tomb in which the ancient Relic Priest is meditating, as ever, upon the fine details of the Great Plan. However, in their haste it would appear that the scouts were somewhat careless, as they have been followed to Kroak’s location by a force of those insidious ratmen, the Skaven! They plan to destroy him, once and for all, by incinerating his physical remains that anchor him to the world. This must not come to pass – defend Kroak from harm whilst his priests awaken him!

A valiant start, Tehenhauin, but more rat-spawn dwell elsewhere; corrupting and withering life in Lustria. Seek out more territory and clear it of vermin!\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The Dust Gate offers insight into the lost plaques for which we search, but it appears to be occupied by another. We must take this temple if we are to find the missing plaques.\n\nLearn more about ritual resource sites [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_resource_sites]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_resource_sites}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Prophet of Sotek! The plague-ridden rat-spawn once again invade our continent. Purge them and restore order as the Old Ones foretold!

Skaven inhabit the Under-Empire, making their settlements indistinguishable from ruins until approached.

Learn more about the Skaven Under-Empire [[url:script_link_campaign_skaven_underworld]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_skaven_underworld}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The area is purged, Great Prophet. The Skink delvers perch ready to extract the troves of lost plaques we so desperately need. All you need do is give the order.\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The interpretation of the Great Plan over the millennia is dense and complex - some knowledge has regretfully been lost. We must discover forgotten lore and fathom new methods of warfare against the warmbloods. Construction of this building will allow us to begin.\n\nLearn more about technologies [[url:script_link_campaign_technology]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_technology}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Wise you are, mighty Prophet of Sotek. The ritual is prepared yet we lack the plaques to complete it. Seek them out so we may protect the Great Warding.\n\nLearn more about ritual currency [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_currency]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_currency}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The rat-spawn must be killed if Lustria is to recover from the plagues spread by these vile, rancid creatures!\n\nLearn more about factions [[url:script_link_campaign_factions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_factions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The province is under your control now, Prophet of Sotek, the coldbloods in this territory will obey your commands.\n\nLearn more about commandments [[url:script_link_campaign_commandments]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_commandments}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].
The correct alignment is upon us, righteous prophet. Enact the Ritual of Prognostication!

The servant awaits your attention, my master. Send him on a critical task to further the Great Plan!\n\nLearn more about heroic actions [[url:script_link_campaign_hero_actions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_hero_actions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Master, force alone will not achieve the Great Plan. We must seek out chosen ones to perform certain tasks. Erect a beacon to summon them.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

We are ready, master. The chosen ones gather, basking in the sun. Call them.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The Southern Sentinels also seek to rid Lustria of the plague spreading filth, master. It would therefore be wise to communicate our intention to join them in this holy purge.\n\nLearn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_non_aggression_pacts}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Though your might is renowned, Prophet of Sotek, to carry out the will of Sotek and our revered masters we must enlist more disciples. Bestow armies upon them and they will do your bidding, Tehenhauin.\n\nLearn more about raising armies [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_forces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_raising_forces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Skink researchers and archivists are poised to do your bidding, ancient master. Select the field of knowledge you require and they shall begin.\n\nLearn more about technologies [[url:script_link_campaign_technology]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_technology}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Master! The ever-reaching roots of the forest Elf-spawn has invaded Lustria. We must trim this tendril before more thorns sprout from it. !\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Further sacred plaques are required to complete the ritual, wise Prophet of Sotek! We must scour the ruins of our abandoned Temples for them!\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_searching_ruins]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_searching_ruins}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Prophet of Sotek, the Southern Sentinels have agreed to aid us in our cause. We should trade supplies, both furthering our bond and strengthening each other also.\n\nLearn more about[[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]] trade agreements [[url:script_link_campaign_trade]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_trade}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The spawning pools and barrios are crowded, master. We must look to our settlements - expand and enhance. As per the Old Ones’ plan.\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

With the sacrificial victims shackled, anointed and otherwise prepared for their ignominious ends, Tehenhauin is ready for yet another great sacrifice to the Sotek the Serpent-God. Though the venerable Slann will never permit filthy Skaven captives to enter their revered temple-cities, the Prophet’s ritual ceremony will nevertheless go ahead as planned: Skaven blood will be spilt this fine day!

Sacrifices of great importance involve, as you might expect, the ritual killing of thousands upon thousands of gibbering, jabbering rat men, and the air is filled with their fear-musk mixed with the stench of their foul urine and the sounds of their pathetic whining and begging. With the sacrificial victims shackled, anointed and otherwise prepared for their ignominious ends, Tehenhauin is ready for yet another great sacrifice to the Sotek the Serpent-God. Though the venerable Slann will never permit filthy Skaven captives to enter their revered temple-cities, the Prophet’s ritual ceremony will nevertheless go ahead as planned: Skaven blood will be spilt this fine day!

Sacrifices of great importance involve, as you might expect, the ritual killing of thousands upon thousands of gibbering, jabbering rat men, and the air is filled with their fear-musk mixed with the stench of their foul urine and the sounds of their pathetic whining and begging. With the sacrificial victims shackled, anointed and otherwise prepared for their ignominious ends, Tehenhauin is ready for yet another great sacrifice to the Sotek the Serpent-God. Though the venerable Slann will never permit filthy Skaven captives to enter their revered temple-cities, the Prophet’s ritual ceremony will nevertheless go ahead as planned: Skaven blood will be spilt this fine day!

With Sotek’s arrival finally at hand, Tehenhauin lays an elaborate trap for the Skaven that he knows still dwell beneath the jungle floors of noble Lustria. If everything goes according to his plan, the remaining Skaven host will be driven back and then herded to Gwakmol Crater, where they would be unable to escape their certain fate. Though the Skaven outnumber the Lizardmen many times over, the Prophet’s ever-growing force is empowered by their leader’s undeniable vigour, and they feel assured of victory despite the seemingly insurmountable odds.

Inspiring work, Master of Skies, but there is a further element to your task. Unify this province under our banner, as the Old Ones willed it to be.\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The Orc-spawn occupy a key location! The plaques contained within the Golden Tower must be retrieved. Kill the filthy green warmbloods!\n\nLearn more about ritual resource sites [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_resource_sites]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_resource_sites}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Master of Skies! The warmbloods have wandered too far - the Great Plan does not allow for their presence in this land. Take their settlement! \n\nLearn more about settlements [[url:script_link_campaign_settlements]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_settlements}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The area is purged, Master of Skies. The Skink delvers perch ready to extract the troves of lost plaques we so desperately need. All you need do is give the order.\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The interpretation of the Great Plan over the millennia is dense and complex - some knowledge has regretfully been lost. We must discover forgotten lore and fathom new methods of warfare against the warmbloods. Construction of this building will allow us to begin.\n\nLearn more about technologies [[url:script_link_campaign_technology]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_technology}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Further plaques are needed to cast this ritual! We cannot allow the warmbloods to interfere with the Vortex any longer - hurry!\n\nLearn more about ritual currency [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_currency]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_currency}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The Untamed Ones have already fallen foul of the Great Plan: our masters order their deaths.\n\nLearn more about factions [[url:script_link_campaign_factions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_factions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Tiktaq’to, this province is now solely under your rule. Give them a commandment and they will obey.\n\nLearn more about commandments [[url:script_link_campaign_commandments]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_commandments}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].
The correct alignment is upon us, Master of Skies. Enact the Ritual of Prognostication!

The servant awaits your attention, my master. Send him on a critical task to further the Great Plan!\n\nLearn more about heroic actions [[url:script_link_campaign_hero_actions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_hero_actions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Master, force alone will not achieve the Great Plan. We must seek out chosen ones to perform certain tasks. Erect a beacon to summon them.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

We are ready, master. The chosen ones gather, basking in the sun. Call them.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Though the Southlands were cut off from Lustria, not all followers of the Old One remained there. Seek out our brethren and reconnect them to the Geomantic Web!\n\nLearn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_non_aggression_pacts}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Though you are the greatest Terradon rider and Master of Skies, you can not cover all borders and slay all foes alone. New commanders are needed to further the great purpose - summon a new cohort.\n\nLearn more about raising armies [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_forces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_raising_forces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Skink researchers and archivists are poised to do your bidding, ancient master. Select the field of knowledge you require and they shall begin.\n\nLearn more about technologies [[url:script_link_campaign_technology]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_technology}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Master! These warmbloods invade the Southlands! Though they are children of the Old Ones, they have no intention of playing their part in the Great Plan. Slay them!.\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Master of Skies! More plaques are required to perform the Ritual of Prognostication; send our warriors to search for them in the ruins of the Southlands Jungles. Be careful though, as  there may be warmblood traps within.\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_searching_ruins]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_searching_ruins}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Our fellow coldbloods have been separated from the Geomantic Web for too long, they need time to realign with Great Plan. Perhaps a trade agreement would help reinforce our common cause?\n\nLearn more about[[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]] trade agreements [[url:script_link_campaign_trade]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_trade}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The spawning pools and barrios are crowded, master. We must look to our settlements - expand and enhance. As per the Old Ones’ plan.\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Having felt the power of his Mask of Heavens fading, Tiktaq’to had an inkling that something was amiss. So Hexoatl’s greatest Terradon Rider, the legendary Master of Skies, set out to search for the cause of the disturbance atop his fearsome mount, Zwup. He had first sensed the problem upon his arrival in the Southlands, which led him to conclude that something somewhere on the continent must have been causing it.

Soaring above the vast and immense jungles, Tiktaq’to searched for an explanation through the dense jungle canopy and eventually spotted vermin-like footprints on the ground below. Upon closer inspection, and utilising his highly-developed reptilian senses, he caught the distinct stench of the ratmen’s fear-musk still hanging in the humid air – the Skaven were nearby, and there had to be a link between their presence and the continued weakening of his ancient, revered artefact. After further tracking and skirmishes with small bands of Skavenslaves, Tiktaq’to and his Terradon Riders learnt of an even larger Skaven presence in the jungle. Worse still, they were causing damage to the Geomantic Web through the desecration of the temple ruins in the area, likely whilst searching for the damnable Warpstone deposits.

Only the defiling activities of the despicable Skaven could’ve caused such local disruption to the Web, in turn explaining the weakening of the blessings upon Tiktaq’to’s Mask of Heavens. Now he has acquired this knowledge, there is little else to be done but head to their last known location and slaughter every last one of the blasphemous Skaven-spawn with extreme prejudice!

Although the Mask of Heavens' power is fading, thrice-blessed artefacts such as this are not so easy to destroy – something is amiss. Tiktaq’to, Hexoatl's greatest Terradon Rider – the legendary Master of Skies, no less – must search for the source of this disturbance atop his fearsome mount called Zwup. With the connection to the rest of his Terradon pack weakened, however, he must call in riders from further afield to aid him. Once Tiktaq'to has assembled a complete squadron, he can begin his search for the cause of this blasphemy!

With his squadron finally assembled, Tiktaq’to sets off in search of the disturbance. The weakening of the Mask of Heavens began when the Master of Skies arrived in the Southlands jungles, leading Tiktaq’to to conclude that this continent must be the source of the disturbance. Be that as it may, the Southlands jungles are vast and immense, and searching through the dense jungle canopy is no easy feat, even for the most experienced aerial combatant among the Lizardmen. Pausing for thought, Tiktaq’to realises that the search must begin where he first noticed the power of the Mask of Heavens fade.

Through the cracks in the leafy jungle ceiling, Tiktaq’to spots vermin-like footprints on the ground below. Upon further inspection and utilising his highly-developed reptilian senses, he catches the distinct stench of Skaven fear-musk still hanging in the humid air. Though their thoroughly despicable presence is not unheard of on this continent, the Master of Skies is suspicious that there is a direct link to the continued weakening of his ancient, revered artefact. Whilst there is no proof that these two incidents are related, Tiktaq’to instinctively knows that following the ratmen’s tracks will lead him to the source of the problem.

After tracking down the wretched rat-spawn and immediately before putting an end to their worthless lives, Tiktaq’to and his Terradon Riders learn of an even larger Skaven presence here in the jungle, but their vast underground network of tunnels is masking their whereabouts from any flying above ground. The Master of Skies knows he is close, but now he needs the specialized expertise of another; he needs the aid of a Skink Priest – one able to swiftly use the Winds of Magic to pinpoint the deadly vermin’s filthy, disgusting lair, before he and his noble riders wipe it from the face of Lustria.

The Skink Priest immediately feels a disturbance in the area – he had no need to use the Winds of Magic after all, for he was able to instinctively feel the damage to the Geomantic Web. Whether intentionally or not, the foul rat-spawn must have desecrated the lost temple ruins in this place, probably whilst searching for their damnable Warpstone deposits – only something like that could’ve caused such local disruption to the Web, in turn explaining the weakening of the blessings upon Tiktaq’to’s Mask of Heavens. Now he has acquired this knowledge, there is little else to be done but head to the temple and slaughter every last one of the blasphemous Skaven-spawn with extreme prejudice!

Lord Kroak is one of the First Generation of Slann Mage-Priests, and possibly the eldest, making him one of the most powerful active creatures of any race. He has an added advantage, however, in that he is technically dead; Kroak’s mortal body was killed during the Great Catastrophe but his remains were preserved by loyal Skink attendants, enabling him to re-emerge as the first Relic Priest. Due to his death, Kroak’s meditative cycles are significantly longer than those of younger Slann. An elder Slann must be awakened to reveal his last known location as, simply put, no one else is old enough to remember!

Unfortunately, it appears that the Lord Kroak was roused from his slumber far too early; not enough time had passed since his previous awakening, so he remains in a semi-dream state. This has caused some confusion – both for Kroak and for his attendants – although he is able to give a rough indication as to his whereabouts, pinpointing his exact location will require deeper investigation by his loyal attendants.

After a considerable amount of searching high and low right across Lustria, Lord Kroak’s Skink scouts finally locate the overgrown temple-tomb in which the ancient Relic Priest is meditating, as ever, upon the fine details of the Great Plan. However, in their haste it would appear that the scouts were somewhat careless, as they have been followed to Kroak’s location by a force of those insidious ratmen, the Skaven! They plan to destroy him, once and for all, by incinerating his physical remains that anchor him to the world. This must not come to pass – defend Kroak from harm whilst his priests awaken him!

column4: Chapter V: Wrath of the Heavens

column3: Blessed are the red-crested believers, infused with Sotek’s everlasting spirit, imbued with staunch resilience, propelled by the unwavering zeal of the Serpent-God’s Chosen.
column4: The Rise of the Red Crests: Apostles of War

column3: Against the tide of non-believers, Sotek’s red-crested faithful shall emerge as his champions, to go forth and make disciples of all the Old Ones’ children, beseeching them in the name of the Serpent-God.
column4: The Rise of the Red Crests: Exodus

column3: Only after the bastions of the Old Ones are reclaimed, the incursions of the Rodent-God’s defiling minions upon the land called Lustria shall be borne by an epic struggle…
column4: The Skaven War: Our Blessed Lands

column3: When the evil rat-spawn set foot on these sacred shores to deliver their plague and pestilence, the time of their great purge shall be at hand…
column4: The Skaven War: The Great Purge

column3: Once the Great Serpent is beseeched, the evocation of His slithering servants in the jungle shall see the enemies of the Old Ones’ children fall victim to His vengeance…
column4: The Skaven War: Wrath of the Jungle

column3: The Great Serpent shall have His day, for He is the vanquisher of all rodent-kind, honoured and invoked through rightful tribute, that shall see the rivers of the mighty Amaxon run crimson with blood…
column4: The Skaven War: The Great Serpent’s Due

column3: Behold Sotek, a serpent of such unimaginable size and appetite that he shall swallow the Rat-God himself, whole, and spend a thousand years digesting him, crushing him within his coils!

Right-Fang of Lord Morskittar! My master, Grey Seer Vulscreek, has sent me with a message from the Council. They are pleased with your success so far, Chief Warlock Engineer, but more-more needs to be done! Take-claim more land and build strong under-foundation for our conquest of the reptile-things!\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

An inferior clan has taken the Altar of the Horned Rat and - worse-worse - the Warpstone that should be ours-mine. Slay-kill Clan Spittel! If I do not get that Warpstone it will be on your head, for I’ll tell Morskittar of your incompetence! Now scurry-run, mighty Warlock Engineer!\n\nLearn more about ritual resource sites [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_resource_sites]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_resource_sites}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Come-come, Chief Warlock Engineer, begin-start - that's orders from the Council. Useless clans try to fight-take Lustria but all fail, leave only fear-musk. Council calls for you to steal-take land in name of Great Horned Rat!\n\nLearn more about settlements [[url:script_link_campaign_settlements]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_settlements}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Such magnificence - all shall tremble before Ikit! Even the Horned Rat would chitter at your aggression! You must now act quickly, my master. Locate the Warpstone deposit and begin to mine it, yes-yes!\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Such idle whiskers! Get to work, fool! Secrets to be found, new knowledge, new innovations to be discovered that you must only share with me-me! Build this thing so research can begin!\n\nLearn more about technologies [[url:script_link_campaign_technology]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_technology}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

I need more-more Warpstone - what I summon demands a high tribute! Now other things see the Vortex is weak and seek to snatch it from us-us. Quickly, fools! Collect more Warpstone.\n\nLearn more about ritual currency [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_currency]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_currency}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

My master-sire, Vulscreek sends a message that he is impressed and expects gratitude for following his advice. He said you may repay his wise council by wiping out the dead-things.\n\nLearn more about factions [[url:script_link_campaign_factions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_factions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Most ingenious of Engineers – you are the Right-Fang of Morskittar for good reason! The province is-is yours. The vermin of Clan Skryre await your commandment.\n\nLearn more about commandments [[url:script_link_campaign_commandments]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_commandments}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

It is time, Chief Warlock Engineer. Enact the Ritual of Dark Scrying, yes-yes!\n\nLearn more about rituals [[url:script_link_campaign_rituals]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rituals}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Your minion is waiting for their first mission, master. Make it a good one!\n\nLearn more about heroic actions [[url:script_link_campaign_hero_actions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_hero_actions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Lord-master, this plan to take the Vortex… there are plenty of opportunities for failure and blame. Build things to lure ‘heroes’. If they perform well, the glory is yours for-for recruiting them… If they fail, then they take the blame, yes-yes!\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Felicitous news, great one! Facilities are now in place to summon minion-puppets. Begin at once to strengthen your reach across Lustria!\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The dead-things are led by a madman, an ally in him would be beneficial – point the crazed Vampires and use them as a weapon! Most cunning plan it is-is; and when we strike-kill later the dead-fool we can say he turned on us in a mad rage! Yes-yes! Make it happen!\n\nLearn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_non_aggression_pacts}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

More-more! I need your clan infesting this vile continent. Organise more packs - raise another army, and appoint one you ‘trust’ to lead it-it!\n\nLearn more about raising armies [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_forces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_raising_forces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Facilities are ready, lord-master. Your greatest - and most ambitious - minds are poised to begin researching the thousands of ways your enemies will die. It is now for you to select which method they research first!\n\nLearn more about technologies [[url:script_link_campaign_technology]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_technology}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Man-things come! But these are not from Empire, no-no. They are lost! No masters! Uncertain times have seen a rise in such rogue forces. Kill-kill them before they frustrate our plans.\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Old dusty ruins contain Warpstone... sometimes. Other things may also hide in ruins. Search them, yes-yes, but use expendable servants. No, not me-me, I valuable!\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_searching_ruins]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_searching_ruins}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Eminent lord, my Grey Seer master thinks it a good idea to trade with the dead-things. He believes it will gain trust with the Vampires that can be leveraged later. The Grey Seer’s reasoning is-is sound.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreements [[url:script_link_campaign_trade]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_trade}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The brood mothers’ bellies are full. New pups are being born and the burrows swell, master. We must make room, before they eat each other. Upgrade the lairs.\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Lord Kroak is one of the First Generation of Slann Mage-Priests, and possibly the eldest, making him one of the most powerful active creatures of any race. He has an added advantage, however, in that he is technically dead; Kroak’s mortal body was killed during the Great Catastrophe but his remains were preserved by loyal Skink attendants, enabling him to re-emerge as the first Relic Priest. Due to his death, Kroak’s meditative cycles are significantly longer than those of younger Slann. An elder Slann must be awakened to reveal his last known location as, simply put, no one else is old enough to remember!

Unfortunately, it appears that the Lord Kroak was roused from his slumber far too early; not enough time had passed since his previous awakening, so he remains in a semi-dream state. This has caused some confusion – both for Kroak and for his attendants – although he is able to give a rough indication as to his whereabouts, pinpointing his exact location will require deeper investigation by his loyal attendants.

After a considerable amount of searching high and low right across Lustria, Lord Kroak’s Skink scouts finally locate the overgrown temple-tomb in which the ancient Relic Priest is meditating, as ever, upon the fine details of the Great Plan. However, in their haste it would appear that the scouts were somewhat careless, as they have been followed to Kroak’s location by a force of those insidious ratmen, the Skaven! They plan to destroy him, once and for all, by incinerating his physical remains that anchor him to the world. This must not come to pass – defend Kroak from harm whilst his priests awaken him!

Lord Kroak is one of the First Generation of Slann Mage-Priests, and possibly the eldest, making him one of the most powerful active creatures of any race. He has an added advantage, however, in that he is technically dead; Kroak’s mortal body was killed during the Great Catastrophe but his remains were preserved by loyal Skink attendants, enabling him to re-emerge as the first Relic Priest. Due to his death, Kroak’s meditative cycles are significantly longer than those of younger Slann. An elder Slann must be awakened to reveal his last known location as, simply put, no one else is old enough to remember!

Unfortunately, it appears that the Lord Kroak was roused from his slumber far too early; not enough time had passed since his previous awakening, so he remains in a semi-dream state. This has caused some confusion – both for Kroak and for his attendants – although he is able to give a rough indication as to his whereabouts, pinpointing his exact location will require deeper investigation by his loyal attendants.

After a considerable amount of searching high and low right across Lustria, Lord Kroak’s Skink scouts finally locate the overgrown temple-tomb in which the ancient Relic Priest is meditating, as ever, upon the fine details of the Great Plan. However, in their haste it would appear that the scouts were somewhat careless, as they have been followed to Kroak’s location by a force of those insidious ratmen, the Skaven! They plan to destroy him, once and for all, by incinerating his physical remains that anchor him to the world. This must not come to pass – defend Kroak from harm whilst his priests awaken him!

I question your competence, Crone Mistress - you let traitors run rampant! These are sovereign Druchii lands not for the likes of conspirators and turncoats. Continue the purge and secure the whole region.\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The Scourge of Khaine is but a self-given title. They do not serve Khaine as you do, my queen. Take the scrolls they hoard and your master's shrine, for he will look favourably on you for this.\n\nLearn more about ritual resource sites [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_resource_sites]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_resource_sites}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

For far too long has Ghrond kept the secrets of eternal beauty and violence from you. Take what is rightfully yours and with it the cities they reside within.\n\nLearn more about settlements [[url:script_link_campaign_settlements]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_settlements}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Good. But the task is not yet complete. Erect a shrine to Hekarti, draw her eyes to us, so the Mistress of Magic may reveal more scrolls.\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

My preparations are almost complete but it’s now clear that other races intend to usurp the Vortex. We must be first! Get me more scrolls so I can enact the ritual.\n\nLearn more about ritual currency [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_currency]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_currency}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Surely these traitors have crossed you for the last time? Kill every last one of them!\n\nLearn more about factions [[url:script_link_campaign_factions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_factions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

You control the entire province. All within now obey Hellebron... How quaint! Now, issue a commandment - let’s see just how loyal they are!\n\nLearn more about commandments [[url:script_link_campaign_commandments]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_commandments}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

It is time, my queen. Enact the Ritual of the Tortured Oracle!\n\nLearn more about rituals [[url:script_link_campaign_rituals]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rituals}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Your thrall awaits their first mission. Make it challenging...\n\nLearn more about heroic actions [[url:script_link_campaign_hero_actions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_hero_actions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

There are agents and factors that wish to petition your favour. Ensure they have a place to assemble so we can weed out potential vassals... and traitors.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

We have the location for the vassals to congregate. Now it is time to summon these ‘heroes’ to serve.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The chill of Death Night lingers in the air, forging alliances now may preserve your stock of slaves for future endeavours. These Druchii deplore your violent ways, use this and offer a non-aggression pact to seize the upper hand.\n\nLearn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_non_aggression_pacts}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Now, my queen, raise another army, and put it to sea. Its destination: Har Ganeth. You will need many warriors if we are to spill the blood that Khaine so desires.\n\nLearn more about raising armies [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_forces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_raising_forces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

How adorable! These mortal fools have strayed far. They do not answer to their Emperor. Deal with them quickly, my queen, else they become a thorn in your side, which would be dreadful.\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The ritual is all but prepared, Hellebron, but first you must furnish me with the scrolls of Hekarti that will power such a rite. I suggest searching the ruins.\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_searching_ruins]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_searching_ruins}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Gain their trust, sister. Foster trade - it will enrich you, make your economy stronger. Seek a trade agreement with these Druchii.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreements [[url:script_link_campaign_trade]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_trade}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Momentum gathers. Druchii flock to your banners. Betrayal is inevitable if you do not rule with a strong hand. For now, take advantage of your growing following and expand your settlements.\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The Great Vortex falters. It is vulnerable and the Witch King seeks to take advantage - to enter and channel its energies - to wrest the power of Chaos from the Gods themselves! Before Malekith can do this, he must imbue the Circlet of Iron - an ancient band older than the Elves - with an unholy crux.\n\nWhile Malekith knows that a crux is needed before he can enter the Vortex, frustratingly, he lacks knowledge of this arcane boon's location. He must consult an oracle, kept by the sorceresses, and their services do not come cheap, even if you are the Witch King.

“North,” answer the Hags, trying the Witch King’s patience, for the northern borders of Naggaroth are vast. He demands a more specific location with a threat that Ghrond will burn if a satisfactory answer is not given. The Death Hags look unmoved - they know that Ghrond is Morathi’s city, and that her son would not risk her wrath. Perhaps they do not know the Witch King?

Following a display of Malekith’s temper, the Death Hags are suddenly more forthcoming. Malekith must indeed travel northwards, to the Altar of Ultimate Darkness - a shrine of pure Chaos. The power residing within the altar must be absorbed by the Circlet of Iron, before it can, ironically, be used against the Chaos Gods should Malekith step into the Vortex and take dominion.

Destroyer was forged by the Witch King himself, as a symbol of his determination to rid the world of High Elven kin. The touch of the Destroyer is especially potent against mages. It is a momentous piece of weapon-smithing and yet it has never been blessed by the Elven Maker-God, Vaul.\n\nMalekith considers it a great insult that the god has not deigned to heap praise upon him for his great work. The Witch King, while brooding about this, decides to salve his mood with an outing…

The raids prove a vague distraction, as do the screams of the slaves, but with the Vortex swirling out of control, Malekith cannot afford such time ruminating. He decides to tackle Vaul’s snub head on; If the god will not come to him, then he shall force matters. To start with, Destroyer will need to be slaked in much blood.

Vaul’s Anvil is a volcano within which lies the shrine of the Elven Smith-God. It is the most sacred of sites, and now the Witch King has it in his sights. With Destroyer in hand, he marches relentlessly upon Ulthuan’s shores, to the tip of the Dragon Spine Peninsula and into the volcano itself. As expected, the High Elf guardians are waiting within.

A wise move, Sire. Do not let the vermin get any tail-hold on sovereign Druchii lands. Continue the purge and secure the whole region.\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

As a daughter of Ghrond, I know what trouble it has caused you in the past, my king. And now with Morathi absent, they stray further from your yoke. My contacts in the city tell me they have their own plans for the scrolls we seek. Direct action is required.\n\nLearn more about ritual resource sites [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_resource_sites]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_resource_sites}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

You are right, sire. Act quickly, and flush the infestation from the ruins. Do not let the ratmen take what they seek. Capture their filthy nests!

Skaven inhabit the Under-Empire, making their settlements indistinguishable from ruins until approached.

Learn more about the Skaven Under-Empire [[url:script_link_campaign_skaven_underworld]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_skaven_underworld}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

I will pay a heavy price for betraying the sisters of Ghrond... No matter, a concern for another day. Now, sire, erect a shrine to Mistress Hekarti so that she may bless us with scrolls of lore.\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

My preparations are almost complete but it’s now clear that others races intend to usurp the Vortex. We must be first! Get me more scrolls so I can enact the ritual.\n\nLearn more about ritual currency [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_currency]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_currency}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Come now, sire, surely your patience for these vermin is at an end? Wipe them out.\n\nLearn more about factions [[url:script_link_campaign_factions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_factions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The entire province is subjugated, sire. Your words are absolute - issue a Commandment, your subjects will be desperate to obey.\n\nLearn more about commandments [[url:script_link_campaign_commandments]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_commandments}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].
It is time, King Malekith. Enact the Ritual of the Tortured Oracle!

Your thrall awaits their first mission. Make it challenging...\n\nLearn more about heroic actions [[url:script_link_campaign_hero_actions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_hero_actions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

There are agents and factors that wish to petition your favour. Ensure they have a place to assemble so we can weed out potential vassals... and traitors.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

We have the location for the vassals to congregate. Now it is time to summon these ‘heroes’ to serve.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

I shall not tutor you, sire, on how to run your kingdom - you have been ruling for longer than I have existed. Yet... I will venture that Hag Graef could be a stronger ally than outright enemy at this stage. Perhaps offer their lords a chair closer to yours at the obsidian table? A non-aggression pact is a good start...\n\nLearn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_non_aggression_pacts}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Sire, while you hold my soul-casket, I cannot afford you deposed. My assassin brings word, that elements in the Black Court dare talk of betrayal. Quell this rebellion, for you are the Witch King! Restore public order.\n\nLearn more about public order [[url:script_link_campaign_public_order]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_public_order}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].
column4: Who Dares Defy the Witch King?

column3: You cannot do this alone, sire. Demand that the black-armoured ranks of Naggaroth muster. Raise another army, and give it to your most ‘loyal’ Dreadlord to command.\n\nLearn more about raising armies [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_forces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_raising_forces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

It is not just vermin that infest these lands. These Greenskin brutes have gone rogue. They own no allegiance to anything, deal with them quickly, sire. And keep an eye for other ‘rogue armies’ in the campaign to come.\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The ritual will soon be ready, but I need more scrolls to power it. We may find what we seek in the ruins scattered throughout your kingdom, majesty. If I may suggest, send some expendable wretches to search them.\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_searching_ruins]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_searching_ruins}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

There is no sin in profit, your majesty. Fostering trade relations will strengthen your support further in The Dark Crag, seek a trade agreement.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreements [[url:script_link_campaign_trade]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_trade}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Sire, the race to dominate the Vortex will be a long one. While I seek to fill the goblet with lifeforce, I beseech you prepare the infrastructure of the kingdom to make this endeavour more efficient. It is time to upgrade.\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Momentum gathers. Druchii flock to your banners. Betrayal is inevitable if you do not rule with a strong hand, for now take advantage of your growing following and expand your settlements.\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The Witch King has been without his Spellshield for a few centuries after losing it in the southern lands whilst fighting the reptiles over tablets of lost lore. While its loss bothers Malekith, it doesn't trouble him greatly, for he is the owner of countless arcane artefacts.

However, now it has been found – well, according to the Dreadlord, Strenious Kingslayer, it has. He brazenly enters the Black Council’s chamber and approaches the obsidian table – where the Witch King sits with his most loyal advisors – proclaiming that he knows the Supreme Spellshield’s whereabouts and will share it for a price. In the chamber sit a hundred Lords, none of whom can remember such an audacious attempt to provoke the Witch King; many see Strenious’ life lasting only seconds more!

Yet Malekith does not unleash his legendary rage. Instead, he sits back upon his chair and simply asks how much the Dreadlord wants...

Malekith sets about raising a force to accompany this Captain Kingslayer to Lustria. He keeps Strenious close, and even shares the odd jest. Maybe the Witch King is impressed by this Dreadlord’s gall? It makes a refreshing change to all the usual schemes and secret plots, and so is the talk of Naggarond.

Strenious Kingslayer leads the Witch King to Lustria. There, on board his Black Ark, as it is moored off the savage coast, he reveals that deep in the Mosquito Swamps the Witch King’s shield can be found, hanging as a trophy from the palanquin of a Slann Mage-Priest. Malekith makes a great show of thanking the Captain, and pays him then and there. As Strenious smiles upon the wealth he’s suddenly accumulated, the Witch King grabs the captain by the throat and casually throws him over the side of the great vessel. His fortune follows him into the sea, for Malekith cares not for riches, it is power he has always craved.\n\nStrenious’ crew do not bat an eyelid at their master’s sudden death, but quickly make themselves busy when the Witch King orders his army disembarked for an expedition to retrieve the lost shield.

I question your competence, my Queen - you let traitors run rampant! These are sovereign Druchii lands not for the likes of conspirators and turncoats. Continue the purge and secure the whole region.\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Oh dear, you seem to be having trouble? Despite your involvement in our creation, you can’t help but make enemies of our kin can you? Clar Karond defy us, we need the scrolls they are hoard. Take their shrine.\n\nLearn more about ritual resource sites [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_resource_sites]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_resource_sites}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

I notice you let traitors steal what we need. I wonder, does your son know how you reign over such incompetence? I would remedy this situation quickly. Flush the cravens from the ruins. Capture their hideouts!”

Learn more about settlements [[url:script_link_campaign_settlements]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_settlements}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].	Bleak Outlook	CAPTURE_REGIONS	rom_event_mission.png	dwf/generic	false	Military		0	0	false	0		false	false
false	wh2_main_def_morathi_early_game_construct_ritual_building	Good. But the task is not yet complete. Erect a shrine to Hekarti, draw her eyes on us, so the Mistress of Magic may reveal more scrolls."

Learn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

My preparations are almost complete but it’s now clear that others races intend to usurp the Vortex. We must be first! Get me more scrolls so I can enact the ritual.\n\nLearn more about ritual currency [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_currency]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_currency}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Surely these traitors have crossed you for the last time? Kill every last one of them.\n\nLearn more about factions [[url:script_link_campaign_factions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_factions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

You control the entire province. All within now obey Morathi. How quaint. Now, issue a commandment - let’s see just how loyal they are!\n\nLearn more about commandments [[url:script_link_campaign_commandments]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_commandments}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].
It is time, sorceress. Enact the Ritual of the Tortured Oracle!

Your thrall awaits their first mission. Make it challenging...\n\nLearn more about heroic actions [[url:script_link_campaign_hero_actions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_hero_actions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

There are agents and factors that wish to petition your favour. Ensure they have a place to assemble so we can weed out potential vassals... and traitors.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

We have the location for the vassals to congregate. Now it is time to summon these ‘heroes’ to serve.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

How does someone like you, make allies? Me, Hellebron, Clar Karond... you certainly know how to make enemies. But now you must seek allies. These Druchii respect the Hag Sorceress. Use this, and offer a non-aggression pact.\n\nLearn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_non_aggression_pacts}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Now, sister of Ghrond, raise another army, and put it under command of one of your seduced puppets. You will need many warriors if we are to put your son in the Vortex...\n\nLearn more about raising armies [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_forces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_raising_forces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

How adorable. These mortal fools have strayed far. They do not answer to their Emperor. Deal with them quickly, my queen, or else they could become a thorn in your side, and that would be dreadful.\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The ritual is all but prepared, but you frustrate my plans, my queen. If you want your son to win this race to the Vortex, then you must furnish me with the scrolls of Hekarti that will power the ritual. I suggest searching the ruins. Send some expendable minion to seek them... or you could even go yourself.\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_searching_ruins]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_searching_ruins}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Gain their trust, sister. Foster trade - it will enrich you, make your economy stronger. Seek a trade agreement with these Druchii.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreements [[url:script_link_campaign_trade]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_trade}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Momentum gathers. Druchii flock to your banners. Betrayal is inevitable if you do not rule with a strong hand, for now take advantage of your growing following and expand your settlements.\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Morathi, mother of the Witch King, Hag Sorceress of Ghrond. More than any other, she is responsible for the Druchii; for splitting the greatest of all races in twain. It is a claim few have made directly to her face, but one she would not deny - and would actually revel in - before flaying the skin off the accuser, of course.\n\nThe instruments of such torture would be her paired weapons; the spear, Heartrender and sister blade, the Darksword. These were gifts from her son. But relations between mother and child have soured of late, with the Witch King banishing her from his sight. And so, in a fit of pique, she puts her paired weapons aside to focus on inflicting misery upon any who cross her path.

The raiding has proved a useful respite for the Hag Sorceress, there are many slaves to torture and souls to claim. And yet the six-armed Goddess, Hekarti, is as thirsty as Khaine. Morathi must recruit more of her kin if she is to continue this journey out from the under the shadow of her son’s dominion.

With a force worthy of Ghrond, Morathi rides forth in search of even more victims. She cares not whether these are the insufferable reptiles that lurk in the south, more puppets of her son, or even the filthy vermin that have been spotted more and more of late. Of course, the greatest prizes are the Asur - their souls always taste the sweetest!

Morathi’s sojourn has proved restorative, if rudderless. Although she would not admit it - and should anyone suggest it, they would be first on the skin-flensing table - this has been about getting the attention of Malekith, proving to the Witch King what a powerful and indispensable force she is. But alas her achievements are of little consequence, and her son’s gaze remains fixed on the failing Vortex…\n\nAt least, that is what she wants her enemies to believe, for Morathi is intelligent and cunning. Let Hellebron and Felicion believe that she unleashes a trail of destruction as nothing more than a temper tantrum; the Hag Sorceress has a far worthier target in her sights. But first she will need captives and plenty of them, for preparations must be made before she can bring her dark arts to bear.

The rites have been spoken and the seals of Hoeth broken; it is time for Morathi to conduct a ritual of her current patron, Hekarti. And with it shall come the power she needs to seek out her true target - a sanctuary of her hated kin. And when that is taken, her son and her enemies will surely notice her!

The rites have been spoken and the seals of Hoeth broken; it is time for Morathi to conduct a ritual to Drakira. And with it shall come the power she needs to seek out her true target - a sanctuary of her hated kin. And when that is taken, her son and her enemies will surely notice her!

The High Elf colony of Arnheim has no right to be on the Black Coast, and yet it has proved a stubborn canker to remove. However, Morathi, banished to the southern part of Naggarond by her son, and weaving a trail of destruction ever since, now has it in sight. If she can destroy Arnheim, she hopes to return to the Witch King’s good graces and once again take up Heartrender and the Darksword, gifts from her beloved, if temperamental son.

The accursed demands to aid Skavenblight have left your resources depleted and your position weak. Raiding the enemy will furnish what you require, and keep your minions busy enough to prevent them plotting against you.
In Grimnir’s outraged sight, the filthy, chuffing Greenskins dare hold on to Khazids owned and built by Dawi of Karak Kadrin. This is a grudge that must be avenged immediately!
column4: The "Get Off My Chuffing Land!" Grudge
