{{tr:wh2_main_qb_final_battle_skv_description}}
{{tr:wh2_main_qb_final_battle_skv_description}}

Grand Prince of Clan Mors! Greatest champion with longest tail! My master, Grey Seer Vulscreek, has sent me in his stead - he knows of your-your dislike of Grey Seers. If I may be so humble to pass on a message… he tasks you take the whole province from the Elf-things.\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Indolent you are-are! You have let a greater clan take the Warpstone we-we need. Now you must go to war steal it back. I shall go and bribe-treaty with Clan Moulder. We will need them later. But for now-now, kill-maim - capture caverns of Sotek!\n\nLearn more about ritual resource sites [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_resource_sites]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_resource_sites}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Pathetic! The Council assign you down here – at my insistence – and already the stench of failure surrounds you! Kill-kill the Elf -things in our way. Take-take that settlement, spray it with your scent. Clan Mors must reign here.\n\nLearn more about settlements [[url:script_link_campaign_settlements]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_settlements}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Such magnificence - all shall tremble before Queek! Act quickly, my master. Locate the Warpstone deposit and start mining it, yes-yes!\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Such idle whiskers! Get to work, fool! Secrets to be found, new knowledge, new innovations to be discovered that you must only share with me-me! Build this thing so research can begin!\n\nLearn more about technologies [[url:script_link_campaign_technology]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_technology}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

I need more-more Warpstone. That what I summon demands a high tribute! Now other things see the Vortex is weak and seek to snatch it from us-us. Quickly, fools! Collect more Warpstone.\n\nLearn more about ritual currency [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_currency]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_currency}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

At last! Now I see what Warlord Gnawdwell sees in you-you. The Elf-things die. Now utterly purge them from this realm!\n\nLearn more about factions [[url:script_link_campaign_factions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_factions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Most potent of warriors – you are the Right Claw of Warlord Gnawdwell for good reason, mighty Queek! The province is-is yours. The vermin of Clan Mors await your Commandment.\n\nLearn more about commandments [[url:script_link_campaign_commandments]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_commandments}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

It is time, Warlord Queek. Enact the Ritual of Dark Scrying, yes-yes!\n\nLearn more about rituals [[url:script_link_campaign_rituals]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rituals}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Your minion is waiting for their first mission, master. Make it a good one!\n\nLearn more about heroic actions [[url:script_link_campaign_hero_actions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_hero_actions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Lord-master, this plan to take the Vortex… there are plenty of opportunities for failure and blame. Build things to lure ‘heroes’. If they perform well, the glory is yours for-for recruiting them… If they fail, then they take the blame, yes-yes!\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Felicitous news, great one. Facilities are now in place to summon minion-puppets. Begin at once to strengthen your reach across the Southlands!\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Careful, Queek. There are plots in Skavenblight, the Lords of Decay play their game and you are a piece. I will-will guide you, yes-yes! There are factions that want you at war with the Lizard-things - confound them, by making treaty-pact of no-fight! Then we strike later, when their eyes swivel elsewhere!\n\nLearn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_non_aggression_pacts}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Master! Master! I hear them plotting… please spare this pathetic scribe, for I am your eyes and ears. That they dare move against mighty Queek shows you have been too lenient of late. Come down on them with a tail of iron! Solve your obedience issues or they will fester.\n\nLearn more about public order [[url:script_link_campaign_public_order]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_public_order}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

More-more! I need your clan infesting this vile continent. Organise more packs - raise another army, and appoint one you ‘trust’ to lead it-it!\n\nLearn more about raising armies [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_forces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_raising_forces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Facilities are ready, Lord-master. Your greatest - and most ambitious - minds are poised to begin researching the thousands of ways your enemies will die. It is now for you to select which method they research first!\n\nLearn more about technologies [[url:script_link_campaign_technology]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_technology}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Man-things come! But these are not from Empire, no-no. They are lost! No masters! Uncertain times have seen a rise in such rogue forces. Kill-kill them before they frustrate our plans.\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Old dusty ruins contain Warpstone... sometimes. Other things may also hide in ruins. Search them, yes-yes, but use expendable servants. No, not me-me, I valuable!\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_searching_ruins]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_searching_ruins}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

We must continue this scheme with the Reptile-things, while the politics back in Skavenblight playout. To prevent the lizards getting suspicious perhaps we should deepen our ties? Trade-barter with them, yes-yes? Offer them riches, we can always take them back later.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreements [[url:script_link_campaign_trade]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_trade}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Set your engineers to-to work, upgrade your nest-burrows, I need you-you and your packs at peak proficiency to realise my plans.\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The brood mothers’ bellies are full. New pups are being born and the burrows swell, master. We must make room, before they eat each other. Upgrade the lairs.\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Curses! Dwarf Gouger has been stolen. Queek immediately slays two of his most trusted lieutenants, who were clearly to blame; it is irrelevant that he was the last one in possession of it! Killing his loyal followers is not enough to sate the Headtaker’s rage, so he lashes out at the closest enemies, for they are clearly the thieves… in some way. And deep down in his verminous mind he knows that keeping his horde busy will distract them from his own incompetence in losing one of Clan Mors' most priceless artefacts.

In the aftermath of Queek’s real - or maybe false - rage, one of his snivelling minions approaches and concludes that a Clan Eshin assassin was the actual thief. For a moment, Queek is tempted to rip out the messenger’s throat at this news, but realises that if he keeps killing his loyal servants he’ll run out of followers. Instead, Queek settles for a swipe with his claw, sending the inferior flying, before rearing to his full height and demanding the perpetrator must be found. He promotes the servant he has just struck to ‘chief-finder’, giving Queek a convenient scapegoat should the search prove fruitless.

Queek’s agent returns to his master. He approaches cautiously, sniffing the air to pick up what mood the Headtaker is in. As expected, Queek is impatient but stays his wrath until the ‘chief-finder’ has given his report.

 "Most vengeful of warrior-lords", begins the agent, with tail flat on the floor in a sign of submission. Queek’s whiskers twitch in appreciation at the ego-boosting address, but otherwise he remains silent and still. "The assassin-thief has deliberately fled in Dwarf territory. I suspect a trap."

Queek rises to his full height in triumph.

"I knew it! Beard-things!", he says with glee. He ignores the agent’s meek protestations that he suspects a ruse, for Queek has a battle-lust about him and immediately sends his minions scuttling forth to raise a horde as quickly as possible.

A Clan Mors force runs through the Underway with Queek at its head. Already the Warlord can taste the stench of the Dwarf-things on the stale air. His underling - the ‘chief-finder’ - in fear of his life, tries once more to state that it’s a trap. But Queek waves the coward away - after all, he is Queek Headtaker, what could go wrong? A messenger intercepted in an off-shoot tunnel is captured, on his way to report to the Grand Warlord himself - this was nothing but a ruse by Gnawdwell himself to keep Queek on his toes! Headtaker takes the news surprisingly well, as he relishes the opportunity to kill lots of Dwarfs and prove himself to his master!

Queek Headtaker is the Right-Claw of Warlord Gnawdwell, the chief enforcer of the utterly powerful Clan Mors. While Queek, of late, has spent much of his time in the City of Pillars, his duties as Gnawdwell’s primary intimidator have seen him scamper and skitterleap across continents.

You’d think a rat so busy and dedicated to Clan Mors’ ascendancy would have no time for some lesser rivals’ petty insults, but this is Queek...

Word has reached the Headtaker that a Warlord from a rival clan is boasting that his armour is better. Most would ignore such a slight, or mark it in their memories for vengeance at a more opportune time, but Queek abandons his current objective and puts all his energy into seeking out the liar!

Headtaker scours the land in search for the one who dares slight him. It is a wasteful campaign, but none in his circle of advisors dares to question the undertaking, lest they face Queek’s wrath instead. In the aftermath of his search, Queek is confronted by several enemy forces; the Warlord is excited by the prospect of topping up his trophy rack. In his lust for battle, he almost forgets why he started this campaign in the first place!

Queek ignores the alleged insult, but it seems the boaster isn’t done with him. Once more, taunts reach Headtaker, but this time the more cunning side rather than the wrathful part of Queek emerges. Headtaker determines that he will be the richest rat there is - then no snivelling vermin with shiny, more Warpstone-y armour will dare tell him otherwise!

No little vermin boaster is better than the Right-Claw of Warlord Gnawdwell! Queek's agent reports a sighting of his rival close to nearby ruins. Despite protestations from minions loyal to Clan Mors, Queek orders the area raided – its wealth stolen for Queek… And if the boastful one can be located, then he can be gouged too!

At last, Queek has the rival Clan Warlord cornered! It is fitting that the boaster was found, cowering, underground, deep below ruins that may have been important to some Wizard or other. Queek cares not; what matters is that the two will face off in battle and the shiniest armour will be the Headtaker's own!

Mighty and pestilent Lord Skrolk, Grey Seer Vulscreek entreats that your Clan Pestilens forces move to take the whole of this province. Let all the things know that Clan Pestilens stalks upon Lustria again!\n\nLearn more about provinces [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Indolent you are-are, Skrolk. You have let an inferior clan take the Warpstone that should be ours-mine. Go and take-steal it. Destroy Clan Spittel! Do not fail me again, or I’ll tell Nurglitch of your incompetence!\n\nLearn more about ritual resource sites [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_resource_sites]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_resource_sites}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

A thousand buboes upon you, pestilent lord. It seems the Reptile-things are basking in jungle temples that should belong to Clan Pestilens. While we make ready the first ritual, I humbly suggest you attack, yes-yes?\n\nLearn more about settlements [[url:script_link_campaign_settlements]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_settlements}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Such magnificence - all shall tremble before Skrolk! Even the Horned Rat would chitter at your aggression. You must now act quickly, my master. Locate the Warpstone deposit and start mining it, yes-yes!\n\nLearn more about buildings [[url:script_link_campaign_buildings]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_buildings}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Such idle whiskers! Get to work, fool! Secrets to be found, new knowledge, new innovations to be discovered that you must only share with me-me! Build this thing so research can begin!\n\nLearn more about technologies [[url:script_link_campaign_technology]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_technology}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

I need more-more Warpstone. That what I summon demands a high tribute! Now other things see the Vortex is weak and seek to snatch it from us-us. Quickly, fools! Collect more Warpstone.\n\nLearn more about ritual currency [[url:script_link_campaign_ritual_currency]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_ritual_currency}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

I pass on congratulations from the Lords of Decay, Skrolk, they are impressed with your expansion over the Reptile-things. Now finish them!\n\nLearn more about factions [[url:script_link_campaign_factions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_factions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

I subjugate myself - please-please befoul my fur with your stench, my lord. You have done great things, Clan Pestilens controls the province and now you may utter a commandment that all must obey.\n\nLearn more about commandments [[url:script_link_campaign_commandments]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_commandments}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

It is time, Lord Skrolk. Enact the Ritual of Dark Scrying, yes-yes!\n\nLearn more about rituals [[url:script_link_campaign_rituals]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rituals}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Your minion is waiting for their first mission, master. Make it a good one!\n\nLearn more about heroic actions [[url:script_link_campaign_hero_actions]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_hero_actions}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Lord-master, this plan to take the Vortex… there are plenty of opportunities for failure and blame. Build things to lure ‘heroes’. If they perform well, the glory is yours for-for recruiting them… If they fail, then they take the blame, yes-yes!\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Felicitous news, great one. Facilities are now in place to summon minion-puppets. Begin at once to strengthen your reach across Lustria!\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes [[url:script_link_campaign_heroes]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_heroes}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

We have no interest in the Dead-things. Besides what can your plagues do things that are already dead-dead? Useless! Make treaty-pact of no-fight with Vampires. Turn on them later, of-of course.\n\nLearn more about non-aggression pacts [[url:script_link_campaign_non_aggression_pacts]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_non_aggression_pacts}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

More-more! I need your clan infesting this vile continent. Organise more packs - raise another army, and appoint one you ‘trust’ to lead it-it!\n\nLearn more about raising armies [[url:script_link_campaign_raising_forces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_raising_forces}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Facilities are ready, lord-master. Your greatest - and most ambitious - minds are poised to begin researching the thousands of ways your enemies will die. It is now for you to select which method they research first!\n\nLearn more about technologies [[url:script_link_campaign_technology]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_technology}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Master, I bring worrisome news: Tree-things roam close. They are not with the Elf-things, a rogue force – this is not the last time we shall encounter such armies. They will need-need dealing with.\n\nLearn more about rogue armies [[url:script_link_campaign_rogue_armies]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_rogue_armies}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

There are secrets and power in the ruins, my plaguelord. Warpstone for sure... although traps and other nasty-sneaky surprises too. I humbly suggest you search with your least loyal minions.\n\nLearn more about treasure hunting [[url:script_link_campaign_searching_ruins]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_searching_ruins}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

Eminent lord, my Grey Seer master thinks it a good idea to trade with the Dead-things. He believes it will gain trust with the Vampires that can be leveraged later. The Grey Seer’s reasoning is-is sound.\n\nLearn more about [[img:icon_trade_agreement]][[/img]]trade agreements [[url:script_link_campaign_trade]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_trade}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The brood mothers’ bellies are full. New pups are being born and the burrows swell, master. We must make room, before they eat each other. Upgrade the lairs.\n\nLearn more about provincial growth [[url:script_link_campaign_growth]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_growth}}]][[col:help_page_link]]here[[/col]][[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The Liber Bubonicus, a rancid tome full of vile lore collected by Pestilens’ plaguelords, is currently in Skrolk’s possession. In a devious move, his minions led a large expedition from the Old World down into the long abandoned Mortuary of Tzulaqua, via a trail of worthless trinkets leading deep under the ruined pyramid. A few of the greedy fools were lost to ancient traps, but most made it to the sacrificial chamber.\n\nThere, on a simple stone plinth, rested the Liber Bubonicus. If the book was left closed they may have lived, but one of the Man-things opened the Liber Bubonicus and from its pages sprouted a thousand plague-flies. The swarm buzzed, biting, laying eggs, and spreading an awful pox. The ploy worked! The Horned Rat is surely pleased, yet Skrolk is weary and must now recuperate.

Skrolk’s cunning trap worked better than even he could perceive, but the cost was high, so he must bathe in filth and corruption to restore himself once more; a ritual should do the job. When ready, he will return to the Mortuary of Tzulaqua and collect the Liber Bubonicus.

On completion of the ritual, Skrolk quickly gathers about him a verminous horde and scampers to the crypt, where his prize surely waits. The pestilent Lord arrives at the dank cave that leads into the crypt. His Plague Monks gnash the air, eager to descend, but he holds them back with a flick of his claw. Cautiously, he sniffs the air; his whiskers twitch. Something is not quite right…

Skrolk’s deadly rod has been at his side for the many decades the Plaguelord has walked the world. It is said that the rod was awarded to Skrolk in the wake of his blindness. When he clawed at his own eyes after bearing witness to Arch-Plaguelord Nurglitch, Skrolk wished no other vision to obscure that glimpse of pestilent perfection.\n\nDespite this, Nurglitch does not brook failure, and remains unimpressed with Skrolk’s performance since the Vortex became vulnerable. Matters are not helped by the Rod of Corruption’s recent inability to cast rust upon metal. Flesh will still slough from bones when struck, but where before metal would oxidise and corrode, it remains gleaming. Skrolk suspects that the recent Vortex activity and his rod’s lack of corruption are linked, but first he must appease the Arch-Plaguelord and bolster Clan Pestilens' forces.

The cold-bloods have become the focus of Skrolk’s impotent rage. Back in Skavenblight, Arch-Plaguelord Nurglitch tuts at Skrolk’s performance, but still the Lizardmen must pay the price. But Lord Skrolk is more cunning than most. To outsiders he may seem to be lashing out, but those who know Skrolk know there is method in his fury. The Lizardmen hide knowledge; they have many secrets and one is the power to eat metal. Once he is rid of the reptiles, he will scour their plaques with eyes that cannot see until he finds out how to restore the Rod of Corruption.

Lord Skrolk has discovered what the Lizardmen hide and the thing that he seeks - the power to befoul metal and restore the Rod of Corruption. To the north of Lustria lies the Island of the Crimson Skull; it is the Skull itself that Skrolk seeks, as it is made from a unique mineral that can be powdered into a red oxidising material that eats iron and steel. Once spread upon the Rod of Corruption, Skrolk’s weapon will be powerful once again. Then he can return to his grand schemes.\n\nFirst, he must deal with the Council while the Great Vortex remains unstable, but that is what this lick-spittle scribe is for. Let the Council be distracted by this scheme, so Skrolk can plan his ascension to Arch-Plaguelord without interference.
The sign of the Jaguar God has been witnessed on both the ground and in the sky. Huanchi is on the prowl and so the cohorts must act. A sacred spawning will come forth should the prey be caught.
The signs are in the sky; a sacred spawning is imminent, but first Caxuatn, the Predator, must have his prey.
Slann awaken with a start - their equivalent of a nightmare - but it is just the Old One God of War, Tlanxla, making his will known. When he is appeased, a sacred spawning shall be granted.

The Lord of Strength, the Old One, Tzcatli, does not perceive this portent solely as raw vigour, but recognises economic strength as well. The storms that rage over the gold mines are a sure sign that he requires the cohorts to build their wealth. Should the gold be accrued, a sacred spawning will surely follow.

The Lord of Strength, the Old One, Tzcatli, does not perceive this portent solely as raw vigour, but recognises economic strength as well. The storms that rage over the gold mines are a sure sign that he requires the cohorts to build their wealth. Should the gold be accrued, a sacred spawning will surely follow.

The snakes migrate in great numbers, a sure sign that Sotek demands action from one of his chosen priests. If they are worthy then their cohort will be blessed with a sacred spawning.

The Old One Quetli, the Warrior - his stars shine brightest of all. This is an omen that a sacred spawning is due, but sacrificial payment in the blood of enemy warriors is first required.

The Lord of Strength, the Old One, Tzcatli, does not perceive this portent solely as raw vigour, but recognises economic strength as well. The storms that rage over the gold mines are a sure sign that he requires the cohorts to build their wealth. Should the gold be accrued, a sacred spawning will surely follow.

The storms that rage over the gold mines are a sure sign that he requires the cohorts to build their wealth. Should the gold be accrued, a sacred spawning will surely follow.
The Old One known as the Arbiter of Duty has sent a prophecy through the frenzied dreams of the builder Skinks: industry is required and with it will come a spawning of revered beasts.

The Old One who even Slann of the Second Generation dare not name aloud is angry! The skies burn with his wrath; he must be appeased quickly, and in doing so he may issue a sacred spawning, whose reptiles will be special indeed…

The Old One who even Slann of the Second Generation dare not name aloud is angry! The skies burn with his wrath; he must be appeased quickly, and in doing so he may issue a sacred spawning, whose reptiles will be special indeed…

The Old One who even Slann of the Second Generation dare not name aloud is angry! The skies burn with his wrath; he must be appeased quickly, and in doing so he may issue a sacred spawning, whose reptiles will be special indeed…

The Old One who even Slann of the Second Generation dare not name aloud is angry! The skies burn with his wrath; he must be appeased quickly, and in doing so he may issue a sacred spawning, whose reptiles will be special indeed…

Tlazcotl the Impassive is patient and determined. His sign is flocks of birds suddenly becoming still and silent, perching for days and never moving. The Great Plan will be revealed in time; until then the Lizardmen must grow in power, both militarily and economically. This will please the Old One and award his followers a sacred spawning.
The Messenger, Uxmac, will bring word of the Old Ones. The cohorts must be prepared, and if they are, a sacred spawning will be awarded.
The Messenger, Uxmac, will bring word of the Old Ones. The cohorts must be prepared, and if they are, a sacred spawning will be awarded.
The Messenger, Uxmac, will bring word of the Old Ones. The cohorts must be prepared, and if they are, a sacred spawning will be awarded.

The Messenger, Uxmac, will bring word of the Old Ones. The cohorts must be prepared, and if they are, a sacred spawning will be awarded.
The Messenger, Uxmac, will bring word of the Old Ones. The cohorts must be prepared, and if they are, a sacred spawning will be awarded.
The Winds of Magic coalesce and shift along the Geomantic Web. The Old One, Potec, sends an omen. Should the Slann heed his warning then a sacred spawning is surely due.
Success

I know you would not let anyone on the Black Council talk to you, yet you need me, so I speak without the riddles and flattery. For thousands of years you have tried the same tactics and yet we remain in Naggaroth. We must research new methods - after all, a torturer should have many tools at his disposal.
Come now, my king and queen, the time for influencing from afar is over. Now is a new age of blood - send forth armies of Druchii!
Where is Fellheart? No matter, if the Krakenlord is absent there are plenty of other captains eager for glory and slaves!

I need you to do something for me… You won't like it but it needs to be done or I will not be able to perform the last ritual. Some political manoeuvring on your part will be required - isn't that what you excel at?

The next ritual victim will take us north; I can feel it, the strands of dark magic pull me in that direction. Your majesty, if we dominate that territory then it will be much easier to harvest the victim's lifeforce.
Hiding behind your son's cloak? It's what you have done for millennia. But do not worry, I have an answer: you must ally with the sisterhood, summon the death dancers!
It is time to bring the screaming arboretums, slave arenas and pleasure palaces to the lesser races. Our cities shall flourish, our guests will never leave…

Stop these fools, they interrupt my work. I know it amuses you to vex me, but your son has given me this task and if I'm successful, then both of you will wield total power. Now, silence our enemies' armies - declaw them!

You demand this of me and yet there is someone in my way. I could have my ally kill them… of course, but he is busy with my own contracts. Don't bluster - do you want eternal power for the Witch King or not? Get it done.

If you want me to quicken my pace, I must seek out the next victim. The ritual will reveal that, but I need Scrolls of Hekarti to power these invocations. Find me a library or scroll-room full of magic!

My king, the Scrolls of Hekarti reveal things to me… Hotek – the renegade smith who forged your armour – was he as skilled as the legends proclaim? Do the runes of spite in your armour fade? I think they do. His sigils have an expiry and that day comes. Why do I tell you this, your majesty? Because you have my soul cage. Drench the sigils in the blood of your enemies and the levy will be paid, the armour restored.\n\nAnd perhaps you'll grant me the boon of returning my soul?"
This army of dregs and fossils is in our way. Take them as slaves or kill them painfully - either way it must be destroyed.

Your majesty, we must show the gods your ambition, for the final rite will depend on them. Muster your most loyal warriors, have the Black Guard of Naggarond march, and all - mortals and gods alike - will never doubt your cause.

You have a pest problem; vermin are after the Vortex. That we know. They are up to something. Your inability to stop them thus far is shameful! Do your job or I'll tell your son all about your incompetence!
Do not simply destroy. Think about it! Search the ruins and not only could you find prey and slaves, but there may well be secrets to uncover.

I note you tried to kill me again, Hag Queen. Don't worry, my own assassin dealt with your petty minions. But I do not contact you to trade barbs. We need more flesh, more bodies for labour in these works. I suggest you go hunting.

I find the reptiles of the south disgusting. No - you misunderstand - I do not care how they look, it is their dogmatic creed and alignment to high, pure magic that is so retch-inducing. Find the stronghold of this nuisance and thwart them.

Delightful! The Asur are angry after we culled one of their princelings in the first ritual. It is like scolding a child and watching the inept rage. I am, of course, just a servant, but if I were you I'd go and teach them what real fury is…
The Winds of Dark Magic gather! The Vortex shudders! Now is the time to cast a rite…
The coffers run low. I suggest you send your captains far and wide and begin the harvest, for we will need resources in the days to come.

The rituals take their toll. When the chalice is full the Witch King needs to be ready. He or his kin must be at the peak of their power - for the magic will reject the weak and ravage the feeble. Only the strong will survive!
I have sent one of my followers to you. They have a task - do not interrupt them, it is critical for our success.
My king, we must start the invasion - ravage Ulthuan, bring the hated High Elves to their knees and make them beg in front of their true monarch. Vengeance shall be yours!
My lover is dead. There is nothing in this world for me. I see why your heart is so cold now, my king. Tear it down - bring the world to ruin!
The time is coming, your majesty. Soon we must move on the weaklings. Unite the warhosts of the Druchii under your banner!

With the exception of Lothern, our cities are quiet now - the spectre of our diminishment. But we must strike on in these trying times, build up our cities, and perhaps the populace will grow once more.

We cannot be at war on so many fronts - it is time we force the Lizardmen to listen and acknowledge we are not some petty house servants that should be exiled on Ulthuan. They must understand we are an equal and an ally against the Ancient Enemy and its many forms!

Hale news! The Princes of the Phoenix Court have quietened for now, but there remains a faction that has the ear of the Phoenix King. They clamour about your absence, High Loremaster. Those on his Warrior’s Council - even your brother - bemoan that you have abandoned Ulthuan.\n\nLoremaster Talarian assures me this is not the case, and that your cause serves the world, including the Asur, but still, we must show progress. Talarian suggests you expand rapidly, as not only will this help us in finding more Way-fragments to power the next ritual, but it will boost confidence in your purpose back home."

Talarian pontificates as his kind are wont to do, but we are running out of time! Battle is the best way to safeguard Ulthuan and exact vengeance upon the most bitter of our enemies.\n\nFocus on slaying lords and princelings; their armies will cave, their soldiers retreat and whatever plan the Witch King has regarding the Vortex will come to ruin!"

Though it pains me to say it, at times the Dwarfs and men have us right - the Asur can be arrogant. We think of ourselves as protectors of this world, but the amphibious jungle-dwellers of Lustria were the first. Perhaps we don’t give them the respect they deserve? In any case, war between us is not overly common, so we were unprepared when they struck. They gave us no warnings, attacking without mercy. I fear this is connected to the waning Vortex but while the Squire and I hunt for the Star Crown you, my lord, must deal with the Lizardmen's aggression.

My lord, we must prepare for the next ritual. Now we know what we seek - the missing shards of the Star Crown - it is time for the Phoenix Kings, both living and past, to show us the way.\n\nKing Finubar the Seafarer is eager to help, but wary of the political cost should he fail in the role cast by the upcoming ritual. We must shore up his support. As one of the Twin Princes - the Defenders of Ulthuan - your influence on the Phoenix Court is immeasurable, even if you cannot be there in person."

I have received a report from our envoy who was sent to parley with the reptiles.

He was taken with the central pyramid of the temple-city, where the smaller breed - a Skink - spoke to him, all the while surrounded by the Lizardmen's warrior caste. The Skink stated that only when the constellation of Abordis has aligned would the Slann awake, and only then could negotiations begin."

I have studied the heavens and such a stellar occurrence is not due for months, maybe even years! We should seek a means to influence this awakening..."

The vermin filth sully our pristine homeland! They have never had so much as a tail-hold before, and now the Lords of Decay have their champions stalk our lands! Does the Everqueen not weep? This cannot be allowed. Seek out their vile leaders, cut off their heads, and the swarm will be easy to purge.

You risk much. It is dangerous to call upon such power without the safeguard of the Vortex. Daemons listen… you know N’kari thirsts for your soul. Yet should you prevail with this course of action, then the Druchii cause will be seriously damaged.

Greetings, now you have influence both in the Phoenix Court and beyond we must focus on empowering King Finubar for the next ritual. The blessing of Mathlann, Lord of the Deeps and God of the Sea, will temporarily grant our living king with the power to separate the oceans!
We have discovered a lost cache of Way-fragments, a boon sent by Asuryan that must not be squandered or taken from us. Claim it now, and quickly, before the spiteful ones seek it themselves.
The Elven gods are deaf to the screams of hatred between the Asur and the Druchii. Just as the leopards and lions of Ulthuan hunt their prey, so we must hunt our spiteful kin.

Another battlefield encounter with the Druchii, while satisfying, achieves nothing. Send forth a warrior who can hide amongst our enemy and learn from the Scrolls of Hekarti they are so keen to seek. Then we’ll know how far they their own dark desires have taken them, and what we must do to stop them!

The Loremasters would have us forsake the world and seek enlightenment in nothing but scrolls hidden away in their towers, yet there is plenty of lore out there. You have taught me that, my prince, and I now repeat the lesson back to you: the search for knowledge is key to victory.

Our envoy among the Lizardmen has gained their trust enough for them to reveal something of ill-portent. The Mage-Priest has spoken at last, informing our emissary of how one of its generational-kin has fallen from the Geomantic Web. The creature now exists apart from the other Slann, a chunk of raw Chaos impaled in its head. The lost Mage-Priest’s thoughts are no longer its own, and through it corrupted spawnings strode forth, destroying all.\n\nWith our envoy present, the Mage-Priest reached out to see if he could touch the mind of his tainted kin, but was repulsed by a wall of chittering. It seems Sotek’s nemeses are the ones that hold dominion over the lost Slann and these fell spawnings - they must be destroyed!"

The gods mock us with their timing, for it is a decade since the Everqueen made her last pilgrimage beyond the equator to the Tower of the Sun and performed the rite that prevents the eclipse of the moons. She must go once more. I do not want to even contemplate what should happen if Morrslieb becomes empowered while the Vortex wanes.\n\nBefore the Everqueen sets off on her quest, she must be protected by those that can shield her from the evil moon’s glare."

Though it pains me, we must contemplate what is currently happening to the souls of our kin. As you know, my prince, an Asur’s soul is bound to the Waystones - the fragments of which we currently seek. They, in turn, helped power the perpetual rite that channelled the Great Vortex. With the weakening of the Vortex, I fear that the Dark Prince, Slaanesh, feasts!\n\nThis reason is perhaps above all others why the Great Vortex must be restored - but in the interim, we must persecute the followers of Chaos at every turn."

Your followers have captured a Naggarothi spy. Not unexpectedly, as that is a role the warriors of Saphery have performed for millennia.\n\nThe spy thinks to shield her mind, but even from here we can fathom her true intentions. The Witch King sends his legions against you, Teclis. He fears your plans will stop his own from coming to fruition. Act first! Read from the Scroll of Hoeth and know the terrible truth."

My liege, as you are all too aware, without the fortress gates in the north of Ulthuan, the Druchii would have scoured the Inner Kingdoms long ago, hollowing out our homeland. And now the Phoenix Gate comes under sustained attack. Our Dark Elf-kin hope the failing Vortex will keep us distracted long enough for them to breach it, but Avelorn lies beyond and the Everqueen herself may be put in harm's reach. She and the Inner Kingdoms must be protected - the Fortress Gate has to hold!

The Everqueen is ready to embark on her pilgrimage to the Tower of the Sun and enact the rite that will keep Morrslieb from destroying us all! The Phoenix King has requested that you plan her journey, my prince.\n\nWe could send her predominantly by land, but it is a longer route and not without risk for the tiger-headed warriors of Ind are aggressive. Or we could use the sea - it will get her to the destination quicker - but the Druchii and vermin are so active upon the ocean and if she fell into their cruel hands… Such a fate is unthinkable! Ensure the ocean is safe."

Grave tidings. Through my arcane preparations for the next ritual, I have learned of a terrible fate for our lost kin. As the Vortex deteriorates some of the souls have been drained from the Waystones and captured in a dread pool. Like a second Vortex, is has sucked lost Asur souls in, ready to be consumed.\n\nMy prince, I feel the hand of N’kari in this… those souls must be freed!"

High Loremaster Teclis, the Druchii begin to encroach on your realm. Should they invade, it will make the search for Way-fragments even more difficult. Their advances suggest some kind of intelligence regarding your actions; there may be spies or sleeper agents close!\n\nThe Swordmasters have always been more than mere warrior-scholars and protectors of the White Tower. They have an on-going duty to hunt down Druchii impostors - use them now!"

It is clear that the Vermin of Hruddithi and the Druchii not only intend to wrest the Vortex from us, but befoul it for their own ends. I fear what the Witch King plans above all; he has coveted the Vortex ever since his failed attempt to unbind it thousands of years ago, which brought about the Sundering. Malekith, his mother, and all their followers must be stopped!

The Vermintide floods the southern continent, eating, consuming and ruining everything in its path! We are at a critical juncture in the ritual process - Way-fragments must be sought with the spirit of Bel Korhadris invoked next and quickly if we are to maintain a grip on the Vortex. The Vermin of Hruddithi know this and seek to stop us. We must fight back!

We search for the Star Crown, but that was just one of three sacred gifts bestowed upon us by the goddess Lileath. The Moon Staff was another, which is why you must keep it close, High Loremaster, for it is precious as it is powerful. Yet its power currently wanes, for the Winds of Magic unravel. Nearby deposits of Warpstone further tamper with the staff's potency. Purge the area of vermin and the staff may awaken.

The ruins that scatter the world hold secrets. The Loremaster is busy preparing the next ritual, but he bequeaths me to urge that you begin searching the lost ruins, as that is where victory might be found.

Hale news, my master! The Princes of the Phoenix Court have quietened… for now. While they are placated, and support for you is high, the time to act is now. Take Ulthuan’s realms under your yoke! We can always cede them back to their traditional Lords once the Vortex has been secured.\n\nWith more realms of Ulthuan under your domination, we can search for Way-fragments unimpeded."
Revered warrior, the moon is red. Tlanxla has spoken and he calls upon the cohorts to align to his will.
Revered Lord of the Second Generation, the Forked Tongue of Sotek has disappeared! Its arc has soured the sky - a celestial alignment must be enacted to heal the rends in orbit.
Children of the Sun, see your time has just begun. We must gather the yellow element - favoured of Chaqua - and use it to enrich ourselves, for the younger races inexplicably find value in it.
Quick, master! The Geomantic strands do not knit as they should. A minor rite must be performed to tame the winds, and allow for concurrence.
The Ritual of Contemplation will soon be upon us. We must prepare - construction of further ziggurats and restoration of lost Star Chambers is required.

Most revered master, there is discord. A Mage-Priest presumes to know more than Lord Mazdamundi. His interpretation aligns closer with those who sought to harm the Old Ones. Clarity in the great purpose must be restored.
The ground shakes, the sky heaves - the Old Ones are angry! We must appease them with the sacrifice of enemy spawn!
The strands of the Geomantic Web begin to unbind, a result of the assault on the Great Warding! We must work fast, revered one, or unmaking will begin sooner than we have foretold!
Our numbers must be increased, ancient master. Should I activate the Geomantic Web and churn the spawning pools?
We must spawn a servant, for there is much to do. Many tasks must be performed to save the Great Warding.
We are all tools of the Old Ones, but to be useful in the struggles ahead we must be ready, prepared and able to withstand the perils sent against us…
My Lord Mazdamundi, the plaques need gathering but our patrols suffer. We must control more of the world. The Old Ones decree that Hexoatl's influence must grow beyond its traditional borders.

The accursed Rat-spawn blight us once again. It is strange that I do not feel Sotek's presence, despite the vermin being so prevalent and His comet flying closer than ever before. Perhaps he will answer if many Rat-spawn are sacrificed? Seek out the vermin!
Chameleon Skinks bring back news of a lost librarium - many sacred plaques are said to be there. We must capture it, before the Khanx and Kota steal the secrets within!
Sotek the Deliverer decreed that the Xa'kota must never tread in sacred Lustria or the untouched paradise of the Southlands. Purge the world of vermin; in doing so we protect the Great Warding.
This one is an enigma; I have searched the plaques, spoken to many masters, but this being should not exist. They are a cosmic accident that needs cleansing from reality.
The Scrutiny of the Old Ones is upon us. I sense we adjust ourselves to the top of the pyramid. The younger races are prey - let the hunt begin!
Ancient Scar-leader… Prepare your spear. The vermin come - there is one of their swarm that Sotek has demanded be slain. Its death must be sacrificial, and performed in battle. Now go and hunt!

The Itz'xa'Khanx, those servants ringed by the ocean - the ones that have remained on the island as the Old Ones intended - broadly act to preserve our defences against the Ancient Enemy. We should consider aligning with them for the present.
Great Master, it seems the lost servants will not return to the island in peace. They are no longer part of the Great Plan but are incongruent to it. As is your will, they must be decimated.
One specific plaque states that to defragment the Great Warding we need a certain spawning. Perhaps I should call upon the Pool Keepers to churn the waters and release those spawnlings?
Chotec rages! He must be appeased. We should wash the ground in the blood of our enemies. I have seen it in the plaques - this is how the great purpose proceeds.
Master! With the Vortex in peril, we must quickly synchronise the contemplations of the younger generations and seek out knowledge that the Old Ones left for us and us alone.
Last Defender, the island-hopping Khanx hinder our plans. Set your cohorts against them and persuade them to return to their true home.
Slow! Corpulent you have become-come. The Council demand you work faster. Yes-yes! Spread far and wide - tails and whiskers are needed everywhere!
I see-see you gain power. Prestige-status. Remember you are my pawn - do not-not forget I Grey Seer with Council backing! You'll never rise above me-me!

Thirteen-thousand apologies! Please-beg that my punishment for intruding is not as severe as the last one, but I have news from Skavenblight, mighty-tailed one. The Lords of Decay speak - they wish easy ingress into your realm so that the clans may travel more freely. Search the ruins and open an old link - perhaps a Dwarf-thing-way that will connect to-to the tunnels of the Under-Empire?

A moment of your time, greatest of greater Lords who is-is very great. My master sends words that it is time to enact an Age of Ruin. The Elf-things, the Reptile-things - all things shall quake before my master's wrath. Or so he says. You are his conduit. Bring ruin... Please.

Most potent of potentates! The power and Warpstone is yours to take. My master, Vulscreek, starts to fear you. Perhaps even a seat on the Council of Thirteen will be yours if you continue to gain influence? Carve an empire and Skavenblight will take notice.

I am sorry to bother you - have I mentioned how much I envy-lust your fine tail, my lord? We have received word from Clan Skurvy. They are on Council's business and request we prepare their arrival by controlling the ports. They will pay in Warpstone.

Excuse my interference in your empire building, greatest of all whiskered-masters, but the nasty-Elf-things of the North dare to interfere in your great works. If our scout-spies are to be believed, the things also seek out Warpstone for their rituals. Master-Grey Seer Vulscreek orders they must be stopped. He says to do it now-now" - I am only the messenger!"
Well-well? What are you-you waiting for? A personal invite from Seerlord Kritislik? Get on with it! Breed warriors - send them above ground - enslave the no-furs!
Why-why they call you Headtaker? Hmm-HMM? I don't see many heads on your trophy rack. Perhaps they should call you Queek Headless-taker? Yes-yes? I would fill up your rack if I were you…
The Warpstone must be mined-found! These things are in our way! Make them move - make them die-die!

Lord, I will flay myself vigorously for this-this interruption but envoys from Clan Moulder are here - their services are crucial to my master's plan in time. For now, they must be seen to be favoured - we must impress on them how crucial their 'products' are to-to our success.
Pathetic! So much for the Right-Claw of Gnawdwell! If you are not-not up to the job, perhaps I shall call in the Deathmaster, yes-yes? Make Clan Mors dominant?
For next part of the plan, Clan Moulder are growing something very-very special! They need payment. We must ensure delivery - find funds!

Curses! The Reptile-things are agitated. My scrying suggests they think their pitiful Snake-God, Sotek, returns. They are fools! Yet if they believe this then it emboldens them against us-us. We must not repeat what happened last time! My plan requires Clan Pestilens presence in jungle-continent. Assassinate-kill their prophets, yes-yes! Strike down their priests - Sotek be-be forgotten!
Cast the rite, fool! Quickly, make our enemies fear the power of the Thirteen Lords of Decay!

Most cunning magnificence… if I may bother you with an insignificance? I have received intelligence that a rival Warlord seeks to usurp your position. This could upset your - and the Council's - plans, most lordly of lords. If that wasn't enough, he-he called your fur mangy...
The Council's plan-scheme is nearly complete, but a piece of the machine I still need. Get it for me-me!

I know you hate us-us, Queek. Despise Grey Seers, yes-yes? Well, I have a task you will-will enjoy. There is another Seer who insists my plan is his plan, taking credit in the Council for my initiatives. He needs to die. Do-do this and I will grant you a boon! Whisper words in Gnawdwell's ear about your greatness! We have pact-deal?
My masters on the Council ask for progress, Lord Skrolk. We must-must soon begin the Ritual of Decay. Use your followers, my-my lord, spread their pestilent gifts far and wide, yes-yes!

I-I speak for the Council. They are suspicious, yes-yes… They wonder if you put your own interests-desires before theirs? A test-test is needed; prove yourself to the Council of Thirteen, become a willing tool of the Lords of Decay and bring about the end-end of all things!

We have made our play! The Grey Seer Clan is now the sacrifice. They control the Council and will send all the other Clans against us! We must fight-fight, we must win - the Horned Rat will favour us-us!
Useless! You are-are as incompetent as Thanquol! More things need to die! I have negotiated with Clan Eshin on your behalf. I suggest you-you hire their best.

The-the Vermin Lord, the Screaming One, it still speaks to me… It wants power to force its way unto the-the Shadow Council of Thirteen - I do not know what that is! It says we must infest this realm. Then tribute will be paid in full!

Greetings, oh glorious lord! Your tail is long with many defined segments! I-I could not begin to-to comprehend how you command such great hordes… but if I may - a tiny suggestion? Begin great works. Learn or steal knowledge! Clan Skryre is the most powerful clan due to their technological dominance - we must better them!

Thirteen-thousand apologies, for disturbing you, pestilent lord, but the Reptile-things come! They steal our Warpstone. Casting it into pools of horrible pure light! My master, Vulscreek, insists you-you deal with them. You are of Clan Pestilens - the reptile of Sotek must be destroyed, yes-yes!

Oh, great and powerful lord. I have blessed news that I am unworthy to bear. A great seam of Warpstone has been found close by - fuel to power the rituals and construct our device! We must capture it, great one, at once, before other clans or things get their claws on it!

The Realm of Chaos plays fast and loose with the concept of time... Once a devout and pure Templar Priest of Sigmar, Archaon searched ancient texts for the means to destroy Chaos, but his studies proved worse than futile. Uncovering a set of heretical manuscripts, he learned a terrible truth which drove him to an unquenchable fury. Rejecting his former gods, he swore himself to the service of Chaos instead. Tearing down the temple, Archaon vowed to become the scourge of the Empire. The scrolls contained details of several artefacts of power and of a great warrior who would win the items and gain the blessing of all the Ruinous Powers. Archaon has vowed to become this man, or die in the attempt. Having cut a bloody swathe across the Empire, he has entered the dreaded Chaos Wastes. Many lesser servants of Chaos have come to follow him, but now he searches for true Warriors of Chaos, sworn "Swords" to form the core of his forces and demonstrate his might.

As Archaon marches across the surreal wastes, flanked by the Swords of Chaos, his elite guard, he is driven on by a remorseless maxim which beats at his consciousness: strength begets strength! Rare is the man who rises, or falls, to the station of a Chaos Lord. Nevertheless, some have, and each represents a challenge to Archaon, but the fallen Templar knows that all are the playthings of the Dark Gods and that only by amusing these all-powerful beings will he rise to dominance. Archaon resolves to build his strength for the Unholy Quests ahead, the trials of the Everchosen yet to come.

The time is nigh. The weird moon Morrslieb leers down from a sky pregnant with the stuff of change. The gaze of the Dark Gods is full upon the Chaos Wastes and Archaon means to place himself at its centre. He sends an emissary forth to seek a worthy challenger against whom he will display his might.

The time is nigh. The weird moon Morrslieb leers down from a sky pregnant with the stuff of change. The gaze of the Dark Gods is full upon the Chaos Wastes and Archaon means to place himself at its centre. He sends an emissary forth to seek a worthy challenger against whom he will display his might.

The gateways that divide worlds swell with power, and the dark shadow of Chaos spills outwards, engulfing all in its path. Before this irresistible tide, the minions of the Dark Powers gather, and Archaon draws them to his cause. Countless tribes of northern barbarians, roving bands of Chaos Warriors and all manner of mutant beasts flock to his banner, attracted by the unmistakable lure of raw power. The world trembles before the horde as city after city is set to torch, the souls of the vanquished on the pyre and devoured by Daemons.
Once more Archaon's deeds have drawn the gaze of the Gods of Chaos, and once more he sends forth an emissary with a challenge to any who deem themselves worthy to confront him.
Once more Archaon's deeds have drawn the gaze of the Gods of Chaos, and once more he sends forth an emissary with a challenge to any who deem themselves worthy to confront him.

The Ruinous Powers have found some fleeting entertainment in Archaon’s feats to date, but there remain others who also command their attention. Archaon has seen his own destiny though, revealed to him in the heretical manuscripts of Necrodomo the Insane, who tore out his own eyes after having a vision of the destruction of the world at Archaon’s hands. His power waxes ever stronger, and with it the favour of the Dark Gods.

Although his accumulation of power is remorseless, Archaon finds himself chafing at the steady pace. Gripped by conviction as to his fate, he searches in vain for a challenge worthy of him. At last, after weeks or perhaps months of aimless wandering, Archaon determines to seek answers from one of the Chaos Sorcerers who have attached themselves to his horde. Such mortals barter fractions of their souls in exchange for greater magical powers. They are seen as the oracles of the Gods and act as prophets, seers and counsellors, guiding their warlords and chieftains to ever greater conquests.

Although his accumulation of power is remorseless, Archaon finds himself chafing at the steady pace. Gripped by conviction as to his fate, he searches in vain for a challenge worthy of him. At last, after weeks or perhaps months of aimless wandering, Archaon determines to seek answers from one of the Chaos Sorcerers who have attached themselves to his horde. Such mortals barter fractions of their souls in exchange for greater magical powers. They are seen as the oracles of the Gods and act as prophets, seers and counsellors, guiding their warlords and chieftains to ever greater conquests.

The fell Gods of Chaos ask for total and complete devotion from their followers, and they grow strong upon the conflict and bloodshed they unleash. In exchange, the Ruinous Powers offer their champions dark blessings - gifts that make the faithful mighty indeed. For the chosen few, whose heaped sacrifices draw the gaze of their patrons time and again, no reward - not even that of immortality - is beyond their grasp. Yet Archaon’s destiny drives an ambition higher still, and as his power grows ever greater it demands a Warshrine to focus the gaze of the Dark Gods upon him above all others.

The rewards of the Chaos Gods take many bizarre forms. A champion might be blessed with great strength and fortitude, or his flesh may start to mutate; his limbs twisting into strange and deadly forms or his soul blasted, reducing him to a mindless beast. Other gifts are broader in scope, affecting a Chaos Lord's qualities as a leader. The blood-slick trail that such a man carves upon the groaning face of the world creates a resonance with the Ruinous Powers and, in exchange, followers are drawn to his banner. Blessings such as these are another measure of patronage, and as such Archaon must excel in them, as in all else.

Again the need to vanquish a rival weighs heavy on Archaon. The easy conquests that he has made in mortal lands are as nothing compared to the true test that only a Lord of Chaos can provide. Once more he sends forth his emissary to search the wastes for one who is worthy of facing him blade to blade; and so another trial is enacted.

Again the need to vanquish a rival weighs heavy on Archaon. The easy conquests that he has made in mortal lands are as nothing compared to the true test that only a Lord of Chaos can provide. Once more he sends forth his emissary to search the wastes for one who is worthy of facing him blade to blade; and so another trial is enacted.

Far to the north, deep in the roots of the mountains, Kholek Suneater has slept for generations. A Shaggoth of tremendous age, first-born of Krakanrok, father of the Dragon Ogres, he stirs, sensing his time as the Bringer of Darkness is come once more. Dire storm clouds gather around the peaks and crags where the Mountain God is said to slumber, yet Suneater is not fully awake. Before a great chasm that splits the mountains like a gigantic axe wound, hundreds upon hundreds of Northmen kneel in the pelting hail and snow, chanting sonorously as tribute after screaming tribute is hurled bodily down into the cavernous lair. Over the chanting rises another voice, distorted to guttural inhumanity. As a sorcerer-servant of the Ruinous Powers completes the summoning, rocks explode as a cataclysmic lightning bolt lances down.

With a mighty crash of thunder and scintillating display of lightning that channels into the deepest of crevices, Kholek emerges from his lair onto the mountainside. The tribes prostrate themselves before their terrible master. And yet this display of utter abasement does nothing to quell the mighty Shaggoth’s rage! Starcrusher, his gigantic arcane hammer, is missing! Vanished while the Dragon Ogre slept. A search must begin, the tribes must find the location of Starcrusher or all will be obliterated by their master’s indescribable wrath!

With a mighty crash of thunder and scintillating display of lightning that channels into the deepest of crevices, Kholek emerges from his lair onto the mountainside. The tribes prostrate themselves before their terrible master. And yet this display of utter abasement does nothing to quell the mighty Shaggoth’s rage! Starcrusher, his gigantic arcane hammer, is missing! Vanished while the Dragon Ogre slept. A search must begin, the tribes must find the location of Starcrusher or all will be obliterated by their master’s indescribable wrath!

Prince Sigvald the Magnificent is bored. The Chaos Wastes are all well and good as far as such things go, but they lack certain comforts that a man of Sigvald’s refined tastes has come to expect. Sigvald is the chosen scion of Slaanesh, the Dark Prince of Chaos. Known as the Lord of Excess, Slaanesh is the master of passions and sensual indulgence, but also of cruel torments and despairing agony. He is the patron of the obsessive, and his attention is drawn to those who inflict pain to satisfy their own desires. As the adopted son of Slaanesh, Sigvald is the personification of beauty on the outside, but rot within. He is attended by dozens who attend to his every whim and desire, but a man can never have too many admirers. As he stands in the midst of battle, preening and murmuring compliments to himself while beings die all around him, he has a whim to gather to himself a band of perfectly-skilled retainers to share in this adulation, perhaps holding mirrors that he might see himself more clearly.

Prince Sigvald is not happy. The field of battle is his playground, where his dark father can revel in his son’s cruel deeds. But it is also a place of squalor, of mud, blood and ordure. In every battle, Sigvald is constantly inconvenienced by the need to clean some vile taint from his otherwise spotless armour, be it dirt or the lifeblood of his latest victim. These interruptions are irksome in the extreme and they deprive his followers of precious moments in which to admire and praise their Lord’s perfection. Reluctantly, the Geld-Prince summons a Chaos Sorcerer to advise him. Though the man bears unsightly mutations and cannot be described as sweet-smelling, the fact that he has traded his very soul in servitude to the magic of the Dark Gods means that he may be able to suggest a solution.

The mad sorcerer rants wild-eyed of the many visions gifted to him by the Ruinous Powers. There is much spittle-flecked talk of lakes of blood, crystalline butterflies, gardens of rot and so on. Sigvald finds his attention wandering to a complacent consideration of the perfection in his own immaculately manicured hand. However, his attention snaps back to the Sorcerer when the man’s meanderings touch upon a great Lord in shining baroque armour of ensorcelled gold, forever untarnished by age or the tiniest fleck of dirt and surrounded by warm perfumed air, even on the snowy plain across which he marches at the head of a great Chaos host. The ground reshapes itself to let the warrior pass, and his feet float an inch above the world’s surface so that his boots are never touched by the mud or gore of the battlefield. There follows some babbling about the defensive properties of this wondrous mail, but Sigvald hears none of it as he curtly orders the Sorcerer forth to investigate.

The mad sorcerer rants wild-eyed of the many visions gifted to him by the Ruinous Powers. There is much spittle-flecked talk of lakes of blood, crystalline butterflies, gardens of rot and so on. Sigvald finds his attention wandering to a complacent consideration of the perfection in his own immaculately manicured hand. However, his attention snaps back to the Sorcerer when the man’s meanderings touch upon a great Lord in shining baroque armour of ensorcelled gold, forever untarnished by age or the tiniest fleck of dirt and surrounded by warm perfumed air, even on the snowy plain across which he marches at the head of a great Chaos host. The ground reshapes itself to let the warrior pass, and his feet float an inch above the world’s surface so that his boots are never touched by the mud or gore of the battlefield. There follows some babbling about the defensive properties of this wondrous mail, but Sigvald hears none of it as he curtly orders the Sorcerer forth to investigate.

Prince Sigvald is in search of a new diversion. The scion of Slaanesh was ever one to satisfy a dark desire, be it carnal, the casual murder of the ugly or irritating, the eradication of whole cities on a whim, or even the sweet savour of flesh. But for every new height of cruel depravity he conquers, there are always greater peaks to be scaled. Jaded in the extreme, Sigvald has decided to allow his caprice free reign amongst his supposed allies. First, all must be compelled to admire Slaanesh’s favoured son, however unwillingly.

Feted by a legion of devoted admirers wherever he goes, Prince Sigvald basks in the adulation that is his due. Rare is the man who will not willingly forsake his Lord to follow the Geld-Prince. And yet such men do exist, thralls to Lords who through jealousy will not acknowledge him as Sigvald the Magnificent. An example must be made. One of these malcontents must die, and in a cruel and degrading fashion that will pay homage to the Dark Prince of Chaos.

A great man's appeal is many-faceted, and surely no-one would dispute that Prince Sigvald is the greatest of men. He is devastatingly handsome, moves with the lithe grace of a cat and has a magnetic personality and charm. A throng of admirers follow him wheresoever he goes, strewing his path with lavish gifts as they strive just to be noticed by him.

Higher and ever higher, the Geld-Prince’s stock rises. All know him to be the moving hand behind the murder of his rival, yet all applaud his actions. Rumour has it that the mortal had been on the verge of attaining a higher station, a position of power under the full gaze of the Chaos Gods. If any man is well-suited to being gazed at though, it is surely Prince Sigvald the Magnificent.

Higher and ever higher, the Geld-Prince’s stock rises. All applaud his every action and a clamour rises for him to be awarded a higher station, a position of power under the full gaze of the Chaos Gods. If any man is well-suited to being gazed at though, it is surely Prince Sigvald the Magnificent.

As the scion of the Chaos God Slaanesh, none can say that Prince Sigvald is not a generous man. To face him on the field of battle is to watch an artist at work, and his fatal blade has ended the suffering of countless fools who know they are unworthy even to look upon his physical perfection. Now his generous spirit manifests itself once again as he sends forth a herald to share word of his magnificence.

As the scion of the Chaos God Slaanesh, none can say that Prince Sigvald is not a generous man. To face him on the field of battle is to watch an artist at work, and his fatal blade has ended the suffering of countless fools who know they are unworthy even to look upon his physical perfection. Now his generous spirit manifests itself once again as he sends forth a herald to share word of his magnificence.

Archaon stands beneath a storm-shaken sky boiling with eldritch power, pelted by an inverted rain of blood, and buffeted by hot winds. Here, one can witness the rebellion of nature itself, where even the elements are torn between the mortal and immortal worlds. Before him looms a monolith, raised to the glory of a Chaos Champion, the twisted ground at its base littered with skulls from whence screams of malice arise “A challenger comes!”

The earth groans before the might of Archaon. Having gained the favour of all the Chaos Gods, he stands on the brink of destiny. The Winds of Magic howl from the uttermost north where the gates between worlds strain and then burst asunder, admitting a single diabolical form. A Daemonic champion, a Lord of Change, comes to offer a final test to the man who would unite all of the forces of Chaos into an unholy horde bent on subjugating the entire mortal world.

Twisted in body and mind, the sorcerer twitches convulsively in the grip of the Gods and howls a vision of mountains twisted into fantastical shapes with gaping maws jutting out of cliff faces bellowing to be fed the flesh of mortals. Before the mountains lies a bloodstained plain bordered by a forest of trees contorted into blackened skeletons, straining their branches towards warm-blooded creatures. In the tumultuous skies overhead, winged death swoops. A once-noble ruler of the skies, now corrupt with change, a two-headed Dragon of Chaos trumpets its challenge.

As Archaon rides onward, many challenge him, but none can stand before his might. Sparing those who swear fealty, he slays the rest, claiming their warbands as his own by right of conquest. Now he receives word of another challenger, one who will not bend the knee. A mighty Chaos Sorcerer Lord defies him, daring to offer battle with a horde of warriors under his command. The sorcerer wields the wild energies of entropy itself, reshaping reality to better serve his whims and those of his dark masters. A word and a gesture from him can strip the flesh from a man’s bones, or cause a regiment of soldiers to burst into flames. Archaon makes his final preparations to pit the martial might of his troops against the raw magical power of his adversary.

The agent reports that Starcrusher now lies in the ruins of Todtheim - taken there by agents of the Deceiver. The ancient city is being fought over by its winged Undead residents and Orcs. But Kholek is the greater threat by far, and when he comes in thunder to reclaim Starcrusher, flanked by hordes of fanatical Northmen, the thieves will come to know the true meaning of annihilation.

The sorcerer sends word that he has located the golden warrior and stands ready to transport his Lord to the location. Sigvald indulges himself with a last yearning gaze into his mirror, his mind filled with a shining vision of himself clad in the Auric Armour, perfection in both form and in function as he blesses the battlefield with new depths of cruelty.

Jealousy - an ugly word to some, sinful even. Yet what man or woman fortunate enough to behold the scion of Slaanesh can help but harbour a kernel of envy at his cruel perfection? Flanked by scores of devoted admirers wherever he goes, a callous and deadly Lord of battle, and spoiled by his indulgent adoptive father Slaanesh, the Geld-Prince’s every wildly-excessive wish is made manifest. But such renown has its price. The Champions of Chaos are forever searching for more power, and with it, the chance to attract the eye of the Gods themselves. They are constantly hunting out rivals and great duels are fought, with the victor winning further infamy and power. Now a Chaos Lord rival challenges Prince Sigvald the Magnificent, driven by envy and a lust for power, and with an army of hideous beasts repellent to the Geld-Prince.

The curses of man are many - they think to purge the forests of the warherds! Todbringer sends out his armies from Middenheim to rid the Drakwald of Gors. They have slain bray-kin, while the chieftains vie for petty power. However, should the Cloven Ones flock to one banner, Middenheim stands high on the Ulricsberg plateau, making a brute force attack futile. No, to make Boris Todbringer pay, a more cunning approach is needed if the Children of Chaos are to raze his city to ash and ruin… \n\nKhazrak knows that the Elector Count of Middenheim is an honourable fool. Once he sees his people burning, Boris will surely come to their rescue, luring him away from the Ulricsberg. Such acts will also cause panic and fear in the Empire’s subjects, and quicken Beastmen hearts. Let the carnage begin under Khazrak’s command, so it is his name called as the blood starts to flow.

The raids go well, but the prey is wanting to flee before the reaving can be begin in earnest. Faster paws are needed to prevent the quarry from warning others of the Beastmen advance. The One-Eye orders more hounds to be gathered for his warherds - he prefers beasts with a toxic bite.

Middenland is reeling. The One-Eye’s rampage will certainly have got Todbringer’s attention. But that is not enough, Khazrak must not only draw the Elector Count’s remaining eye but make him hate too! A further act of spite and defilement is required, to make the Midden-Wolves desperate for vengeance!

Middenland is ripe with fear - now is the time to plunge a dagger into its quivering heart and force Todbringer to act! Khazrak’s forces take to the beast-paths, surrounding a mannish town that represents everything the Beastmen despise about civilisation! The One-Eye must raze it to the ground and erect a Herdstone in its ruins – the Chaos Gods will be pleased!
It seems that Todbringer has taken the bait. Khazrak sends out a Gor along the beast-paths to scout for Middenheimers.
It seems that Todbringer has taken the bait. Khazrak sends out a Gor along the beast-paths to scout for Middenheimers.

This is Khazrak's time - he embodies the primal force of the forest. He grows tired of Beastlord Graktar’s rule, a dominance only Graktar himself seems to recognise. A lame animal should be put out of its misery, even if the pathetic creature fails to realise it’s for the best.\n\nDespite Khazrak’s standing, Graktar remains a powerful force among those still loyal to him. A head-on collision may not be the best tactic, consult with the Bray-Shaman on how to pierce Graktar’s hide and make him easy prey!

The Bray-Shaman guts a Tuskgor in a darkling rite. As its steaming innards spill onto the ground, he foresees Khazrak at the head of a great warherd. However, this path is not yet set in stone. To topple Graktar, speaks the Shaman, the One-Eye must seek out a deadly poison from the Black Deeps. Even a creature as twisted as Graktar will fall under the poison’s touch, as it is made from the venom of the deadliest spiders in the forest.

The Greenskins and their arachnid allies have scattered. Khazrak must look elsewhere for a source of poison. This shouldn’t be an impossible task as all races, whether fair or foul, have access to such lethal potions. Guided by witch-sight, a trusted Bray-Shaman knows what to look for. Send him to carry out this dark deed.

Even for the Beastmen, to enter the web-shrouded realms of the Black Deeps undetected is impossible. The Goblin Spider Boss now hunts the One-Eye, thinking he can use the herd to feed his colony, but the Greenskin deals with an intellect far more cunning than his own. While the Spider Boss searches, Khazrak makes for the heart of the arachnid realm. The dank lair contains many hatchlings - ripe for the picking without the Goblin Boss’ protection.

With the venom in the One-Eye’s possession, Graktar has vanished. The Beastlord must have been weaker than even Khazrak suspected; Graktar’s Bray-Shamans must have read their own darkling omens and have got wind of the One-Eye’s plans. The fleeing Beastlord must be found quickly, before he can amass a large herd to protect him. Black-hearted crows bring word of possible herd movements in Esk...

With the venom in the One-Eye’s possession, Graktar has vanished. The Beastlord must have been weaker than even Khazrak suspected; Graktar’s Bray-Shamans must have read their own darkling omens and have got wind of the One-Eye’s plans. The fleeing Beastlord must be found quickly, before he can amass a large herd to protect him. Black-hearted crows bring word of possible herd movements in Esk...

There is a reason that Malagor is depicted as the arch-foe of Sigmar in tales and on wood carvings throughout the Empire. He is the Dark Omen that despises all gods in opposition to his Ruinous masters. But it is Sigmar he loathes the most, so where better to strike than at the Sigmarite Cult’s heartland - Reikland?\n\nLet the Uncloven folk who dwell within the borders of Reikland know that the Crowfather now stalks the lands.

There is a reason that Malagor is depicted as the arch-foe of Sigmar in tales and on wood carvings throughout the Empire. He is the Dark Omen that despises all gods in opposition to his Ruinous masters. But it is Sigmar he loathes the most, so where better to strike than at the Sigmarite Cult’s heartland - Reikland?\n\nLet the Uncloven folk who dwell within the borders of Reikland know that the Crowfather now stalks the lands.

Men quell in fear, barring their doors at night and hanging fetishes from eaves, not that it will do them any good. Yet while this pleases Malagor, he requires a tangible force to extract his toll in blood and death - a powerful warrior to carry out the next portion of his dark scheme. It is said the strongest beasts are found deep within the Forest of Shadows...

Morrslieb glowers full this night. It is time to make camp and lay tributes to the Chaos Gods. The Ruinous Powers will surely empower the warherd for the battle to come, leading more bulls along the beast-paths to the Crowfather's sway.

The Harbinger of Destruction’s work is never done. As long as Malagor can fly, he must sow disharmony and destruction on mankind - so it has been ordained by the Dark Gods. The raids continue, such acts of vilification will please the Gods and a reward will surely be granted.

The Dark Gods have indeed blessed the Malagor's brayherd. They whisper and mutter of the work still to do, showing the Dark Omen a vision of a burning temple in Grunberg and the ruins of civilisation strewn across Averland. Should these acts of vilification be fulfilled then a further blessing upon the Crowfather awaits.
The Crowfather dispatches a minion to lead the warherd across the beast-paths to doomed Grunberg.
The Crowfather dispatches a minion to lead the warherd across the beast-paths to doomed Grunberg.
Seen by Grimnir in woe and anger, a disgusting Gor - a behorned daemon - set about our honourable throng. Payment in kind is demanded!
Under the withering gaze of Valaya did a warrior of the beasts strike down a beloved hero of the Dawi. This tragedy cannot be allowed to stand!
As witnessed by Gazul, the filthy Beastman did dare to attack our fine Holds and property. Kill the Gor and make this right!
Shamed in Grimnir’s sight did the bestial horde attack from many different angles, breaking the established rules of war. Cheaters all, and they should be punished!
Within Smednir’s vengeful glare did the Gors raid Dawi lands. A foul trespass! Right this wrong!
Spied in the view of Grungni, the warherds of vile, skruff Beastmen pillage and despoil fine Dawi lands. Such a disgrace must be avenged!
Another herd's Hero has become too much of a hazard. Destroy them - see that they never return.
This Hero of Chaos has become troublesome. See them dealt with, and remove this threat forever.
This unfilthy, Uncloven, stunted Dwarf Hero has been allowed to sow trouble for too long. Bury this fool in his caverns - blot out his light.
