This pompous, self-aggrandising Empire Hero believes himself greater than the herd. Bring him down to size - excise this malignancy for good.
This Hero has become a nuisance to the herd. Send him to a gruesome grave, and remove this threat forever.
This Hero has become a nuisance to the herd. Send him to a gruesome grave, and remove this threat forever.
This meddlesome Greenskin Hero pesters us, and can no longer be tolerated. Squash this pest underfoot.
This unfilthy, Uncloven Hero of the Vampire Counts has haunted our lives for too long. Send him to our Ruinous masters, and remove this Unliving threat forever.
This unfilthy, Uncloven Hero of the Vampire Counts has haunted our lives for too long. Send him to our Ruinous masters, and remove this Unliving threat forever.
This Beastman Lord is a thorn in our side. See to it that he never again takes arms against us!
Letting this Lord of Chaos live is no longer an option. Return him to the Ruinous masters - let them decide his final fate!
This tiny Dwarf Lord has caused big problems, but no more. Bring ruin upon him, that he might never make trouble for us again.
A stuffy Empire Lord has become too much of a nuisance to us. Rend his pompous flesh, see him strewn about for feasting!
This Lord has caused too many problems for us - this must stop! Savage him, leave him for dead, and see that he never bothers our herd again!
This conniving Greenskin Lord has been too much trouble for too long. Extinguish this pestering ember - leave nought but ashes where once he stood!
This sallow Lord of the Vampire Counts has been too much trouble for too long. Savage him and see that his Unliving kind never bothers our herd again!
It is the wise beast who rips apart his foe on the battlefield; other Beastlords will be happy to see him smashed and will respect your strength for doing so.
We should fight this enemy on the battlefield. In victory, your power will be undeniable - the other Beastlords will show respect and deference.
Only the true beast would consider raiding these lands. A swift victory will say much about your worth to the other Beastlords.
Burning these settlements and destroying the lands around them would show wisdom, Lord. Other tribes will revel in the destruction, and like us all the more for it.
Another Beastlord is bringing his herd through nearby blood-grounds. If we kill him - and break his horns - his herd will be struck a terrible blow and we will grow stronger.
A Chaos Lord is driving his armies through our blood-grounds. We will gain great glory and prestige if we smash this army to a bloody pulp!
A paltry Dwarf Lord is marching his army right into our blood-grounds. They have brought themselves into the hunt - we will gain glory beyond reckoning if we destroy this Dwarfen host.
A boastful Empire Lord swaggers through our blood-ground. It is an affront! There is man-flesh to rend and rive, and strength to be gained in their devastation!
A Lord dares to march his army through our blood-grounds. Destroy them, break them into pieces, and gain glory and strength through their defeat!
A mewling Greenskin is leading his pitiful band through nearby lands. Should we smear their pestilence away and squash their march, we will become stronger.
A corpselike Lord of the Vampire Counts is processes his army of bones through our blood-grounds. Break them apart, send them to a permanent end, gain glory!
This enemy Beastlord is a powerful adversary, strong-horned and vicious. Defeating him in a bloody battle, and de-horning him, would be a great achievement, showering us in gore and glory!
This Chaos Lord has a dark power, giving him skill on the battlefield. If we defeat him, bring true ruin to his force, then the Dark Gods would favour us greatly in return.
This Dwarf Lord has great strength for such a small thing and is courageous in combat. Should we best him - and we will - there would be much glory and honour showered upon us.
This conceited Empire Lord has great strength and is heroic in combat. Stripping him of his vaunted skill, destroying him in battle, will exult us; glory through bloodshed!
This enemy Lord has great strength and is savage in combat. Killing him in battle -filthy and bloody battle - would be a great achievement, raining glory and strength upon us.
This pernicious Greenskin Lord has surprising strength, racking up many victories. There is great glory in felling such a warrior - we should take it upon ourselves to slay him!
This cadaverous Lord of the Vampire Counts has a preternatural power and is towering in combat. Rending his soul from his husk and destroying his ambitions will bring great things to us and the herd.
This enemy herd shall face the true chosen of Chaos - their Ruinous might shall flow through us as their destruction is wrought upon the battlefield!
This Chaos force shall experience the power of a fully-armed Beastmen army. Attack at will!
This shrunken Dwarf army faces the horrible majesty of the Beastmen! Destroy this force in the name of ruin and madness!
This pathetic man-filth Empire army shall be brought to heel; their pomp and pride shall come to naught as they fall before the snarling and smashing of the Beastmen.
This enemy army shall face the fury and savagery of a true Beastman army, and they will know our might as they are destroyed!
This meddlesome Greenskin army shall fall under hoof as we trample this force of pests into nothing more than mud and blood.
This Beastmen herd thinks they can encroach on OUR blood-ground. That is not their right. Our land. Our hunt. Our retribution!
A Chaos force marches where they are not welcome. The true chosen of the Chaos Gods desire flesh and war, and so we will repulse this invasion!
A band of foolish Dwarfs has trudged onto the blood-grounds. They know not what they do, but will feel our wrath all the same!
A presumptuous Empire army marches onto our blood-grounds. In their arrogance, they have invited our terrible fury down upon themselves. Enact that fury. Destroy them!
An enemy army has dared to trespass on our blood-grounds. This makes them fair game. To the hunt!
A noisome Greenskin force has moronically entered where they are not wanted. Send them back to their huts and hovels and dung. Smash them apart. Destroy them!
The pallid Vampire Counts have dared to snake their dead, crusty tendrils into our lands. Their graves cannot remain empty for long - see them returned!
These pallid Vampire Counts shall face true terror beyond their reckoning at our hands; to war, to glory, to feast!
Another herd has dared challenge us upon the waves. Their fury is no match for ours - send them to the depths!
Such small and stunted creatures are not made for the seas. It does not suit their temperament. Show these foolhardy Dwarfs their errors. Flood their senses!
The boastful Empire has made a critical mistake in thinking they can best our naval dominance. Show them the true power on the waves. Send them to the deep!
This force has made the error of thinking they can outclass us at sea. Demonstrate their error - smash their ships apart!
This snivelling Greenskin force has somehow set themselves to sea. They cannot, nor should not, last long. Hasten their departure from our dominion.
This ghastly Vampire Count force has made the most grave error of setting themselves against us on the waves. It is a lucky thing that the dead float…
These Dwarfen lands, their holds and their tunnels, are brimming with plunder. Summon the beasts, call them to war - there is hunting to be done!
The Empire lands are full of the rich-blooded and the haughty. Their flesh is fat, and so are their coffers. To battle then, for the prize!
This blood-ground is ready to be ravaged. Summon the herd, begin the hunt! We take what we want, and leave nothing for the carrion!
This Greenskin land is filthy, disgusting and remorseless - it is perfect for us. We lay claim to this land, and all within it!
Amongst the ash, and bones and towering piles of corpses lie treasures unending. The Beastmen will have these treasures; they can keep the bodies.
The more land we conquer, the more territory we own, the larger the force needed to control it. Attract more Gors to the herd; expand our might!
The oceans are treacherous, fraught with danger for those who do not treat them with respectful caution. The herd must take to the seas - conquer!
The Dwarfs' network of tunnels and stone dares to decry our base majesty! Leave nothing of it for them to salvage - turn stone and bones to dust!
This shining, 'civilised' Empire settlement is a brazen affront to the glorious filth of the world! The beasts should ride to defile these pretenders. Call the herd. Destroy man!
This settlement cannot be allowed to remain - it is too clean, too pure; it is an insult. Bring it to rubble - bring it to ruin!
These Greenskin hovels are disgusting; admirably filthy, but they still cannot be allowed to endure. Remove this unworthy pestilence!
These desiccated cadavers believe themselves to be the true heirs to the Empire, the true inheritors of 'civilisation' - there is no such thing! Destroy them! DESTROY THEM ALL!
The Gorebull is a powerful and useful Hero of great advantage to us on the blood-grounds!
The Bray-Shaman is a deeply mysterious but extremely effective Hero. Stalking the blood-grounds with us, its power could be brought to bear excellently.
Although brutal melee is always preferable, there is tactical advantage in bombarding our enemies from afar. We do not have enough artillery under our command - this should be rectified!
A powerful division of cavalry is crucial to victory. We are fielding very little cavalry - something that should be addressed!
The melee is everything! Brutal, bloody, savage combat! We do not have nearly enough melee troops - recruit more with haste!

We prefer to fight with our hands and our hooves and our teeth, yet there is some advantage in softening up the foe with missile fire before the charge. We do not have enough missile troops - this should be rectified!
The bigger the beast, the better the slaughter! There are not enough War Beasts in our herds - recruit more with haste!
War Machines help us tear down the world of man. We are not fielding enough - recruit more War Machines and destroy our Uncloven foe!
These underlings think to play above their station. Hah! Smash this snivelling, mewling beast into the dirt!
An aberration of the highest order dares to move against us. Let no such nonsense stand - eliminate this beastly agent and be done with it.
Stinkin', stupid Beastmen agent needs to be smashed, crushed, sliced! They'll have to put him back together.
This beastly, uncouth Beastmen agent thinks to tread upon our lands. Drain this fool, leave him for the carrion!
If these beasts love war so much, we shall bring war to them and show them the fury of the Ruinous Powers. Fell their general; establish dominance!
Savage brutes that know only war are best defeated, comprehensively, on the battlefield. Cut the head from a snake, and watch the body wither.
column4: The beasts want to fight, then fight! Yes! Take to the battlefield and smash the big one into the dirt! Then we'll see how much they like fightin'!

column3: The beasts want to fight, then fight! Yes! Take to the battlefield and smash the big one into the dirt! Then we'll see how much they like fightin'!
On the battlefield, the beasts are ferocious and savage, but so are we. Let our prowess be known; fell the strongest of them and the others will follow suit!
The Beastmen rise from their forests and their filth, frothing over with fury at the 'civilisation' of man. They clamour for blood.
From afar, the Beastmen watch the cities of man with a baleful gaze, longing to tear apart that which they so detest. And so it comes to pass.
With splintering roars, the great throng of Beastmen descend upon the world of men. With much clamour, and a singular hatred, they charge and do not cease.
Every tower, every gatehouse, every thatched home is an affront to the Beastmen's very essence. With fire, brawn and rage, the unending herds will see it all destroyed.
The land burns, the seas boil, the world cracks and blooms into destruction. The Beastmen, bloody-handed, see this, and know that it is right.
column4: Chapter V: The Tree of Wrath

column3: The Beastmen rise from their forests and their filth, frothing over with fury at the 'civilisation' of man. They clamour for blood.
From afar, the Beastmen watch the cities of man with a baleful gaze, longing to tear apart that which they so detest. And so it comes to pass.
With splintering roars, the great throng of Beastmen descend upon the world of men. With much clamour, and a singular hatred, they charge and do not cease.
Every tower, every gatehouse, every thatched home is an affront to the Beastmen's very essence. With fire, brawn and rage, the unending herds will see it all destroyed.
The land burns, the seas boil, the world cracks and blooms into destruction. The Beastmen, bloody-handed, see this, and know that it is right.
column4: Chapter V: The Tree of Wrath

column3: At last, the Middenheim army marches forth from its fastness, lured by the defilement of their so-called civilisation. Now, Khazrak will show them why his name is whispered in horrified tones; why he is the most cunning Beastlord to have ever lived! Should he succeed the Bray-Shamans have promised him a great tribute - a cursed lash that will ensure the fealty of the tribes. Ambush the man-filth outside of Middenheim, in the forests of the Drakwald!

Graktar is camped near the mannish towns of Kelp and Koldust. As suspected, the Beastlord is gathering his loyal Gors to him, ready to fight back! Using his bestial cunning, the One-Eye sends his forces to surround Graktar’s own warherd, trapping him in place. The time to strike is now; with the venom in Khazrak’s possession, Graktar is no match, and that blackened chainmail he wears can be claimed by the true Beastlord of the Drakwald!

The Minotaur tribes are formidable but won’t fight for a Bray-Shaman, even one as notorious as the Crowfather. Only a Gorebull - a champion amongst its blood-gorging kin - can rouse the tribes to flock to the Dark Omen’s banner. But time grows short; to capitalise on the shroud of fear across Reikland’s borders the Crowfather must act soon. Malagor must dominate the Minotaurs with his eldritch might, forcing them to supplication.

Now the chapel of Grunberg is burnt to flaming rubble, Malagor wishes to exact one more cruelty upon the race of Man. Having seen a smoking, festering carcass of a griffon in his earlier vision, Malagor knows his final target is the Knights Griffon. Upon their destruction will his foul fetishes be elevated to blasphemous Icons of vilification.

The Dark Gods are pleased… mankind is ravaged. They have been taunted, hunted and broken by the Children of Chaos. The land is ripe for an even greater invasion; for other followers of the Ruinous Powers to make their mark, as paltry as it will be compared to the triumphs of the Cloven Ones. Yet there remains defiance - the armies of man-filth muster as one, refusing the inevitable. No matter! This is but another opportunity for the Beastmen to prove themselves the most worthy of the Dark Powers' servants. Find this "gathering of might" and ensure the fall of man!

Sigmar has ever-been a warrior god, and his clergy have followed his example. They are no mere priests or tranquil monks but warriors all - as eager to split skulls with hammer as preach from a pulpit. At the head of the Cult is the Grand Theogonist, and while many have filled the role over the years, most - if not all - have been intimidating men; full of fury and bombast, and piously devoted to Sigmar's tenets.

Should the Empire come under threat, then it is not always state troops that must face the threat alone. The Cult of Sigmar has often answered the call to war, with the Grand Theogonist at its head, eager as any of his Warrior Priests to smite the foe. It was on one such doomed campaign that the Jade Griffon - a talisman of the Theogonist's office, said to have been blessed by Magnus the Pious himself - went missing. The Grand Theogonist at the time was brought low by Chaos filth, and the Jade Griffon lost somewhere in Kislev.

Many years later, and word has reached Volkmar the Grim that the Jade Griffon has resurfaced. The Grand Theogonist senses that the time is right to go in search of this precious antiquity. Volkmar issues a proclamation that he intends to march for Kislev. In the vanguard of his force go the desperate and the fanatical - those that have lost everything but their faith. Let their zeal light the way.

According to the Witch Hunters, Mannfred von Carstein's willing creature, Helman Ghorst, has also started searching for the Jade Griffon. To have a talisman blessed by Magnus fall into the hands of a Necromancer such as he would be a fell thing indeed. Volkmar tasks his agents with breaching Ghorst's lair, thus distracting the liche and halting the Undead servant's search before it can truly begin.

According to the Witch Hunters, Mannfred von Carstein's willing creature, Helman Ghorst, has also started searching for the Jade Griffon. To have a talisman blessed by Magnus fall into the hands of a Necromancer such as he would be a fell thing indeed. Volkmar tasks his agents with taking Templehof from the Necromancer's filthy clutches, diverting the Undead servant from his search.

The Witch Hunters of the Holy Order of Sigmar have a certain talent for extracting information, even from those of an Undead persuasion. When torture isn't an option there are certain hexes and rituals that may well work. In any case, crucial information has been learned regarding the Necromancer's plans, and they are diabolical indeed. Should Helman and the Brothers Ghorst get hold of the Jade Griffon, then he will use a dark spell from his Cursed Book, one that will taint the talisman and flood it with fell magic. On learning this, Volkmar angrily rises from his chair and spits orders. The Jade Griffon must be found before Ghorst gets his hands on it. And if that means every Kislevite dwelling upturned in the search, then so be it!

The Witch Hunters of the Holy Order of Sigmar have a certain talent for extracting information, even from those of an Undead persuasion. When torture isn't an option there are certain hexes and rituals that may well work. In any case, crucial information has been learned regarding the Necromancer's plans, and they are diabolical indeed. Should Helman and the Brothers Ghorst get hold of the Jade Griffon then he will use a dark spell from his Cursed Book, one that will taint the talisman and flood it with fell magic. On learning this, Volkmar angrily rises from his chair and spits orders. The Jade Griffon must be found before Ghorst gets his hands on it, so the Cult of Sigmar will make for Kislev on a war footing. Volkmar knew that he risked the wrath of Ursun and his followers, but there was simply too much at stake.

Despite the Grand Theogonist's best efforts, the Vampires have somehow unearthed the Jade Griffon first, Sigmar damn them! But Volkmar the Grim is not known for giving up. He sends his best Templars of the Holy Order after the Undead thieves. Witch Hunters are famously dogged in pursuing their prey and this agent is no different. Word soon reaches Volkmar that the Witch Hunter has picked up the trail and has divined that the Necromancer is heading for Hel Fenn...

Despite the Grand Theogonist's best efforts, the Vampires have somehow unearthed the Jade Griffon first, Sigmar damn them! But Volkmar the Grim is not known for giving up. He sends his best Templars of the Holy Order after the Undead thieves. Witch Hunters are famously dogged in pursuing their prey and this agent is no different. Word soon reaches Volkmar that the Witch Hunter has picked up the trail and has divined that the Necromancer is heading for Hel Fenn...

There has always been a darkness about Volkmar. Not for nothing is he known as "the Grim". Those who know Volkmar well, such as Karl Franz, realise that this brooding nature is a fierce internal piety, frustration that Chaos still thrives and a grim determination to purge the Empire's foes. Yet the office of the Grand Theogonist has always attracted enemies, from both within and without. Volkmar, a man who has never suffered fools, has burned alliances and gained many opponents during Altdorf's courtly political games, so when the malicious rumours started to circulate about Volkmar's behaviour, there were many suspects.

 The rumours were few at first, but have since spread like balefire - "Volkmar communes with Daemons"; "The Grand Theogonist wishes to depose the Emperor"; "He is the arch-heretic". Despite the Emperor's urging, Volkmar refused to waste time defending himself from such vapid gossip. This played into his unseen enemy's hands, and now the Staff of Command - the symbol of the Grand Theogonist's august office - has been reluctantly taken and locked away by the Holy Order of Sigmar, such is the feeling against Volkmar. Even Franz, his closest friend, is politically tied to remain a mere observer whilst the Witch Hunters investigate the allegations, baseless as they are.

Spurred on by strong support within the Cult of Sigmar, Volkmar has at last decided he must act and despatches loyal Warrior Priests throughout the realm to track down the deviant rumour-mongers.

While tending to their flocks, the Warrior Priests counter the rumours about their liege and spread words of truth - of Volkmar's faith and devotion to Sigmar. They also gather intelligence on the source of these lies, yet no instigator is found.

All is not lost, there are a couple of possible leads. A few tales by wary villagers back in Reikland tell of priests of the Wolf God, Ulric, besmirching Volkmar's name. Tensions between the two cults are often fraught but cordial. However, ever since Volkmar and his Arch Lectors voted against the Ar-Ulric's candidate in the election for Emperor, relations have been strained.

If the Cult of Ulric is spreading these fell rumours, then Volkmar will need the support of the Arch Lectors once more.

The Cult of Sigmar's movements have not gone unnoticed. And in response, there are large troop movements, especially in the north, in Middenland, a stronghold of Ulric worship. The Emperor is concerned, but dare not intervene and start a full-scale civil war. Nevertheless, the Cult of Sigmar must bolster its home city should a confrontation become inevitable.

Grave tidings from Altdorf! The Cult Of Ulric has moved against the city. Never before have the followers of Ulric been so aggressive, maybe there is something more behind this? Even as Karl Franz plays peacekeeper, Volkmar must show the Sigmarites' strength; after all, Sigmar was a warrior in his mortal life and would never cower from a fight. The War Altar of Sigmar should be brought forth as a show of power and defiance!

The Ulricans main force has moved away from Altdorf's walls due to the brilliant statesmanship of the Emperor. Volkmar, however, is in a rage! The slurs of Ulric's supporters and their armies' trespass must be answered. The Grand Theogonist deploys a Warrior Priest to seek them out.

The Ulricans main force has moved away from Altdorf's walls due to the brilliant statesmanship of the Emperor. Volkmar, however, is in a rage! The slurs of Ulric's supporters and their armies' trespass must be answered. The Grand Theogonist deploys a Warrior Priest to seek them out.

The plot is revealed! The Necromancer, in concert with a cabal of Vampires, plan to plunge Sylvania - and then all the Empire - into endless night! The Jade Griffon is the relic they plan to use to power this despicable deed. That such a holy symbol should be considered for this heresy is more than motivation enough for Volkmar to summon a mighty host, as the Vampire Counts must be brought to battle and stopped at all costs! Hel Fenn is a cursed place, where much blood has been spilt, but perhaps it is a good omen to fight here? After all, it was here that the death of Mannfred von Carstein occurred, for a time. If Sigmar sees fit more monsters will perish here!

The army of the Ar-Ulric has been found, several leagues from Altdorf. They are in the midst of deploying, clearly expecting battle. Volkmar will not disappoint, as his reputation and honour have been despoiled by the Cult of Ulric. While fighting between two such noble religions is regretful, the Middenlanders must be taught a lesson, with victory ensuring the Staff of Command's return.

Helman arrives with his minions to see that the Cult of Sigmar are already excavating the site, presumably looking for the casket that contains the missing pages of the Liber Noctus. Such a large expenditure of resources proves to Ghorst beyond doubt the pages' importance. Once rebound, this book will give the Necromancer untold power! While the temptation to attack immediately is strong, the cunning Ghorst decides to hold back, letting the Arch Lector do the hard graft and find the casket. In the meantime, the Necromancer prepares an ambush to relieve the Sigmarites of the pages as soon as they have been found!

Vlad is pleased - the forces of men muster to fight in an army grand-enough to appease the Vampire Count's ego. His sword shall drink deeply from the mortals gathered and Ostermark will burn! A great summoning is needed to call all the creatures of the night from their lairs and awaken those in their graves. As for the living that face Vlad, they will join his ranks soon enough!

Vlad has found the meteor site. He wastes little time gathering further intelligence on who or what lays claim to it, for he is keen to return to the court of Sylvania in case any of his kin get 'ambitious'. A lightning strike at the mine is the best approach. Anyone foolish enough to stand in his way will be obliterated or inducted into his army's ranks...

The Plague of Blue Roses is a vile disease, sadly common throughout the southern provinces and Tilea. Once its spores have been inhaled, mortal men will quickly perish in a matter of hours, the tell-tale bluish fungus bruises covering their bodies. So it was that a young Helman Ghorst discovered his father and four brothers lying in their beds, taken by the Plague. In a fit of anguish, Helman embraced his dead kin - desperate to contract the plague himself - but fate had other plans for the youngest of the Ghorst family.

Unable to accept his family's deaths, Ghorst sought other, darker means to bring them back. Years later, Helman crossed paths with Mannfred. The Vampire Count saw something in Ghorst, a potential ally perhaps? To that end, he gave Ghorst the Liber Noctus, the Cursed Book of Necromancy. Yet the pages of greatest lore were missing - torn from their binding and scattered across the Empire. No doubt this was Mannfred's true agenda all along - a test - and should Ghorst be successful, he would imbue one of the nine Books of Nagash with great power once more.

Ghorst must begin the hunt for the missing pages immediately or risk disappointing the Gravelord, Mannfred, himself. Fast-moving Dire Wolves will allow the Necromancer to cover more ground.

Helman Ghorst is on the hunt. The Necromancer is desperate to reunite all the pages of the Liber Noctus - a book that contains even more powerful enchantments than those written in its sister tome, the Liber Necronomica.\n\nThere are whispers that one of the missing pages has been framed and hung up in a tavern, the ignorant peasantry believing it to be some generations old proclamation from an Arch Lector. What fools! The location of the tavern has been narrowed to three townships. Ghorst must find the page and punish these mortals for their ignorance!

Helman Ghorst is on the hunt. The Necromancer is desperate to reunite all the pages of the Liber Noctus - a book that contains even more powerful enchantments than those written in its sister tome, the Liber Necronomica.\n\nThere are whispers that one of the missing pages has been framed and hung up in a tavern, the ignorant peasantry believing it to be some generations-old proclamation from an Arch Lector. What fools! The location of the tavern has been narrowed to the province of Reikland. Ghorst must find the page and punish these mortals for their ignorance!

One of the missing pages is in Ghorst's pallid hands, but there are more still to locate. As Helman's Corpse Cart trundles on rickety roads through the ghoulish countryside, the Necromancer is approached by a hunched-back dreg. The creature bows and scrapes before the Necromancer in false obsequiousness. He brings word from his mistress, a sultry Vampiress who has heard of his quest and has information that could aid him in search for more of the pages. Perhaps a pact is in order?

In exchange for spores of the Blue Rose Plague, the Vampire bequeaths Ghorst some pertinent information. The Cult of Sigmar have caught wind of Ghorst's search as, after all, the Necromancer wasn't very subtle in burning down Empire settlements. The Sigmarites are now searching for the last remaining pages to keep them out of Ghorst's, and ultimately Mannfred's, hands. They have tracked the pages to a site deep within the Border Princes - taken there by a Lahmian cult centuries ago, placed in a sealed casket and thrown in a deep gorge to keep them out of Nagash's necrotic hands. Burning the pages would have proved more effective, but many counter-curses ensure the Books of Nagash cannot be so easily destroyed.\n\nAnd so the Cult of Sigmar control the site, hunting for the casket. Ghorst needs the location. The Vampire gives him a redolent smile, stating that while the whereabouts remain a mystery to her, she is aware of a ranking officer that does know. Getting the information from a single Empire soldier shouldn't be too taxing, as will killing him afterwards to ensure his silence. He can then join Ghorst's brothers on the cart!

In exchange for spores of the Blue Rose Plague, the Vampire bequeaths Ghorst some pertinent information. The Cult of Sigmar have caught wind of Ghorst's search as, after all, the Necromancer wasn't very subtle in burning down Empire settlements. The Sigmarites are now searching for the last remaining pages to keep them out of Ghorst's, and ultimately Mannfred's, hands. They have tracked the pages to a site deep within the Border Princes - taken there by a Lahmian cult centuries ago, placed in a sealed casket and thrown in a deep gorge to keep them out of Nagash's necrotic hands. Burning the pages would have proved more effective, but many counter-curses ensure the Books of Nagash cannot be so easily destroyed.\n\nAnd so the Cult of Sigmar control the site, hunting for the casket. Ghorst needs the location. The Vampire gives him a redolent smile, stating that while the whereabouts remain a mystery to her, she is aware of a being that does know. Getting the information from such a creature should not be too taxing, as will killing it afterwards to ensure its silence.
With the location of the pages now known, Ghorst sends an agent to survey the area.
With the location of the pages now known, Ghorst sends an agent to survey the area.

Blood Drinker thirsts. The sword has lain dormant for centuries, and so the blade has dulled - its once-golden pommel tarnished. The sword must drink, must be bathed in blood - only then will its pommel brighten and blade shine again.\n\nVlad has returned. The sword's one true owner sees it is in a sorry state and begins a campaign to quench its thirst in the blood of Sigmar's sons. Vlad has already decided on a target, he will strike where he did once before; Ostermark sits ripe and plump like a suckling pig basting over a hot fire. It is ready to be consumed...

Vlad rampages through Ostermark, yet the Elector Counts seem unfazed. News takes a while to filter through the Empire, perhaps they have only heard rumours and refuse to acknowledge Vlad's return? Either that or they do not care and look inwardly on their own squabbles.\n\nA surgical strike is needed to make the fools realise that no one is beyond von Carstein's reach!

Vlad rampages through Ostermark, yet the remnants of the Empire seem unfazed. No doubt the survivors are looking to their own needs, and see the bloodshed and destruction in far off Ostermark as simply not their problem. And so mankind sways further into the clutches of dark gods.\n\nA more surgical strike is needed to make the fools realise that no one is beyond von Carstein's reach!

Mankind has finally been shaken into acting, they are mustering forces and prepare to face the Undead legions of Vlad's design. A puppet should be despatched to seek out where this army of mortal dupes gathers.

Mankind has finally been shaken into acting, they are mustering forces and prepare to face the Undead legions of Vlad's design. A puppet should be despatched to seek out where this army of mortal dupes gathers.

The Carstein Ring has returned its master to Unlife once more. Vlad, the first Vampire Count, patriarch of the Von Carstein bloodline, is abroad and the world should tremble! However, this resurrection has proven a difficult one. The power of the ring fades, so Vlad must do something about it if he is to use its benighted abilities in future. First there are other priorities; Vlad's absence has been a long one, and his kin have been busy in the intervening centuries. They have been plotting for what Vlad feels is little gain - too interested in their own petty disputes and sibling rivalries. It is time for the first von Carstein to wrest back control from these pretenders!\n\nTo enact his grand plans, Vlad needs a companion, after all where would the Count be without his lady?

So, it is fear and blood. Vlad first feasts on those of his brethren foolish enough to outwardly oppose him, but a further show of strength is needed. Target the living flocks, those mortal few that live in the shadow of their Undead Lords. Killing them or those in neighbouring provinces will send a strong message to Vlad's enemies and bring them to heel. Let the smallfolk soil their breeches at his name!
Vampires are greedy creatures - they always want more, whether that is an immortal span, more blood, or greater power. Vlad has promised to share such resources, but first he must accrue them...

So, it is fear and blood. Vlad first feasts on those of his brethren foolish enough to outwardly oppose him, but a further show of strength is needed. Target the living flocks, those mortal few that live in the shadow of their Undead Lords. Killing them or those in neighbouring territories will send a strong message to Vlad's enemies and bring them to heel. Let the smallfolk soil their breeches at his name!

With a powerbase established and much of Sylvania back in his thrall, Vlad can restore the Carstein Ring to its former power. For this he will need Warpstone, a material craved by other noisome races and Dark Magic-users alike. Vlad is aware of a Warpstone seam deep in the Desolation of Nagash. A chunk of Morrslieb fell from the sky and struck the area many years back, scattering the area in the Chaos-infused rock. Assuming it hasn't already been mined to exhaustion, there will be more than enough for Vlad's needs.\n\nAn expedition across the World's Edge Mountains is needed to collect the Warpstone, one that Vlad plans on leading himself. To bolster this force, he summons his von Carstein sires from the catacombs, those who have been locked and left to rot within their coffins...
Vlad sends one of his agents ahead to scout the area and locate the crash site of the fallen meteor.
Vlad sends one of his agents ahead to scout the area and locate the crash site of the fallen meteor.
Valaya has wept to see such violence befall our sons. A grudge, once written, must be avenged. Find this forest-dweller, and destroy them!
Below the furious nose of Grimnir, this stinking leaf-lover has enacted a great treason against us. Kill them, and erase this grudge!
Before Grungni’s baleful sight, this Elf-scum has dared to step onto our lands. The grudge is written; throw them out, and avenge it!
column4: The Folly of the Moss Men Grudge

column3: Though Valaya is aggrieved to see it, these bark-eaters have stolen a victory from the Dawi. This slight cannot go unavenged. See to it!
Grimnir rages at the sight of these leaf-lovers raiding our lands. The grudge has been entered into the Dammaz Kron – strike it out!
column4: The Ego of the Soil Servants Grudge

column3: Furious Smednir cries out at these thicketed fools sacking our Karaks. This cannot stand, so says the Book; you must fight, and win, for the grudge!
column4: The Nuisance of the Branch Fancies Grudge

column3: As spied by a wrathful Grimnir, did the tree-hugging elgi bastards come and take our settlement. What do these gits even want with rock and metal? Get them out!
This vile and unnatural Beastman seems determined to ruin our plans. Show it the fury of the forest - destroy this blight!
What vicious schemes the Chaos Gods wish to rain upon us! Do not let them endanger Athel Loren - smite their corruption from the forest!
The diminutive mountaineer thinks to sully our plans. Show him otherwise - let him feed the Worldroots!
The haughtiness of man is apparent. Let no agent of the Empire forestall our progress. Turn them to mulch!
The enemy think we can be taken for granted! They are sorely mistaken - show them the error of their ways.
What schemes does she mean to employ against us? See that they are never brought to fruition.
What a vile, fungal nuisance this one is! Cut him down to size and stop his sneaky meddling once and for all!
The dead have no place amongst the living. Their place is in the earth, serving as mulch for the trees. See them sent below!
Cadaverous and pallid, this Undead heiress must be swiftly and surely dealt with; never again must she darken the forest!
Too monstrous for us to suffer, the master of this brayherd should not be allowed to live. Send out Athel Loren's best; deal with this slavering Beastman!
The influence of Chaos cannot be allowed to grow, lest they become any more of a threat to the forest. This Lord must fall!
Whatever dark plans this Dwarflord has for the forests, they cannot become reality. Strike him down!
This arrogant child of the Empire can no longer be suffered to live. In the name of the forest, have him killed!
This enemy threatens to make trouble. See that they never take up arms against us.
This filthy Greenskin drives his disgusting forces before him. Stop them - cut the head from this fool!
What is dead can and will be put down again, along with any dark plans of conquest that may be under way! See to it.
Though cavernous and dark, this Dwarf stronghold is a good place to make camp!
These Empire settlements are ready-made for us; let us take up positions here!
This settlement is as good as any for us to use as an outpost!
Though filthy and dank, this Greenskin settlement will do well for us.
Athel Loren has been seized! Such an affront cannot stand - reclaim it, at once!
Though dingy and morose, this Undead settlement will suffice as an outpost.
Our kindred have requested that we deal with these warriors. They are the strongest of their kind - their defeat will endear us to our brothers, which is essential for our ultimate victory!
Our forest kith request we capture this place. Doing so will strengthen our bonds with them.
If we take down these fierce warriors, it will strike a terrible blow to their morale. Our potential allies ask that we do this in the name of greater friendship between us.
Potential friends have asked we take the fight to this army. Defeating them will prove our mettle beyond doubt and their gratitude will greatly endear them to us in return.
The key to better relations with our potential allies lies in raiding this territory. They have requested it of us, and by doing so our friendship will be shored-up further.
Our kinsmen have requested that we ransack their enemy's lands, swearing fealty if we succeed. Do this and we will increase our chances of their being brought completely under our rule.
This filthy Beastlord thinks he can trample our sacred territory. Bluntly put, he must be killed, and a terrible lesson taught to our opponents!
Chaos has no place amongst the civilised, and this Lord of Chaos walks our lands hitherto unchallenged. Put him to the sword, and demonstrate we are not to be crossed!
This bantam-weight warrior thinks he can march through our territory. What idle madness these Dwarfs must dream - put him to the sword!
The arrogant and aloof Karl Franz sends one of his leaders against us. Show no mercy to this interloper - strike a blow to the heart of the Empire by cutting him down.
As the seasons change, so too do the whims of fools. An enemy leader has camped too long near our lands, and so the Spring of our clemency must become the Winter of our wrath!

This filthy Greenskin leader thinks he can defile the sanctity of Athel Loren, leading his troops through our lands. Leave nothing for the carrion; destroy them all, Gork (or Mork) will recognise his own.
With every step this Undead leader takes, it corrupts and besmirches our lands with its decaying touch. Put it back in its grave once and for all!
This Beastlord is a thorn in our side; he is indeed mighty, but by felling him the glory gained will be great!
This Lord of Chaos is most formidable! Killing him will be a decisive blow to their forces but a great victory for Athel Loren!
For something so small, this Dwarf is certainly mighty! If we defeat him, we reap the glory found through the killing of a challenging opponent!
This Lord of the Empire may be arrogant, yet he remains a powerful warrior. We should bring him down lest he become more than a mere mayfly irritant.
No matter their strength, all enemies will fall before us. This foe has great skill and power, in their defeat there is great glory to be gained for Athel Loren!
Though slimy and stunted, this Greenskin warrior is nevertheless powerful. To make him little more than carrion feed would bring us many great boons.
For a mere corpse, this Vampire is surprisingly formidable. Yet the dead should remain dead, with great glory to be found in returning it to the grave.
No brayherd can stand against us. Smash these ingrates to dust!
Chaos is a blight upon the world, and one we will see destroyed utterly!
What these Dwarfs dream of in the dark and dank depths shall not be wrought upon our lands!
Haughty, arrogant Empire forces have no place here. Put them to rout, for Athel Loren!
The forests whisper its desires - that this army be brought utterly to ruin. Enact Athel Loren's will!
This infestation of Orcs and Goblins has no place on this earth - smash them into the dirt, nasty green scumbags!
These detestable Beastmen infest our lands. They must be pushed back; Athel Loren must not be defiled!
Chaos cannot be allowed to encroach upon the sanctity of Athel Loren. Push its forces back - smash them!
The pernicious Dwarfs try to sully and plunder the forests; no more! Meet them in battle and crush them further down to size!
This pretentious, bejewelled Empire army treads where it should not. Show them the error of their ways!
No army has the right to march within our sacred boundaries. They must be repelled, and learn their folly is repaid in blood.
These fungal pests were not granted permission to enter our territory, nor would they ever be. Squash them, and return purity to these glades.
The Undead shuffle into our lands in great numbers, bringing with them their corruption and filth. Shatter them and leave their bones for mulch!
No army, living or dead, can stand against the might of nature. For Athel Loren, smash these brigands!
Dwarfholds may be dingy and dark, but they contain many riches; riches that we should claim for ourselves!
The Empire may be arrogant, but their territory is wealthy. Why should they have it all, and not us?
The riches of the earth are rightfully ours. We need only march forth and claim them!
Greenskins peddle filth wherever they roam, but beneath the dirt treasures can often be found. Treasures that, despite the grime, we should seize!
The Vampires are decrepit and deceitful, but they hoard great and ancient wealth. How it would benefit us if we were to simply reach out and claim it!
column4: You Can't Take It With You

column3: Athel Loren is threatened, so sound the call - bring more warriors to her defence. Recruit more!
What the Dwarfs have, we shall take by force. Burn their Holds, and take their treasures by force!
What mighty towers the Empire constructs! Such affronts to nature should be toppled for their arrogance - see it done!
The Council has decided, in its wisdom, that this settlement has no right to exist further. See it brought low, for the good of Athel Loren!
They pile their filth high and call it a settlement. It is nothing more than heaps of dung, and dung burns SO well…
Nothing kills the Undead better than fire, which makes this settlement little more than a glorified funeral pyre. Provide the match.
The Branchwraiths are powerful, if twisted, additions to any forest defence force. Athel Loren requires more of them - see it done!
The Waystalkers are the most keen, determined scouts in all of Athel Loren. Bring more of them into our ranks, to give us an edge over our enemies.
The Spellsingers, elegant and deadly, number too few among our ranks. See this remedied, that they may bring their beautiful ways of death to the battlefield!
Without cavalry, we are at a severe disadvantage - at risk of being outflanked and charged to devastating effect! We must field more to guard the edge!
column4: To Steed or Not to Steed…

column3: Melee infantry are the spine of any good army, and we are severely lacking in their regard. We must field more to create a strong central core within our forces!

We are the warriors of Athel Loren, we strike from afar and with deadly precision. However, our armies are lacking in archers and scouts - recruit more, and they will surely give us the edge we require.
Without monsters to field, our forces lack the same punch as those of our rivals. We should field some huge creatures as to terrify our enemies!
The Beastmen rise from their forests and their filth, frothing over with fury at the 'civilisation' of man. They clamour for blood.
From afar, the Beastmen watch the cities of man with a baleful gaze, longing to tear apart that which they so detest. And so it comes to pass.
With splintering roars, the great throng of Beastmen descend upon the world of men. With much clamour, and a singular hatred, they charge and do not cease.
Every tower, every gatehouse, every thatched home is an affront to the Beastmen's very essence. With fire, brawn and rage, the unending herds will see it all destroyed.
The land burns, the seas boil, the world cracks and blooms into destruction. The Beastmen, bloody-handed, see this, and know that it is right.
column4: Chapter V: The Tree of Wrath

column3: At the centre of the realms of Athel Loren lies the Oak of Ages, beating heart of the forest and the sacred shrine of the Asrai. From the mighty Oak, life flows into the forest and through the world.
From the Oak of Ages, Orion is reborn each year. The Oak gives life to the King of the Asrai, and he in turns gives purpose to his Elvish subjects.
column4: Chapter II: The Oak of Oaks

column3: The Wood Elves believe their fate, and that of Athel Loren, to be intrinsically linked to the Oak of Ages. Many have tried to despoil it, and for eons many have failed. If - gods forbid - the Oak should fall, so too would the forest itself.
column4: Chapter III: What Grows Beneath Mighty Boughs

column3: It is said that no artefact forged by the mortals of the world can match the magical power of but a single acorn from the Oak of Ages. When the Winds of Magic blow strong through Athel Loren, the Oak of Ages radiates with an otherworldly power.
column4: Chapter IV: Great Things Grow Greater

column3: At the centre of the realms of Athel Loren lies the Oak of Ages, beating heart of the forest and the sacred shrine of the Asrai. From the mighty Oak, life flows into the forest and through the world.
From the Oak of Ages, Orion is reborn each year. The Oak gives life to the King of the Asrai, and he in turns gives purpose to his Elvish subjects.
column4: Chapter II: The Oak of Oaks

column3: The Wood Elves believe their fate, and that of Athel Loren, to be intrinsically linked to the Oak of Ages. Many have tried to despoil it, and for eons many have failed. If - gods forbid - the Oak should fall, so too would the forest itself.
column4: Chapter III: What Grows Beneath Mighty Boughs

column3: It is said that no artefact forged by the mortals of the world can match the magical power of but a single acorn from the Oak of Ages. When the Winds of Magic blow strong through Athel Loren, the Oak of Ages radiates with an otherworldly power.
column4: Chapter IV: Great Things Grow Greater

column3: Wherever Morghur treads, Chaos follows with him. A dark tide of ravening madness and mutagenic power swirls around Morghur, corrupting and changing all those around him - friend and foe alike. This power, however, is beyond the control of Morghur even - to contain the swirling essence of Chaos that trails the Master of Skulls is beyond the capability of any mortal container. For this essence to be caught, and harnessed, something more... immortal is required. Such vessels are not made easily; they require macabre and difficult to obtain materials, but needs must.\n\nYou must start with the spines of the Orcs.

Greenskin spines are seemingly difficult to come by these days, as their kind has been almost eradicated. Yet no matter, Morghur has his ways, and there are always alternatives, particularly as the Greenskins are so-often spineless in their behaviour. The price must instead by paid in souls - a great number of souls. To this end, Morghur must... harvest them.

Defeating the Greenskins was not the difficult part - that was removing the spine in one piece from their bodies. Nevertheless, Morghur now stands over the emptied corpses of a dozen felled Orcs, their spinal cords stored safely away. His attention turns now, in crazed and macabre bloodlust, to the Dwarfs. Their stern and thick craniums will be the next important part of the ritual. As many as can be obtained must be, and as fast as possible!

The Dwarfen skulls are of great importance to the ritual. Yet thick and hardy as they are, the innate Dwarfen inability to channel the Winds of Magic leaves them at a significant disadvantage. The leaves rustle and the trees themselves seem to shiver as Morghur unveils the final part of his plan: the Wood Elves. The Asrai and their forests are steeped in magic, old as the world itself. A Waystone, thieved from deep within the sanctuary forests of Athel Loren, will be more than sufficient to sate Morghur's desires. Let none of the Elves or Treekin stand in your way - cut them down in the name of this quest!

The insidious Elves are never far behind; the forests speak to them and reveal all the secrets that lie beneath the canopy. Ariel is no fool either, she knows Morghur better than any of his enemies, and has tracked him down. In her stead, she sends a champion, at the head of an Asrai host, to put an end to Morghur's dreams of destruction and return Athel Loren to 'peace'. This is but a fleeting hope, however, for Morghur will not suffer these forest folk to interrupt his desires. This champion will be eviscerated and returned to Ariel in a dozen Ruinous pieces, each more garishly transformed than the last.

With the required items in his possession, Morghur can begin his ritual. But not here, not amongst all this… normality. He must return to his lair, where he can be alone amongst his twisted creations. Within this dank and unknowable cavern, Morghur's physical form is hewn from countless gifts and boons from the Ruinous Powers, coalesced together to create the Master of Skulls. It is here that he will capture the essence of Chaos and make it his own.

With the required items in his possession, Morghur can begin his ritual. But not here, not amongst all this… normality. He must return to his lair, where he can be alone amongst his twisted creations. Within this dank and unknowable cavern, Morghur's physical form is hewn from countless gifts and boons from the Ruinous Powers, coalesced together to create the Master of Skulls. It is here that he will capture the essence of Chaos and make it his own.

Eventually, Durthu and his retinue burst into a copse to find a battle fully joined! The Glade Scouts of Athel Loren pitch themselves desperately against hordes of Undead, who rive and shift at them in seemingly-endless waves. Though Durthu has no love for any but those embodied by the forest spirits, he knows the Undead are the greatest scourge and must be purged immediately!

Durthu had suspected the hand of the Necromancer Heinrich Kemmler, but instead his nefarious student was behind the Undead horde. The damp and pallid hallmarks of Kemmler are all over his protégé's work as he advances on the forest with his desiccated horde in tow. The forest must be protected, and Durthu will give no quarter in its defence. Let these dark and twisted fiends feel the full wrath of the Deepwood, with the wrathful Ancient as its instrument of war!

A great horde of Beastmen besiege the Oak of Ages! There are brayherds present from every corner of the Old World; Morghur has summoned to him the Dark Omen, Malagor, and even Khazrak the One-Eye is said to be stalking the field. The Beastmen are drawn here to enact a final, bitter blow against the roots of life itself. Should they succeed, all will be plunged into a hell beyond reckoning and without end. They must be stopped before they bring this land to Ruin. Defend the Oak; defend the Old World!

So it has come to this. Morghur has thrown an almost endless torrent of Beastmen at the Wood Elves, yet they have pushed back the tide. Now the Shadowgave makes one final gambit - a push for the Silver Spire itself, intent on poisoning the water supply that nurtures so much of the land and leaving it for dead. He cannot be allowed to succeed. Yet Morghur has dark and twisted schemes that make him extremely difficult to kill - the Asrai must watch carefully and use their superior Elven intelligence to overwhelm his trickery. Hold fast against these desperate beasts, see the day won and the Old World saved!

It is clear now that the Glade Lord has been deceived by Slaanesh; the temptation of power and pleasure was far too corrupting. They have fallen to Chaos, and now the dreaming woods - Athel Caiellin - call. They cannot be allowed to enter that realm of terror and malice with the Cloak of Isha. It must be secured and, for both their own sake and that of the realm, the Glade Lord and retinue must be put to the sword. The forest watches with fearful anticipation; the Night Glens seem to grow darker as the hour of battle approaches. Orion knows he cannot flinch, and that everything he does, he does in the defence of his realm.

With a zeal that could inspire any being, Orion breaks into the clearing and blasts the Horn of the Wild Hunt. With a crack of lightning, and the scream of several displaced spirits, the magical aura is purged, and the beast-path revealed. However, the Horn is entirely drained of energy, if only temporarily. Orion is unconcerned, however, as with the passage open, the moment of his revenge is at hand. Rallying the Wood Elves to his side, he pushes onwards to find Morghur and sate his bloodlust. As the Elves edge forward, the path closes in around them and the moment of battle draws near...

Orion and his forces rush to the defence of the Oak of Ages, and find the sole surviving warrior of the feast at the head of the rebel army - a traitor through-and-through. They explains how they were chosen by Anath Raema to be her champion. Having infiltrated the Oak of Ages, Anath Raema - Goddess of the Savage Hunt - planned to supplant Ariel and ascend to an Athel Loren shaped by her malicious desires. Orion's final act must be to destroy this Glade Lord and put Anath Raema's destructive desires to the sword once and for all.

The forests of Athel Loren once again bloom into majesty, yet all is not well within the woods. Durthu wakes; once wise and kind, he is now twisted by ages of war and destruction beyond counting. His rage is limitless, his sorrow unbound. He exists now to protect the Deepwood against any and all interlopers and blackguards. He can sense them, swarming and encroaching upon its bounds. No tactless fool can be suffered to besmirch the sanctity of the forests. They must be crushed; they must ALL be crushed.

Though the interlopers have been extricated from the branches and brambles of the Deepwood, and now lie battered and bloodied across the marshes, their foul stench of decay and corruption lingers in the trees. Returning to the glade, Durthu is greeted only by haunted memories and perished spirits of his past. His sorrow and rage are tempered only by his understanding that something is terribly wrong within the Deepwood. There can be no delaying; he summons his loyal Treekin to him, intent on discovering the truth behind the forest's ailment.

Durthu and his kin delve deeper into the forest, led by a growing sense of darkness and half-heard screams. As he continues exploring, the light filtering desperately through the canopy far above him, the screams and sounds of battle grow ever louder. As he marches further on, the restricting miasma of corruption and dread seeps into every pore of the forest, seeming almost to exude from the trees themselves. With increasing haste, Durthu pushes on...

With Durthu's help, the Glade Guard scouts emerge victorious; the battlefield is littered with scattered limbs and Undead detritus. Though afeared of the lumbering, vengeful Ancient of the forest, the Guard nevertheless tell him that this force was but a fraction of a larger, more dangerous Undead horde that lurks not far from here. They advise caution and to wait for further Elven reinforcements, but Durthu knows better than these Asrai. Yet they cannot be wholly blamed for their ignorance - their lives are so fleeting compared to his; he has observed this a thousand times before and undoubtedly will a thousand more. No, there will be no waiting. He will move now, and strike this threat at the source - the Necromancer behind this will die, and his stumbling thralls will collapse like abandoned marionettes.

With Durthu's help, the Glade Guard scouts emerge victorious; the battlefield is littered with scattered limbs and Undead detritus. Though afeared of the lumbering, vengeful Ancient of the forest, the Guard nevertheless tell him that this force was but a fraction of a larger, more dangerous Undead horde that lurks not far from here. They advise caution and to wait for further Elven reinforcements, but Durthu knows better than these Asrai. Yet they cannot be wholly blamed for their ignorance - their lives are so fleeting compared to his; he has observed this a thousand times before and undoubtedly will a thousand more. No, there will be no waiting. He will move now, and strike this threat at the source - the Necromancer behind this will die, and his stumbling thralls will collapse like abandoned marionettes.

The High Realm of the Wood Elves, Modryn, has long languished in eternal shadow. No light pierces the dense canopy above, yet even in a land as darkened as this, a new and creeping sense of dread lingers. The Cloak of Isha, much revered relic of the goddess herself, is missing - presumed stolen. The Elves speak of dark omens and shadowy whispers pervading the Night Glens, and even Ariel herself feels the changing of the forest as surely as she feels the shifting of the season. The cloak must be returned and Athel Loren restored. To this end, she dispatches her consort-King, Orion, to lead the hunt. She also sends her most trusted of maidens, who know the forests almost as well as she does, to assist him. Together, they will find the source of this trouble. Indeed, they must, for all hangs in the balance...

Nothing in Athel Loren escapes the notice of the Sisters of Thorn. They hear the whispers in the glades, the birdsong in the canopies, and everything in between. Before long, the Sisters locate a message bound for Modryn, and pluck it from its destination with the delicate hand of fate. The letter is most certainly alien to these parts; written and sealed with all manner of foul and forbidden glyphs and mannerisms. It undoubtedly belongs to the Cult of Pleasure; the worshippers of Slaanesh. The message speaks of their prowling of Athel Loren's glades, but nobody can know exactly where. Orion's rage is great. He is moments away from ordering the destruction of the glade, in order to find the interlopers, when the Sisters present an alternate plan. The letter hails from Bretonnia, tracing its source would enable its destination to be ascertained and much destruction avoided. After all, the devastation of Bretonnian lands is much preferable to that of Athel Loren.

Much Bretonnian land is burned in the name of the truth, and Orion watches dispassionately as field after field is torched as part of his investigation. Eventually, in a mansion belonging to a 'Krueger', his scouts discover an unsent letter hidden in a secret chamber, addressed to a Glade Lord. If the letter is to be believed, the Cloak of Isha is to be given to the Cult of Pleasure in exchange for the Mark of Slaanesh. Orion is incensed; a Glade Lord, sworn to the defence of Athel Loren, plots against the forest and plans to usurp it! There is no time to waste, haste must be made back to the forest to confront this errant and treacherous Lord before it is too late!

Much Bretonnian land is burned in the name of the truth, and Orion watches dispassionately as field after field is torched as part of his investigation. Eventually, in a mansion belonging to a 'Krueger', his scouts discover an unsent letter hidden in a secret chamber, addressed to a Glade Lord. If the letter is to be believed, the Cloak of Isha is to be given to the Cult of Pleasure in exchange for the Mark of Slaanesh. Orion is incensed; a Glade Lord, sworn to the defence of Athel Loren, plots against the forest and plans to usurp it! There is no time to waste, haste must be made back to the forest to confront this errant and treacherous Lord before it is too late!

Dark news reaches the court of Athel Loren; shadows loom on the outskirts of the forest, and the Waystone fence is threatened. Outposts beyond the perimeter have not been heard from in many moons and are presumed lost, down to the last. Although Orion sped there with the wind at his back he found no evidence of who or what was responsible. Although the desire for revenge runs deep, he knows there can be no offensive against his enemies whilst Athel Loren lies vulnerable; the defences must be rebuilt before any vengeance can be taken. To the battlements!

With the perimeters of the forest secured, a relative sense of normality is restored to the forest. However, foulness still lurks beneath the trees, and Orion will see the source of it uncovered and eliminated. Reports reach the king that a herd of Beastmen, using the confusion sown by the attacks, slipped through the perimeter and defiled another Waystone. Before he could intercept them, however, they used their hidden beast-paths to slink back into the undergrowth and, with all the subtlety they could muster, out of sight. However, Orion and his scouts detected the foul and pestilent aura of Dark Magic at the site of the Beastman raid - an aura that could belong to only one Beastman that Orion knows of: Morghur. As ill an omen as it is that the Master of Skulls is abroad, the lingering magical detritus provides an opportunity. If it can be analysed then it can be traced, and the enemies of the Elves can be brought to justice. To do this, however, the Spellsingers must be consulted...

The Spellsingers are mystical and arcane beings, and Orion does not profess to understand even half of what they do, yet he knows he must be patient as they do it. After days of pondering, enchanting and researching, the Spellsingers emerge, and present Orion with an ancient artefact, imbued with the essence of starwood pyre; the Horn of the Wild Hunt, Orion's treasured relic. A sharp blast will dispel the magical residue left behind by Morghur's minions and reveal the path back to his location. Orion is overjoyed, the burning desire for vengeance bubbling up in him as the moment of justice grows nearer. As if guided by the hand of fate itself, a report reaches him that another raid is taking place. Seizing his chance, he bounds off into the forest, the Horn in hand and his retinue close behind.

The Spellsingers are mystical and arcane beings, and Orion does not profess to understand even half of what they do, yet he knows he must be patient as they do it. After days of pondering, enchanting and researching, the Spellsingers emerge, and present Orion with an ancient artefact, imbued with the essence of starwood pyre; the Horn of the Wild Hunt, Orion's treasured relic. A sharp blast will dispel the magical residue left behind by Morghur's minions and reveal the path back to his location. Orion is overjoyed, the burning desire for vengeance bubbling up in him as the moment of justice grows nearer. As if guided by the hand of fate itself, a report reaches him that another raid is taking place. Seizing his chance, he bounds off into the forest, the Horn in hand and his retinue close behind.

Time marches ever onwards, Winter grows ever closer and with it the time of Orion's return to the Oak of Ages, and to renewal. The Wild Riders are charged with the sacred task of seeking out a new host to meet with Ariel. If she finds their choice to be appropriate, she will forge him into the new Orion, who will emerge from the Oak of Ages the following Spring. For this, the most sacred of hunts, the Wild Riders must be called and readied.

The Wild Riders have searched far and wide, returning with a number of young warriors they feel may please Ariel. Yet the Queen of Athel Loren demands, as ever, that all candidates be tested; put through a crucible of endurance to see who is most worthy. She sends them into the field to fight for the honour of her attention, yet knows others have a more sinister desire. Not all suitors can be trusted, and not all have altruism in their hearts - there are those who would see Orion reborn to their liking, for their own purposes. These evils must be rooted out and defeated, lest they send Athel Loren down the path of ruin.

The suitors of Ariel return, battered but victorious, proud of their achievements in the field and eager to see if they will be chosen for rebirth as King in the Woods. Yet there are forces of darkness that would see this path curtailed all too quickly. A poison, vicious and cloying, flows through the candidates by means of tainted chalices. By morning, they are all as cold as winter's breath. All except one, who has vanished without trace. Athel Loren is in uproar; fear sets in like a deep chill, which shatters into panic when a rebel force reveals itself, advancing on the Oak of Ages. Enraged and alarmed, Orion rushes back to defend the Oak. Even as he feels his strength sapping away, he knows he must do this one last thing...

The suitors of Ariel return, battered but victorious, proud of their achievements in the field and eager to see if they will be chosen for rebirth as King in the Woods. Yet there are forces of darkness that would see this path curtailed all too quickly. A poison, vicious and cloying, flows through the candidates by means of tainted chalices. By morning, they are all as cold as winter's breath. All except one, who has vanished without trace. Athel Loren is in uproar; fear sets in like a deep chill, which shatters into panic when a rebel force reveals itself, advancing on the Oak of Ages. Enraged and alarmed, Orion rushes back to defend the Oak. Even as he feels his strength sapping away, he knows he must do this one last thing...

Belegar Ironhammer has made bold oaths to reclaim his lost kingdom. The fabled treasures of this legendary fortress should be returned to honest, noble Dawi hands. It is said that King Lunn himself sealed away the mighty hammer of the Angrund Clan and only a true heir shall reclaim it. Among Belegar's many oaths is a pledge to seek out the legendary hammer, but first the area must be purged of Greenskin filth so the search may begin unimpeded!

Belegar Ironhammer has made bold oaths to reclaim his lost kingdom. The fabled treasures of this legendary fortress should be returned to honest, noble Dawi hands. It is said that King Lunn himself sealed away the mighty hammer of the Angrund Clan and only a true heir shall reclaim it. Among Belegar's many oaths is a pledge to seek out the legendary hammer, but the first the area must be purged of foes so the search may begin unimpeded!

The path towards King Lunn's lost vault is cluttered with urks and other degenerate creatures. Belegar and his kin must rebuild the former glories of his Ancestors, Hold by Hold, using the bodies and blood of the hated Greenskins as their foundations!

One of Belegar's doubters was the High King. Thorgrim wanted Eight Peaks back within the Karaz Ankor as much as any Dwarf, but thought the cost in kin and resources too high at this point. Yet Belegar's expedition and the tenacity of the Angrund Clan has impressed the High King. He sends a request to Karak Azul that their Angrund brothers be aided with stalwart Dwarf war machines.

Thorek Ironbrow, the Master Runelord of Karak Azul, is as impressed with Ironhammer's progress as the High King is, and while the war machines from Azul's forges would no doubt be a boon in the wars to come, Thorek wants to do more to aid his kin. He reveals the location of the vault’s secret door to Belegar; King Lunn’s hammer will be in its rightful owner’s hands again soon enough.

Thorek Ironbrow, the Master Runelord of Karak Azul, is as impressed with Ironhammer's progress as the High King is, and while the war machines from Azul's forges would no doubt be a boon in the wars to come, Thorek wants to do more to aid his kin. He reveals the location of the vault’s secret door to Belegar; King Lunn’s hammer will be in its rightful owner’s hands again soon enough.

The Dwarfs of the Angrund Clan have a special hatred of urki and grobi, even more so than other Dawi, for it was the Greenskins -along with fell underground allies - that drove the descendants of King Lunn from Karak Eight Peaks, a Greathold whose majesty was eclipsed only by Everpeak itself. The entire Angrund Clan can trace their lineage back to King Lunn and all become outraged at the thought of those dark times.\n\nKing Belegar Ironhammer lives with this rage on a daily basis. He is the True King of Eight Peaks and his Clan's goal is to inhabit their mighty Dwarfhold once more. Even now, wherever Ironhammer holes up, trouble with the Greenskins seems to follow. Since the Chaos Moon arose, weeks prior, the raids have dramatically increased. It is not just Skarsnik's minions alone that attack - a new green-skinned enemy has entered the fray. Belegar orders his throng forth, as it is better to meet this fresh threat head on than hide meekly behind the barricades.

This should be a time of great celebration throughout the Karaz Ankor, for the urki and grobi have been scattered, their tribes have been broken and the World's Edge Mountains are free of their taint and ripe for reclamation by Dawi hands.\n\nYet for the Dwarfs of Clan Angrund, led by Belegar Ironhammer, Ancestor of King Lunn, there seems to be no respite. No matter how many times the Greenskins are crushed they seem to emerge again from under their fetid rocks. There have been reports of Greenskin activity on Death Pass and the Silver Road. If Belegar's throngs control these important trade routes, further investigation on where the urks are skulking could be undertaken.

These Greenskin attacks are different to those Ironhammer has witnessed in his countless years fighting the urks. They seem more disciplined and better equipped than even Skarsnik's rabble. Answers must be sought. Belegar tasks one of his most trusted champions to hunt down, interrogate and then slay one of the Greenskin bosses. Any information this agent gleans will help counter the Greenskin threat.

Belegar's champion returns with a trove of information. An Orc Warboss had taken Dawi he had found imprisoned deep under Black Crag and all but forgotten by their jailer, Gorfang Rotgut. The Warboss stole away the Dwarfs and, under enslavement, forced them to dig new passages within the Underway, secret to all but his own rabble of filthy Orcs.\n\nBelegar is outraged! He at once recognises the captive Dawi as kin - fine folk taken from Karak Azul in a raid years past. This is a fell deed that demands vengeance! However, Ironhammer knows it is not a grudge he can right on its own; King Kazador of Karak Azul still broods on this outrage and so must be informed at once. Dwarf tradition states that news of such great import be given with a surety - a bond between kings - so that no Dawi could doubt its severity. Belegar doesn't hesitate and sends his shield as his oath.

Belegar's champion returns with a trove of information. An Orc Warboss had taken Dawi he had found imprisoned deep under Black Crag and all but forgotten by their jailer, Gorfang Rotgut. The Warboss stole away the Dwarfs and, under enslavement, forced them to dig new passages within the Underway, secret to all but his own rabble of filthy Orcs.\n\nBelegar is outraged! He at once recognises the captive Dawi as kin - fine folk taken from Karak Azul in a raid years past. This is a fell deed that demands vengeance! However, Ironhammer knows it is not a grudge he can right on its own; King Kazador of Karak Azul still broods on this outrage and so must be informed at once. Dwarf tradition states that news of such great import be given with a surety - a bond between kings - so that no Dawi could doubt its severity. Belegar doesn't hesitate and sends his shield as his oath.

It is said that there is a whole chapter in the Dammaz Kron on Skarsnik, the self-proclaimed Warlord of the Eight Peaks. Both the Dwarfs and the Skaven despise him, and yet none doubt his supremacy over the region. The fact he has achieved such an iron grip, although merely a Night Goblin and not some brutal Orc, says more about his malign intelligence than any chapter in some stunties' silly book!\n\nDwarfs are stubborn, but even that fat fool at Everpeak at least acknowledges that the Eight Peaks are lost. Yet the Angrund Clan refuse to accept the status quo - they deny the truth, that their ancestral home is beyond their meagre, stunted grasp. Even now they are set on another foolish attempt to wrest control from Skarsnik! However, nothing escapes the eyes and ears of the Warlord. News of a fresh expedition quickly reaches him and in his unusually astute Greenskin brain another wicked plan is formulated. To begin, Skarsnik will send this new throng his personal ‘greetings’...

It is said that there is a whole chapter in the Dammaz Kron on Skarsnik, the self-proclaimed Warlord of the Eight Peaks. Both the Dwarfs and the Skaven despise him, and yet none doubt his supremacy over the region. The fact he has achieved such an iron grip, although merely a Night Goblin and not some brutal Orc, says more about his malign intelligence than any chapter in some stunties' silly book!\n\nThe Angrund Clan is no more. However, that doesn’t mean Skarsnik can sit safely on his throne of rat skulls. Many covet the lost valuables buried deep in the ancient Dwarf citadel. However, nothing escapes the eyes and ears of the Warlord. News of an enemy treasure-seeking expedition quickly reaches him and a wicked plan begins to form within the chief gobbo’s mind. For starters, Skarsnik will send his regards to the homelands of those who seek to steal from his domain!

While the stunties are distracted by the loss of their pathetic Lord, Skarsnik's forces storm through the Peaks, raiding and destroying anything in sight. This is Skarsnik’s way, a method tempered through years of dealing with the power-hungry Orcs that have tried to take his throne: perceive the threat and then utterly destroy the foe before it can act against you!

Whether the Karaz Ankor functions or not, no Dwarf could sit idle while Skarsnik’s hordes raided across the mountains. Valaya would weep tears of blood if such a thing was left unchallenged, and so the Dwarfs, or their remnants, muster.\n\nOf course, this was what Skarsnik desired all along. It is but another of his ‘sneaky schemes’. By cunning placement of his gobbo scouts, the stunties are lured to Death Pass, where the bulk of his horde lies in wait to ambush them. All that is needed now is the appearance of the Warlord himself!

Well that was exhausting! It was a sight to warm Skarsnik's rotten heart - to see the Dwarfs scatter with their beards between their little legs! However, the Goblin boss can't help brood - how can he impose his will if an Orc has a better reach? Maybe he needs a long stick like those wizards always carry around with them? While he ponders on the problem, his best 'recruiterz' are sent to bolster the horde, as a few were killed during the fight. The Warlord demands they be replaced by 'somefing arder dan Orcs'.

The Dwarfs are returning - the fools want another go and don't know when they're beaten! This gives the Warlord another idea, he takes a wicked-lookin' halberd from his pile of shiny stuff. It may have belonged to a humie wizard or one of them long-eared gits - he cares not. Skarsnik summons Kruggler, his most 'trusted' hench-gobbo, and orders him to the battlefield before the Dwarfs' second attack. There he must smear the new 'prodder' in the spent blood of the stunties littering the ground. Skarsnik will follow with an army and collect his new extra pointy, extra nasty prodder after the fight!

The Dwarfs are returning - the fools want another go and don't know when they're beaten! This gives the Warlord another idea, he takes a wicked-lookin' halberd from his pile of shiny stuff. It may have belonged to a humie wizard or one of them long-eared gits - he cares not. Skarsnik summons Kruggler, his most 'trusted' hench-gobbo, and orders him to the battlefield before the Dwarfs' second attack. There he must smear the new 'prodder' in the spent blood of the stunties littering the ground. Skarsnik will follow with an army and collect his new extra pointy, extra nasty prodder after the fight!

The Badlands have always been, well… bad. In the past, it was a realm of several dark and doomed empires, but now it is an arid backwater dominated by the Greenskins. The Orcs and Goblins thrive in this forsaken place. It was the birthplace of many a Waaagh! that has gone on to devastate Dwarf and humie kingdoms alike. While a Waaagh! can occur ‘naturally’ sometimes these things need a catalyst. For years, that catalyst has been Wurrzag, 'Da Great Green Prophet'. \n\nHowever, word has reached the Savage Orc Shaman that some gobbo in the south is claiming to be the new prophet, denouncing Wurrzag as an "air-a-tick" and "pretenda"!
