If he is to cause maximum terror while on the search for his crown, Throgg must have them in his army ranks before setting off.

With his horrific entourage complete, the Troll King is ready to trample the civilised realms into a bloody pulp in search for his prized crown. Very few men have faced him and not ended up as one of his meals, but now Throgg can show the rest of their frail race that Wintertooth is not just a myth witnessed by foolish dead heroes! Throgg chuckles to himself – he is looking forward to ruling over the man-cattle of the Empire, and surely these cowards were the ones who had taken his crown, or at least knew who did. He will bring a blizzard of death and destruction to the very hearts of their villages and towns, leaving no stone unturned in search of his prize!

Throgg tore through the villages and towns of men with ruthless ease. His travelling horde of monsters revelled in the pillaging of the arrogant Empire-men’s settlements, whose greatness was now swiftly fading. The Troll King was glad to satisfy his hunger for man-flesh, which he did several times over. But still his prized crown eluded him.

As he contented himself in the gleeful dismemberment of captured soldiers to snack on later, one of the doomed individuals begging for his life tells him of a vast Dwarf convoy travelling from Karak Kadrin that had been seen on the move nearby. It was allegedly carrying with it great riches, but more interestingly, in the convoy’s ranks was a particular Runelord known to be an infamous hoarder of treasures. Undoubtedly, this convoy was as good a place as any for Throgg to continue the search for his crown.

Throgg gobbles the informant up whole and spits out his bones before calling on his force to march on Peak Pass. Throgg had dealt with Dwarfs before, and knows that by raiding Dwarf lands there is a good chance of finding out what route the convoy would be taking.

Throgg is no ordinary Troll. Although as brutal and savage as all others, he also has a grim and malevolent cunning which has made him widely feared across the Old World. Proclaiming himself the King of Trolls, great heroes regularly ride northwards to attempt to slay him. And every season, Throgg dines on their flesh.

Recently he became infuriated that he was missing his prized Wintertooth Crown, so headed southward into civilised lands, tearing through the villages and towns in search of it. He was unable to find any leads until he heard of a vast Dwarf convoy travelling from Karak Kadrin that had been seen moving towards Peak Pass. Within its ranks was one particular Runelord known to be an infamous hoarder of treasures. The Troll King decided that this convoy was as good a place as any to continue the search for his crown.

Throgg now calls upon his force to march on Peak Pass. By raiding Dwarf lands, there is a good chance of finding out the convoy’s location.

Throgg now knows for sure that his destiny – his path to becoming the overlord of the entire Old World – is unfolding before him. His scouts tell him that the convoy has been spotted nearby, and that the thieving Runelord in its ranks does in fact have Throgg’s prized Wintertooth Crown in his possession! Frothing at the mouth in both anger and excitement, Throgg sputters a war cry at his horde to move out, and swiftly. He will eat this thief slowly and painfully, piece by piece, and take back what is rightfully his!\n\nAs they catch up to the convoy, Throgg sees that the Dwarfs have not been caught off-guard and are expecting him, so an ambush is not possible. They have already taken up a defensive position at a small chokepoint in the road. Best be quick – this is Dwarf heartland after all.

Wulfrik is a cursed individual, for he is the ever-restless Eternal Challenger. Also known as the Worldwalker, he is forever compelled by the Dark Gods to wander the Old World in search of worthy opponents to fight to the death. Every Hero, champion, and monster who has heard the utterance of his undeniable challenge so far has fallen defeated before him, with their skulls taken as his trophies. And still, Wulfrik’s burning desire to engage in murderous single combat always remains unsated.

As they had so often done in the past, the Gods send Wulfrik a vision. In his dreams he sees the petty kingdom of men known as Bretonnia, where he glimpses a great and lauded hero atop a mighty charger, rescuing the weak and punishing the wicked. To Wulfrik’s delight, his vision shows the horseman to be completely drenched in blood – a sign that this formidable warrior is undoubtedly his next quarry. Such is this opponent’s worth, that Wulfrik anticipates the most glorious of duels culminating in his victory and a murderous offering that cannot go unnoticed by the Gods.

To draw the great hero out, Wulfrik must first have his warband raid and despoil in Bretonnia itself, by wreaking havoc and spilling the blood of innocents. Only the fiercest and most bloodthirsty of Norscan Marauders would be suitable for such work.

Wulfrik gazes out at the twisted men and brutish beasts of his raiding party with a wry smile. It is truly a terrifying force of bloodthirsty killers, some of whom had already accompanied him across the world countless times before. All of them, however, have qualities that the great Norscan Worldwalker demands of all his followers – an inclination to perpetually murder and raid, and the dedication to loyally march with him as he seeks his challenges. With his warband now sufficiently bolstered with the deadliest killers in Norsca, it is time for him to set sail for the 'land of chivalry’.

Having arrived on Bretonnian soil, Wulfrik needs to gather the scent of his prey and draw him out of hiding. He knows that by ruthlessly and mercilessly pillaging the lands surrounding Bretonnia’s capital, he will have a good chance of attracting the horseman's attention. If he is as chivalrous and honourable as Wulfrik’s dreams had portrayed him to be, this warrior could surely not ignore such atrocities committed against his countrymen. Or if that doesn’t work, Wulfrik’s raiding party should at least be able to torture some useful information out of some poor peasant wretches! Wulfrik must now raise the raiding banner and begin a campaign of wicked despoilment.

To Wulfrik’s frustration, his raiding foray has not been enough to draw the hero out, at least up to now. But as he skewers peasant after peasant at one of Couronne’s sacked farm estates, he stumbles upon a stroke of luck, as if placed before him by the Dark Gods themselves. One of the prisoners about to be painfully impaled hastily blurts out the existence of a small keep further down the coast in Lyonesse, which he swears will be of great interest to the giant warrior. With Wulfrik agreeing to spare him in return for more information, the peasant goes on to mention that this is no ordinary keep – it contains the remains of a long-dead Bretonnian King considered to be some of the holiest relics in the Kingdom, as well as a trove of precious jewels and other stately heirlooms of immeasurable value.\n\nWith quick perpendicular swipes of his massive sword, Wulfrik quarters the peasant into a bloody four-part mess before calling on his warband to immediately march south to the site of the keep. By attacking it, Wulfrik will surely get the great duel he so craves; it is inevitable!

Wulfrik is the ever-restless Eternal Challenger, forever compelled by the Dark Gods to wander the Old World in search of worthy opponents to fight to the death. Every hero, champion, and monster who has heard the utterance of his undeniable challenge has fallen defeated before him with their skulls taken as his trophies. And still, Wulfrik’s burning desire to engage in murderous single combat always remains unsated.

Recently, the Gods sent Wulfrik a vision in which he glimpsed a great and lauded Bretonnian hero atop a mighty charger. The horseman of Wulfrik’s dream was drenched in blood, a sign that he was the next quarry. Leading his army southward, Wulfrik viciously raided the lands of Bretonnia's capital in an effort to draw the hero out, but he did not appear. He then learnt of a small keep in Lyonesse which contains holy relics, precious treasures, and stately heirlooms, all of which are of great importance to the Bretonnian Kingdom.

Seeing the opportunity, Wulfrik calls on his warband to immediately march south towards the venerated keep to attack it. The hero is yet to show himself, but Wulfrik will get his duel one way or another!

The keep in Lyonesse is likely to be heavily defended, but will surely yield considerable riches, enough to fuel Wulfrik's plundering warband for the many more sorties to come. More importantly, desecrating a site of such importance to Bretonnia will undoubtedly attract their toughest champions, and he expects one of them to be the horseman of his visions - the one he seeks to fight. It must be! Only by fulfilling the demands of his masters can Wulfrik be granted the dark rewards of power which he craves far more than mere material wealth. He raises his sword and the raiding banner once more. Let the slaughter commence!

When Thorgrim declared the new Age of Retribution, his intention was that it would be founded on a new, renewed spirit of co-operation between the remaining Dwarfholds. For too long have the Dwarfs been weakened by often bloody grudge-feuds between their kings. As High King, Thorgrim will put a stop to this, even if his axe must do the talking!

The power of the Dwarfs grows. Many long-harboured grudges have been settled and a spirit of co-operation between the Holds has given new vigour to Thorgrim’s plans. In days of yore, the Dwarfs wandered throughout the Old World, seeking new lodes of the ores they prize. New Holds were founded, from the Grey Mountains in the west to the Mountains of Mourn in the east, from the Dragonback Mountains in the south to the ice-locked peaks of Norsca in the north. Then came the Time of Woes, when a series of disasters led to the fall of countless Holds and the sons of Grungni found themselves penned into their remaining Karaks. With the reclamation of the World's Edge Mountains under way, Thorgrim’s thoughts turn northwards to the once-mighty Hold of Kraka Drak in Norsca. If the Norscan Dwarfs have endured the Time of Woes and Kraka Drak remains unconquered, it would be invaluable in the struggle against the Norscan tribes who feed the forces of Chaos. The High King dispatches emissaries northwards.

The power of the Dwarfs grows. Many long-harboured grudges have been settled and a spirit of co-operation between the Holds has given new vigour to Thorgrim’s plans. In days of yore, the Dwarfs wandered throughout the Old World, seeking new lodes of the ores they prize. New Holds were founded, from the Grey Mountains in the west to the Mountains of Mourn in the east, from the Dragonback Mountains in the south to the ice-locked peaks of Norsca in the north. Then came the Time of Woes, when a series of disasters led to the fall of countless Holds and the sons of Grungni found themselves penned into their remaining Karaks. With the reclamation of the World's Edge Mountains underway, Thorgrim’s thoughts turn northwards to the once-mighty Hold of Kraka Drak in Norsca. If the Norscan Dwarfs have endured the Time of Woes and Kraka Drak remains unconquered, it would be invaluable in the struggle against the Norscan tribes who feed the forces of Chaos. The High King dispatches agents northwards to discover the fate of the Norse Dwarfs.

Now communication has been re-established with the Norse Dwarfs, Thorgrim has a clearer picture of events in that frozen land. He receives regular reports on the movements of the Norscan tribes, and other significant events. Soon an emissary from Kraka Drak brings word that the Troll Country, a malign wilderness in south-eastern Norsca, has seen a steady rise in the numbers of hideous creatures stalking its ice-wracked forests and tundra. Countless numbers of Trolls and Giants, displaced by the increased competition for food and territory, are a threat to Kraka Drak whilst others encroach into the World's Edge Mountains and other civilised lands. It is time for a cull, and whenever there is a foul monster in need of vanquishing, there you will find the Slayers: death-sworn followers of the Slayer Cult, and therefore ever in search of the most dangerous adversaries upon which to unleash their mighty axe-craft.

Alas, Kraka Drak is no more, and another grudge must be marked in the Great Book, perhaps along with an oath to re-establish the Hold at some point. For now though, Thorgrim pores over the reports on the movements of the Norse tribes, and other significant events. It would seem that the Troll Country, a malign wilderness in south-eastern Norsca, has seen a steady rise in the numbers of hideous creatures stalking its ice-wracked forests and tundra. Countless numbers of Trolls and Giants, pressured by the increased competition for food and territory, have been displaced into the World's Edge Mountains and other civilised lands. It is time for a cull. And whenever there is a foul monster in need of vanquishing, there you will find the Slayers: death-sworn followers of the Slayer Cult, in search of the most dangerous adversaries upon which to unleash their mighty axe-craft.

Alas, Kraka Drak is no more, and another grudge must be marked in the Great Book, perhaps along with an oath to re-establish the Hold at some point. For now though, Thorgrim pores over the reports on the movements of the Norse tribes, and other significant events. It would seem that the Troll Country, a malign wilderness in south-eastern Norsca, has seen a steady rise in the numbers of hideous creatures stalking its ice-wracked forests and tundra. Countless numbers of Trolls and Giants, pressured by the increased competition for food and territory, have been displaced into the World's Edge Mountains and other civilised lands. It is time for a cull. And whenever there is a foul monster in need of vanquishing, there you will find the Slayers: death-sworn followers of the Slayer Cult, in search of the most dangerous adversaries upon which to unleash their mighty axe-craft.
As the throng gathers to Thorgrim's banner, he sends a ranger ahead to reconnoitre the route.
As the throng gathers to Thorgrim's banner, he sends a ranger ahead to reconnoitre the route.

The Engineers' Guild have some new designs for an exciting improvement to the Gyrocopter, which would allow for increased speed and lifting capacity. These dark times call for a departure from the Dwarfs' customary adherence to tradition and suspicion of anything 'new'. Though these plans have been only half a century in the making, almost an insult to the Ancestors in their hasty preparation, the Guild has decided to bring them to Thorgrim's attention, though the Guild hall has been the scene of lengthy and heated debate on the matter. Now a Master Engineer has been tasked with producing the final technical drawings and prototypes before production can begin. However, the experimental processes involved will require further investment in the Guild's workshops, and this will not come cheap.

The Engineers' Guild is in uproar. The Master Engineer tasked with developing the plans has presented his initial prototypes, together with a proposal to roll the improvements out within a matter of months. The unseemly haste of this timeframe has polarised opinion between the younger members, uneasy with such novel thinking, yet intrigued by the possibilities it presents, and the traditionalists who advocate the more usual decades of testing and would have the "trial-and-error charlatan tinkerer" thrown out in disgrace. Hearing the outcry, the High King steps in and orders that the prototype be put into full production.

Early test flights of the Gyrocopters have been fruitful. The machines have shown that they are ready to be deployed against the enemy. In addition, during long-range testing to verify operational ranges, the test pilots observed a large gathering of Greenskins around a location in the Badlands known as the Pillar of Bone. Thorgrim despatches a Ranger to gather more detailed intelligence from the area.

Early test flights of the Gyrocopters have been fruitful. The machines have shown that they are ready to be deployed against the enemy. In addition, during long-range testing to verify operational ranges, the test pilots observed a large gathering of Greenskins around a location in the Badlands known as the Pillar of Bone. Thorgrim despatches a Ranger to gather more detailed intelligence from the area.

The Great Book of Grudges groans under the weight of the outrages, injustices that fill its many, many pages. High King Thorgrim spends many hours brooding over the tome and planning the means to exact payment in full for every grievance recorded therein. When the weight of his fury becomes too great to bear, he often descends to the vaults to seek solace amongst the riches heaped there. But gold itself presents another means to achieve vengeance, and as such a king can never have enough of it. Thorgrim is determined to fill the vaults to bursting, and then to delve new vaults and fill them with the treasure which will fuel his plans for ultimate vengeance and enable him to strike out every grudge within the book.

The workshops of the Hold blaze with light from the incandescent forges, and the ring with the hammers of the smiths who work there day and night. A tide of goods flow in to flood the deep vaults. Once more Everpeak is the nexus of a mighty trade empire. Yet still grit fouls the cogs of this mighty machine and daily Thorgrim must scratch out new grudges in the Great Book. Old enemies prey upon the trade caravans, butchering the traders and plundering their wealth. Of late, no caravan has made it through the ill-omened province of Sylvania. Whilst it's true that there are other routes into the Empire, the Sylvanian route offers certain advantages, and besides, there are fresh scores to be settled. First things first: Thorgrim needs to know what he's up against. He summons a Thane and orders him to reconnoitre the area.

Once more Everpeak is the nexus of a mighty trade empire. Yet still grit fouls the cogs of this mighty machine and daily Thorgrim must scratch out new grudges in the Great Book. Whilst it's true that there are other routes into the Empire, the Sylvanian route offers certain advantages, and besides, there are fresh scores to be settled. First things first: Thorgrim needs to know what he's up against. He summons a Thane and orders him to reconnoitre the area.

On being acclaimed High King, Thorgrim Grudgebearer swore a solemn oath that his reign would signal the dawn of a new age: the Age of Reckoning. It is his dream to avenge the wrongs done to his people by striking clean the entire ledger in the Great Book of Grudges. This begins with the reclamation of the fallen Holds.

In ages past, the Dwarfs stood shield-to-shield with the men of the Empire, braced against the constant attacks of their common enemies. Over the centuries though, the ties have loosened inexorably. Beset by ever greater threats and a series of defeats, the Dwarfs retreated into their remaining mountain Holds, and the power of the Empire dwindled under the yoke of weak, foolish or wicked Emperors. Now Thorgrim’s great oath of vengeance requires that the Dwarfs re-establish old alliances.

In ages past, the Dwarfs stood shield to shield with the men of the Empire, braced against the constant attacks of their common enemies. Over the centuries though, the ties have loosened inexorably. Beset by ever greater threats and an inexorable series of defeats, the Dwarfs retreated into their remaining mountain Holds, and the power of the Empire dwindled under the yoke of weak, foolish or wicked Emperors, until it was finally brought to its knees. Now the men of the Empire are fugitives, driven from their homelands and forced to find refuge in remote places. Yet pride and the love of their warrior god still burn within them, and they would surely embrace any chance to avenge themselves on their enemies. Thorgrim dispatches messengers to locate and establish contact with the fugitives.

Unable to find trustworthy allies elsewhere, Thorgrim resolves to contact a band of Empire fugitives, forced from their homelands and finding refuge in remote places. Yet pride and the love of their warrior god still burn within them, and they would surely embrace any chance to avenge themselves on their enemies. Thorgrim dispatches messengers to locate and establish contact with the fugitives, bringing them gold and supplies to sustain them.

Unable to find trustworthy allies elsewhere, Thorgrim resolves to contact a band of Empire fugitives, forced from their homelands and finding refuge in remote places. Yet pride and the love of their warrior god still burn within them, and they would surely embrace any chance to avenge themselves on their enemies. Thorgrim dispatches messengers to locate and establish contact with the fugitives, bringing gold and supplies to sustain them.

There are dire tidings from the South: Rangers report that a brutal Orc Warboss has arisen and that hordes of Greenskins are flocking to fight under his leadership. A mighty Waaagh! is forming and seems to be heading north toward the gateway to the Empire’s southern border: the fabled Black Fire Pass. This route through the mountains has witnessed countless titanic struggles over the centuries, many of them pivotal to the survival of the Old World, where Dwarfs and men stood together to hold back disaster. Thorgrim sends a scout to Black Fire Pass to gather intelligence.

There are dire tidings from the South: Rangers report that a brutal Orc Warboss has arisen and that hordes of Greenskins are flocking to fight under his leadership. A mighty Waaagh! is forming and seems to be heading north toward the gateway to the Empire’s southern border: the fabled Black Fire Pass. This route through the mountains has witnessed countless titanic struggles over the centuries, many of them pivotal to the survival of the Old World, where Dwarfs and men stood together to hold back disaster. Thorgrim sends a scout to Black Fire Pass to gather intelligence.

Ungrim Ironfist, the Slayer King of Karak Kadrin is a restless Dwarf. His five-time great grandsire suffered a terrible loss and in his torment swore the Oath of Slayers. This vow to seek out death conflicted with his vow as king to protect his people. In the end, good Dwarf sense prevailed and he found a way to honour all commitments by founding the Slayer Shrine of Karak Kadrin, establishing a haven for Slayers that continues to this day. Now Ungrim, bound by the same oaths, spends many hours before the shrine, chafing at his fate. Though he cannot seek death himself, he can certainly seek out opportunities to slay the enemy, and it is this that affords him a modicum of solace.

Ungrim kneels before the Slayer Shrine once more, fingering his notched axe as his battle rage cools. In his last battle, a reverie came upon him again. Whilst in the midst of slaying, he felt a discordant note amongst the otherwise perfect rhythm of battle. Contemplation brought him to the realisation that his own axe was the source of the disharmony. Reforged from the shattered remnants of the az of the first Slayer King, it is missing a section which has been replaced with Gromril. Though Gromril weapons are amongst the most deadly in the Old World, the replacement section is blank, lacking the runes of power that are etched into the rest of the blade. The secrets of many of the ancient runes of power have been lost over the millennia but the axe is not whole and the missing runes must somehow be reforged if the weapon is to sing true once more. Ungrim summons a Runesmith to discuss the matter.

Having consulted with his Guild, the Runesmith reports that the missing runes are amongst those whose mysteries have been lost to the Dwarfs for centuries. However, the Guild’s council suspects that in revealing its song to Ungrim, the axe is attempting to make itself whole once more, seeking the aid of Ungrim’s kindred warrior soul to do so. By wholly aligning his spirit with the axe in the crucible of battle, the Slayer King may be able to provide the counterpoint to mend the blade’s song. Such perfection of alignment is more likely to be achieved in a high place, closer to the Ancestor gods, and against an adversary of great skill in battle-craft. In his many hours of contemplation before the Slayer Shrine, Ungrim catches a gossamer thread of song coming from the north. Rising, he orders the horns sounded to summon his throng.

Having consulted with his Guild, the Runesmith reports that the missing runes are amongst those whose mysteries have been lost to the Dwarfs for centuries. However, the Guild’s council suspects that in revealing its song to Ungrim, the axe is attempting to make itself whole once more, seeking the aid of Ungrim’s kindred warrior soul to do so. Such perfection of alignment is more likely to be achieved in a high place, closer to the Ancestor gods, and against an adversary of great skill in battle-craft. In his many hours of contemplation before the Slayer Shrine, Ungrim catches a gossamer thread of song coming from the north. Rising, he orders the horns sounded to summon his throng.

A message has arrived from High King Thorgrim Grudgebearer. The scroll is a long one with well over half of it detailing the many enmities recorded in the Great Book of Grudges against the foul Greenskins, an interminable list that is engraved as deeply on Ungrim’s heart as on that of any other Dwarf. Now Thorgrim plans to set in motion a campaign to strike a telling blow against the urks and grobi, so that their stain might be erased from the face of the Old World once and for all. Before the final blow can be struck, they must be weakened in stages, and the first step is to reconnoitre their territory in force.

Though the Orc and Goblin menace seems to have been dealt with for now, the High King knows that somewhere in the wilds scattered bands of fugitives will be hiding, just waiting for a new Warboss to rise so that they can flock to his banner in another mighty Waaagh! Constant vigilance is called for and Ungrim is ordered to send out scouts to keep watch.

Goblins have been seen sneaking through Dwarfen territories, particularly in the central World's Edge Mountains. Ungrim especially despises these underhand Goblin sneaks who lack even the Orcs' one redeeming feature of being prepared to stand and fight. Fire must be fought with fire. Ungrim sends out an ally to put an end to the foul creature before he can do any harm!

The war drums are pounding in the Badlands. The settlements belonging to the Greenskins seethe like anthills as the enraged Orcs gather to strike back at their tormentors. According to the High King’s plan, the trick is to ensure that the counterattack is channelled in a direction of the Dwarf’s choosing so that the final confrontation is on ground that favours them. Broken Leg Gully is a low pass in the World's Edge Mountains perfect for such a battle. All that is required is some bait to draw the raging Greenskin horde there. Summoning a trusted champion, Ungrim instructs him to infiltrate a Greenskin settlement and plant a scroll indicating the presence of a secret tunnel entrance in Broken Leg Gully and leading to the nearby Hold of Karak Kadrin. Such a tunnel doesn’t exist, but in their current state of rage, the Orcs will surely take the bait!

Though the agent failed to plant the scroll, it would seem that the ruse wasn't required anyway. The Goblins were scouting the area ahead of a huge Greenskin Waaagh! which landed south of the Badlands and made its way north by secret paths. Ungrim despatches a scout to track them and discover their objective.

Though the agent failed to plant the scroll, it would seem that the ruse wasn't required anyway. The Goblins were scouting the area ahead of a huge Greenskin Waaagh! which landed south of the Badlands and made its way north by secret paths. Ungrim despatches a scout to track them and discover their objective.

During his escape from the Greenskin settlement, Ungrim's agent spotted a group of Goblin scouts sneaking away to the North. On a hunch, the agent tracked the Goblins north to Broken Leg Gully. Eavesdropping on their foul conversation he learned that they were a scouting party sent out ahead of a large-scale Greenskin attack planned for somewhere in the vicinity. Having read the report, Ungrim dispatches a scout to watch the area whilst he gathers the throng and marches to join them.

Dark clouds have enveloped the accursed province of Sylvania. Such a spectacle has not been seen since Count Mannfred von Carstein, the Vampire Lord of that realm, was last vanquished. Now reports reach Ungrim of sinister black-robed old men roaming the high peaks. He suspects that death has regained mastery of Sylvania and the interlopers herald the spread of its corruption to neighbouring regions. The Slayer King will need to act in order to protect his people.

Ungrim's agents send word that they have tracked two of the cloaked figures, who appear to be Necromancers, and have worked out likely locations where they might be cornered. There seems to be no good reason for the Necromancers to be roaming the high peaks, and Ungrim sends word for his agents to act against them to put an end to whatever scheme they are engaged in.
Whilst the Necromancers could not be found, the throng have reported rumours of Vampiric activity in the darkest corners of Sylvania. Ungrim sends a scout to investigate the area.

The scout watching Sylvania's border reports a chance encounter with a terrified Sylvanian peasant who lay hidden and witnessed the passing of a hideous army of the dead. At its head rode two pale figures on dead horses, one in crimson armour, the other robed in black. The armoured figure slapped his mount's neck with a mailed fist and cursed in a voice as cold as death "Weeks of searching the mountain caves and still you have failed to find what I desire. If you are wrong about the locations to the northwest, and we should find no dragon's corpse to serve me into death, I shall feast upon your soul". It seems that the Undead Lord is searching for new materials for use in his foul Necromancy. It would seem that the dead have found at least two possible locations for what they seek and are now moving to claim their vile prize. King Ungrim marches from his hall, shouting for the throng to be assembled. In the meantime he must decide which of the Undead hordes his scout should track.

The scout watching Sylvania's border reports a chance encounter with a terrified Sylvanian peasant who lay hidden and witnessed the passing of a hideous army of the dead. At its head rode two pale figures on dead horses, one in crimson armour, the other robed in black. The armoured figure slapped his mount's neck with a mailed fist and cursed in a voice as cold as death "Weeks of searching the mountain caves and still you have failed to find what I desire. If you are wrong about the locations to the northwest, and we should find no dragon's corpse to serve me into death, I shall feast upon your soul". It seems that the Undead Lord is searching for new materials for use in his foul Necromancy. King Ungrim marches from his hall, shouting for the throng to be assembled. In the meantime he must decide which of the Undead hordes his scout should track.

At its head rode two pale figures on dead horses, one in crimson armour, the other robed in black. The armoured figure slapped his mount's neck with a mailed fist and cursed in a voice as cold as death "Weeks of searching the mountain caves and still you have failed to find what I desire. If you are wrong about the locations to the northwest and we should find no dragon's corpse to serve me into death, I shall feast upon your soul". It seems that the Undead Lord is searching for new materials for use in his foul Necromancy. It would seem that the dead have found at least two possible locations for what they seek and are now moving to claim their vile prize. King Ungrim marches from his hall, shouting for the throng to be assembled. In the meantime he must decide which of the Undead hordes his scout should track.
With the decoy force destroyed, Ungrim orders his throng to pursue the second Undead horde, again sending a scout ahead to mark the way.

A number of strange incidents have occurred within the Empire of late: tombs have been desecrated and libraries broken into. Oddly, nothing has been taken. The Emperor's spies report that a number of ill-omened individuals have been connected to some of the misdeeds. The trick now is to catch one of them and learn more.

The information received indicates that the intrusions are connected with the search for a magical amulet, believed to have been buried in the tomb of a powerful Lord centuries ago. The fact that the enemy are searching over a large area, and in libraries as well as tombs, suggests that they are yet to discover the amulet's precise location. However, they seem to be concentrating their efforts within the eastern realms and this provides a clue. Balthasar Gelt advises the Emperor that the search would best be orchestrated by the Colleges of Magic.

The Wizard reports back to Gelt that their researches have turned up two possible locations: the barrow of the ancient tribal Chieftain Marbad in Middenland, or the tomb of an unknown Lord in the dusty foothills of distant Estalia. Gelt decides that it is time for research is over. The leads must be investigated in person.

The Wizard reports back to Gelt that their researches have turned up two possible locations: the barrow of the ancient tribal Chieftain Marbad in Middenland, or the tomb of an unknown Lord in the dusty foothills of distant Estalia. Gelt decides that it is time for research is over. The leads must be investigated in person.

The Wizard reports back to Gelt that their researches have turned up two possible locations: the barrow of the ancient tribal Chieftain Marbad in Middenland, or the tomb of an unknown Lord in the dusty foothills of distant Estalia. Gelt decides that it is time for research is over. The leads must be investigated in person.

As the last echoes of battle dwindle and the silence descends upon the tomb once more, Gelt searches for any sign of the magical amulet. Grave goods there are aplenty but the amulet is not among them, and even the most rapacious looter amongst the surviving men is strangely reluctant to so much as lay a finger on any of the treasures piled amid the ancient bones. His metallic voice betraying nothing of the frustration he feels, the Supreme Patriarch gives orders to investigate the lead in Estalia.

Balthasar Gelt has always been fascinated with the purity of gold. In his eyes, no other metal can compare. He has laboured long in probing its secrets and inevitably these studies have led him towards solving the ultimate mystery of transmutation - the permanent transformation of base iron into gold. Now his search is nearing its goal, but the Supreme Patriarch requires raw materials for his research.

Dwarfs have ever-been adept at fashioning metal, and Gelt suspects that their smiths may have uncovered secrets that will be useful to him. However, their methods are guarded more closely than their lives and the Supreme Patriarch will need to employ guile to wrest the knowledge he needs from the ancient Dwarf halls. He despatches a Hero to negotiate with the Dwarfs.

As Gelt suspected, the Dwarfs flatly refuse to share their knowledge. His emissary does mention that as he prepared to leave the Hold, a Gyrocopter pilot arrived with news of a Greenskin warband that had attacked a Dwarfen trade caravan and stolen the precious Gromril ore it was carrying. Ever a planner, Gelt sends a pathfinder to the gully to assess the threat.

The knowledge Balthasar Gelt seeks would have been recorded in one of the Dwarfs' Guild books. Many of these have been destroyed during the fall of the Dwarfholds. One Greenskin Warboss is said to carry a personal store of them, torn pages from which he takes with him whenever he visits "Da Drops". Scouts report that this Boss is currently to be found in Broken Leg Gully. Ever a planner, Gelt sends a pathfinder to the gully to assess the threat.

The Dwarf lore reveals synergies between alchemy and the manufacture of Black Powder. With the raw materials and key knowledge in place, Gelt sends word ahead to Altdorf to prepare his laboratories whilst he rides for the capital.

Gelt's researches lead him to the location of an ill-omened cave, shunned by any unfortunate enough to live in its vicinity. He dispatches a scout to reconnoitre the route whilst he recovers from his injuries.

Gelt's researches lead him to the location of an ill-omened cave, shunned by any unfortunate enough to live in its vicinity. He dispatches a scout to reconnoitre the route whilst he recovers from his injuries.

The Colleges of Magic in Altdorf are abuzz with intrigue. Every eight years, a wizard who has proven himself worthy may challenge the Master of the Colleges to a magical duel, with the winner becoming the next Supreme Patriarch. The competition even to become a candidate is white hot. Wizards, being what they are, mean the selection process is at best pedantic; at its worst, real enmities can develop. Balthasar Gelt is the Patriarch of the Gold Order, and tipped to win, but a rival Light Wizard, Gottfried Orr, desperate for the position, wants rid of Gelt before they even reach the Hall of Duels. While this is an open secret, no direct accusation can be made as that is not how wizards manage their affairs. However, Gelt is something of a maverick and knows he needs the edge when Orr inevitably makes his move. As such, the Gold Wizard sets about locating a valuable lodestone and harnessing its power. Lodestones sometimes occur in areas struck by lightning - areas such as Kislev, which has recently experienced heavy storm activity.

With his rival dispatched, Gelt returns to Altdorf to face the current Supreme Patriarch, Thyrus Gormann, in the Hall of Duels. Gelt was unconcerned by the Bright Wizard, after all he had a far more powerful contender in Orr. So, perhaps arrogantly, Gelt considered the Staff of Volans his in all but name until confirmed as the Supreme Patriarch.

Emperor Karl Franz has received an urgent message from the college of the Celestial Order. Skilled in divination, the Celestial Wizards have been concerned by unusual eddies within the Wind of Azyr. Using the vast magical astrolabe which lies at the heart of the college's sixteen towers, the astromancers have divined a dire conjunction of certain astral bodies, portending doom for the Empire. However, the fluctuations in the sorcerous winds are obscuring the precise nature of the threat. Only by taking observations from another geographic location can the wizards triangulate a more accurate divination.

With fresh observations, the Celestial Wizards are closer to a definitive reading, but their astrolabe requires certain adjustments and intricate additions in order to perform the calculation. The latter will require rare materials which will not come cheaply.

With the adjustments to their magical astrolabe completed, the wizards of the Celestial College report back their findings, and the portents could not be more dire. A great Orc Warboss has arisen somewhere in the lands south of the Black Mountains. His fearsome reputation has gathered many Greenskin tribes behind him in a Waaagh! which is now headed for the main route from the Badlands into the Empire: Black Fire Pass. The first priority is to prevent further Orc warbands from travelling to join the Waaagh! Meanwhile, messengers are sent to summon all allies to face this threat.

With the adjustments to their magical astrolabe completed, the wizards of the Celestial College report back their findings, and the portents could not be more dire. A great Orc Warboss has arisen somewhere in the lands south of the Black mountains. His fearsome reputation has gathered many Greenskin tribes behind him in a Waaagh! which is now headed for the main route from the Badlands into the Empire: Black Fire Pass. Whilst messengers are dispatched to alert the Dwarfs, the Emperor tasks one of his most trusted champions to locate the Orc Waaagh!

With the adjustments to their magical astrolabe completed, the wizards of the Celestial College report back their findings, and the portents could not be more dire. A great Orc Warboss has arisen somewhere in the lands south of the Black mountains. His fearsome reputation has gathered many Greenskin tribes behind him in a Waaagh! which is now headed for the main route from the Badlands into the Empire: Black Fire Pass. Whilst messengers are dispatched to alert the Dwarfs, the Emperor tasks one of his most trusted champions to locate the Orc Waaagh!
Theoderic Gausser, Elector Count of Nordland, requests aid. His lands are experiencing increased coastal raids from Norsca and he needs allies to help repel the attackers.

Hearing rumours of increased sightings of Norscan marauder longships along the coast of Nordland, and fearing that they are forerunners of something more sinister, Emperor Karl Franz summons an agent to gather intelligence in the area.
Norscan activity in the Sea of Claws increases almost daily, in order to prove his credentials, Karl Franz needs to respond, firstly by strengthening his forces.
Whilst he prepares his forces, the Emperor despatches a trusted lieutenant to scout the route and keep him informed of developments.
Whilst he prepares his forces, the Emperor despatches a trusted lieutenant to scout the route and keep him informed of developments.

The vaults deep below the palace of Altdorf have been breached and the powerful Silver Seal artefact stolen! The guards are strangely hazy about the events on the night of the theft. But wards that should not open for anyone but the Grand Theogonist or the Emperor have been cracked, this is no mundane thief. A Witch Hunter is summoned.

Azhag’s Armour is alright. It’s got spikes in the right places, the odd skull here and there and is decorated with the crusted blood of countless broken enemies. But it’s missing something, and Azhag can’t quite put his finger on what that is. He summons his Shamans to demand answers.

Azhag’s Armour is alright. It’s got spikes in the right places, the odd skull here and there and is decorated with the crusted blood of countless broken enemies. But it’s missing something, and Azhag can’t quite put his finger on what that is. He summons his Shamans to demand answers.

The Orc Shaman prances about the campfire, gyrating to extremes the boyz have never witnessed before - or ever want to see again! The thumping of the drums and the rattling of his bone charms soon brings on the trance-like state which allows him commune with Gork (or Mork). Having danced himself to exhaustion, he finally collapses. From his prone position on the dusty ground he gasps that Mork and Gork want to see some proper stomping and Azhag should "get one of them big fellas in 'is mob". Once this is done, they might have a way of "blinging 'is armour up proper like".

The Night Goblin boils a potent fungus brew with his secret stash of black caps. Having gulped down the poisonous concoction, he doubles over and emits a peal of manic laughter before twitching spasmodically and blowing purple bubbles. With his bloodshot eyes still unfocussed and staring, he squeaks that Mork (or Gork) wants to see some spidery stompin', so Azhag should get "one of them 'uge spiderz in 'is mob". Once this is done, they might have a way of "blinging 'is armour up proper like".

The Shaman's vision suggest that the Greenskin gods are unhappy with Azhag, who seems more interested in listening to the magic crown he wears than "proper fightin' an' stuff". Azhag ignores the voice in his head which is urging him not to waste time on this nonsense, and orders his mob to prepare for a scrap.

As Azhag's mob picks over the corpse-strewn scene of their latest victory, the Shaman suddenly goes rigid, his eyes bulging and glassy as he enters another trance. In a dreamy voice he says that Gork an' Mork are pleased that Azhag has "stopped muckin' about and got stuck in ta da fightin'". They'll overlook his wearing of the humie Necromancer's crown for now. The Shaman declares that Azhag just needs one final bloodbath, one more bout of carnage and the Great Green will enter his armour and make it properly 'Ard! The crown whispers something about the south, some place in Bretonnia. Azhag orders one of "da lads" to take a look-see.

As Azhag's mob picks over the corpse-strewn scene of their latest victory, the Shaman suddenly goes rigid, his eyes bulging and glassy as he enters another trance. In a dreamy voice he says that Gork an' Mork are pleased that Azhag has "stopped muckin' about and got stuck in ta da fightin'". They'll overlook his wearing of the humie Necromancer's crown for now. The Shaman declares that Azhag just needs one final bloodbath, one more bout of carnage and the Great Green will enter his armour and make it properly 'Ard! The crown whispers something about the south, some place in Bretonnia. Azhag orders one of "da lads" to take a look-see.

Once Azhag was the chieftain of a little-known tribe subsisting high in Troll Country. The Greenskin tribes in the far north are bitter rivals, fighting choppa-and-claw over the few spoils the hostile, barren lands provide. Since then, Azhag has come south to the Badlands, but now events seem to be drawing him back to his old stamping ground once more. Azhag has received a tip from an unlikely source: a captured gobbo from a rival tribe, desperate not to be eaten. The snivelling little git claims he knows of an abandoned tomb-city, once the seat of a great king who worshipped dark powers. Within this necropolis are said to be great treasures... Azhag cuffs one of his own Goblin Bosses around the ear and hoofs him out of the camp, telling him not to come back until he's found this mythical place.

Despite low expectations, the Goblin scout has found a possible location for this lost city that Azhag's increasingly-loony Shaman insists on calling Todtheim. The Shaman rants on about some humie Necromancer who has some connection with the place and whose iron crown is rumoured to be there. The crown is said to allow its wearer to wield sorcerous powers. He also mutters something about the crown's ability to possess its wearer, but Azhag isn't paying attention anymore. The scout has found an "'orrible" place that stinks of the Ruinous Powers. However, to loot it will be no easy feat as circling above the ruins are flying creatures, flocks of fell bats and other, more monstrous things. To be able to fully explore the dead city, Azhag's mob will need to control the skies as well as the land.

With plenty of "shooterz" in his mob, Azhag feels ready to launch his raid on the tomb city. His mobs must cull the flying Undead and Chaos denizens, and then hunt through the tombs and monsters' lairs within the catacombs below. The Chaos Wastes are a weird and dangerous place though, so he sends a scout ahead to mark the way.

With plenty of "shooterz" in his mob, Azhag feels ready to launch his raid on the tomb city. His mobs must cull the flying Undead and Chaos denizens, and then hunt through the tombs and monsters' lairs within the catacombs below. The Chaos Wastes are a weird and dangerous place though, so he sends a scout ahead to mark the way.

Azhag really wants to go south. Not all that unusual for an Orc brought up in Troll Country, after all, the squishiest humies and shiniest loot is in the Empire (which is ironically now in da north since the slaughterer upped sticks and went to the Badlands!). But Azhag's top Bosses know, that's not why he wants to go south - something else is pushing him to go that way. He is prone to bouts of staring into space or arguing with his magical crown, but when he snaps out of this he is the old Azhag, intent on "fightin' and lootin'".

As Azhag's Waaagh! rampages through the soft southern lands, his tactics become increasingly 'un-Orcy', straying from the usual Greenskin staple of 'outnumber and charge'. The Orc Warboss now fights with more complex strategies - pincer movements, refused flanks and their like. He even sends out scouts ahead so that he can pick the best targets for his horde, rather than just smashing anything they come across - something he calls "strategy" apparently. All the while he argues with a voice in his head, seemingly coming from the dark crown he looted up north. His boyz shrug to themselves. As long as da Boss is fightin', who cares if he's actin' a bit loony?

Whilst raiding their way southwards, Azhag's boyz are merciless as they ravage and plunder the land. Many of them continue to note marked changes in Azhag. He uses un-Orcish words, goes into trances, mumbles to himself constantly and often tries to explain orders instead of simply cracking skulls and bellowing. But again, the hordes forgive such peculiarities as the victories and loot stack up. All in the name of "The Slaughterer"!

Azhag’s path takes him south into the Badlands. But while the Crown pressures the Orc to continue his southern route, his iron will reasserts itself. He cannot resist opportunities to raid or confront forces raised against him, and so his army zig-zags along its journey, heading south when the crown holds dominance but frequently detouring when Azhag regains control. He does, however, once again send a scout south, seemingly at the crown's behest.

Azhag’s path takes him south into the Badlands. But while the Crown pressures the Orc to continue his southern route, his iron will reasserts itself. He cannot resist opportunities to raid or confront forces raised against him, and so his army zig-zags along its journey, heading south when the crown holds dominance but frequently detouring when Azhag regains control. He does, however, once again send a scout south, seemingly at the crown's behest.

A Goblin scout has brought word that an unusual number of Gyrocopters have been seen travelling back and forth between various Dwarf Holds and the northerly World's Edge Mountains. Something is clearly brewing. Anything that might bring the stunties out from behind the doors of their mountain fastnesses has got to be good news. Grimgor decides to take the uncharacteristically subtle move of cuffing his agent around the head and sending the Goblin sneaking back out to discover more information.

Unable to carry out his original mission, and knowing what his fate will be if he reports this failure to Grimgor, the Goblin searches frantically for any information he can find to try and save his own miserable hide.

Having weakened the Dwarfs (and had a good time doing so), Grimgor now despatches a Goblin scout to locate the Chaos Warband, knowing that the remaining throng will also be drawn to it and that the resulting battle will be another opportunity to slake his insatiable lust for war, albeit temporarily. Whilst he awaits word, he looks for other targets for his wrath.
Grimgor's scout has sent word of movement in the north. He is moving in closer to observe whilst the rest of the mob travels to the location.
Grimgor's scout has sent word of movement in the north. He is moving in closer to observe whilst the rest of the mob travels to the location.

Several Goblins have been spotted sneaking around the Badlands. It stands to reason that they're up to no good, and there may be some fighting to be had at the end of it. Grimgor orders his scouts to bring one of them to him.

The cringing Goblin reveals that he was on the trail of another Orc Warboss, said to have found a powerful axe somewhere in the mountains and headed north in search of some humies to try it out on. Eager for the chance of loot, the Goblin was hurrying to join his mob, but adds that no-one has heard from the Warboss since, though there are plenty of rumours of him amongst the various Greenskin tribes. Grimgor delays his plan to squish the Goblin spy and instead sends him to find out who knows anything of value, and to torture the information out of them.

The cringing Goblin reveals that he was on the trail of another Orc Warboss, said to have found a powerful axe somewhere in the mountains and headed north to Black Fire Pass in search of some humies to try it out on. Eager for the chance of loot, the Goblin was hurrying to join his mob, but adds that no-one has heard from the Warboss since. Grimgor delays his plan to squish the Goblin spy and instead sends him to sneak around Black Fire Pass.

Having infiltrated another tribe, the Goblin listened to rumours being discussed around the campfire and eventually came up with the name of a Greenskin who might have more information. Waylaying his victim, he extracted further information before despatching him. It seems that the Warboss was probably headed for Black Fire Pass, on the borders of the Empire. The Goblin now heads to the area to continue his investigation.

Having failed to find a target, and knowing that to return to Grimgor empty-handed would spell certain death, the Goblin shows unusual initiative by surmising that the Warboss was probably headed for Black Fire Pass, on the borders of the Empire. He heads for the area to continue his investigation.

The axe-carrying Warboss met a powerful Empire force at Black Fire Pass and was defeated. Presumably, the magic choppa remains with his corpse. All indications are that the humies remain in the pass, preparing to march back up north, but they might be persuaded to stay long enough for Grimgor to have a crack at them. The Black Orc Warboss orders his mob to march on the pass, and to announce their approach by burning everything en route. The humie scum will have no choice but to stay and face a far deadlier threat than that 'pretenda' that now lies rotting in the pass with Grimgor's choppa!
With the rest of the mob otherwise occupied, one of the boyz ranges ahead, eager to see whether the humies are still about and ready for a scrap.
With the rest of the mob otherwise occupied, one of the boyz ranges ahead, eager to see whether the humies are still about and ready for a scrap.
Under the vengeful eyes of Grimnir did we witness wrongs committed by a Bretonnian dog! A grudge has been committed against the Dawi. Hunt down this umgi and slay him!
As witnessed by a wrathful Grimnir, a fell Northman attacked our honourable throng. The sorry cur, lackey of the Ruinous Powers that he is, must pay with his life!
Under Valaya's sorrowful eyes did we see a terrible act. A Dwarf attacking honourable kin in battle. The Slayer Oath will not expunge such a sin, only his death can atone the shame of his ancestors!

As seen by the Mother of Home and Hearth, the umgi of Sigmar's blood, a former guest of the Karaz Ankor now strikes out against our warriors! A despicable, dishonourable act that must be paid for with his life!
Beheld by Grungni's defiant eyes, the fell urki record yet another wrong in our great book. The beast attacked a throng of proud Dawi. A wrong that must be put right with its death!

Seen by a disgusted Grungni, enemy of all Vampires and their fell minions, did one of their Undead creatures attack our brave kin. This is a grudge that can only be settled with the abomination's death.

As witnessed by the unforgiving eyes of Grimnir, this umgi has murdered a brave Dawi hero! We should not expect anything less from traitorous Umgi, but now vengeance must be settled. Find and kill this manling!
Under the withering gaze of Valaya, a vile Champion of Dum has killed a hero of our folk. Such a terrible act must not go unrecorded or unpunished! Claim the umgi's head and erase this fell grudge!

Viewed by a deplored Grimnir, this Dwarf has broken a sacred trust and killed one of his own. This is a grudge that must be answered for Kin-slaying is the worst of crimes. Find this traitor and kill him!
Observed by Grimnir's raging glare, a vile umgi assassin has slain a great hero before his saga was fully formed! An outrage. Slay this manling murderer!
Under Grungni's worldly gaze, the fell grobi scum-sucker has slain the honoured Dawi. This is a grudge we cannot tolerate! Slay the urk - dreng him now!
Seen by Valaya's stern gaze, the Zangunaz has slain the brave Dawi. We must have vengeance! Settle this grudge with the Vampire abomination's destruction.
Witnessed by Grungni's wrathful eyes, this umgi Knight has dared to trespass on Dwarfen lands and commence manling mischief! Such wanton vandalism cannot be left to pass. Kill the trespasser!
Under Grimnir's enraged sight, the Chaos filth has attacked a Dwarfhold. Slay the fool, and right this grudge!
Dok'd by Valaya's distressed eyes, this Dawi traitor has attacked one of his High King's own settlements. So a grudge is recorded, and will not be erased until this sorry, scraggy kruti is dead!

As seen by Grungni's withering gaze, this umgi wazzock has attacked a Hold of the Karaz Ankor. This is a gross trespass on our sovereign mountains! A grudge has been recorded, his death the price to clear it.
Spied by Grimnir's raging sight, the Greenskin dared to attack an honoured Dwarfhold. Scum! Filthy urk and grobi scum! Find and kill it to appease Grimnir and release this grudge!
Watched by the Mother of Home and Hearth, the Undead creature has desecrated our Hold - a fell grudge indeed! Appease the ancestors and kill the abomination.
As witnessed by Grimnir's disappointed glare, this army of Bretonnian curs stole victory from our throng. Such a grudge should be avenged!
column4: The False Pride of Knights Grudge

column3: Seen by Grungni's indignant eyes, the Chaos horde has cheated its way to victory against our brave Dawi throng - a grave grudge indeed! Right this wrong, and hunt down the Chaos filth.
Under Valaya's stern gaze, the rival wattocks of a failing Hold have claimed victory against us! Foolish Dawi - it is a grudge that must be settled!
Spied by a raging Grimnir, the umgi - who once claimed kith and kinship with the Dawi - dare to entrap and slay our throng. Hunt down this army and wipe the grudge from the Dammaz Kron!

Witnessed by Grimnir's vengeful sight, the Greenskin mob attacks our own throng and fell urk treachery has forced a dishonourable retreat! We cannot - will not - let such a stain on Dawi courage past. A grudge is recorded, ensure it is settled!

Observed by the judgemental glare of Valaya, the filthy blood drinkers have claimed victory against honest, breathing, beard-growing Dawi. They are an affront to the Mother Goddess, hunt down this host and send them back to the dark!
Seen through Grungni's resentful gaze, the manling Knights in their shoddy, umgak armour have raided this Dawi-claimed region. Defeat these cretins to restore honour.

Under Grimnir's raging sight, the Chaos corrupted umgi have raided our lands - a fell grudge indeed! Find these urks and defeat them, only then will Grimnir let such an atrocity against the Dawi relent.
Via Valaya's despairing glare, our territory has been raided - not by urk filth but by our own kin! A vile betrayal, a terrible grudge, and one that must be paid in Clan blood!
In Gazul's vengeful sight, the manlings of the Empire have raided Dwarfen lands and taken Dwarfen treasure! This must be paid for in blood!
Under the outraged sight of Grimnir, the grobi scum raid our mountains as they always have. Another grudge for the great book, another wrong to be righted, more Greenskins to hunt and kill!
Witnessed by Thungni, an Undead host has raided our lands. Hunt down this horde of filthy bloodsuckers and visit vengeance upon them!
Witnessed by Smednir's furious, fuming gaze, their crone of a goddess has sent her Knights sacking Dawi lands. Find these trespassers and hold them to account!
Seen by Valaya's agonised eyes, the northern manlings have despoiled our home, stolen artefacts and tainted sacred vaults. A grudge is in place, vengeance will be ours!
In Grungni's deplored sight, our kin have defiled a rival Hold. Such desecration of our own Karaks by treacherous Dawi cannot be tolerated! Find the enemy throng and punish them!

Under Grimnir's vengeful stare, the Empire has betrayed and defiled our Holds, stealing our secrets and ruining proud Dwarfen works - as is typical of their kind. Find this army and claim retribution.
Beheld by a wrathful Grimnir, the old enemy, a Greenskin mob has sacked a Dwarfhold. The rage is deep, this is a grudge like no other! Find the grobi scum responsible and wipe them out!
Regarded by Valaya's resentful eyes, Uzkular have invaded and sacked our proud Dwarfhold. Revenge must be enacted; the grudge put right. Find this grave-scum host and destroy them!
Under Valaya's disappointed glare, infighting amongst the Dawi has led to an insurgency here. The grudge has been listed - end this despicable influx!
In Valaya's very own sight did the Bretonnian chufs dare take our homes and mines. Bring it back into Dwarf hands and curse every umgi for this treacherous act!
Under the wrathful sight of Grimnir did Dwarfs of a rival Clan take this settlement by force. We cannot abide such wilful trespass. Remove them and restore the Dwarfhold to its rightful owners.
Viewed by a weeping Valaya, rival Dwarfs have taken a Hold in lieu of a debt allegedly owed by the original inhabitants' ancestors. Lies! Restore the true owners.
By Grimnir's stare, the Sigmar-loving umgi dare to take our homes and mountains. Record it in the book and ensure the settlement is returned to the Dawi.
Witnessed by Grungni, the urk and grobi bastards have taken our Dwarfhold. Is there a fouler grudge ever recorded? Get it back!

Seen by the Mother of Home and Hearth, the Greenskins have taken a Dwarfhold. A vile sin, this grudge has been entered into the book and must now be wiped clean. Take the Hold back and kill any grobi in our way!

As witnessed by a weeping Valaya, the enemy did come to our ancient home and ruin it. The Halls of the Ancestors lie discarded, the vaults raided! This is a black grudge, return the Hold and slay any who get in our way!
Seen by Grimnir, the Undead dare to ransack and occupy our settlement. A grudge has been recorded, ensure it is settled.

As seen by Thungni's raging glare, innocent Dawi travelling through Stirland have been taken by the von Carstein Zangunaz and slain. Their bodies have been risen and made to perform a dread revel - a puppet re-enactment of Jaeger's travesty of a play, "Stoutheart Beardcomber and the Ostlander's Wife". This is a terrible grudge - for it is a terrible play - and one that must be paid with von Carstein heads!

Under Smednir's annoyed gaze, did the Dwarfs from Kraka Drak send their emissaries to Everpeak covered in Chaos-tainted beard ticks! Many Dawi set their beards alight to rid themselves of the parasitic embuggerence or covered their beards in acrid powder, which had the unfortunate side effect of bleaching said facial hair a drastic blonde colour! A grudge is recorded against the Norse Dwarfs - one that should be settled by ignoring these lice-carriers for a long time.

Via Morgrim's discriminating glare, the manlings of Kislev are befouling sacred Dwarfen ale by mixing it with their distilled potato juice! Such contempt for honest Dwarfs ales tainted by this 'vodka' - they have even dared name it a 'boilermaker' - cannot be tolerated! This is a grudge of the highest order, let us show these manlings how Dawi feel about this... violation!

Seen by Valaya's angry eyes, the Bretonnians have slain many thaggoraki in their fell nest to save a clutch of maidens, both umgi and Dawi. But it turns out that the kruti Knights, while gladly escorting the damsels back to safety, left the fair Dwarf maids to fend for themselves with sorry excuses about there not being enough room on the backs of their nags. An outrage and one that must be paid for with these Knights' blood.

Beheld in Grimnir's seething sight, Bugman's Brewery was once the greatest of all brewhouses, where the fabled Bugman's XXXXX was created - a few casks of which still exist. But it all ended when the grobi fell upon the fortified brewery, enslaving and killing the Bugman Clan, and - worst of all - drinking the ale! Such an atrocity is a grudge that can never be truly settled. Go and slay Greenskins to salve this open wound!

As witnessed by a vengeful Grimnir, the Orcs have taken great delight in reminding us of their 'claim' on the Dragonback Mountains, of how they have defiled Ekrund and stolen its wealth. Enough! Even if we lack the stout hearts to take it back, we can spike their grog. Let us give them a taste of Dwarf medicine!

Under Morgrim's disappointed glare, did the Dwarfs of Karak Ziflin steal away a cook bound for the kitchens of Karaz-a-Karak! The secret of his nutty fig pudding recipe was the reason - a spiteful move to deprive the High King of one of his favourites in petty retribution for a difficult Reckoner's inspection. A grudge has been recorded and there will be no negotiations with Ziflin until they give up the Halfling!

Witnessed by a concerned Valaya, the Karaz Ankor's ambassador to Nuln has returned with his beard shaved off! Apparently, the Countess Emmanuelle didn't take kindly to the Dawi's chance remark about the accuracy of the pupils at the Imperial Gunnery school! This is an affront to all Dwarfs - Nuln must pay!

By Grungni's indignant glare, the Imperial School of Engineers in the umgi city of Altdorf has claimed technical superiority over our kin! Such an offensive boast cannot go unchallenged, Dwarfen supremacy must be retained at all costs! Show the foolish manlings and their umgak machinery Dwarfen supremacy!

In the stern eyes of Valaya did the Elector Count of Ostermark commission skilled Dwarf Engineers to raise a mighty fortress and then short-change the Dawi by two pennies. An outrage! Ransack Ostermark to recover the cost!
Success
Khorne cares not from whence the blood flows - kill him!
This bearded mortal is a threat to our plans. Send the oath-shackled fool to an early grave and take his soul for good measure!
One of Sigmar's little thralls challenges us. Ensure his death.
The Chaos Gods have deemed this foe our enemy, he should be devoured by you and you alone!
The Chaos Gods have deemed this foe our enemy, she should be devoured by you and your alone!
The Greenskins are nothing more than noisome beasts, and now one of their number acts against us. Kill it.
The feeble-minded creatures - enslaved to the weak-magic of Nagash - seek to steal our power in a vain attempt to become the fifth throne of Chaos. Destroy him.
The feeble-minded creatures - enslaved to the weak-magic of Nagash - seek to steal our power in a vain attempt to become the fifth throne of Chaos. Destroy her.
The Chaos Gods are capricious - they demand one who was formally favoured be slain. Do it before they turn on you.
This Dwarf Lord has the blood of the hated God, Grimnir, coursing through his veins. Cut him open and imbibe his lifeforce, for the favour of the Ruinous Powers awaits.
This man's soul demands to be ripped from his body and offered to our Dark Masters. Find him, slay him and take his soul for Chaos!
This Lord is a thorn in our side! Pluck him from our flesh as every thorn should be!
Only Khorne values the mongrel souls of the Orcs - find this Orc Lord and take its life in the Blood God's name.
This Vampire thinks he is powerful, he arrogantly believes he can challenge the Chaos Gods themselves! By their blade, decapitate this Undead thrall!
You are the one the Dark Gods favour as the Champion of Champions. Archaon's host is close, hunt down and kill the pretender!
The High King's throng is close - if you take Grudgebearer's head the whole Dwarf Race will bear an eternal grudge - a glorious act indeed!
The weakling southerners see Karl Franz as their saviour, let us disabuse them of that notion by killing this Emperor and taking his head for the glory of Chaos!
The enemy of Chaos is near! Hunt down his army and take his head before his troops. Their sorrow will be drank by Slaanesh!
The Orc known as Grimgor Ironhide, although an agent of destruction, plays no part in our masters' plans. His army is close, go and slay the beast.
That foolish grave-scum, Mannfred, like Nagash and Vlad before him, thinks he is better than the Gods of Chaos. He marches nearby - destroy him and watch his host crumble.
Our rival of the Gods' favour leads his followers through nearby lands. Pursue this pretender and destroy him - let the Ruinous Powers know there is only one true Champion!
The Dwarfs march from their mountain holes close to us. They are led by their insufferable Lord. His soul would make a fine trophy for the Chaos Gods, go and claim it!
The crippled nation of the Emperor sends out his subjects to play war nearby. Let us show them this is no game - take their general's head as a prize!
The enemy is close by, we cannot dishonour Khorne by ignoring battle. Hunt down the foe and slay the enemy leader in the Blood God's name!
The Greenskin mobs are close, it would be a trifling matter to hunt down this filthy tribe and take their Boss' head for the Dark Powers.
An Undead host arises close to us, led by a Vampire. They think anchoring their souls to immortal remains keeps them from our masters' grasp. Prove that notion wrong - slay the corpse-lord!
This enemy army of Chaos shall fall before the might of our warriors. Smash them!
A Dwarf Throng comes. Slaughter them all!
So from the south of milk and honey come the weaklings of the Empire. Ravage them.
An army approaches, eager for battle. BLOOD FOR THE BLOOD GOD!
The Orcs come blundering forward desperate for battle, it is Khorne's wish we give it to them!
The meek-willed Champion of a rival aspirant tramples across our lands making sacrifices to the Gods in a vain attempt to mock our legions. Avenge us!
The short flesh-bags of prideful hot air - the Dwarfs - dare to trespass on lands claimed by the Ruinous Powers. Destroy them!
Franz dares to send his forces north. He thinks his crippled god as powerful as our Dark Masters. Prove yourself to Chaos, find these so-called invaders and obliterate them!
Our enemies invade! They dare to fetter lands claimed by the Dark Gods, they must be punished!
An Orc rabble has invaded. Show these filth who should be invading who!
The Undead trespass on our lands. They think to spread the taint of Nagash against the northlands - show them the wrath of the true gods!
The Undead seek battle. In the Dark Gods names, tread them into dust!
The Dwarfen mountain realms are ready for ravaging - begin the harvest!
The lands of Sigmar are ripe for pillage and plunder. Time to raid!
Mortal concerns hold little interest for the Chaos Gods, yet the tribes put great stock in raiding, so we must reward them. Raid this enemy, make them pay!
The Greenskin lands generally offer little of value to the Chaos Gods, yet this region may hold some riches for our Dark Masters.
The Vampires, squirrel away their arcane treasures for their own selfish ends. They do not realise the power the hoard - get it back for the Ruinous Powers!
It is time to gather the tribes. We invade the soft, sweet mortal lands - their souls are ours to take! Raise an army for Chaos!
This Dwarfen settlement is condemned by the Dark Gods. Reap what you can from it; if you see fit, put it to the torch as well!
A mortal settlement ripe for raiding. Take its value and then send it to the many hells with fire!
This settlement offends our masters. Steal what you can and then bring fire to all.
These hovels belong to the Greenskins, see them destroyed in our masters' honour but only after we have taken anything of worth!
The Spawn of Nagash continue to eek out an existence in these broken castles, contrary to our Gods' demands. Take everything and leave the grave scum with nothing!
Champions of Chaos that swear fealty are useful servants - powerful and domineering… and should things go awry, we can blame them in lieu of the Chaos Gods' wrath!
Chaos is magic. Magic is Chaos. None can wield its incarnadine power like the sorcerers of Chaos. We will be stronger with one in our service.
The Hellcannon is a Daemon-forged monstrosity. Part artillery, part Daemon - it should be brought to battle for the glory of Chaos!
The cavalry of Chaos makes the Grail-drivelling fools of Bretonnia look like children on ponies! Bring the Horsemen and the Knights of Chaos - make the ground quake as they charge!
Reap their souls, and cover thyself in gore. Khorne will reward those who fight up close, where the blood flows strongest!
While such methods are shunned by the Skull Throne, there is use in some limited missile attacks.
The creatures of the Chaos Wastes are blessings from the Dark Gods, we should use their mortal children and bring ruin to the enemy!
Our hordes lack significant numbers of chariots. We should forge these Daemon-machines and unleash them on the enemy as quickly as possible.
A vile Champion of the Ruinous Powers challenges us directly. He is a threat to our nation and must be vanquished before his lies and taint spread further. By Sigmar, smite him!

A Dwarf agitator causes us trouble - we must silence him! It is a task that risks offending the High King, but we cannot be paralysed by fear of offending the Dwarfs, for they take on grudges far too easily.
The Electors send their men abroad to rabble-rouse and damage our cause. Find this so-called 'hero' and slay him. Let the rivals of the Emperor know that Franz can play this secret war too.
This enemy malefactor is a threat. By the comet, slay him!
This enemy malefactor is a threat. By the comet, slay her!
The Orcs send out their malefactors to disrupt our plans. Find the sorry Greenskin and slay him in Sigmar's name!
An Undead minion is abroad defiling Sigmar's lands with his foul stench and fouler actions. Send this creature back to the grave!
An Undead minion is abroad defiling Sigmar's lands with her foul stench and fouler actions. Send this creature back to the grave!
A high ranking Champion of Chaos threatens our borders and slays our people. Hunt the heretic down!
Some foolish Dwarf Lord mocks our ancient alliance. We can no longer tolerate this - slay him.
This Empire Lord is a thorn in our side. See to it that they never take arms against us again!
Kill this enemy Lord and we may one day have peace in the Empire. A forlorn hope, I know…
Hunt down the Orc Lord that is ravaging our lands. Kill the mongrel, and there will be one less threat to the throne.
The von Carsteins think they are worthy of titles. They masquerade as nobles but they are monsters! Slay this false Count and reveal them as the beasts they are!
If the Elector Counts refuse to parley then we must take the lands in the Emperor's name through force of arms!
To ensure the security and prosperity of Sigmar's realm we must expand its borders. Begin the conquest!
Altdorf is lost! Retake the capital at all costs for Karl Franz is the Prince of Altdorf - a title he must retain!
The Vampire Counts have always arrogantly believed the lands they hold dominion over are theirs, but they are and have always been within the Emperor's borders.
column4: Take It Back From the Dead

column3: Our ancient allies have failed us. Let the Dwarfs know that their time has come, now is the Age of Karl Franz - the reckoning will ours! Declare war!
Mine Emperor has tried Shallya's dove but now is the time of Ulric's Wolf! It is war within the Empire!
Too long have we suffered these Greenskins to live. The time has come to march to war!
Too long have we suffered the Vampire menace to fester in Sylvania! We must purge the land of the Undead and return it to Sigmar's care. Declare war on these abominations!
We have been asked a boon by our potential allies - to wreak havoc upon their enemy by assassinating one of their men. If we do this, we increase our chances of ruling all our fellow men!

Our countrymen have requested that we weaken their enemy's position by seizing one of their regions. The men will bow to the Emperor if we succeed. Do this and increase our chances of bringing them entirely under our rule.
Our countrymen are in peril - they have requested that we defeat their enemy in battle. If we are victorious they will have no choice but to bow before the throne!
If we strike a blow against the enemy of our potential allies in battle, they will be more open to our requests. Do this - break the allies' foe and they will see the Emperor as a force for good!

We have been asked by potential allies to sabotage their enemy's war efforts by raiding their supplies. A grim task but if completed it will increase our chances of bringing them entirely under our rule.
Our fellow men have requested that we wreak havoc upon their enemy by ransacking the foe's lands. They may abide by the Emperor if we enact this dark mission.
Archaon leads his Swords of Chaos, corrupting the lands nearby - now is the time to answer the challenge and depose of the Dark Gods' champion once and for all!
The Ancient Alliance must die with the Dwarf High King. Grudgebearer is close - take his head, it is a heavy price but the Dwarf debt of blood is now too great.
To destroy this rebellion against the throne decisive action is needed. Kill this Faction Leader in battle and the men should turn back to their rightful ruler.
The foe is close, leading his dogs across lands. Bring him to battle and strike him down. Take the serpent's head and watch the body writhe!
Grimgor Ironhide is close! If we kill that mongrel dog in battle then his so-called Waaagh! will collapse as fast as his corpse. Break the beast and watch his support wither!

There are few ways to slay a Vampire, but decapitation works even on an Undead Lord as powerful as Mannfred. The Count is close, seek him out in battle - destroy him and witness his hordes literally crumble.
The Chaos Gods send powerful servants against us. Some will tell you glory awaits in slaying such a Chaos Lord, but that is false. There is no glory in this act, just survival…
This Dwarf Lord comes down from his mountains and dares to challenge us. Kill the little oaf and take his beard as a trophy!
A Noble of the Empire of some considerable rank and support, has decried the rule of Franz. He is a traitor and cannot be allowed to live or others will sense weakness.
This enemy Lord is powerful indeed. Think of the glory to be gained in killing him in battle!
A Greenskin Warboss, one chosen by his foul gods is a threat to our people. We must slay the brute before his power grows even stronger.
A Vampire Count has arisen, one that could challenge even Mannfred - but for now the creature is a threat to the Empire. It must be slain in Sigmar's holy name.
The forces of Chaos come to destroy us. Engage the dread army - For Franz, for Sigmar!
A Dwarf throng readies itself to battle us. We should not disappoint the bearded fools. Show the stunted folk what men of Sigmar can do - engage!
It is to be battle, such a waste in a world with so many other enemies. Yet Sigmar has ever-been the Warrior-God, so we must not disappoint him now - to arms!
There is only war. Engage the enemy army; bring them to battle!
An Orc mob gathers. We must stop it before they ravage the land. Bring the green filth to battle!
A Chaos horde raids across our lands. It must be stopped.
