The Dwarfs stomp around our lands without our leave. Such defilement cannot be ignored!
An army of a rival Elector blatantly marches through our lands unsettling the smallfolk; it is time to put a stop to this.
This enemy force is stomping around our lands. Let us show them that Sigmar's justice is swift!
Orcs and Goblins raid the provinces, despoiling and befouling as they go. By the Jade Griffon, we cannot tolerate this!
An Undead host shambles around our lands. Hunt down and destroy the Corpse-spawn!
The puppet-master of an Undead horde seeks battle. By Morr's will we must oblige them. Send this grave filth back to the crypts!
The Dwarfs are as uncomfortable on the sea as they are above ground. Their metal boxes are no match for our vessels. Seek them out and destroy the Dwarf fleet.
The traitor fleet must be destroyed, send them to the depths and Stromfels' embrace!
The enemy fleet is close, a worthy sacrifice to the Sea God, Manann. Seek them out!

That the Orcs have an actual naval force is one of the great mysteries only the Gods themselves can unravel. That the Greenskins seek to fight with it is another. Find this ramshackle collection of 'ships' and sink them!

Despite Sylvania's land-locked nature, there have been several infamous Vampire 'admirals' - Count Noctilus and Luther Harkon being two… And now a Dreadfleet sails the seas again. Find it and destroy!
The race of men know many enemies. By allying with our kin, we may stand a better chance at survival against dark forces of destruction.

The greed of the Dwarfs is legendary, taking valuables and jealously hoarding them under the ground. This region is said to contain some lost Dwarfen vaults, send forth dungeoneers to search for them!
This region of the Empire has been forsaken by Sigmar, so says Volkmar the Grim. It is ripe for plunder.
This region is ripe for plunder. Send forth forces to reap their lands!
This region, held by the Orcs, may turn up valuables and plunder missed by the Greenskins whose interests lie in violence rather than riches.
This Undead realm hides many great secrets and relics of value - items of gold and other baubles that no longer interest immortals. Send forth forces to scour the lands.
As the Empire grows, so too does the need to raise additional forces to protect our borders and expand further. We should raise an army.
The seas that surround the Old World need to be controlled as much as the land. Raise a fleet worthy of the Heldenhammer to protect our naval interests and bring ruin to our enemies.
This Dwarfen settlement is an affront to Sigmar! Reap what you can from it; if you see fit, put it to the torch as well!
This settlement is home to the enemies of the Emperor. Take anything of value and then put it to the torch!
This settlement is a blight on the world. Cleanse it in holy fire after you have taken anything of value.
These vile Orc hovels are an affront to Sigmar! See if there is anything worth taking and then purge it in flame, should you so wish.
This Vampire nest is an unholy blight on the world. Send in the Witch Hunters so they may confiscate the abominable relics and then put the foul place to the torch!
A Captain of the Empire - a warrior from the noble classes - will be able to bring discipline and martial prowess to our forces. We should recruit one at the first opportunity!
A Warrior Priest is needed in our force to embolden the men and bring his righteous might to the many battles we will have to fight.
An agent of the Order of the Silver Hammer - more commonly known as Witch Hunter - is needed. His unique skills will give us a clear advantage in the battles to come.
Not since before Magnus as the Empire been without enchanters to protect and serve our nation's interests. We should recruit an adept - a Battle Wizard - from the Colleges of Magic.
The Dwarfs can try, but no one under Sigmar's sun can match the range and accuracy of the Imperial Gunners. Bring the artillery to bear; let it speak for itself!
We care not what the Bretonnians claim, it is the Empire that is blessed with the best cavalry in the Old World! We should recruit such regiments now.

The highly-trained State Troops cannot be beaten by savages or even the axe-obsessed Dwarfs. Individually, they may not the greatest of fighters, but as regiments, the Empire has the best troops. Start recruiting!
The missile troops of the Empire are like no other, armed with black powder or more traditional crossbow weapons. We should bring some into our armies.
The menageries of the Empire contain many fantastical beasts that brave - or foolish - riders can guide into battle. Now is the time to see such magnificent creatures!
Empire war machines have long since surpassed those of the Dwarfs that are moribund in pointless traditionalism. The Empire innovates! Bring these machines of war to the battlefield.
A servant of the Dark Powers could be a threat to your growing power, grab your choppa and bring this metal-clad fool down.
If the Dwarfs love their dead ancestors so much, send them to meet their rotting kin! There is one of the bearded-gits mocking you - make him the first to die!
One of the Empire's agents could be a thorn in our side. Stomp on him good.
We need to kill this foe, or he'll become a threat to your dominance.
We need to kill this foe, or she'll become a threat to your dominance.
Another Greenskin dares to challenge us! End him.
An agent of the Undead stalks you. Best to seek him out and rip off the wretch's head - let us see if he can rise back up then!
An agent of the Undead stalks you. Best to seek her out and rip off the wretch's head - let us see if she can rise back up then!
The Chaos Lord needs to die. Take your choppa and slaughter him, only then will your Green Godz smile on us.
The Dwarf Lord mocks you. He needs to die, or your loyal boyz will wonder if you are the leader for them.
The humies of the Empire are getting cocky, they need a good 'slap' - especially this one Lord. Kill him and watch the rest shirk back to their cities.
The enemy Lord has his eyes on you, he thinks to topple us. Better strike first. Kill him and watch his support fall.
An Orc Warlord wants your position. Hunt the fool down and slaughter him in front of his boyz.
This Vampire is already dead, but his corpse refuses to acknowledge it! You should go and persuade this creature that a corpse should no longer move - destroy it!
It is time to expand your realms, Mork demands it! Take another region off the stunties, make them scrawl another wrong in their petty little book!
This stronghold is dominated by a rival Warboss, take it from him! Let the other wretches know the power of the boyz!
Black Crag has been taken! The boyz will falter if they think we cannot control our own stronghold. Get it back!
Your ancient enemies think to bring back their petty empire. Declare war! Show them their age is done - now is the time of the Orc!
The time of men is over, begin the Waaagh! Ravage the lands, Mork demands that the green tide rises - declare war!
Not all the boyz want to be dominated. The fools! Teach them the error of their ways, make them pay for defying us! Declare war!
Time for the Vampires and their shambling hordes to feel the might of the Greenskins. Declare war!
Boyz from another tribe have asked for a 'favour'. If you slay the git bothering them, then they may well swear allegiance.
The Greenskins of another tribe have begged us to take their enemy's territory, swearing fealty if we succeed.
Our potential allies have a task for us, if we can bring down their enemy's champion in battle then they may be inclined to Waaagh! with us. It's a good deal!
Some boyz want us to fight their enemy. Do this and we will increase our chances of bringing them entirely under our rule.

A rival tribe and potential ally have asked your boyz to go raiding on enemy lands. The spoils will be ours, of course, and it will be seen favourably by these boyz - allowing us to dominate them soon!
Your Greenskin mates have requested that we wreak havoc upon their enemy by ransacking their lands. Do this and we will increase our chances of bringing these boyz entirely under our domination!
This Archaon proclaims himself the ultimate destroyer, that is our savage Lord's role! Hunt down this spiky-clad pretender and his pitiful army - destroy them all!
The Dwarf Boss - king of the stunties - is close. Go and find his mates, kill them and take the Dwarf's crown. That will be something to write in their precious book alright!
The Emperor is close. He leads his personal army out - a foolish move that our Boss should take advantage of. Kill Karl Franz in battle and watch the humie scum quail!
The enemy is leading his army through nearby lands. Kill him - take his head for the boss pole and we will strike a terrible blow against our foes!
Grimgor challenges us, and he is close. Bring this pretender to his knees and then knock out his teef, and take his boyz!
The Blood Sucking corpse known as Mannfred is near. He leads an army of bones within brawling distance. Bring the cadaver to battle and kill him - again!
The Dark Gods send their champion forth and he is powerful indeed. His head on your boss pole would bring more boyz to our banner. Go and slay the Chaos Lord - take his glory for your own!
One of the Stunty gits has gotten too big for his beard. Find this 'Lord' and bring him down. Make the git even shorter by a head than he is now…
An Empire noble is on the rise, some even call him 'Orc-Slayer'. Best to find this git and show him what a 'humie slayer' can do.
An enemy Lord grows in power. A choppa to the face will cut him down to size!
A rival Warboss has been causing trouble amongst the tribes. See that he doesn't cause anymore!
The Undead stalk the lands and a Vampire Lord rises in power; that could threaten us. Seek out the corpse-creature and take a choppa to its neck!
The Chaos army shall fall before the might of our boyz. Smash the spiky metal gits!
The Dwarfs send a throng against us. Seek them out and fight!
The Empire seeks out our mobs and readies for battle, it would be un-Orcy to shun such a scrap!
The foe comes - an army calling us out. For Mork's sake, engage the army - bring these gits to battle!
Orcs come! These Greenskins are our enemies - it is time to fight!
The Chaos filth roam across lands proclaimed by Gork and Mork, kick them out!
The Dwarfs invade tribal lands. How dare they! Get rid of the stunties!
Karl Franz sends his men to take Greenskin lands from our tribes. It's time to fight!
The enemy raid our lands. They raid OUR lands! Find these gits and get them good!
A rival tribe roves through our region, raiding and plundering. Find the invaders and make them pay.
An Undead army shambles through our lands, taking stuff - get them!
This Undead host stands ready for battle. Be it Blood Sucka or Necromancer, we must teach these corpses a lesson - not to mess with living, breathing Orcs!
The Stunties steam across the oceans in big metal cans. Open up their metal hulls and let the sea do the rest!
The Empire ships are drift wood - they just don't know it yet!
The enemy fleet is no match for the hulks of the Orcs, send the gits to the sea bed!
A rival fleet of Orc ships dares to challenge us upon the water - show them that choppas work on the sea just as well as dry land.
The Vampire Counts think their ramshackle boats are better than our ramshackle boats. Prove them wrong!
There are many gits to crush. Make an alliance with fellow Greenskins and you can destroy the other races together.
Stealing from the Dwarfs really winds them up! Let's loot their lands and really get their beards in a twist.
This Imperial region is ripe for plunder. Send in the scavengers and pick it clean!
This region is ripe for plunder. Send forth forces to reap their lands - Gork demands it!
This land is yet to become green - loot it and take anything shiny!
Raid the Vampire lands, knock over a few graves and steal from the tombs. That is the Greenskin way.
As the Waaagh! grows additional boyz can be summoned. Send out the call, bring fresh mobs to our totem.
We need to bash a few hulks together and get some of the boyz on the sea. It's not the best place for an Orc, but we can't let our enemies control the oceans.
This stunty barrow needs smashing! Take any shiny stuff and then burn it!
This settlement of man must be destroyed - Mork commands it! Reap what you can and then bring fire!
This settlement must be broken as if by Gork's Fists. Put it to the torch but only after you have taken all its valuables for the Boss' shiny pile.
This Greenskin encampment should be ransacked and burnt in Gork's (or Mork's) name. Do it!
The Vampires have their filthy nests everywhere. This one should be raided; steal all the shiny stuff and then - if you want, and you probably do - burn it to the ground!
You need a Goblin to talk to other Goblins. Well, whether that true or not, recruiting a Goblin Big Boss is a good idea!
A Shaman is needed to give your mobs a bit of arcane poke. Recruit one - Goblin or Orc it doesn't matter… yet.
A Greenskin barrage is about throwing lots of big rocks at the same time. Crude but effective. Let's organise it.
Greenskin cavalry can be fast and brutal. We should get some mobs of cavalry in, they will make your armies more powerful.
More boyz means more choppas. That’s a good thing… Get some more!
It doesn't always have to be about getting up close with your choppas. Hitting the gits from afar can work well too. We should recruit some missile mobs.
The monstrous pets of the Greenskins will terrify and munch through any army, Get some!
Greenskin war machines are the best - maybe - I recommend starting construction!
This mortal vessel reveres the Dark Gods, he is a pawn of our enemies and a risk to our own plans. Kill him.
One of Grudgebearer's peons is a threat. Send him to an early grave so the stunted fool may be risen to serve us.
A dog of Franz comes lolloping into our sights. It is loyal to its master and believes it can do you harm. Put the mongrel out of its misery!
This agent of the foe is hostile to our goals. Sever his head from his shoulders, and the threat will go away.
This agent of the foe is hostile to our goals. Sever her head from her shoulders, and the threat will go away.
The Greenskins send their brutes to frustrate and annoy our plans. Obliterate it, like you would any pest!
Another practitioner of Dark Magic seeks to unseat us. Send this amateur's pet back in a coffin!
Another practitioner of Dark Magic seeks to unseat us. Send this amateur's pet back in a coffin!
This Chaos Lord, one of the Ruinous Powers' primary servants is a threat to our goals. Silence him!
A Lord of the stunted seeks to ruin us. Ruin him instead!
Karl Franz dares to send his minions to threaten us. Kill the mortal and send a message to the usurper!
Seek out this enemy Lord and make the mortal fool regret crossing the Vampire Counts!
The Orcs dare to send a Warboss against us. It is a beast, and should be dealt with like any unwanted pest. Kill it.
Another Vampire, one of our own bloodline, seeks domination over us. Seek out your kin and send him back to the crypt.
This settlement of mortals should belong to us. We care not for Morr's tenets - conquer it at the first opportunity!
The Undead require this settlement. Send forth our legions to take it.
The von Carsteins ancestral castle has been taken! It must be returned to Mannfred's hands.
These lands are ours by rights older than Sigmar himself! Claim them in the von Carstein name.
It is Hel Fenn all over again! This time the Vampire Counts will be victorious - declare war on the Dwarfs!
We have warred with the mortal usurpers of the Empire many times before; now we will teach them a final lesson!
Too long have we suffered these Greenskins to live. The time has come to march to war, wipe these base creatures off the map!
For too long have we suffered these thralls to parasitically exist on our triumphs. No longer! Destroy these pretenders, there is only one von Carstein!

Our brethren have requested that we dispose of their enemy's greatest warrior, and will swear fealty if we succeed. Do this and we will increase our chances of bringing all Vampire Counts entirely under our will.
Another of our bloodline has requested that we weaken a mortal's position by seizing the enemy region. Should we do this, our sibling will swear fealty, or so they say.
Our kin request that we strike a blow to their enemy by slaying their greatest mortal fighter in battle. Do this and they will be more susceptible to our dominion!
Another count has approached us; we must engage an enemy force to plague them. If we do this, then we can manipulate them into our service.
Another count has approached us; we must engage an enemy force to plague them. If we do this, then we can manipulate them into our service.
Another Count has approached us; we must engage an enemy force that plagues them. If we do this, then we can manipulate them into our fealty.
Your brothers in death have requested that we sabotage their enemy's war efforts by raiding their supplies. Should we do this, they will owe us!

Our Undead brethren ask that we wreak havoc upon their foe by ransacking their lands. Bring the blight to this mortal enemy and our brothers may side with us, allowing the Midnight Aristocracy to ascend!
Does the Ruinous Power's chosen pet, think to threaten us? What does he know of immortality? He and his armies are close, find and kill this pretender.
The Dwarfs have always been threat. Now their High King marches close with his stunted throng. Hunt down their sovereign and slay him.
The false Emperor is close! Karl Franz is near, accompanied by his cattle. Let us find him and slay the fool, leaving the throne for us!
An enemy is so close, you can taste it! Hunt down this fool and his entourage - show him the power of the Undead!
The beast, Ironhide, is close. Hunt down this Orc's army, meet the creature in battle and bring its end.
He challenges us. But there is only one, count… one Lord of the Night… and that is you! Find this pretender for he is close and skulking within his host. End him!
This Chaos Lord holds great power. Nagash would see such a foe and end them - so should we.
A Dwarf Lord challenges us. There is much glory in silencing such challengers.
This Empire Lord grows in power. To kill and rise him up as a zombie servant would be very satisfying indeed.
This enemy Lord is powerful indeed. Think of the glory to be gained in killing him in battle!
A Greenskin Warboss rises in power and could one day even challenge the Midnight Aristocracy! Take the beast's head as a trophy!
Another of Vlad's progeny emerges and thinks to challenge our dominion. Take it's head and show the world who is the one true von Carstein.
Chaos think to take this world - but it's ours to reap! Engage this Chaos army in battle!
A Dwarf army has been lured into our trap. Now finish the job and bring the bearded-scum to battle!
An Empire army comes, engage the mortal fools in combat and think of the corpses that shall refresh our ranks in battle's wake.
This enemy army shall fall before the might of our Undead warriors. Make them dead.
The Greenskin may love war but they are no match for our Undead minions. Bring the Orc-filth to battle and teach them what immortality is!
The Ruinous Powers dare to set foot in lands claimed by von Carstein. Get the invaders, show them a new god - show them death!
The Dwarfs send their stunted kin to our lands in some foolish notion to steal our territory. They are not welcome here - eject the living from our lands!
The Empire claim these lands as their own… They are trespassers! Invaders! See them destroyed!
This enemy force is stomping around our lands. Show them the darkness of the grave!
The Orcs invade our lands. Find them, steal their breath and make them dead!
A rival stalks our lands at the head of an Undead host. We must show him who the true ruler of the night is!
This enemy Vampire army shall fall before the might of our unholy host. Tread them into dust!
These mountain pigs have no place on the dread oceans. Sink their metal boats!
The ships of the Elector Counts are no match for our Dreadfleet. Seek out the Imperial ships and sink them.
Make this enemy fleet nothing more than a sorry collection of ghost ships!
Hunt down the Greenskin vessels that dare to stay afloat, send them down to the icy depths.
An enemy Vampire fleet is no match for our mighty ships of bone and blood. Send the pretender's vessels to the depths.
This Dwarfen region is ripe for harvesting. Send forth our legions to reap their lands!
This region of the Empire sits stagnant and rotting like an ageing corpse. Sack it and dispose of the remains.
Like a rotting corpse, this region is ripe for plunder. Send forth forces to reap their lands!
This region claimed by the Greenskins is ripe for harvest. Send our legions forth to do this.
This Undead region should be searched, and anything of value brought to us. Send out your forces.
As our eternal empire grows, so too, does the need to raise additional forces to protect our borders and expand further. We should raise an Undead host.
The Sea is not Manann's domain, but the dead's. Send forth the Ghost Ships - raise the Dreadfleet.
This Dwarfen settlement is a canker on our plans. Destroy it. Steal its secrets and then bathe it in fire and blood.
The mortal settlement of the false Emperor should be no more. Reap what you can from it and then bring fire!
This settlement offends our Undead majesty. Steal anything of value and then burn it to the ground, if you so wish.
The accursed Greenskin blight of a settlement must be purged. Take anything of value and put the rest to fire!
No Vampire has the right to exist - except our Lord - reap this lair. And then destroy it with fire.
Summon a Wight King - this ancient warrior's martial skills will help our damned cause.
A Vampire Count under our dominion is a powerful ally. Just remember, they are as ambitious in their quest for power as us.
The sorrowful wails of a Tomb Banshee are needed, their shrill screams should send enemies fleeing for their pitiful lives. Summon such a harridan.
We need a Necromancer in our legions. A wretched magic-user whose abilities will aid our unbreathing legions. Consider recruiting one soon.
The Cavalry of the Undead is a fearsome spectacle, adding speed to our shambling forces. Add their might to our roster.
Our melee hordes can overwhelm any foe and will never succumb to mortal concerns such as fear. Raise them!
The pets of the Vampire Counts are fearsome Unliving creatures whose only desire is to serve. Read the books and summon them to our cause!
Nagash never took much stock in war machines but he was wrong. Recruit engines of death - make their deadly mechanisms work in service to us!
Success
Success
All are pawns of Chaos, all must serve. Do as the Dark Gods wish and begin the destruction. Thus is the way prepared for the End Times.
A loyal servant to the Chaos Gods is one that enacts carnage - that raids and destroys and scatters the mortals before him.
All hail the champions of Chaos, it is they who the eyes of the Gods fall upon. They are the ones that risk damnation in exchange for a chance of greatness - continue the slaughter!
The destroyer comes, and with him the favour of the Ruinous Powers. The southern lands of milk and honey will wither at his touch.
Behold the Everchosen! The Daemons rejoice for the End Times are here. Destroy and corrupt those that still hold out against the inevitable. Chaos has come - the world will be broken!

The Karaz Ankor has fallen into decline, assaulted by fell enemies above and below the ground… but no more! Everpeak has stirred, the High King demands that the Dwarf realm be brought back to its former glory. Let  the task begin in earnest!

With the Time of Woes a distant memory, the Dwarfs should look to the future and the restoration of the Karaz Ankor. The more territory around and even beyond their traditional mountain homes the Dwarfs can claim, the more the Ancestors will be pleased.

There must be more Dwarf expeditions deployed - let them take the regions in the High King's name, and wipe out many grudges regarding those who stand against the Dwarf race. In this way the Karaz Ankor will be returned to its rightful glory!
column4: Chapter III: One Dwarfhold at a Time

column3: The Karaz Ankor will be great again, for Thorgrim has sworn it and the High King never reneges on an oath. Every Dwarf worth his beard bears the same bond. There are still regions outside of Dwarfen control, they must be brought under Karaz-a-Karak's dominion as soon as possible.

Not since Valaya and Grungni strode the mountains have the Dawi been in such a position. A few more realms taken will see the Karaz Ankor at its rightful stature - an empire ruled from Everpeak by a High King whose reign is as enduring as the mountains themselves. One last push, brave Dawi, one final push...
column4: Chapter V: A Second Golden Age

column3: The election of a new Emperor has oft-led to turmoil as the machinations of the Elector Counts play out. But as the nobles conduct their petty power-struggles, the nation fractures. It is up to the newly-elected sovereign to begin the process of reunification - bringing an entire province under his rule must be a priority.

Even the worst Emperors in history, and - to our shame - there have been many, could claim to have more than one province under their rule. To truly bring the Empire back to greatness, the throne must exert its power to provinces further afield.

It was Magnus of Nuln that ended the turbulent Time of the Three Emperors, by defeating the Chaos Lord, Asavar Kul. In the wake of such a victory the Empire was united. To withstand another such invasion, we must be united again with more provinces under the Emperor's rule.
column4: Chapter III: As Magnus Did, So Shall We

column3: The time of feuding Elector Counts and petty squabbles between provinces is over. The encroaching threat from the north cannot be ignored any longer. To face the armies of Chaos the Empire must be as one. Only then does mankind stand a chance against the Dark Powers and their minions.

This time will be known as the Age of Franz; not since Magnus the Pious has there been an Emperor so beloved of his people and successful in bringing the provinces under Sigmar's banner. Such glory infuriates the Dark Gods, and they will strike hard to destroy the dynasty of the Reikland Princes. Unite the last of the realms, for Chaos comes!
column4: Chapter V: The Age of Franz

column3: Grimgor's traditional stompin' ground was the northern peaks of the World's Edge Mountains, where he laid waste to Kislev and even marched through Sylvania, bedecking his banners with Vampire fangs. Since coming south to slap Gorfang Rotgut, Grimgor might as well hang around for a bit, and sort this sorry lot out. Gits.

If the Greenskins are going to fear Grimgor - as they should - then he must take control and build up a great green empire from which he can launch an invasion to crush all enemies. The local tribes must fall into line or get a proper bootin'.
column4: Chapter II: Get da Gits in Order

column3: It's time to stop messing around and put the boot in! The Badlands, the World's Edge, the Empire - all of it is Grimgor's! Destroy the trespassers, take their lands and get the Waaagh! started.
column4: Chapter III: Put da Boot In

column3: The momentum shifts as the Orc realms expand. The Dwarfs quail, the Empire shudders, even the forces of Chaos stutter as the Green Tide rises. Now is the time to bring outlying territories into Grimgor's clutches.

A Waaagh! is upon the Greenskins. The Orcs gather in great numbers and so they must bring as many regions under Grimgor's iron fist as possible - such an act will appease Gork and Mork and ensure that Grimgor's name is remembered for all time!

Since Count Mannfred's unfortunate defeat at Hel Fenn, Sylvania has been in decline. No longer is it feared as the dread land where the dead do not rest, but instead is seen as Stirland's bastard child. Now a von Carstein resides in Castle Drakenhof once again, it is time for the Vampires to take dominion over their haunted realm.

Mannfred's influence must spread across all of Sylvania and beyond into the Empire itself if he is to realise his dread ambition of becoming the first and only Eternal Emperor. But before he can rule, a powerbase should be established and fresh troops risen for the challenges ahead.
column4: Chapter II: The Spread of Undeath

column3: Now is the time for Fell Bats to blot out the sun, for gloom to fall upon the lands of the living and the Long Night to begin. Mannfred's dominion shall extend far and wide if the prophecies in the Liber Noctus are to come true.

Mannfred's fell influence saturates the lands, but for the scions of Sigmar's Blood to truly fear the power of the Vampires then all the Old World must be taken in von Carstein's name. Nothing is beyond the reach of the Midnight Aristocracy!
column4: Chapter IV: Behold the Midnight Aristocracy

column3: The time is now - Mannfred von Carstein needs to make his move and take Sigmar's throne, or claim the lands from any foe - living or immortal - that dares resist the inevitable. Mannfred will rule over all as an Eternal Emperor - an immortal king that even the Chaos Gods bow to!

With the Slayers to the fore, chanting songs of battle doom, Thorgrim’s throng sets forth for the Troll Country. Ahead lie countless dangers, but the Masters of Steel and Stone are ever dauntless, and if they should meet their end in the icy wastes, they shall do so with bright honour, climbing over the bodies of their defeated foes as they set foot upon the Path of Grimnir.

The High King's scout reports the presence of numerous Orc and Goblin warriors engaged in some sort of ritual activity which appears to be centred around several Shamans. Given that the Pillar of Bone is known to be a nexus of arcane power, Thorgrim is determined to disrupt the ritual. With the reassuring "Thwoppa, Thwoppa, Thwoppa" of Gyrocopter rotors overhead, he orders the battle horns sounded. The new flying units will have an early opportunity to prove their usefulness.

The Thane returns and makes his report. A dark cloud has descended over Sylvania, and in the midst of its gloom he found several sacked caravans, surrounded with the broken detritus of a desperate fight. Though there were no corpses, a freezing dread pervaded the area. As he picked through the remnants, the Thane was disturbed by a moaning sound and was horrified when shambling figures emerged from the fog. The dead walk Sylvania’s benighted land once more! Cutting a path out, the warrior made his escape. In the sickly moonlight he passed bands of the Undead, all of them lurching northwards toward the vile fog-enshrouded marshes of Hel Fenn. Sprinkling sand on the fresh ink with which he has recorded all of this, Thorgrim slams shut the Book of Grudges, ordering the horns to be sounded and the throng armed. Evil stalks Sylvania once more and the axes of the Dwarfs will oppose it, and as of old, they will face it at Hel Fenn.

The scout reports smoke on the horizon near to Black Fire Pass and a great pall of dust betraying the passage of countless marching feet. The Waaagh! approaches! Thorgrim dispatches messengers to his allies. It is time for old allies to stand shoulder-to-shoulder in the bone-scattered pass, with the fate of the Old World once again balanced upon a blade’s edge.

The flow of Greenskins towards the north must be halted. Make haste, for any concentration of grobi spells trouble for Dwarfen kind. If the Orcs and Goblins were of a mind to ambush the king's army, however, then Thundering Falls would be a good place to do it...

As the throng marches north, Ungrim finds his step matching itself to an ever more insistent rhythm. What began as the faintest flutter has now swelled into a pulsing cadence that drives him on. As the Slayer King crests a ridge near High Pass, a crashing discordancy rises within the symphony yet still aligns itself with the overall construction. Climbing to the summit of the pass is a great Ruinous host marching beneath the dread banner of a mighty Lord of Chaos. Ungrim’s gaze falls upon the Chaos Lord, his adversary's head snaps up and their eyes lock. The symphony rises to a crescendo and Ungrim’s axe pulses in his hands as he screams his battle cry.
The Greenskin horde is heading for Broken Leg Gully, which links with Karak Kadrin nearby. As Ungrim considers these tidings, the war horns sound. The Waaagh! has come!

The Greenskins have taken Ungrim's bait and an immense horde has boiled out of the Badlands, heading north for Broken Leg Gully. If truth be told, Ungrim Ironfist hasn’t particularly enjoyed the tasks that his High King has set before him up until this point. There is an underhandedness to them that is a murky mirror to the vile nature of the urks and grobi. The Slayer King prefers the clean simplicity of the shieldwall, and now he will cleanse himself in a battle of annihilation on the slopes of Broken Leg Gully.

Having pursued the enemy for several days, Ungrim's throng finally tracks them down to an ill-omened shrine near the River Stir on the borders of Talabecland and Stirland. There is no sign of a dragon cave and it would seem that this force was merely a distraction. Nevertheless, they are a threat that needs dealing with. The Undead horde are arrayed for battle around the shrine, before which some sort of summoning ritual is being conducted by a black-robed figure. Desperate to interrupt the evil rite, the Dwarfs charge.

After a hard march, even for the doughty Dwarfs, they come upon the Undead. Their numbers are higher than Ungrim had anticipated. It would seem that the two forces that crossed Sylvania's border have combined into one great army of the dead. Facing the entrance to a great cave, a pale figure in a black cloak stands with arms upraised, a pale nimbus of liche-light surrounding him. Eerie words of summoning drift upon the chill wind. Though the Vampire Lord seems absorbed with his rite, the dead who serve him are not. They adopt a defensive stance around their Lord. Pale skeletal warriors await the Dwarfs in a silence broken only by mindless moans of numberless Zombies and the feral cackling of Ghouls and other nameless horrors.

A torrid sun beats down on the troops as they traverse the dusty plains before the Estalian foothills. Strangely though, the men feel a growing chill in their marrow the closer the ominous peaks come. When the Supreme Patriarch signals a halt before a cleft in a cliff, many hardened veterans can barely master their fear at the waves of freezing enmity emanating from the dark opening. Gelt himself seems unaffected though, apart from a grim satisfaction that this is surely the tomb he seeks.

As Gelt leads his men beneath the rough stone lintel of the ancient barrow mound, the shadows crowd in upon him, dimming even the light emanating from his raised staff. Creeping despair wreathes the hearts of the warriors as they descend, tightening its coils as ominous sounds echo in the gloom: bone on stone, pitted blade on rusted scabbard. It seems that the loyalty of the buried king's ancient retainers remains firm even in death.
With the route scouted ahead, Gelt sets out for Broken Leg Gully to claim the Gromril for his own. The Dwarfs can keep their secrets, Gelt will discover the means himself!
With the route scouted ahead, Gelt sets out for Broken Leg Gully to claim the Gromril for his own. The Dwarfs can keep their secrets, Gelt will discover the means himself!

It seems that the process of transmutation is dangerously unpredictable, and Gelt has barely survived the resulting explosion. However, his first-hand experience of the forces involved gives him an insight into an artefact that may reduce the risk. Gelt’s researches lead him to the location of an ill-omened cave, shunned by any unfortunate enough to live in its vicinity.

Gelt's contact reports that the recent storms are almost certainly due to the activities of a Chaos host rumoured to be attempting the conjuration of the mighty Dragon Ogre Shaggoth, Kholek Suneater, the so-called "Herald of the Tempest", somewhere high in the southern-most tip of the World's Edge Mountains. Gelt persuades the Emperor that this represents a threat to the Empire and sets off at the head of an army to intervene.

The wild storm activity around the battle site yields a lodestone of magnificent proportions. Satisfied with his bounty, Gelt retraces his steps to Altdorf, confident that this will see off Orr’s challenge. The rival Light Wizard, however, has other ideas. He ambushes Gelt and a ferocious eldritch battle ensues.

The wild storm activity around the battle site yields a lodestone of magnificent proportions. Satisfied with his bounty, Gelt retraces his steps to Altdorf, confident that this will see off Orr’s challenge. The rival Light Wizard, however, has other ideas. He ambushes Gelt and a ferocious eldritch battle ensues.
Hoping that his Dwarfen allies will arrive in time to aid him, Karl Franz prepares to face the Greenskin onslaught, aware that this is the greatest test that he has yet faced in his reign as Emperor.

Those that would break away from the rule of the Emperor are nothing but tenacious. They have sent a request for assistance to their allies in the north, and this appeal has been answered with covert detachments of men. Our spies have revealed the massing of a military force in the Bloodpine Woods. Take the fight to them before they can grow into an army.

With a massive Norscan force en route to Nordland's shores, the Emperor must show that his reign is one of military strength; that none should doubt the power of the Emperor. He must drive the Norscan army back into the Sea of Claws!
The Vampiress (for such she seems to be) has chosen to fight near a shrine of ill omen. She has raised an army of corpses to defend herself with.
Trapped by the waters, the Vampiress (for such she seems to be) has been brought to bay near a shrine of ill omen. She is raising an army of corpses to defend herself with.

Word has come back from Azhag's sneak-thief scout. Down in Bretonnia, those stoopid humies prance about on their ponies on the burial mound of Grudsnik. No wonder the gods ain't 'appy, dat's 'allowed ground. Go give 'em a big slap...
The crown awaits, and already Azhag can hear a faint whispering voice of ancient evil drawing him onwards.

Again Azhag's strange decisions have borne fruit. The scout he send out reports that finally, the humie fugitives gather in numbers great enough to offer battle at a place called Butcher's Hill. Azhag laughs as he surveys their forces, then twitches and thumps his iron crown, "Shuddup iron 'at, we'll go south later. I got some bizniss 'ere first!".

In the Southern Badlands the primitive Savage Orcs gather to hinder Azhag’s horde. The Slaughterer needs to dominate these tribes, so forces the Savage Orcs, led by some git called ‘Slagga’, to acknowledge him!

Shrewdly concluding that reporting in person again to Grimgor would likely have fatal consequences, the Goblin agent has instead sent word via a naive (and doomed) Snotling messenger. It seems that the Dwarfs have got wind of a Chaos Warband returning from the Dark Lands to the East where they have collected a consignment of equipment from the wicked Chaos Dwarfs. The Dwarfs have gathered several throngs to intercept them as they pass through the northern World's Edge Mountains. One of these throngs is en route through Broken Leg Gully. Grimgor seizes his axe and marches forth immediately, pausing only to boot the Snotling out of his path. His bodyguard, Da Immortulz, follow, with the rest of the Greenskins a safe-ish distance behind them.

The scout reports that a force of Chaos Warriors is approaching High Pass in the northern World's Edge Mountains. They are clearly returning north from the Dark Lands where they are known to trade with the wicked Chaos Dwarfs for items of power. On course from the south is a second force, this one belonging to the Dwarfs and clearly intent on intercepting the first army. With the scent of battle in his nostrils, Grimgor marches over the reporting scout, heading north.

With his mob following a safe distance behind him, Grimgor stomps toward Black Fire Pass, a murderous red gleam in his eye. Any boyz reckless enough to come near, hear him growling, "I'm gonna stomp 'em to dust, I'm gonna grind their bones. I'm gonna pile 'em up inna big fire and roast 'em. I'm gonna bash 'eads, break faces and jump up and down on da bits dat are left. An' den I'm gonna get really mean."
A Dwarfen artillery brigade was foolish enough to leave the safety of its keep, marching too close to the Greenskin host. Smash them from front and back before they can even load their guns!

Having haunted the Vaults for several days, Kemmler’s forces have intercepted several warbands of Chaos Raiders. Their presence suggests some hidden purpose. Kemmler traces their movements onto a glacier in the high peaks. Lost memories return to Kemmler and he recalls tales of a great Champion of Chaos slain by the hand of Sigmar himself in battle. Could this be the tomb of Krell?

Kemmler receives word of a likely location for Marbad’s tomb in southern Middenland. On the fringes of the forest lies a barrow mound so huge that it can easily be mistaken for a natural hill. However, places of death are not easily disguised against those who serve death. Though its exact nature is unclear to most, the barrow’s innate power has drawn others to it, and the agent reports that a local tribe of Forest Goblins uses its summit for their rituals. It seems likely that any attempt by Kemmler to disturb Marbad’s eternal rest will also stir up the Greenskins. However, no challenge is sufficiently daunting to deny the Lichemaster an opportunity to paw through a trove of ancient grave goods in his unending search for power.

Having summoned a lesser Vampire from Sylvania, Kemmler dispatches her to la Maisontaal. Her task is to use her exotic beauty to beguile the leader of the mercenaries into accepting a contract to attack the abbey's defenders. Within hours, she returns and reports that the mercenaries will launch their attack the following night. Kemmler readies his force and as the sounds of battle rise from the abbey he signals for his Undead horde to move in for the kill. The abbey will fall, and the Lichemaster's eyes glitter at the prospect of the power he will unearth within its walls.

A sickly moon hangs low over the foothills of the Grey Mountains, casting a corpse-pale light on the plains beyond. The Lichemaster stands atop a ridge, watching as an Empire army emerges from Axe Bite Pass and marches toward the Abbey. Across the plain, the tiny figure of a Bretonnian rider can be dimly discerned as he rides frantically along the road from the Abbey to the fortress of Montfort. Kemmler’s plan has worked even better than he could have hoped! The fools of both blind nations are each other's throats thanks to his machinations! As the two forces clash, Kemmler signals for his Undead horde to move in for the kill. The abbey will fall, and the Lichemaster’s eyes glitter at the prospect of the power he will unearth within its walls.

The Necromancer returns and makes his sly obeisance before Count Mannfred. He has travelled throughout the Badlands, conducting dark summoning rituals at the many battle sites to be found there. Having questioned the spirits of countless slain warriors, he eventually located a likely site on the southern border of the region. Unfortunately, he has been unable to investigate the area fully due to the presence of large numbers of primitive Savage Orc tribes who roam the plains there, watched over by the crude idols of their gods. It seems that the Vampire Count will need to reconnoitre the area in force if he is to gain the answers he seeks, since the Savage Orcs are unlikely to let any intrusion into their territory go unchallenged.

The Necromancer sends word that Grudsnik’s mound lies to the east of Castle Carcassonne whose duke commands a powerful garrison. Doubtless this puny mortal will try to interfere with Mannfred's plans, but no matter; his corpse will serve the count as well as that of any other man.

An expeditionary force of soldiers have been sighted at Hel Fenn. The Empire will regret deploying troops this far from home. The Vampire Counts must crush their army, drive the terrified survivors from your lands, and raise their dead into your service.

The thrall reports that the Greenskins have gathered in great numbers around the Pillar of Bone and that their Shamans are engaged in one of their primitive rituals to their gods, Gork and Mork. Mannfred fingers his sword thoughtfully then calls to his Wight King captains to ready the army.
Success
Success

Having realised the limits that mortality placed on him, Heinrich Kemmler made it his life’s work to escape them. He became a great and much-feared Necromancer... until his rivals brought him to his knees. Now he wanders the land, his body broken and his mind blasted. However, somewhere within, his innate lust for power still burns. As his faltering steps take him close to an ancient barrow he hears a whisper that cuts through the chaotic whirl of his shattered thoughts. Almost unbidden, the words of summoning form on Kemmler’s lips.

“What iss thy will, Masssster?” the thoughts enter Kemmler’s head, resonating like the echoes of a crypt. The Necromancer’s unfocused gaze shifts to take in an imposing figure, clad in tarnished gold and bronze armour, which stands before the barrow’s broken door stone. The blazing eyes of the Wight King are a fixed point around which Kemmler’s thoughts coalesce and steady themselves. Though covered in sores and clad in beggar’s rags, the black tendrils of necromantic power wind through his frame and he is the Lichemaster once more. “Bring… the others” he croaks.

Heinrich Kemmler, his mind restored, surveys the silent groups of armoured Wights arrayed before him. He raises his eyes to the distant mountain peaks which he wandered for so long during his madness. Some impulse draws him back there. Possibly it is a last vestige of the once-mad, but his days of plundering Wizard's towers and temples in his search for dark truths have taught him to trust his instincts. Some source of power lies in those peaks, and Kemmler intends to find it.

Some vestiges of Kemmler's old power have begun to leech back into his emaciated form. He feels ready to seek out the nexus he sensed. Sending a scout to establish its precise location, Kemmler readies himself for the challenge to come.

Some vestiges of Kemmler's old power have begun to leech back into his emaciated form. He feels ready to seek out the nexus he sensed. Sending a scout to establish its precise location, Kemmler readies himself for the challenge to come.

Morbidly questing after the secrets of death, a Necromancer deeply steeped in the lore of the dead stands on the threshold between worlds, neither wholly alive, nor one of the Undead. As a Master Necromancer, Heinrich Kemmler’s thirst for power has seen him plunder countless lichyards and sacred tombs in search of ominous artefacts or the raw materials for his hideous arcane experiments. Now the Lichemaster is on the trail of the resting place of an ancient tribal king: Marbad of the Endal tribe. Marbad fought alongside Sigmar himself in the great wars that saw the birth of the Empire. A once-powerful man, his tomb will doubtless contain vestiges of his great spirit, and Kemmler intends to bend this to his own purposes. The search begins in the libraries and archives of the Empire.

The ravaged lands are in turmoil. Refugees and fugitives clog the roads, attempting to flee the area. Kemmler has received word that many ancient tomes from the great archive in Altdorf have been loaded into wagons to be taken to safety. By intercepting travellers in the area, Kemmler hopes to lay his hands on the load and find the clues he seeks.

King Marbad fought alongside Sigmar himself in the great wars that saw the birth of the Empire. He fell in battle against a Greenskin horde, sacrificing himself to save the man who would unite the tribes of men into the Empire. Such greatness of spirit is a noble thing for most men, but to Kemmler it represents only a potential source of power waiting to be tapped. The tomb will doubtless contain vestiges of Marbad’s spirit, and Kemmler intends to bend this to his own purposes. Texts looted from the Empire’s scriptoriums indicate a location somewhere in Middenland, but the exact site remains a secret, almost certainly to deter the activities of fiends such as Kemmler. He despatches an agent to search Middenland for further clues.

King Marbad fought alongside Sigmar himself in the great wars that saw the birth of the Empire. He fell in battle against a Greenskin horde, sacrificing himself to save the man who would unite the tribes of men into the Empire. Such greatness of spirit is a noble thing for most men, but to Kemmler it represents only a potential source of power waiting to be tapped. Marbad's tomb will doubtless contain vestiges of his spirit, and Kemmler intends to bend this to his own purposes. Texts looted from the Empire’s scriptoriums indicate a location somewhere in Middenland, but the exact site remains a secret, almost certainly to deter the activities of fiends such as Kemmler. He despatches an agent to search Middenland for further clues.

King Marbad fought alongside Sigmar himself in the great wars that saw the birth of the Empire. He fell in battle against a Greenskin horde, sacrificing himself to save the man who would unite the tribes of men into the Empire. Such greatness of spirit is a noble thing for most men, but to Kemmler it represents only a potential source of power waiting to be tapped. Marbad's tomb will doubtless contain vestiges of his spirit, and Kemmler intends to bend this to his own purposes. Texts looted from the Empire’s scriptoriums indicate a location somewhere in Middenland, but the exact site remains a secret, almost certainly to deter the activities of fiends such as Kemmler. He despatches an agent to search Middenland for further clues.

The abbey at La Maisontaal in northern Bretonnia has long held Heinrich Kemmler’s interest. It is a major centre of worship for the Nature-God, Taal, and is therefore worthy of destruction in Kemmler’s eyes. More significantly, it serves as a repository for several powerful artefacts. Unfortunately, the abbey is well defended by the forces of the local duke, meaning that any straightforward attack upon it would prove costly. Fortunately the Lichemaster has a plan of pleasingly wicked deviousness. First of all he requires raw materials.
His first plan having failed, Kemmler decides to proceed with caution, hoping that an opportunity will present itself. He sets watch upon the abbey and waits for news.

As the last Empire warrior is cut down, Kemmler drives his Crypt Ghouls away. They hiss and gibber resentfully, keen to feast upon the new corpse flesh, but the Lichemaster needs these cadavers unblemished for his scheme to work. He takes up the dark puppet strings of Necromancy and soon a band of Empire troops stands before him once more with only the odd spatter of gore and their dead eyes betraying their true nature. With a rasping chuckle, Kemmler sets off for Axe Bite Pass, the main route through the Grey Mountains for pilgrims travelling to the abbey. Once there, he intends to have his new ‘Empire recruits’ waylay pilgrims as they make their way through the pass. Once word of this supposed aggression reaches the Abbey, it would be strange if there is no response, and Kemmler will be ready to capitalise on the ensuing strife.

Kemmler's watchers report that a rich and elderly merchant has taken up residence in the lay quarters of the abbey. It seems that the man is originally from the Empire but made his fortune working the trade through the pass. Originally hailing from Talabecland, he the merchant is a devotee of Taal. He has come to spend his final years at the abbey, and has used his fortune to employ a band of mercenaries from his homeland to see him safely through the pass one last time. The mercenaries remain at the abbey, awaiting a suitable contract from another passing merchant. Kemmler spots an opportunity but it is one that will require the services of a silver-tongued temptress.
Kemmler sends a scout to the Abbey to see what effect his wicked scheme has had on its denizens.
Kemmler sends a scout to the Abbey to see what effect his wicked scheme has had on its denizens.

Having summoned a lesser Vampire from Sylvania, Kemmler dispatches her to la Maisontaal. Her task is to use her exotic beauty to beguile the leader of the mercenaries into accepting a contract to attack the abbey's defenders.

While the first Vampire Count, Vlad von Carstein, was the most physically powerful of the Vampire Counts, Mannfred was far more cunning. And when Vlad was slain during the climactic battle of the Vampire Wars, Mannfred did not involve himself in the infighting that followed. Instead, he travelled far and wide, seeking to deepen his knowledge of Necromantic lore and dark artefacts. Now that Mannfred has returned to Sylvania, he is more powerful than ever. Having asserted his dominance, he makes preparations to unearth some of the evil relics that his studies hinted at.

During his studies amongst the bone-dry papyrus and scrolls made of skin in the ancient city of Lahmia, Count Mannfred uncovered several references to a suit of mail imbued with great power. In ages past, the armour’s original owner, a king of Nehekhara, fell in battle somewhere in the southern Badlands - beyond this the armour passes from the record. The Count summons a Necromancer. Though quite mad, the man is adept at rooting out forbidden knowledge, like all those of his benighted kind. He should prove ideal for the task of seeking out any traces of the lost king.

With the Savage Orcs routed, Count Mannfred draws upon his dark arts, dragging the reluctant spirit of the dead Nehekharan king back to the surface. It seems that the king’s army was scattered by a sudden sandstorm, and slain by a horde of Greenskins. The Greenskin Warboss, Grudsnik, stripped the king's corpse of the magnificent armour. The spirit knows no more, and Count Mannfred releases it. The name of Grudsnik is known to the Vampire Lord. Grudsnik da Magnificent was once the scourge of Bretonnia. Such was his reputation that his followers built a great burial mound for him protected by Shamanic fetishes. Such wards are of little concern to Mannfred, and he now sends the Necromancer west to scout out the area.

With the Savage Orcs routed, Count Mannfred draws upon his dark arts, dragging the reluctant spirit of the dead Nehekharan king back to the surface. It seems that the king’s army was scattered by a sudden sandstorm, and slain by a horde of Greenskins. The Greenskin Warboss, Grudsnik, stripped the king's corpse of the magnificent armour. The spirit knows no more, and Count Mannfred releases it. The name of Grudsnik is known to the Vampire Lord. Grudsnik da Magnificent was once the scourge of Bretonnia. Such was his reputation that his followers built a great burial mound for him protected by Shamanic fetishes. Such wards are of little concern to Mannfred, and he now sends the Necromancer west to scout out the area.

To ordinary men, the Necromancer is a vile, withered thing, willing to trade the last shreds of his soul in exchange for the forbidden knowledge of the grave. Yet this impudent ambition can on occasion prove of use to a true Lord of Death such as Count Mannfred. As they strive for petty advantage over each other, these vermin are adept at worming out hidden lore, and it would seem that one of them has unearthed just such a secret now. The Vampire Count issues a summons to his benighted court.

This Necromancer does not fawn and grovel in Mannfred’s presence like so many of their cretinous kind. Instead, he dares to bargain and even threaten a Vampire Count at the height of his power! Mannfred is intrigued. It would seem that this worm has stumbled across a dark tome of ominous power. Count Mannfred is, of course, welcome to the book - for a price. With a sly smile, the Necromancer lets it be known that he has placed a curse in its pages, destroying the book should he come to harm. It would seem that Mannfred must meet his petty demand… for now.

This was a book that eluded his earlier studies. Delving within the ancient flayed skin covers of the fell tome, the Count finds much of interest. Amongst the pages is an examination of binding; funnelling Dark Magic into ancient physical artefacts. When a great quantity of spirit essence is released, it can be harnessed and bound into an item through the use of magical power. Mannfred knows of such a locus, an Arcane Fulcrum of bone deep in the Badlands. It is where Greenskins gather to conduct their pathetic shamanic rites. He dispatches one of his minions to survey the area.

This was a book that eluded his earlier studies. Delving within the ancient flayed skin covers of the fell tome, the Count finds much of interest. Amongst the pages is an examination of binding; funnelling Dark Magic into ancient physical artefacts. When a great quantity of spirit essence is released, it can be harnessed and bound into an item through the use of magical power. Mannfred knows of such a locus, an Arcane Fulcrum of bone deep in the Badlands. It is where Greenskins gather to conduct their pathetic shamanic rites. He dispatches one of his minions to survey the area.

There is no hearth the White Dwarf calls home. He wanders the Karaz Ankor, mostly in disguise, with hooded cloak hiding his face, if not his magnificent beard. When Dwarfkind is in trouble, when an ancient grudge needs settling, then Grombrindal will be there to lend his legendary axe and mighty skills in battle - a great boon for any throng!

In most cases, it is the White Dwarf that seeks out such peril. He will arrive unheralded before, or even during, battle - when all looks lost. However, there have been occasions when Grombrindal has been 'summoned'. If the tales hold true, opening a cask and pouring a flagon of the local master brewer's most precious ale - all while cursing the Black Goblin in flawless ancient Khazalid - mean the White Dwarf will appear soon after.

That is how a group of renowned Rangers claimed to get Grombrindal's attention. After the White Dwarf had quaffed his flagon of Bugman's Troll Chaser (so called, as all you want to do is find and kill a Troll after one swig), the Rangers relayed their message - that none other than the greatest Brewmaster himself, Josef Bugman, was in need of the White Dwarf's aid. Grombrindal, helped himself to another flagon and downed it in one. After wiping his whiskers with his sleeve, he bade the Rangers accompany him to the Grey Mountains and from there to Bugman's Brewery. As the Rangers broke camp, none dared to enquire as to why Grombrindal's armour was missing many of its fine scales, and the White Dwarf himself certainly didn't care to mention it.

These are dark days indeed. The foothills of the Grey Mountains swarm with grobi and Beastmen. The White Dwarf has killed many of these creatures in his long life and yet they still seem to prosper! Despite the urgency of Josef's message, Grombrindal cannot simply let such numbers of urks - be they Greenskin or Cloven - to increase, for they will be a constant threat to all Dawi. Even with his armour in a state of disrepair, he orders his accompanying throng to ready their axes - it is war!

These are dark days indeed. The foothills of the Grey Mountains swarm with urks. The White Dwarf has killed many of these creatures in his long life and yet there will always be more to slay! Despite the urgency of Josef's message, Grombrindal cannot simply let such numbers increase, for they will be a constant threat to all Dawi. Even with his armour in a state of disrepair, he orders his accompanying throng to ready their axes - it is war!
Bugman's scouts have tracked the Chaos Lord and his fell Beastmen to Marbad's Tomb. The White Dwarf should bring this enemy to battle at once!
Bugman's scouts have tracked the Chaos Lord and his fell Beastmen to Marbad's Tomb. The White Dwarf should bring this enemy to battle at once!
Bugman's scouts have tracked the Chaos Lord and his fell Beastmen to Marbad's Tomb. The White Dwarf should bring this enemy to battle at once!
Bugman's scouts have tracked the Chaos Lord and his fell Beastmen to Marbad's Tomb. The White Dwarf should bring this enemy to battle at once!

The Norse Dwarfs of Kraka Drak are in peril and Grombrindal feels their need, as he does the needs of all Dawi. Eschewing his favoured method of travelling incognito, the White Dwarf gathers a throng and heads north to help his Norse kin, even as Great King Thorgard Cromson seals the Hold and prepares for war.\n\nThe White Dwarf despises urks, but reserves a special hatred for the forces of Chaos, for it was the Ruinous Powers that took his kin and liege, Grimnir, away. The revered Ancestor was last seen millennia ago wandering into the Chaos Wastes. Before marching north, Grombrindal sets his Rune Axe on an Oath Stone and pledges to slay many servants of the Dark Gods on this latest of great labours. Only when the tally has been reached will the runes in the mighty axe-head glow once more. The White Dwarf sets about this task immediately by hunting down and slaying as many of the Chaos filth as he can find.

The Norse Dwarfs of Kraka Drak are in peril and Grombrindal feels their need, as he does the needs of all Dawi. Eschewing his favoured method of travelling incognito, the White Dwarf gathers a throng and heads north to help his Norse kin, even as Great King Thorgard Cromson seals the Hold and prepares for war.\n\nThe White Dwarf despises urks, but reserves a special hatred for the forces of Chaos, for it was the Ruinous Powers that took his kin and liege, Grimnir, away. The revered Ancestor was last seen millennia past wandering into the Chaos Wastes. Before marching north, Grombrindal sets his Rune Axe on an Oath Stone and pledges to slay many servants of the Dark Gods on this latest of great labours. Only when the tally has been reached will the runes in the mighty axe head glow once more.

The White Dwarf approaches Kraka Drak but the Norse Dwarfs are famously cautious, especially when facing cunning pawns like those sent by the vile God's magic and trickery. To best aid the Dawi of Kraka Drak, Grombrindal must first gain their trust.

The White Dwarf approaches Kraka Drak but the Norse Dwarfs are famously cautious, especially when facing cunning pawns like those sent by the vile God of magic and trickery. To best enact vengeance on this misdeed against the Dawi of Kraka Drak, Grombrindal must first gain their trust.
With the Norse Dawi firmly in support of Grombrindal, he wastes no time mustering a great throng. But first he must bring the urks to battle, sending a scout to choose an advantageous battleground.
With the Norse Dawi firmly in support of Grombrindal, he wastes no time mustering a great throng. But first he must bring the urks to battle, sending a scout to choose an advantageous battleground.

Does the White Dwarf commune with the Ancestor Gods? This is a question oft-asked by Longbeards at the fireside as they drink long into the night. Some say "of course", whereas others believe he is an Ancestor God himself and a few think he has no more influence in this area than any other pious Dawi.

Whatever the case, there have been persistent tales throughout the ages that Valaya looks upon Grombrindal with fondness, and even some sagas proclaiming that they were lovers at the dawn of history. After all, it is Her cloak which shrouds the legendary Dwarf warrior.

And so it was that Grombrindal received a vision from the Goddess, a new rune to be sewn into his cloak with thread spun from the hair of Dwarf maidens from the Temple of Valaya in Everpeak. The rune will light the darkest reaches of the Karaz Ankor and reveal a hidden evil to the White Dwarf...

Grombrindal described the rune he had seen in his dreams to the Runesmith. The wise old Dwarf had many centuries under his belt, but was shocked by the complexity and potential power of such a marking. Although this rune was of Valaya's making - the Runesmith could see her hand all over it - it nevertheless uses elements of her brother Gods. To craft such a rune, additional knowledge would be needed; firstly from the Runesmiths in the Dwarfhold of Karak Kadrin where Grimnir's influence is strongest...

The Runesmith sends word that progress has been made, but further learning is needed. This time he must travel to Karak Azul, where the residents claim direct lineage to the God of Miners and Smiths, Grungni. Within the runeforges of this Greathold are Grungni's secrets, secrets that will finally unlock the power of the Valaya's new rune...

On his way back from Karak Azul, while traversing the Underway, the Runesmith is ambushed by grobi scum! The Goblins attack but are quickly sent on their way by the enraged Dwarf and his bodyguard. It is only in the aftermath that the Runesmith realises the attack was a diversion - the thieves had stolen his copious notes on forming the new rune!

Grombrindal soon discovers that this is not mere kruti luck, but a ploy by Skarsnik, Goblin Warlord of Karak Eight Peaks. The devious gobbo has somehow learned of the Runesmith's powerful knowledge and stolen the notes, but to what actual end remains unknown.

The White Dwarf learns this tale of woe from another of Valaya's visions. The only Gromril-lining is that if this had been a chance encounter, then the Runesmith would likely have been slain there and then!

The White Dwarf is enraged at this injustice and immediately begins the hunt for the Runesmith's lore, killing all Greenskins that get in his way!

On his way back from Karak Azul, while traversing the Underway, the Runesmith is attacked by grobi scum! The attackers are quickly sent on their way by the enraged Dwarf and his bodyguard. It is only in the aftermath that the Runesmith realises the attack was a diversion - the thieves had stolen his copious notes on forming the new rune!

Grombrindal learns this tale of woe from another of Valaya's visions. The only Gromril-lining is that this is no chance encounter, but a ploy by the White Dwarf's enemies to rob him of the Runesmith's learnings, as they wish to take this knowledge for themselves.

The White Dwarf is enraged at this injustice and immediately begins the hunt for the Runesmith's books and notes. Destroying anything that gets in his way!

The Runesmith's books and vast reams of notes on runecraft and ley-seams have been recovered, so the rune can finally be crafted. As the pattern is sewn into the cloak with a Gromril needle it does indeed begin to illuminate, with any who touch being blessed with a dread knowledge indeed. Something dead stirs in the deeps, so Grombrindal sends a pathfinder to mark the way.

The Runesmith's books and vast reams of notes on runecraft and ley-seams have been recovered, so the rune can finally be crafted. As the pattern is sewn into the cloak with a Gromril needle it does indeed begin to illuminate, with any who touch being blessed with a dread knowledge indeed. Something dead stirs in the deeps, so Grombrindal sends a pathfinder to mark the way.

The Orcs and Goblins are the most detested of urks in a long litany of enemies recorded in the books of grudges that each Dwarfhold keeps sacred. The White Dwarf has slain countless Orcs and hordes of grobi in his time. He has a special hatred in his heart for Goblins, and a black-hooded one in particular!\n\nAnd now, the Greenskins gather again; a vast Waaagh! is forming in the south. The White Dwarf wastes no time, making his way in secrecy to join the throngs defending the Karaz Ankor. As soon as he reveals himself the Dawi rejoice, gather their axes and start killing the hated urki and grobi!

The Orcs and Goblins are the most detested of urks in a long litany of enemies recorded in the books of grudges that each Dwarfhold keeps sacred. The White Dwarf has slain countless Orcs and hordes of grobi in his time. He has a special hatred in his heart for Goblins, and a black-hooded one in particular!

Even with the Greenskins smashed and scattered, the world can never truly be rid of them. But the White Dwarf knows that dominating the Badlands will certainly keep the green filth at bay, even if it does not lead to their outright extinction.

There is one Orc Warboss who has survived his race's doom, who even now gathers the remnants of the tribes for the beginnings of an early Waaagh! The White Dwarf foresees the threat and so the Badlands must stay in Dawi hands.

The Waaagh! grows in power. Many of the Dwarfholds fall under attack, and the Dawi feel hard-pressed. The White Dwarf appears at the forefront of such battles, as he has done throughout history. His Rune Helm - forged in the glorious forges of Zhufbar - glows, replenishing lost Dwarfen courage, a commodity that is rarely lacking in the first place, of course.

The emboldened Dwarfs repulse the Greenskin invaders, but the urks always return - such is the power of this Waaagh!

Grombrindal knows this situation cannot be allowed to continue and so leads a throng from the gates of the Karak and into the wild. He is intent on hunting down Orc supply dumps, and hitting them hard where they live for once!

When Grombrindal arrives at an Orc settlement he is disappointed to discover it is already a burnt out husk with piles of dead bodies everywhere. His anger rises - who would dare rob the White Dwarf of Greenskins to slay?

The answer comes quickly. Sat on a pile of Orc corpses, drinking ale from a fine horn is a half-naked Dwarf sporting a massive slice of crescent-shaped hair, it is none other than Gotrek Gurnisson! The Slayer nods a greeting as Grombrindal sits down beside him. Gotrek offers the horn, and the White Dwarf drinks mightily - although it is a thirst not truly earned. The two legends share a few words, and Gotrek makes to leave soon after, for he has an umgi poet to find. He does offer some sage advice before disappearing into the night: the Warboss at the centre of this Waaagh! is gathering together a mighty horde of monsters. Gurnisson suggests he recruit a  group of Slayers he can vouch for. Gotrek would join himself, but this umgi partner of his seems to be missing and no doubt needs to rescued.

The meeting of two great Dawi heroes ends, and Grombrindal sets out to find the Slayers.
With the Slayers now part of Grombrindal's throng, it is time to end this Warboss' Waaagh! Grombrindal sends a Thane out to find the Orc-filth's horde.
With the Slayers now part of Grombrindal's throng, it is time to end this Warboss' Waaagh! Grombrindal sends a Thane out to find the Orc-filth's horde.

The White Dwarf's throng of brave Dawi prepare to face the Chaos Lord and his Beastmen allies. As Grombrindal looks across the way he sees the Chaos Dragon - ridden by the despicable iron-clad manling of Chaos - and rages.

The Chaos Lord calls from across the desecrated tomb: "We meet again, Whitebeard. I thank my master for awarding us another chance to pluck the scales from your armour and whiskers from your beard." The dragon raises its left claw to show scales of Glimril embedded in its flesh.

Grombrindal swears long and deep in ancient Khazalid, uttering insults which haven't been spoken in centuries. The White Dwarf swings his axe in yearning for bloodshed - many urks will die this day!

The White Dwarf's throng of brave Dawi prepare to face the Chaos Lord and his Beastmen allies. As Grombrindal looks across the way he sees the Chaos Dragon - ridden by the despicable iron-clad manling of Chaos - and rages.

The Chaos Lord calls from across the desecrated tomb: "We meet again, Whitebeard. I thank my master for awarding us another chance to pluck the scales from your armour and whiskers from your beard." The dragon raises its left claw to show scales of Glimril embedded in its flesh.

Grombrindal swears long and deep in ancient Khazalid, uttering insults which haven't been spoken in centuries. The White Dwarf swings his axe in yearning for bloodshed - many urks will die this day!

A dread host of Chaos - one that has hounded the Norse Dwarfs - are deploying for a fight. They wish to spill Dawi blood upon the snow, no doubt in tribute to the vile God of rage and murder. However, the Dwarfs shall not lie meekly in the frost and ice - they are led by the White Dwarf, who has placed an oath upon his axe. Only when this legion of the damned is slaughtered will the many entwined runes upon Grombrindal's weapon burn with power again!

An Undead host has been discovered making its way into the roots of the mountains. The creatures were moving under a devious magical veil that left even Valaya blind to their whereabouts, so she tasked the White Dwarf with adding a new rune to Her cloak to pierce this deceit!\n\nThe rune is now in place and the location of the Undead has been revealed. Although the cloak has been drained of its usual properties, they will no doubt return when this grudge has been settled! The White Dwarf must purge this Undead incursion into the Karaz Ankor at once!

With the Orc lairs destroyed and razed thanks to Grombrindal and Gotrek's earlier efforts, the Waaagh! finds itself isolated, unable to sustain itself and eventually doomed. But rather than let it limp on and eventually succumb to infighting, there are many grudges against its Warboss to settle. There is no better time to strike!\n\nGrombrindal lures the Orcs to a battlefield of his choosing, using a simple bait and switch manoeuvre with volunteers from Karak Azul. And so it is that Rune Helm will glow bright, instilling Dwarfs with heart and courage at Thundering Falls!

Sylvania has been in decline. No longer is it feared as the dread land where the dead do not rest, but instead seen as Stirland's bastard child! Now Vlad - progenitor of the von Carsteins is abroad once again - it is time for the Vampires to take dominion over their haunted realm.

The von Carsteins' influence must spread across all of Sylvania and beyond into the Empire itself if they are to realise their Imperial ambitions. But before they can rule, a powerbase should be established and fresh troops risen for the challenges ahead.
column4: Chapter II: The Spread of Undeath

column3: Now is the time for Fell Bats to blot out the sun, for gloom to fall upon the lands of the living and the Long Night to begin. The von Carsteins' dominion shall extend far and wide if the prophecies in the Liber Noctus are to come true.

The von Carsteins' fell influence saturates the lands, but for the scions of Sigmar's Blood to truly fear the power of the Vampires then all the Old World must be taken in their name. Nothing is beyond the reach of the Midnight Aristocracy!
column4: Chapter IV: Behold the Midnight Aristocracy

column3: The time is now - Vlad von Carstein must make his move to take Sigmar's throne or claim the lands from any foe - living or immortal - that dares resist the inevitable. The Midnight Aristocracy will rule over all - as eternal emperors - immortal kings that even the Chaos Gods bow to!

Sylvania has been in decline. No longer is it feared as the dread land where the dead do not rest, but instead seen as Stirland's bastard child! Now Vlad - progenitor of the von Carsteins is abroad once again - it is time for the Vampires to take dominion over their haunted realm.

The von Carsteins' influence must spread across all of Sylvania and beyond into the Empire itself if they are to realise their Imperial ambitions. But before they can rule, a powerbase should be established and fresh troops risen for the challenges ahead.
column4: Chapter II: The Spread of Undeath

column3: Now is the time for Fell Bats to blot out the sun, for gloom to fall upon the lands of the living and the Long Night to begin. The von Carsteins' dominion shall extend far and wide if the prophecies in the Liber Noctus are to come true.

The von Carsteins' fell influence saturates the lands, but for the scions of Sigmar's Blood to truly fear the power of the Vampires then all the Old World must be taken in their name. Nothing is beyond the reach of the Midnight Aristocracy!
column4: Chapter IV: Behold the Midnight Aristocracy

column3: The time is now - Vlad von Carstein must make his move to take Sigmar's throne or claim the lands from any foe - living or immortal - that dares resist the inevitable. The Midnight Aristocracy will rule over all - as eternal emperors - immortal kings that even the Chaos Gods bow to!

The moon hangs low and red, like some engorged tumour, casting its crimson half-light across all of Sylvania. Isabella von Carstein watches it slink along the horizon and plots her next move.\n\nThough she and her husband Vlad have established themselves at the very summit of the Midnight Aristocracy, there are those who would yet try to undo them. To keep them at bay, Isabella must therefore employ ever darker methods. Whilst she plots and prepares, however, she must know more about her foes. As the blood red moon holds its sanguine gaze, she gives flight to a trusted agent; a speck against the celestial opposition, looming down from the heavens.

The moon has passed into cloud and, when Isabella's agent returns, Sylvania is shrouded in a dark and baleful night. He speaks of insipid Sigmarites amassing nearby, and the Vampire matriarch knows that the Empire only ever comes bearing one thing - destruction. Her blood, such as it is, rises as the realisation dawns like a new moon; if they want war, then war they shall have!

When battle is done, the fields are soaked in less cruor than Isabella expected, or indeed desired. Such paltry forces could not really have been meant for her - for they were no threat at all, and could never challenge her Undead hegemony. There must be more to their machinations, she muses, as she drags terrified and hapless captive Empire soldiers into the bowels of her fortress to extract information in cruel and unusual ways.\n\nTheir dying gasps reveal that they were sent to capture not Vampires, but worshippers of Chaos - the savage, depraved Beastmen. Isabella is intrigued, even as her charges scream in agony. If she could deal with the Beastmen herself, the power they seek could be hers instead...

The Beastmen are arrayed in their usual fashion - a random collection of hooves and grunts that bear no discernible sense of order - dangerous, yet chaotic. And there is something different about them this time - they hum with an unnatural radiance, shining with an entirely disconcerting power. Yet despite this, Isabella will not allow them to best her. She will drive them back, destroy them, and from their broken bones and bloodied horns discover their secrets!

The Beastmen have been destroyed. Isabella and her forces begin picking through the desiccated remains, eventually discovering a horn, thick with foul and pestilent blood, yet glowing with an alluring and altogether otherworldly aura. Though she cannot be sure, the sense of great darkness and dread leads Isabella to believe that this horn is one of the fabled Ruinous Gifts, bestowed upon the Beastmen by the Chaos Gods themselves. Although fascinated by it, Isabella knows that consuming this God-blighted cruor would tear her apart. She must consult those who know of these things - the dark and twisted Necromancers - to reveal more.

Beneath a newly-risen blood moon, the Necromancers toil at their studies. Then, by the grim red light, they report their findings, revealing that the blood of Chaos can be purged and harnessed through completion of an ancient ritual, after which Isabella may safely consume it. The ritual requires, as these things so often do, a massive, living sacrifice, something on a scale that even Isabella finds shocking. The souls and blood would must then be stored inside a precious von Carstein heirloom. Isabella, already excited by the scale of the slaughter to come, fetches an ancient, exquisite chalice that was given to her by her great-grandmother, Countess Bathori, and readies herself to fill it.

With the slaughter over at last, the crimson moon seems pale now by comparison to the sanguine-soaked, beet-red settlements laid waste by Isabella. Through the Necromancers' spells the chalice hums with heathen energy, having consumed countless souls. Isabella knows that her time has almost come. According to her dark magicians only one stage remains: she must defile the resting place of a great and mighty soul. She knows of no greater soul than Marbad, First of the Elector Counts, and interred nearby. Soon, Isabella muses, she will sup on the blood of the Chaos Gods themselves! Gathering her forces beneath the cowering moon, she sets out for his tomb with unmatched thirst.

As expected, the tomb is defended by a retinue of zealous, ignorant Empire troops. Standing between Isabella and her prize, the living fools are lined up before the tomb. Having travelled so far and achieved so much in the name of greatness, she will brook no resistance - smashing these fools apart to claim what she is rightfully owed - a power beyond any in history!
